column3: Santa Monica Bay is a bight of the Pacific Ocean in California, United States. It is home to many beaches including Santa Monica state beach and Malibu lagoon state beach. We visited Santa Monica state beach section of the bay. It has nice sandy beaches along the Pacific ocean. The Bay is also a very popular fishing destination also round the year.
Great for sunsets, although usually its the gloomy California skies in May when I visited. Great vibes and generally clean.
Really nice place to wonder for few hours, when the weather is good even more. Really clean.拽  住转 抓  专爪注 注拽转
beautiful sandy beach fro sun bathing and enjoying wonderful weather. not perfect for swimmers lots of fun activities nearby like biking. shops along the the bay are fun and funky.
Definitely a place to go to enjoy the ocean an nature! The calming ocean sounds,the beach,the peace and quiet!
This beach is so beautiful and pristine! Not too overcrowded ever. Just a great feeling walking along this beach!

column2: Best place for a bike ride
column3: Rented bikes at the Santa Monica pier and ride to Marina Del MarAwesome well marked lanes and no dodging walkers!!!Need some exercise......jump the path

Depending on where you go and it you study the Tide charts you can surf, you can just sun. You can hit the Tide Pools. The Bay is large but plan out what youWant to do. You sometimes run into large crowds in Santa Monica or Venice. Or youCan be practically alone at the Tide Pools near San Pedro. You can't go wrong at any of the beaches. They are all easy to get to and are first class. There is a cement path used for walking, biking, roller blading, running thru the entire Bay. Lots of shops and bathrooms, and stops along the way. Santa Monica, Venice, Manhattan, Hermosa, Redondo, San Pedro are all trips themselves but are all on the Bay.
The bay is really beautiful, and it's a pleasure to visit. It's a great place to stroll around and get great views, especially around sunset
Breathtaking view of the Ocean, sunset is amazing. Clean peaceful and safe. A breath out of the pollution.
Santa Monica Bay is simply gorgeous, a truly lovely beach area and you can understand why its so popular and busy all summer long.
Went to Santa Monica beach in November and luckily there was a bit of a heatwave going on for that time of the year the bay is lovely flat sandy beach lots of restaurants nearby also the famous Pier

Santa Monica Bay is first of all a very large beach area. In December parking next to the beach is not a problem, during the high season it is a big problem. The new metro line makes it very to come to the area without a car. There is the famous pier, naturally a very touristic place. I mostly enjoyed the walk on the beach, hearing sound of waves and enjoying the sun.
After seeing, reading so much about Santa Monica Bay was a little disappointed. The pier really needs and upgrade parts were rotting. Thought it looking tired and worn.

Weve been to Santa Monica beach on previous trips and it is always enjoyable. Walking the pier, seeing the famous start/end of Route 66, watching the seals....and the beach! Dont miss the Mall when youve had enough beach. There are great shops and plenty of places to eat.

column2: Spent a Day and Walked to Venice Beach
column3: We enjoyed walking around Santa Monica! We went on a Tuesday so it was empty! We saw a Sea Lion which was cool!

You can walk all the way along this bay.Beautiful architecture, interesting gardens, the ocean and the piers.Catch the bus to the southern most point you want using the 109 beachside service.Then walk north as far as you like.

column2: Not a nice beach - compact, hard sand and sharp pebbles.
column3: Please stay away if you have children who want to play in the water's edge. The sand is really compact and the pebbles are sharp. If you just want to sun bathe you'll be fine but residential houses line the beach and there are no facilities or shops.

column2: Santa Monica Pier and beyond to Venice beach
column3: A must do LA spot easily accessible by public transport. Wide expansive beaches, great pier with locals fishing, coastal views and locals taking in the fresh air.

A must...take Ocean Park west as far as you can go, plenty of parking (early in the day) and then walk north to the Santa Monica pier or south to the Venice pier...two totally different experiences. Places to get a bite to eat, for the kids to play, or just sit on the beach...and watch the sunset...perfect!
All along Santa Monica Bay there is lots to see. It is a great place to walk along and see all the activity going on.
Shame I was only here for 2 days but would of loved to have spent longer at the beach.the Weather was fantastic for November too

column2: Santa Monica is a piece of heaven!
column3: The water is beautiful any time of year. Bubba Gump Shrimp on the Pier, saltwater taffy, a bit pricey but well worth it.

A must if in LA , this huge beach has a fantastic bicycle track and is wide open, the colors and the Ocean are dramatic, the only down side you cannot swim in it , the Pacific is always way to cold all year round

We spent a good 2-3 hours at Downtown Santa Monica and it was a good place to be at in terms of scenic beauty, food, shopping, beaches etc. It was quiet calm and relaxing. The air was refreshing. One can quietly stroll around the lawns or walk over the beaches on the sand as per the liking. It is an altogether different world. Loved every bit of it.
Santa Monica beach is one of the landmark in Los Angeles and its always busy and fun. Its good family

If you want something more classy than Venice Beach, Santa Monica is the way to go. Wonderful restaurants and shops are very very close, also the boardwalk and teh view are magnificent. Sea is same in everywhere, Mlaibu, Venice, Santa Monica where ever you go, so dont expect better swimming option, but better restaurants, better shops, better crowd.
Beautiful beach , lots of restAurants on the street and the pier. The Wi fi is free in the city Great place
I always stop by beaches here when I am in LA. Parking is easy to find on beaches (and they are not expensive at all). Water is almost always very cold but for a walk these beaches are just perfect.
The beach in Santa Monica is huge and scenic. You can enjoy the beach itself, although the water is cold. You can also rent a bike or drive along the coast and enjoy the view.
such a nice placefamily had a great time walking around watch out water is cold! lolnice clean beach

Such a gorgeous area. The beach is so large that even on a busy day you'll have no problems finding your own little place of relaxation. Heaps of things to see and do around the area. Overall, great for a sunny day out.

column2: Never seen a beach/bay so big!
column3: Super impressed with how much beach space there is, it's phenominal. Loads to do.. definitely recommend hiring bikes and cycling along the path down to Venice beach. Also visit for sunrise or sunset -the views are indescribable. Did find however that there aren't many easy/fast food eateries in the area as a whole.

Just take your shoes off and walk and enjoy the sights. The earth is beautiful walk and look around. The sky is unobstructed and the breeze for sure will come. The surrounding area has boardwalk and people. Lots to see and do only if you want.

column2: I love Santa Monica and the Bay
column3: The waters are extremely cold here in the house clean, but the beaches are huge, sandy, and pretty. You can walk or cycle for miles. When you are done with the beach you are in my favorite beach town Santa Monica.

column2: Great place to go to the beach
column3: This is a nice place to have a day at the beach. Go to Santa Monica pier or stay at the beach while having a cool swim on a hot day in the pacific ocean.
Great view from the pier with interesting shops to by souvenirs and some good free entertainment along the way - nice place for some photos and a dip in the ocean.
Had a day here and was impressed with how clean the beach was. Probably my favourite beach in the L.A area.

column2: What a way to wake yourself up
column3: Amazing running/cycling tracks through the sand going for miles. Big white sand beaches and easy to walk to Venice. If I stay in Venice I will always be here in the early mornings with jetlag. Always wait for the sun to come up though as I dont think its safe before. If you have never been and staying in the city l, its a must to see, breath in the air and check out the many shops along the Venice side
Perfect place to people watch, you must walk to muscle beach, and the pier is amazing. Make sure you go on the wheel.
The Santa Monica Bay area is lovely. The beach is miles long and very wide giving beach goers plenty of space to spread out and bask in the sun.

column2: Lovely beach and area in general
column3: We spent a day here also visiting third street promenade, the pier and hiring bikes and cycling to Venice beach. The best day of our holiday

I was amazed at the size of the beach. Great views. You can sit on the beach and see the Santa Monica mountains on one side and Catalina Island on the other. Santa Monica pier with a lot to see and do. It is a clean beach.

column2: A Los Angeles Area Icon - Shouldn't Be Missed
column3: One of the most beautiful, well-kept beaches in the country and a LA area landmark. Gorgeous beach, shops, walking trail, amusement park, restaurants, concert venue -- something for everyone!
if you like the sun and fun of the beach, this is a great one to spend a day. busy but not boring or too crowded
We went to the pier. parking was $15 not too bad. we had a great time. It was a little crowded we spent most of the time in the water. really nice..
nice place to spend the day. good food, fun walking, beautiful water.we were her 25 yrs ago and pretty much nothing had changed. enjoyed our day here.

We were surprised to find out the day we went to Santa Monica Pier, it was the first Wednesday night of their TWILIGHT Concert Series. We had a BLAST!!! We hope this series continues into next summer with a full summer series starting in June-September.

Stayed in Venice Beach for 11 days and only ventured as far as Santa Monica one day where we cycled and did the pier. Santa Monica is more built up with higher end shops and restaurants than Venice but Venice beach has more charm and character. Santa Monica beach is very busy around the pier area but quieter further out either side with deep and vast stretches of beach to use. To the left of the pier is an open gym with bars and rings and the right of the pier has a number of volleyball courts.
The platform itself is very commercialized and the theme park is crowded and unnecessary.Nice to see, feel the sea but nothing more. In the summer you can't move thereWorth a short visit only

I went bike riding with a friend and had such an amazing time. The fresh air and energy of the ocean was just what I needed. The down side is the amount of homeless living on the beaches and surrounding areas of Santa Monica and Venice. My mouth hung open in shock. The landscape was so different than when I had visited a few years prior.

Nice beach, clean, water clear, a bit chilly but that's the Pacific Ocean normal. Much better beaches than the East coast and they are FREE unlike NJ. I am a NJ resident, it's a crime we pay to get on the durty beach. I now understand why they call California God's country. Everyday is beautiful. So grateful to have the opportunity to visit San Diego, downtown LA, Santa Monica, Anheim and Hollywood CA.
Santa Monica is a very nice place to visit for anyone who visit Los Angeles. Beach is very nice, a lot of restaurants, shops and activities.

as I dont have my girlfriend we are only boys group but thats fine.you can flirt anyone you want,sorry that's the part of joke,well these place is exactly the place where I can enjoy my entire life looking it.
A lot of people walking around, nice place to see. The beach next to Pier is nice and clean. There is a route 66 end of the trail sign in the Pier.

At 4;30 pm, we commenced our one hour walk on this beautiful beach. It is long and has good depth. Even at 5:30 pm, when we were ending our walk, there were still many out on the beach, and some still coming (which I assume are those trying to get in a little beach time after a day's work).
A beautiful place to visit! Very clean. Beautiful beach, not to mention the pier and many sights to see there.

It was a stop on a bus tour of LA. So we got down and walked along the top of the beach. The area is the end of the famous Route 66 - hence the sign. We got to the entrance that lead to the Santa Monica Pier, but on a Sunday, it was heaving with people, so never made it there. There are pricey restaurants but also a row of food trucks when we were there, so a choice of for food budgets!
good place to spend a few hours, lots of restaurants and bars (somewhat expensive), some dificulties to find parking space.

column2: The beach is right in the town
column3: Wide beach easily accessible from LA with public transportation, bus and subway. Must be visited if in town.

column2: A wonderful attack on the senses!
column3: Santa Monica was amazing and is so full of life it risks sensory overload.The pier is vibrant and busy with the scent of sugar, fried foods and salty air. The colours of the stalls and Pacific park rides mixed with the white sand of the beach and blue sky makes a stunning backdrop and a great place to people watch.The town has a wide range of shops to suit all tastes and a good range of restaurants and cafes. On each corner there is some kind of performance - singers, musicians, dancers from the very young to the very old and you cant help but smile as you walk past - a crazy kinda place and wellWorth a visit.
Nice beach, does however not have rental sunbeds or parasols, bring your own. Amusement park not very interesting or very exciting. Restaurants and shops overprized.
Nice beach, good place to spend a time. There is very clean, a lot of car parkings around and places to eat

We are infrequent visitors to Los Angeles, and really just happened upon Santa Monica withough realising what a gem it was. We were staying four blocks from the beach, and revelled in the fresh sea breezes, the day and evening walks by the beach, amazed at how clean it was kept, and by how warm the water was (I had heard the Pacific is always cold)!
Santa Monica is so famous but so dirty. The side walk is disgusting. Beach are quite and nice with amazing ocean view.
Beautiful coastline, drove from Santa Monica to Malibu- beautiful drive along the Pacific Coast Highway

column2: always nice to be by the ocean
column3: santa monica itself is charming and there are lots of really really nice shops and homes but also the underside along the beach and boardwalk is a lot of homeless and the like

column2: Always an iconic place to visit
column3: Went with my grandaughter 16 years of age she loved everything about it from the famous pier and sign,to the beach,shops etc.
Great place to visit for the day. Plenty of interesting things to do and some worthwhile talents/exhibits to see on pier.
We rented bikes I. Venice and ride to the pier. It didnt have much for us there except cold drinks. The bike path was cool!
Great beach nice town centre but Pacific Pier is a bit tacky althoght very interesting to walk along.
this bay and pier are very touristic and expencive. still, but if you have a bike: cycling over the boulevard of the bay is great!

column2: This is what California is about
column3: You can talk about Hollywood and movie stars m. You can even enjoy the Hollywood walk of fame or step into the foot prints and size yourself to hand sizes with major actors and actresses. If you want to understand and feel what California is about, Gogo the beach ! Sit on the sand and listen to the waves. Enjoy the smell of the Pacific Ocean...think about how close you are to natures real power.. now you understand why Californians stay and tourists want to.

column2: Crazy traffic , food trucks and people
column3: We walked all the way down the shopping street nearby which was fascinating on a Sunday with all the street performers and activity.We took a turn left at the bottom to get to the beach and walked a long way down as far as Cha Cha chicken.There are food trucks of every variety, some tortured trees with small squirrels and the beach is in the distance! It is quicker to walk and worth looking just for the experience..We didn't stop at The Pier because it was holiday time and there were wall to wall people.

Nice beach with soft sand, not as soft as the white sands of the gulf, but still nice. Clean. I loved the view while sitting on the beach, the ocean in front, the huge beach area surrounding, the mountains to the northwest, it was so peaceful. The waves crashing were not loud like many beaches I've been to. It got more crowded as the day went on, but not horrible for a Saturday. The weather was a beautiful 70 with full sun. We made a judgement error and didn't put sunscreen on right away, thinking we could get a bit of sun without burning since it wasn't hot, and all 7 of us got sunburned. It was still the most peaceful and relaxing day of our week-long vacation.
Enjoyed a full day soaking up Santa Monica . This trip we stayed a night to really soak in the beach and atmosphere.

column2: This iconic view, Malibu to the east and Palo Verdes to the west
column3: This iconic view, Malibu to the east and Palo Verdes to the west. And the pier in front of you. But plan in advance for parking.

Many years ago, I took my son to the beach at midnight. We went there to have family time and to teach him to fish. It was cold and dark but we enjoyed the night just being there together and enjoying the waves of the sea. it was a beautiful time and we had a great time even though we did not catch any fish.
What a good experience . To top it weather was very nice which added to our pleasure. Overall a very nice energetic place .
Very comfortable beach to be with your family and all the people around is nice and funny also you can have a great day

This is by far one of our favorite beaches to visit its lots of fun for all ages ! I would recommend not to take a stroller hard to push in some parts of the beach due to sand ! A wagon would be much better!

Took the hopon hopoff red route to Santa Monica. It was very foggy early on the day so could not take many panoramic photos. However, the mist lifted in the afternoon and we took some fantastic shots. If you walk up to the police station (up the stairs at the end of the santa monica pier), you can take some aerial shots.
A great day out at the beach ,walk along the pier and take a ride on the big wheel if you are up to a long walk you can walk to venice beach and get a spot of lunch .

had high expectations of a high end resort but frankly it reminded me of Blackpool England on a day trippers dayoutthe transport staff though friendly displayed limited knowledge of the interconnected rail and bus services to anywhere but downtown Los Angeles
Great day and night out. So much to see and an easy walk to the happening Venice Beach. Loved the vibe.
Had a wonderful time here.Lots of eating places and amusements for all ages. Had hot dogs for lunch which were so yummy

We took the metro from Hollywood to Santa Monica Pier, it's a 45 minute ride but worth it. Pier is fun, extortionate prices of course, but the bay is breath taking. Lots of gym apparatus on the sand, beautiful Shutters on the Beach hotel for a drink, street artists, plenty of bike riding and skateboarding - great vibe. A 15 minutes walk takes you to hippy style Venice Beach where the air is heavy with marijuana! Recommend a day in Santa Monica.

The beach at Santa Monica is great. Long and wide and never felt crowded. The pier was fun offering good views of the beach and along the coast.Santa Monica is less crowded and noisy than nearby Venice Beach which suited us just fine.
This is a huge bay with many towns along its shores and miles of beaches, piers, bike riding trail, restaurants. A highlight of any SoCal visit.
2* Santa Monica Bay was not what I was expecting. The restaurants around were nice. The pier was poor.
It was clear skies, bright and sunny buzzing with lot of people. the area and the surroundings were breezy and nice to hand out.

column2: Check out the "Beach Report Card" app before going
column3: This app (see photo) helps me to determine where to swim or surf. If the water quality isn't good, I choose another place. I used to get sinus infections when water quality poor.Also remember sunblock even on a cloudy day! (My teen is still learning this the painful way)

I love to hear the ocean waves and usually walk for a few hours in the mornings/early afternoons...I enjoy it most before or after the busy summer months...sometimes just sitting on a sand dune and listening and watching the ocean is quite peaceful...
I couldnt spend more than 1 hour there, once youve walked the Pier and eaten some below average food. its time to leave.Nothing greta baout teh beach etc.
Reminded me of Brighton pier but with Sun and more light hearted entertainment. The beach is great but unfortunately the weather wasnt up to bikini wear! Definitely Tom Hankss pier!
We parked at the pier itself for $3.00 per hour and walked on the pier watching all the skillful performers on the side of the piers. Amusement park like atmosphere and food to match.

Good to say we went, caught the train from the science centre here and then to the Hollywood walk of fame. People smoke weed in the open and this is where we noticed it. Felt dirty and was great to go and have a look but the walk from the train to the pier was interesting.
I stayed near the Santa Monica Pier, and I just love this place. It's huge and peaceful. You can meditate or just play fun games. Something is always happening here.

Beach is outstanding, however the characters on the board walk are an experience from piano players that should be at Wemblet Stadium to a black turban wearing roller skating guy.The shops are great and the cafe on the front serves excellent food. ( I cannot remember the name of it!)

column2: Nice experience of the Californian beach
column3: This is a very long stretch of beach and very beautiful as well. It was very crowded on the day we went, because it was a holiday. But still it is an enjoyable place with lots of avenues for fun and games.This was one of the routes of our Hop on Hop off tour and so transporation was very easy. There are lots of eateries and bars in the place, which we experienced and enjoyed.
We spent a day chasing beaches and this was one that we really enjoyed, Lots of opportunities to people watch and eat. Nice!
During november it was no people on the beach.Nice and clean. We had to dip our feet in the cold water.
Amusing stretch towards the lighthouse area. Lots of souvenir shops and performers along the way. Restrooms are easily located and clean (at least when I used it).
This place is beautiful. during the day is a great view but at night this place is lit up and beautiful. Especially when the sunset comes in. Breath taking

The Bay includes several beaches, each with it's own character and pleasures, and we love them all. You can't miss the Santa Monica Pier and the beach. It's awesome for running, biking, skating, strollering, and even walking. You can saunter on the pier and people watch or ride the classic fair rides for a scream. If you're there on a cloudy day, it might be quieter and a jazz man will play a solo on his saxophone just for you, with the crashing surf as an accompaniment. You can play or watch beach volleyball, soccer, or flag football, or stretch it out with a beachside yoga class. We love Saturday mornings there, when it's a less crowded, but it's pretty amazing anytime.

What an amazing place, pier is fantastic but there is much more to Santa Monica. The shopping is amazing with something for everyone. The main street is immaculate, with a laid back cool vibe, plenty of places to sit back and people watch.pairEvery major store you could think of, with plenty of bargains to be had.A place I highly recommend for a visit.

Went to Santa Monica beach in April and it was crowded and also not very well maintained as compared to any European beach. Looking at the amount of tourist they receive they should provide more clean with added service. Little bit disappointed.

While hanging out at the Santa Monica Pier we strolled the beach and rode bikes down to Venice beach with my family of 4. it was so pretty and amazing to see. There are many places to just stop and take a family picture with an amazing background. Worth seeing!

I was very surprised to see how many people were out on Friday night at the pier / on beach/ onroad with scooters! Families, couples, friends-great place for everyone. Wyndham Hotel across from Pier entrance recommended stay

I have visited Los Angeles several times and finally got to visit Santa Monica Bay. Very busy area loaded with many shops, Pacific Ocean and the lovely old fashion pier. This is a must visit for vacations. I am from the east coast and I found the experience here so unique. Great memories.

column2: EVERYTHING YOU WISH BETWEEN HEARTH AND THE SKY
column3: If ypu love the sea, an everlasting summer and good hearted people, life and fun addicted, it's the place for you. A wonderful beach, an enchanting shore and very funny people. You feel in peace with the world, have a sunbathe of life there
Visited near end April. Weather was good and people were playing/Swimming in the water already even though it was less than 21degree C
I visited the Santa Monica Pier on a week end and it was extremely festive with a happy atmosphere. Beautiful beach with Mountains in the distance. Nice tram ride down from Los Angeles Union Station

column2: Wide beach with easy access from the town centre
column3: Well worth the stroll along the pathways running both north and south. The walk is lovely but also easy to rent skates, bikes or scooters from local vendors. Great place to people watch especially on the weekends.
from malibu to venus, all nice. we climbed a mountain in malibu, used a scooter(63 and this was the first time) in santa monica and drank in venice beach. all good.

We did find accessible parking affordably and view Santa Monica Bay from the Santa Monica Pier. The pier itself is dog friendly and we were doing route 66 with two dogs in tow, our little world travelling cocker spaniels. We walked the parks above the beach and saw many scenic views and from both side of the pier. The beach and bay itself is not dog friendly.
In town on business and managed to get some time to walk Santa Monica, great place, good food and was very clean and tidy. Aim to return.

Dear friends,When you are in L.A. you need to drive down to Santa Monica.It is so lively and lovely.There are Lots of shops and restaurants and street performers.Its often windy so better you bring a cardigan with you.Have your phone fully charged as you will need it.You can rent bikes too and ride along the beach area.This is a great place to be and to enjoy or to relax.I just love the place!
Nice place to stay, close to LA INT Airport... Many restaurants with any kind of food from reasonable - high price...
Very nice beach. Though I have plenty of beaches where I come from, nothing beats California beaches!
We love to rent a bike and make long run all along the coast using the ride path, we did that many times and always it was very nice experience.

Los Angeles has at least 15 beaches in the county of L.A. and double that if not more when you include Orange County to the South and Ventura County to the North. You're better off at most of those other beaches. Like Venice Beach, Santa Monica Bay and its beaches are vastly overrated. They're famous for being famous but in reality they're crowded with tourists and locals who don't bother to do their homework to find other beaches that are better for an authentic, uncrowded experience. Save the money you will spend on parking and head to another beach that you can park at for free on the side of the road. Do a little digging, and those are easy enough to find in the greater L.A. area. Better yet, support the state and national park system by going to one of their beaches in the greater L.A. area.

Everyone has to go there, it is the place to be. Make photos at different places, go into the nice cafes and diners and watch the scenery. So many lovely people and artists who are selling so very nice stuff.And you can borrow bycyles etc love to go there xx

I had no idea what the view was like from Santa Monica Pier until my wife and I visited a couple of weeks ago. We even rode the Ferris wheel! The view was breathtaking. Clean beautiful beaches in both directions. Nice attractions. Very suitable for children. Enjoyed watching the old fishermen fishing off the end of the Pier. Even though we were on a tour parking was very congested. I would not have wanted to try parking in those very small parking spaces myself. Great time, great tour. Certainly enjoyed it more than our next stop at Venice Beach!

Make sure you have all of the time you need to soak in Santa Monica (and associated) Beaches. Whether you want to enjoy the ocean, walk, run, bike, scooter or just hang out on the beach and people watch, it is a great place to do all of those things!

Santa Monica Pier is about a 45 minute train ride from downtown LA on the Expo line. The Pier was very crowded (though im sure Spring Break probably takes at least some of the blame for that) but quite entertaining. The beach was awesome. And the views were amazing.
Need a lot of time and maybe rent a bike to tour beach walk. The Pier is pretty neat also, beware you may get asked to buy trinkets on the pier.

column2: so cool to see in the flesh
column3: def a place to come walk around and just take in as it is one the those places that is a true palce of beauty as well as on many people buckets list to get too - do not take it for granted

I love the restaurants, the amusement park and the water. Ive been coming here for over 20 years. Its improved over the years and there are more stores. The only complaint is the parking prices and the street vendors that crowd the place sometimes. Overall its a good time.

this is a bit more picturesque than venice beach and worth the walk along from venice beach. plenty of street performers and exercise stations where you can watch people exercising and tight rope walking
Great views and Souvenier shops. Great place to see the sun set. Very crowded though so if crowds are not for you might want to avoid. Make sure to go to 3rd st promenade and Outdoor mall.
Couldn't go to LA without visiting Santa Monica Bay. Visited as part of LA tour and could have spent a lot more time than we did.

column2: Love the Santa Monica Bay Experience
column3: If you are in Southern California then come by the Santa Monica Bay area. Lots of fun things to do, see and eat. Lots of fun attractions, many many people from many parts of the world and of course, you are at the beach.

column2: Great place to send the day
column3: Family friendly and beautiful ocean location. Always fun with food and entertainment. It is a wonderful way to relax and enjoy the day

Beach Is stunning, but so are the people! Music, dancers, artists, bikers, muscle builders. It was a fantastic stroll, so much to see and experience, fantastic pier. Have to come back with the rest of the family.
The Santa Monica Pier is a must see. Rides and attractions aplenty. So many interesting characters and street performers. Lots of yummy, fresh and varied food.
The beach and pier are wonderful, and watching the winter sun set over the Pacific was a great experience. A part of LA not to be missed.
You can walk along the park-like street or down on the water. It is always crowded, even in the rain, but up on the walkway is a great place to watch the sunset.

A bit disappointing the carnival wasnt opened. Check before you go there for carnival opening times.Only souvenirs on the boardwalk. A few place to buy food. You can hire a bike and ride along the promenade.

column2: So much to do in this beautiful area of L.A.!
column3: This area is a favorite for our family and our first stop to bring our out-of-town guests. Beautiful ocean views, great bicycle riding,fun shopping, walking distance to 3rd Street Promenade, amusement rides, and an incredible variety of terrific restaurants!Dorothy, Newbury Park

Made a trip to Santa Monica Shopping Centre to park our car.Walked around and had late lunch. Walked to the Pier at Santa Monica Beach. It was very cloudy and we decided to wait till Sunset. Entertained with music and a very pleasant view.As we watched the Sun setting from 1640 hrs to about 1740 hrs, it was really awesome! Everyone were excited and some clapped with joy!Very pleased with the long wait.Rember to find a cheaper carpark as we paid USD$18 for about 5 hrs or less.

Lots of foreign tourists come to Santa Monica which makes it fun, reminds me of when I backpacked through Europe. We have one of the best hostels here, no age limit, great shopping and strolling, the scooters are a blast, I ride them everywhere! Fantastic restaurants down by the pier, and it's also an easy bike ride, scooter ride, or Uber to Main street on the way to Venice. Some of the best hotel chains in the world also! A lot to do, including four movie theaters, but people watching and entertainment on the promenade is free and always fun. In the summer you can add the beach!

column2: Like St Kilda Esplanade, Melbourne Australia, only bigger
column3: Ride, electric scooter, skateboard, stroll along here from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier. Its a great experience in winter
Nice boardwalk with bikers, skaters and families. Many restaurants available and can catch the Hop-on/off bus nearby.
Great view of the ocean and a prime location for many photos of the beauty. can be crowded at times but if it's "cold" it is less busy.

The bay is one of my favourite places on Earth. It is always interesting, always beautiful and always different. I have been here in winter with gale force winds, in the summer heat and in early September which is probably my favourite time to visit. I love walking along the boardwalk all the way from Santa Monica Pier to Venice Pier taking in the weird and wonderful people who live and visit here. Early mornings are the best time to do this. The local street vendors are setting up their imaginative street stalls and wares, the first fitness fanatics are out and it is still pretty empty if tourists. It is a bit over 10k from Pier to Pier and back. If you start at Santa Monica Pier then Cows End is a good place to grab an early coffee at the half-way point. Evening walks have their own splendour with amazing sunsets and an unexpected quietness. Here you are with a multi-million people city at your back and it is quiet. Just waves, seagulls and a subtle buzz.The other ways to explore Santa Monica Bay are obviously on a bike, hire scooter or on rollerblades. Take a walk or a ride but do take it, its worth it!

column2: A Walk on the Beach is Well Worth It!
column3: The beach can get crowded during the summer and especially on the weekends, because it is popular with locals. Getting away from the fast-pace of Los Angeles, it is the ideal place to walk along the beach (solo, couples and families) in a more relaxed state of being.Parking at the beach or on the pier.Eateries available on the pier and along the walkway at the base of the pier/beach.

Santa Monica beach is our favorite beach for a nice sunny day. It tends to get crowded during the summer but if you go early on a Sunday, youll get great cheap parking and have a fantastic day. Lifeguards are around and if yo fancy a swim, the best time is Sept or Oct when the water is warm. Waves can be wild though. Lots of food options around. Great place to visit. Quieter than Venice beach but better experience.

column2: Not Bad for kids, but fairly down market
column3: The Pier is at a beautiful location. The fair is quite ok for going with kids who will enjoy the rides. All day ticket passes are reasonable at about 18 dollars for a kid. Certainly the fair looks rather aged and could use a face lift. Usual fair food is scarce and I inviting. Best for kids and young teenagers.

We stopped here several times while in Santa Monica. The beach area is very clean and welcoming. We had a chance to test the waters of the Pacific. Even on a crowded day there is plenty of room to walk along the beach and enjoy the sound of the waves.

The beach is really nice. We were there in a sunny day and it was gorgeous. The parking is OK but it would be paid (~$10). Renting bikes was a really nice experience with the kids. There's a special trail for bikes and it was parallel to the beach. Overall, it's a nice place to spend a day or so.

column2: Such a contrast to the rest of L.A.
column3: Even if you can't swim in April when I visit, this is still a go-to place. It can be crowded, but can't be compared to the freeways and downtown, find it pleasant and relaxing and the sunsets are superb. Good for walking on the sandy beach or the footpath.
The beach is okay but not the best ive seen. It is very famous but there are better beaches in my opinion even near los angeles.
This has to be one of the most beautiful places in LA - watch a pacific sunset and you will be hooked for life. So much to see and do in Santa Monica.

Despite it is always busy and full of people, this place is worth to visit. You can park your car at the designated parking spots or park at the multi-storeys car park nearby. We have chosen one that is free for the first 90 mins and then walked out to the pier. The pier is an ocean park with scenery, restaurants and shopping spot. The Pacific Park has offered fun to family.

I ride my bike along the bike path from Marina del Rey to the foot of Palos Verdes. When it is clear and sunny Catalina is visible in the distance. Activity along the beach whether people are walking their dogs, running, people playing volley ball or surfers all add to the energy of the experience including other cyclists. It is different from day to day like after a storm the waves are strong and powerful preventing many of the surfing set to stay out of the water. "On a clear day one can see forever."
On a 3 week family holiday. We didn't plan on visiting Santa Monica. Boy am I glad we did. Great vibe. Pier is great. Great town centre too. Well worth a visit.
The best view of Santa Monica is from the Santa Monica Pier.The view is panoramic.Along the ocean is a park, many restaurants and homeless people.Overall, it's nice.George Vreeland Hill

column2: 4 hrs from Vegas to put my feet in the Pacific
column3: Drove a rental from Vegas to put my feet in the ocean & see a few of the sights in LA. Chose to bypass the Pier 4 the canals of Venice & hit downtown for free surround views of the city of LA fr atop City Hall, Art Walk, & dinner.

column2: This was the highlight of my trip to LA
column3: Short review:I walked from the Santa Monica peer to Marina beach. Overall, was pretty enjoyable if you have about half a day to a day to burn around this area. The traffic is insane but once you are there, you should be good to get food, shade, a place to rest or just lay down. The peer is the main attraction but the beach is super convenient. Get your swimmers out and enjoy some of the water.Longer a bit more detailed:I am glad I had a stopover of several hours, enough for me to take an uber and come to Santa Monica to kill some time, otherwise my impression of LA would've been pretty negative. I say this not as an insult to people living there or anything, I just didn't find anything attractive about LA as it reminded me to a huge parking lot.Leaving my whining aside, as I knew I was going to be spending several hours in LA, I asked a few friends and all of them recommended me to stop by Santa Monica. Getting there was horrible, the traffic moves incredibly slow and I was about to request the uber driver to take me back to the airport. Fortunately, he told me "the peer is close by, you can get out here and walk the rest so you are not bored here".Few minutes later, I was on the peer and I started to feel a bit more relax. You will find several shops, food, the carnival and lots of different attractions around. I walked towards the carnival first as it is quite emblematic. Not having a picture of the place would've been a crime. While in there, stopped for a burger and the super over sized drinks and chips (french fries?)...Honestly Americans, why do you need to add 3 and a half kilos (7 pounds) of sauce to a burger? Obviously, that is an hyperbole but it did not matter where I had bitten, the result would've been the same: a splash of sauce flying away from the burger (thankful it flew towards some lady sitting nearby... followed by 2 million apologies from my part, but getting in the plane with grease would've been nice).In any case, from the peer, you should be able to walk south: initially close to the beach (which is nothing special when compared to the ones we have in Australia) then closer to the shops. In general, I liked it quite a lot.A few hours into my visit, I was engaged by a few ladies and a bloke asking me where I was from. Didn't want to enter into too much polemic, so replied that I was from South America which none of them believed. After a bit, told them I was from Australia and they took it in without issues. They just wanted to sell me stuff which I declined, but all of them started asking me about all the dangerous animals we have down under... sigh, here we go again. The reason why I am telling you this is, they recommended me to by the Venice Beach Boardwalk which was pretty entertaining.All in all, I must say my stay (whether short or long) was enjoyable, making it the entire highlight of my trip to LA.

Booked the hop on hop off tour bus and one of the routes took us to Santa Monica and the beach. Pacific Park is a good place for families with kids, the ferris wheel, roller coaster, restaurants and cafes with street entertainers on the pier.

I cannot say one thing negative about this area. I started by taking the Red/purple line from Union Station and transfer to the Expo Line which has the last stop in Santa Monica. From that point on do what you like Shop, take a Walk on the Pier, Walk, Ride the Farris Wheel, Walk, Fish, Walk, Swim, Walk, Eat. My pick is Bubba Gump Shrimp Company. Then WALK it off and go down to the Beach and Walk to the Venice Beach Area. Numerous bike rentals along the way, Do your home work prices for rentals do very a lot. Venice Beach is just a great place. By the way one of the most cleanest area in the LA. Their small Garbage Trucks appear to have all have Wax Jobs, not kidding.

column2: Great day out.. with kids, family or friends
column3: Santa Monica Bay is fabulous.. there is something for everyone.. a visit to the pier either Santa Monica or Venice Pier, although there is more to do on Santa Monica pier.. you can eat, fish, watch the surfers or walk along the beach or walkway all the way to Venice.. great swimming.. and/or great sights, you can either swim on the beach or people watch at muscle beach, you can hire a bike, have a beer.. take a picnic or just watch the sunset.. a must!!
Went to the beach at night and ate at a seafood restaurant there. Food was great and the view was just beautiful and peaceful.

Visited this iconic area on a breezy Sunday. Pier was throbbing with visors and artists performing. Walking along the beach path passed the beachfront holiday homes for several kms was interesting and then up onto the promenade to the shopping precinct again with various artists performing including an Amish choir singing Christmas carols.

Santa Monica beach is one of the coldest and dirtiest beaches in LA County, there are to many homeless and gang related people around you wont feel safe or enjoy your trip there, the boardwalk its crowded and again not very exciting.

column2: Right in the middle of it
column3: Santa Monica Bay and the beaches there are easily accessible. There is so much to see and do. Not the cleanest water to swim in but it's come along ways. You can enjoy the beach, walk or bike the bike path, get a snack or lunch, visit the Santa Monica Pier. There is usually ample parking in the lots, not sure the cost but you can pay one price and stay the day.

hey this is the end of Route 66, where Forrest Gump walked to the end of the Pier and turned around and where some of Baywatch was filmed. It is gimmicky but you need to see it and it is a pretty area.
Went there for the !st time, spent the afternoon on the beach and cycling the pathways. Enjoyed the day very much.

It was just nice to stroll along the soft whitish sand after walking along the roads and sidewalks . The sand being so soft and clean , the family kept their eyes on me , as I would have walked for miles .Brilliant well cared for beach .

column2: Lovely walk from Venice to Santa Monica
column3: We enjoyed a sunset walk from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier one warm evening in LA. Lots of activity on the board walk with cylists, walkers, scooters and people getting around on all sorts of contraptions.Unfortunate that there was a constant woft of marijuana in the air, but I guess that's LA life.

column2: A must see while in California!
column3: We always wanted to go to California, so it was a dream comes true for us! We visited Disneyland, Santa Monica, Malibu & Hollywood. it is a trip worth of your time & money if you enjoy traveling like us!

We visited Santa Monica on the hop on/hop off bus. The pier was fun for the children and we spent many hours walking the boardwalk after playing on the pier. The beach was lovely, however we did encounter fog on the day that covered the entire area reducing visability considerably from around 2pm onwards.
Nice place with beach and knowing old history. Good board walk with street food,souvenir, street shows, tourist. A must visit place in the evening.
Great people watching and lots of history.santa Monica pier is so fun and lots of great people watching.
A nice beach. Venice beach is a nice area to walk around as well as a good beach. Parking is available at nearby pay lots or perhaps at no charge if you can find it on nearby streets.
nice beach to pass the day. Many resturantes, views, warm water. delicious to spend the day. many people.

This is a place to visit if you are in Los Angeles. If you go early in the morning, you might get some fog and it might be a bit nippy depending on where you live. The water could be really cold. There is a boardwalk for those people who don't want sand in their shoes and you an also walk on the sand. If you are really lucky, you might be able to see dolphins and/or whales. The beach is almost empty until about 10:30 or 11 am, after that, there are more people coming to enjoy the cool weather. So if you like it quiet, go early, walk all the way south to Venice and come back to your car. Or head up walking towards the north, the beach/sand is very walkable in this part. You can park in the short term parking lot for 2 hours and pay only 2 dollars.
A must if a first time visitor. Great for all ages, vendors, restaurant, rides, the ocean. We went in the late afternoon/early evening it can be chilly.
One of the best parts of Los Angles. Our favorite beach in LA. It is absolutely beautiful here. Highly recommend.

If you haven't had the opportunity to visit this location in California, you must make it here. The Santa Monica Pier has been seen in numerous movies, and documentaries. Located in Southern California, it is one of the most popular places to see. You can get there by car or there are many Sightseeing buses to take you there. Enjoy rides, shopping, artists, Music and more there. It is crowded most of the year but a lot of fun.Parking is at the base of the pier and will set you back about $10 to $ 20.00 depending on the time of year.405 San Diego Freeway south to the 10 Santa Monica Freeway west will put you at the start of the pier area.Also while you are in the area Don't miss the 3rd Street mall.

We travelled by train to Santa Monica and walked to the pier. I guess it is more for kids and teens. Just a few carnival stalls and rides. Nice icecream but, everything is overpriced. The beach looked beautiful on a warm autumn day.

Californian beaches is something so special for us. My kid was so excited to visit Santa Monica beach. We saw so many beautiful birds over there. There are some surfers. Now I want to try surfing too! Next trip we going to be there in the water
Take the kids and let them have fun. Go to the Santa Monica Pier and let the kids ride the rides. Cost is comparable to fairs

Once you are in LA you have to go to the beach and there's no better beach place than Santa Monica. What a coastline !!! miles and miles of shore where sand meets the ocean. We spent half a day there and enjoyed the beautiful sun.

column2: Great clean beach with pier and shows
column3: We walked here from Venice Beach and it is much nicer. There are shows on the pier or food outlets and shops and route 66 signs. Nice clean beach

You don't feel like the hustle of LA when you walk this beach. Very pleasant and clean. The sights are majestic with the elevation changes and handsome dwellings above. The sight of the famous pier makes me reflect to my youth watching Three's Company. Very enjoyable walk!

column2: No Trip to LA Would Be Complete Without ...
column3: No visit to LA would be complete without spending a day in Venice Beach and Santa Monica. Love walking along the Ocean and catching the sights (many) and sounds (many). We even got to witness a Space X launch on October 7.

column2: The Part of Santa Monica People tend to Miss: Will Rogers State Beach
column3: Everyone's excited to go to the touristy and rather crowded pier and that's nice but if you want enjoy a more natural experience. Park at Will Rogers State Beach. Somewhere between 7:30 AM and 10 AM you may see a martial arts group practicing by the shore, dolphins, mussels growing on rocks and a nice 4.5 mile walk to the pier.

We visited the beach on our last trip to LA, it was a nice walk but not all that it is hyped up to be. The restaurants are good and so is the shopping, the pier is very busy and hard to get around with the amount of people that gather there. The carnival on the pier was very expensive.If you have some time to kill then visit the Pier at Santa Monica.

Out for a nice day at the beach, my family and I usually park near the 3rd street Promenade , which makes it easier for us to visit both locations, its only a ten minute walk to the sand and a 5 min walk to all the stores at the promenade . It is totally worth the no headache youll get waiting in the congested 10 fwy . DO NOT TAKE THE FREEWAY TILL IT ENDS , get off on Lincoln make a right and park on 3rd street . Trust me youll save and hour of driving and looking for pier parking  not worth it  park on top and save Time and Money.

column2: It was so cool to be in Santa Monica
column3: I love the boardwalk there. I t was a different place. I love everything in Santa Monica..Walking and the sea breeze really is so good plus a lot of fun for us...A must see...
nice place to spend a day, pier is absolutely busy place, things to see or just enjoy day at the beach.only thing that didn't like was pretzels. Wouldn't recommend them

If you gave an option - go elsewhere, preferably south. The bay is very polluted and water is very cold. A couple of hours drive south toward San Diego/Newport area and you will have a much better experience on the beach.
What a view, a lot of activities for families, also good for :dates. The beach is amazing & extremely relaxing, ther is water along the beach as far as you can see.

column2: Must on your trip to Cali!
column3: Cool, but a beautiful view! It was awesome to visit the pier also and we had great foods and gift options! There's even Pacific Park which is an amusement park there. A must but go before traffic back to LA gets bad!

It's normal beach..but had different way of car parking.. different way for people who want to go on beach and enjoy..another way to just enjoy the beach from a tourist spot..where you have to really walk down..then you will find whole lot of vendors..on sides selling their stuff..and few beggar's on sides..their is entertainment rides for kids and few for adults.. coffee shops..but too expensive.. I didn't enjoyed it at all ..not recommended

column2: Nice beaches and a pleasant day out
column3: We only visited for the day because we were staying north of the city but it was pleasantly warm and a good day out.There are just LOADS of T-shirt and momento stores there but also a few restaurants. There is also the pier of course so therewas plenty to keep us occupied.I'm not sure if I would go there again since there are so many beaches around there just doesn't seem any point in going to the same one repeatedly unless you are a local.Worth a visit though.

column2: Large Area with Several Beaches and Piers
column3: The Santa Monica Bay is home to some of the most famous beaches in the world including Malibu Beach, Will Rogers Beach, Santa Monica Beach, Venice Beach and Dockweiler Beach. There is Broadwalk and Muscle Beach at Venice. For shopping one can go to 3rd Street Promenade at Santa Monika. There is lot to do in various Piers including Malibu Pier, Santa Monica Pier, Venice Pier, Manhattan Beach pier, Hermosa Beach pier, and Redondo Beach pier.
This is s great place to come take a long walk, then grab a bite and relax. Never know who you can bump into here.
there is a lot to do here. The Sunset is the highlight. Plan it your day there around the sunset. Plenty of restaurants to choose from. Parking on the pier is a plus.

Look, it's the Baywatch beach -- the iconic beach experience. It has a nice sidewalk out to the sand and it is near restaurants and whatnot, so it's convenient. But with convenience comes CROWDS. So don't expect to have the beach to yourself. It will be yourself and 8,000 other people. Just know that going in. If you want a quieter experience, Google some Malibu beaches. There are some "secret" beaches that are WAY less crowded and probably nicer...but they aren't the Baywatch beach. So pick your poison.

visited as part of our 6 hour LA City Tour - was great to see the iconic beachfront and big wheel. Would like to return for a few days stay to explore the area further- some lovely restaurants and boutique shops

drove here from las vegas to spend one night in LA. this place was amazing the beach, the rides, the food, the view, worth the day trip. kids loved it. decent price for young kids 7 and under for unlimited rides. 18$ kids older than that is almost 40.
Rented a bike for all day ($16) and went from Santa Monica to Venice and back! Amazing weather, great beach view and just super experience!

so much to see and do here....shop the promenade, trapeze school on the pier, rent a bike and take a long ride along the beautifully paved bike path or take a walk on the bluff. Venice is close by and always fun. Have lunch at shutters or Casa del Mar-both are just steps away from the pier. Bring a suit and take a dip. A day here is just the tip of the iceberg. There are endless events and things to do
when I lived in LA county, may have taken my first born to the beach here. People very considerate sun hot
So beautiful! Beach was clean a few homeless people but not enough to make me leave. We we're there in late August, weather was fantastic and the water was warm! All around great place!
unbelievably busy but lots and lots of beach! which heads all the way into venice beach! Santa Monica is a little rough around the edges but again its a must see i feel. Plenty of restaurants around

We stopped here for a couple of hours and the kids loved swimming in the sea, even if it was a bit cold. Vendors go up and down the beach with drinks etc. Parking was about $14. If you've ever played GTA5 then you'll know how to get here lol

column2: Nice place to spend an evining
column3: This is most happening place with all kinds of entertainment. Enjoyed sun set in front of sea. Various restaurants, cafes, rides. Taking snap in front of End of trail 66 is memorable. Overall good place to spend evening here...

Being an avid traveler, I've seen a lot of Beach. Beaches that are a lot nicer! I guess if you're coming to California you have to visit but they're much nicer beaches in other parts of the world. Skip Malibu and Santa Monica and just go to Hawaii! This place is really expensive shopping and its really into itself!

Lovely to spend a hot day by the water. The city needs to ensure that the water fountains work and that there are taps to wash the sand off the feet once one leaves the beach. Lots of interesting vendors some nice places to eat and drink. Enjoyable.

column2: Santa Monica has so much to do!
column3: This is just one of the many things to do in Santa Monica so make sure you do your research to see what the locals do here. My best advice is to park, if you drove, at the public parking lot and walk to the Santa Monica Pier. Restaurants & Rides, even an Aquarium. You can rent bikes or roller skates near the steps at the bottom of the pier. Beautiful ocean breezes blow constantly as you walk along the bay. The Santa Monica mountains can be seen as you are looking in the same direction as Malibu. If you dont have time to stay the day, you can park on the Santa Monica Pier also unless its full, just follow the signs. Check out my restaurant review on the first on the restaurant on the left on the pier. Its delicious. I say go early in the day, or by noon to get the best parking. Check the hours of each place to eat. I believe we arrived around 11am. Enjoy!
Blue skies and ocean views! From Palisades Park to the Venicepier, Santa Monica bay is an amazing place. The ocean is usually calm and the sky is nearly always ble. Truly a special place.

Really enjoyed Santa Monica Pier! We were lucky to get there on a Sunday morning and by chance happened to see the amazing cars of the Westside VW Club. Just started our beach day perfectly! Had a good bagel on the pier and soaked in the athmosphere of streetmusicians and family fun. No place to hang around all day, but well worth an hour or two of your time to relax.

Did all the normal stuff out onto the pier, walked to Venice beach about 25/30 minutes Got there by train from Downtown LA from 7th Central station, got renewable top-up tickets takes around 1 hour.Interesting train trip through the suburbs to the coast

I was born and raised in West Los Angeles and Santa Monica Bay is the place that defines our summers. It is not a pristine beach , but the sands are expansive, The pier is worth a look and visit the old fashioned merry go round. Have a hot dog on the stick and enjoy the boardwalk. People watch. And remember we can enjoy the beach more than 8 months a year. Avoid the crowds and park early especially on the weekends.
Best place for families, out of town guests, bike riding for all ages-people watching, great hotels, fun restaurants and an amusement park. So much to do!

Not sure what the hullabaloo was about. the pier has a small amusement park with about 8 rides for pre teens. There are just. A few restaurants, most without a good view, and 1 or 2 small shops. Was hoping to have a dinner overlooking the ocean and get some souvenirs, but the pier didn't have either. The streets around the pier had restaurants and restaurants though.

Santa Monica Broadwalk is at the end of legendary Route 66 as it ends here. Lot of things to do for all ages. Ferris wheel, kids play games, lovely beach. Lot of good eateries close to the board walk. 3rd St Promenade has a great selection of shops. Helpful hint: On 2nd st, there are public parkings lots where first 90 mins are free. Otherwise paid parking can be very expensive, From 20 to 40 dollars for the day.
Nice beach , not crowded. Lots of families on the beach. A very nice path to walk along. The changing area was clean. Its very easy to hire bikes and scooters.

Really something see. Lots of different areas to see, all have their distinct feel. Most beaches are large. Most beaches have a nice crowd and parking is a bit scarce. Surprised to see most of the bay is calm with the exception of certain areas. Of course those areas are loaded with surfers. Just so cool.
If you haven't been it's worth visiting this part of LA. it is bustling and full of touristy stuff as well as some nice eateries.
On a hot summer day Santa Monica beach was ideal for a trip.The bay was full of sun and sea lovers.The beach was sandy.Beach services were provided by mobile cars offering from bikes to scooters.

Santa Monica definitely reminded me of home as it feels like a lovely beach town, with nice warm weather and ocean front views whats not to love? Everything is in walking distance, and if you are feeling particularly tired there are motorised scooters available for hire around every corner.

The pacific coast highway through Santa Monica is busy and fast. The beach is huge! Well maintained and pretty clean for California. Over taxed and under funded is the motto. Overall nice place to visit.
People watching at its finest. Take a walk from Venice to Santa Monica and take in the little shops and interesting people.

We visited the Santa Monica beach during my visit to LA in May... I visited it two times with friends 锔 I fell in love with the place, a lot of activities, cool people, lovely white sand beach. A lot of volleyball fields where you can enjoy the sun and the game. A long pathway where you can ride bicycles and enjoy the view. Available parking as well as bathrooms...
Santa Monica has lots of character and the beach front and bay are stunningLovely restaurants coffee bars and nice jovial and casual crowdsWorth visiting for 1/2 a day to a full day
I love this place, the beaches are clean, its beautiful, the people are so chill. Sunsets are gorgeous here
Every one their is so fit and a cool place to be seen everyday and nightSo many people doing exercising being fit and enjoying life
Easy to reach by commutertrain. The pier more lika a market place but sandy beaches looked nice. Tempting towncenter for shopping.

So lovely that our public beaches can be accessed by all and there is something for everyone. You can bike or stroll along path that runs parallel to the shore for miles in each direction or just sit on the beach and enjoy the waves.

We visited on a Sunday afternoon and took a walk along the super wide beach packed with sunbathers and swimmers. Looks as if it goes on forever. The walk did! Famous beach and a must to visit if in the area.

column2: Endless sands, incredible sunsets, great food
column3: Such an amazing place to experience! The beach itself is stunning, white sands for miles, great fun to be had on the pier, loads of places to eat for all budgets and tastes, fun and relaxed atmosphere!
Even on busy days there is plenty of room as beaches are huge. Very clean. Mexicans are selling watermelons but they do not bother you if you do not make a sign. Always a treat to come here.

We arrived by metro and it was only a short distance to the Pier, which was interesting as it being the end of Route 66, we didn't previously know that. There are amusements and places to eat. We walked along the promenade to Venice Beach, interesting watching bikes, scooters, skateboards all mingling along. Watched the skateboarders in their park and muscle men exercising at Venice Beach. I was surprised by the number of homeless living here.
We like the beach, but it was very crowded on a Tuesday night! Limited parking as well. The surrounding area offered alittle bit for everyone.
Great place to visit where the crowds aren't too big and the scene is a family friendly vibe. Santa Monica itself is wonderful as well.

Santa Monica bay is a great fun day, fantastic beach, beautiful long pier with food, fairground numerous shops. The beach is very clean, water is clear, showers everywhere, a beautiful place to spend the day with the family. Don't forget the ferris wheel a must do. If you stay late you will be treated by a terrific sunset. Word of warning watch out for the scooters.

column2: Beautiful Beach and many fun activities
column3: One of our favorite spots in LA, so many things to do, swim and tan, play games at the pier, eat in one of many seaside restaurants , or our personal favorite take a bike ride up to Malibu or down to Venice beech, then in the evening go shopping g at the nearby mall, enjoy street shows or watch a movie.
Santa Monica bay is a great day out, fantastic beach, lovelly long pier with food,fairground & shops .You can take a UBER taxi for $34 dollars wach way from Hollywood, it only takes 35 minutes.

This place is beautiful, I went over there with my wife for a running next to the beach, we did 14 beautiful miles running. Then we spend the rest of the day in the beach. It is very clean, showers everywhere, restaurants, super nice

Visited Santa Monica Pier and Santa Monica Beach for a swim and to look around. It was very windy that day, so we didn麓t do the beach. Parking was pretty easy, many parking lots around the pier. Parking a bit expensive, but very convenient. Had lunch at a nearby restaurant which actually was crowded but very good food. Pier was nice, and also recommend to take a walk in Santa Monica City, nice place.
Great two visits to escape the Valley heat...15degrees cooler..Fab place to visit,great beach....places to eat....but beware of the scooters.....nightmare.

Nice place to visit, you will find all types of restaurants to have lunch. The pier is also a MUST when you visit Santa Monica, long walk but it is worth. The Pacific Park is nice, very good to families!
We went to Santa Monica pier and enjoyed the beach there. There was plenty of room to sit and relax. My son loved being able to walk into the water and just walk around.
Santa Monica is a nice place Santa Monica bay is great place for a walk, clean beaches nice views great for photos

column2: One of our favourites in LA
column3: It totally depends what you want from LA, but we were definitely glad we came here during our three-day stay.We actually walked from Venice Beach along the boardwalk. We didn't like Venice Beach as much but the whole walk and experience was enjoyable. When we got to Santa Monica we went on the pier. It was very busy but quite an exciting place with plenty of things to do in the fairground (Pacific Park). Its free to go in and look around. You can look back towards the shore and its pretty!We then spent some time on the beach and in the sea which was lovely. It was nice to get away to a beach and feel at peace and relaxed in the bustling city of LA. The toilet and shower facilities on the beach are also really good.We then took a venture up to the shopping area and for some food which is very well designed and is such a pleasant experience. We then watched the sunset from the pier before catching an uber back to our hotel in Hawthorne.In general its a really pleasant and relaxed area of Los Angeles. One of our favourite areas!

I wasn't expecting this place to be amazing, however I absolutely loved it. The beach is great, the pier is nostalgic and the sunset beautiful. I arrived here early one more and there was plenty of parking. Stopped by again in the late afternoon and parking was at a premium. Loved everything about this place.

column2: Great place to stay in LA
column3: Santa Monica has the beach, shopping and some interesting newly gentrified areas within a 10 minute drive. Worth looking at if you are planning to spend more than a few days in LA.

column2: Wide beach and very active after 11 am
column3: Whole are is not crowded in the monring but after 11 it is getting crowded. It is a good place to visit if you love beaches
Definietly worth a visit. Could easily spend a few hours or even a day. We trekked from Venice Beach and made our way to Santa Monica Pier which is well worth

column2: The GO TO Beach in Los Angeles...
column3: I live in Santa Monica. And like most Santa Monicans I have a love/hate relationship with the beach and with local tourism in general. LOL. That said, we have one heck of a beach here (and coupled with the Pier - it is pretty much unsurpassed.) There is so much to do. So much to see. So many amenities. So much people watching - that for even a native it can be really invigorating and quite exciting. I suggest you rent a bike and ride along the Pacific Coast Bike Path. Have a meal and a drink on the Pier. Mariasol serves a pretty good meal and a pretty great margarita. But sitting under a beach umbrella on a blanket on a hot afternoon next to Santa Monica Bay is its own terrific reward. I rarely feel more relaxed, more rested...
It was wonderful to see the beach and pier but it was so crowded and expensive. Great shops in town.

The bay has a nice somewhat crowded beach with plenty of amenities such as bathrooms, places to wash the sand off your feet and sand volleyball nets. We were there around sunset so it was nice place to watch the sun go down.
Its a massive expanse of golden sand, huge iconic pier, surf and sea to enjoy and a day to be remembered here. Dont forget your sun cream either.
Very crowded on the pier. Our guide drove us there and pick us up after 10 minutes which was enough time to walk the length of the pier to see everything. Reminds me of a county fair on a pier.

Santa is truly beautiful as well as having the Santa Monica pier, its home to the Original muscle Beach, and a outside Chess club or you can just relax and take in the Sun-rays its very lively and from my Experience never far away from a Street performer, Venice Beach isnt to far around a 15 mins walk you can also see some Beautiful scenery like Mountains facing towards Malibu or Topanga state park which I also hope to also visit in the near Future. You can do many Activities like volleyball Surfing working out and many more, also has a Iconic amusement park, with Restaurants and games rooms. My kids love it here we Often walk Back-and-forth Between Santa Monica and Venice beach
we had nice time spending in the place , nothing is special , similar to pther places on the ocean in LA
This can be reached by metro from Downtown , all is well worth taking the time to visit and stroll along the boardwalk .
We went to the beach that was right under the flight path for LAX. A little noisy, but my son loved watching the planes. The beach was nice. Had large fire pits available. RV camping also.
A convenient beach to visit even taking a public transportation. There's a free wifi everywhere supported by Santa Monica. Safe place to roam around looking for good restaurant or shopping store.
A sandy beach on the Pacific Ocean- Santa Monica beach is a must visit while traveling to LA...The entire atmosphere appears to be festive around the Pacific Park with a range of shops and cafes.
You will want to spend lots of time here to enjoy everything it has to offer. Breath taking and Beautiful
This was a cool relaxing day for my family. Beautiful sight! The water was a bit cold for us, coming from humid hot Texas.

I guess watching so many American TV shows and movies made me think this beach is going to look like some sort of tropical beach where everyone looks like Barbie or Ken.Well it did not happen, instead I saw a quiet beach with normal people. The water is not that blue as the photos suggest - well it is also very cold as it is the Pacific Ocean.All in all it is a nice beach but I have seen more beautiful ones

It is far and out of the way! Traffic is terrible, and the sand is dirty from too many tourists! This place is overcrowded and terribly overrated! The only good thing is the long side walk for walkers and cyclists! As for the rest its not that good, especially since its highly rated and over hyped! I guess I am just spoilt with amazing beaches in South Africa!
Arguably one of the most iconic places in Southern California. It did not disappoint, the beaches and especially the pier was beautiful. Great food from Bubba Gump Shrimp and fun times at the arcade.

column2: Great place to take a bike ride on Saturday
column3: Arrived Friday at Union Station. Then the cheapest way to get to Marina Del Rey or Santa Monica is Uber. Then you can rent a bike at many places, take a ride on the 24 mile bike trail up to the Santa Monica Pier, from wherever you are staying. Great place for beach parties, taking the kids to the amusement park on the pier, and, in general, people watching.

It was on a day tour but we could spend sometime at Santa Monica. There was huge number of tourists on the day we visited and there is lot of attraction as the association organizes various shows. Wonderful experpience.

column2: Santa Monica supports your mood swings
column3: You have the crowd and serenity at the same place. Walk on the pier and enjoy the street artists and food. Walk of the pier and enjoy the solitude pf Pacific ocean

...It's a bay.There's some beach (mostly overrated), commerce, and questionable-quality sea water. It's a place that people should love to say they've been to, but probably in retrospect don't care that they were.

column2: TRULY BEAUTLIFUL PLACE TO SPEND A DAY
column3: Just about what I had pictured as we saw this beach. Great place to spend the day. Not too crowded today as it was a weekday but so beautiful.
Beautiful long and wide beach. Lots of free sport and exercise facilities. Nice places to eat and drink. Great place to sunbathe or swim.
santa monica was good, from the pier to the lovely sandy beach although they were doing some work by the car park by the beach.
It is a must in Los angeles.You need to visit with the family, water is very cold, sunset are great
Good day out beach fair restaurant all lovely clean street entertainment food very good price good easy to get to was not that busy lots of restaurants and bars definitely worth a visit

column2: Santa Monica was a nice place to visit
column3: We got the metro from LA which was about an hour... you hop of the metro straight into the main town. There are lots of cafes, restaurants, bars and shops here in the town area. As you head towards the beach and the pier it is only a short walk away. The beach is lovely with white sands, there was at the time a memorial to soldiers who were committing suicide from PTSD which was very sad. The pier has the normal types of attractions with arcades and rides- you can buy a day ticket.

column2: Beautiful Day on white sandy beaches!
column3: Lots of interesting people, foods, treats, smells and sounds! From tourist things to just a beautiful beach with waves rolling in, I highly recommend stopping game by!

column2: Beautiful and best viewed from the Pier.
column3: We could have spent a whole day just taking in the sights here. It was a beautiful historical place and we are so glad we visited.
The beach was almost vacant and it was fabulous. The wind, the gulls, the ocean smell, were all perfect. Beach was totally clean.
An excellent place to escape the grimy streets of Hollywood. The Pacific becomes a playground for the rich and famous...plus the rest of us. Worth a ride down the boulevard of broken dreams.

column2: Santa Monica Bay offers the Best Fun.
column3: Take a day and go to Santa Monica beach in the morning and enjoy a swim and some sun. Lunch can be at wonderful restaurants and cafes along the boardwalk. Then go to the PIER and look at the characters that play music and sing, and feel welcomed by big smiles from beautiful people. Behind the bay is the mall full of terrific boutiques and cafes and at the end of the day enjoy a cocktail as the sun sets. Santa Monica Bay..... will give you your best day! Janice.

Spent so much time here, just walking up and down from Venice to Santa Monica and back... I love watching people walk their dogs, couples in love, friends hanging together, people doing acrobatics, fitness and different kinds of sport. It's beautiful and windy, the sun shines bright and you just know that life is good, and all is well. Positive vibes here!

Enjoyed spending time around the pear and the bay several times during our vacation in the area. Weather early in the morning, during the day or into the evening . It is a really nice place to spend the time as a couple or family. The walk paths along the beach, bike paths are a great way to enjoy the area and people-watch :-). Recommend taking the time to enjoy it well, all the area from the Santa Monica Pier down through Venice beach into Marina Del Ray area
What a lovely day out, spending time in the shops and restaurants, and ofcourse the Pier! Beautiful beaches and beautiful people, this is a MUST if visiting LA.
A popular beach and promenade. Beachside you can easily walk down to Venice Beach and the Palisade cliff top walk gives a different perspective. The pier is also an highlight of the area.

column2: MORE THAN JUST A GREAT BEACH
column3: If come to see Santa Monica beach you will find so much more. The beach itself it a great place to spend the day. Of course there is the famous pier with food and shops plus rides so something for the whole family. After visiting the area if you have any energy just walk a couple blocks inland to the 3rd Street Promenade. Shops and restaurant all in a wonderful atmosphere of SoCal. One note if you have never been to the area it can get cool. I brought friends visiting from Pennsylvania and had secretly placed sweatshirts in the trunk. They used everyone of them. To me it is the best of both worlds.

I highly recommend this beach. The water is already very warm and clean from April. The beach is well maintained and has a very large and inexpensive parking. The people on the beach are very nice and friendly. You can also borrow a bike very cheap and drive it.

Visited here as oart of a tour operated by AMG Coaches and Tours of Anaheim. The pier was a fun place with plenty going on. We were amazed to see parking for vehicles actually on the pier, nothing like that in the U.K. The beach was superb and all in all it was well worth stopping here on the tour.

Always seen the landscape shots with my old favorite late night show and want to make sure I went there at least once. Only draw back is the parking situation and the cost too. This is where I was introduced to the new thing with renting Bird electric scooters. Theyre everywhere!!The people on the bike path are a little agressive even for an adult with fearing of getting clipped and runner over. Let alone with small children.

I grew up going to Santa Monica Beach. It was a family friendly beach then and it still is. There are no rocks and the sand slopes slowly into the ocean. With the boardwalk and pier always within walking distance, there are plenty of food and entertainment choices. The biggest mistake tourists make is coming in June or early July; this is when it is often overcast and the water is still cold. Late July through early September are definitely the premium months. Additionally, if it is possible, avoid the weekends when the locals are off and head to the beach.
beautiful. a lot going on there- good shops and beautiful shoreline and beach. everyone is carefree here.
