We were there early and by the time we were leaving it was getting very busy. A must see. Huge beach and coastline and you could see Malibu in the distance.

We hired bikes close to Venice canals and cycled along the beach cycle track through Venice to Santa Monica. The golden sand looked beautiful in the sunshine, there was lots to see and photograph, happy holidaymakers mingled with cyclists, skaters and Segway riders. Santa Monica pier is huge and we enjoyed an ice cream as we strolled along and took it all in. There were plenty of places to leave our bikes locked up and we walked up into Santa Monica from here for lunch. The area was beautifully looked after and another time I would like to stay here as there is so much to see and enjoy.

column2: Nice beach & views to take a stroll.
column3: I visited in May 2016 last year, on my solo trip to Cali. I was lucky enough to go on the day the metro line (light blue) opened up to Downtown Santa Monica, which saved me a whole lot of hassle to get there in the first place. Since it was the opening, the metro line was packed, packed, packed. The metro ride is a good 40min, if you are starting from Downtown LA (Hollywood red line). Also, the metro is incredibly cheap (but not 100% safe, so be smart and alert). For a 1 week unlimited pass, which included metro AND bus, I paid 25.00$. Certain areas do not have a metro line yet, so you will have to grab a bus (double check on the metro map before you set out to leave - they show maps with new lines, but they aren't open yet. That was a tad confusing to me, and it did ruin some of my original planning for transport). Santa Monica is big with lots of restaurants, shops, endless beachline and an amusement park at the pier. Since I was alone, I simply walked about exploring, but it was not a hit for me (I'm not a beach fan to begin with). But if you love shopping and laying down on the beach, this is the place to be. If I had stayed a shorter time in LA, I would have skipped this visit.
Santa Monica is beautiful - the beach, the weather, the shopping, etc.Even if you only visit once, you have to go :)

column2: Great place to spend a day.
column3: We stayed in West Hollywood but loved the Santa Monica area. The pier, the beach, the restaurants - fantastic. Next time in LA, this is where we will stay.

column2: spectacular view, great beach, lots of activity
column3: Santa Monica is wow! View from the promenade on top - quite a stroll after you dine and show in the town or drop down to a fabulous beach, fun pier, and ocean fun. Wwe took paddleboards and just loved it!

The Santa Monica area is full of things to do. There is shopping nearby, restaurants for all tastes, an amusement park at the pier, or you can spend a lazy day on the beach. For the more active there is a running/wal;king path on the boardwalk or along Ocean Avenue. There is something for everyone.

We drove down the coast and walked on the beach. The water was spectacular! There were many great restaurants and bars along the way. Great place to spend the day relaxing and enjoying nature. We even saw sea lions playing nearby
We only had 20mins at this place and it wasn't enough - we will definitely going there again when we go back to LA.
Took the family to the pier and enjoyed pizza and watched the boys ride the Ferris wheel and play the games. Good family fun if you are looking for a night that is not to full on.
Santa Monica peer most be the equivalent of the Blackpool peer in the UK. Lots of tourists, public toilets are filthy and not that special. No class

column2: It's good but there are better
column3: I mean, it's like any other beachfront. Some good places to eat and relax, but it's usually crowded and it ain't the cleanest beach on the west coast.

Santa Monica Bay and Pier is a very nice place to go. You have a nice beach, you have fun anda good food at the pier and 2 block from the beach you have a street shop with lots of famous brand. Greta place to spend your day!

We found a parking spot just slightly south of the Pier. If you've ever driven here you know that's a miracle! The grassy area by the parking is quite nice. It's a good spot for a picnic.We walked over to the beachside via the overhead walkway. It's a bit smelly in spots. The beach is wide and the waves are great. The water is cold in July... don't worry, you'll get used to it quickly. The undertow is pretty strong. Keep an eye on small children it could pull them under. We've seen a lot of piers so we skipped this one, enjoyed the beach and then back to the hotel for showers and a nice dinner.
Great beach, all the way to Venice, rented bikes at Perry's, visited the Pier, and Pacific Park. Kids spent more time in the water near Venice beach.

Glad I went just to say, "I've seen the famous SM Pier" go back....NOPE. This place is filthy. Homeless people everywhere and people begging for money. The smell of Dope hits you every hundred feet. The beach was so packed, it looked like ants in a sugar farm. The boardwalk smelled of urine and body odor from all the homeless. SAD :(

A perfect way to spend a day at the beach. We parked at the South Parking Lot #4 - $8 for the day, midweek and parked 20 feet from the sand. Uncrowded, great warm surf to play in and fine clean sand - overall a great day
Some lovely views of beach scenes and some good restaurants.Visited the pier and the funfair, good fun

We spent a whole day in Santa Monica. there is so much to do here. We visited the little aquarium under the pier, walked up and down the pier, so much entertainment going on, There was a rock band playing made up of a family of brothers and sisters from about 8 or 9 to 15 years old and they were great. After the pier we walked along the beach for bit before coming in land and spent some time around the shops before having some food and then a movie. Even that was amazing, we do not have such luxurious cinemas were I live in UK. I tell anyone that asks me about highlights of our trip to LA that out day in Santa Monica was definitely one.

We travelled here by train - only an hour's journey from Hollywood. It was worth the ride, we walked on the pier and also walked to Venice Beach and back. The latter is about 40 minute walk from the pier. We sat on the beach and my son swam - there are strong tides so you do have to be careful where you swim, and listen to the lifeguards. Some parts of the sea are reserved for surfing and water sports. We enjoyed paddling near some rock pools where there are little crabs. Lovely clean beach with sand - it gets very hot at midday so don't walk barefoot! We got a bit sunburnt - make sure you keep topping up the sun cream.

As good as the last time we were there. Bubba Gumps grat for lunch.sat for a while on the beach and people watched. Bit of a pain getting there from LA as sat nav seemed to be sending us in all the wrong directions.

Hot and crowded the day we visited, but still, an interesting place to see. The Ferris wheel is quite iconic and so a must-do, but to be perfectly honest, the beaches in California are not a patch on Australia's.

We caught the metro to Santa Monica it took about fourty minutes,and then it was just a short walk to the pier.Lots to see there was a fair ground ,loads of stalls,looking down on the beach it looked quite busy.The end of the Pier was the end of route 66.Very interesting.Nice day out.

column2: Fabulous beaches and a great cycle route
column3: We hired bikes in Venice beach and rode along the dedicated cycle lanes to Santa Monica Pier. The beaches are long and wide and there is plenty of room for everyone to stretch out and, if you're brave enough (the waves are huge) to go for a swim.

Santa Monica and its beaches are justifiably a top tourist destination but the summer weekends get very crowded. As a resident I know it well. Parking is difficult to find near the pier and the traffic is heavy. If you must come on a busy weekend here are some tips.1. Take the train. There is a rail line from downtown all the way to the beach. Park at one of the of the other stations like Culver City2. Try the Municipal parking lot off Main St and Pico Blvd if you do drive to SM3. Enjoy the beach north of the pier: its worth the walk along the path to get away from the noise and crowds4. Eat on Main St south of Pico. Great noodles, vegan Thai, ice cream shops.5. Rent a bike from Sobi the SM bike share program
Stayed just off Santa Monica Pier! It was amazing! Enjoyed the ocean, the pier, and the shopping! Definitely a fun time!
This location was one of the stops on our tour. It was very peaceful to walk around and has such beautiful scenery.
Lovely to visit. Clean beach. Lots of room for everyone. Lots of fun things to do on the pier - mini funfair and lots of nice treats to eat. Clean and tidy. Parking close to beach.

column2: Not safe! Drug users and needles all over!
column3: I remember coming here for years. This trip to my extreme shock the drug users seem to have taken over the beach and pier. Needles in sand, users all over, not what it used to be and unfortunately very unsafe for families! My trip ended in ER after getting poked by a drug needle while running fingers in sand!
The "Pier" was a cool fun place, loved it. lot of nice helpful people. Beach was tons of fun will go back soon.

Santa Monica Bay beautiful beach with endless possibilities. Water nice surf or boogie board or lay out picnic.Walk on path, Rollerblade, bike with rentals close.Walk to pier 4 more adventurous family fun. U can go to mini amusement park ride roller coaster, merry go round numerous small rides & games win prizes eat cotton candy to pizza,burgers or sit down restaurants on pier. Walk end pier listen to music enjoy view or even fish! More upscale restaurants u can walk up the pier to third street promenade for fabulous family fun. You have upscale stores all around, beautiful mall with great food court and walk the pronenade for out door performers from clowns,rappers, musicians to outdoor cafes fun for all. Enjoy Santa Monica Bay the family adventures endless.

column2: A lovely wander along the beach
column3: We had a lot of fun, just wandering along with the crowds, buying some souvenirs and having a dip in the sea. If you are into healthy eating, we found a huge range of great restaurants back off the beach.
The pier is exciting and fun. All sorts of foods to snack on, rides to enjoy and loads of picture taking opportunities.

You walk in the side of the beach surround it by food trucks shops cyclist and different people mashing exerciseDespite the horrible smell of marihuana in each step it was a nice walk with a lot of people singing I the corners
We have seen Santa Monica's wooden wharf for several times in the movies. It was exiting to see this historical wooden wharf naked eye.
I went 2 times, on weekend and on a week day. Both super crowded, but the beach is good to chill, talk, tan a little.

column2: Vibrant and fun but too crowded
column3: There's a lot to do, rides, carnival games, all different kinds of great street performers in every corner of the pier. You can go fishing or hang out at the beach. Just be prepared for the big crowds especially on a nice sunny weekend. Getting to park by the pier alone is crazy. The beach is packed and the lines for everything is long.

column2: The pier is a must see if you are in town
column3: While not a lot to do on the pier, it is a classic that shouldn't be missed if you are nearby. The sea water is not the cleanest compared to the areas just north like Malibu. The beaches are very accessible and clean. The small aquarium is interesting as a sort of please touch museum that supports the bay foundation. Go early for parking and to get ahead of the crouds during peak season.

column2: Santa Monica Bay is Beautiful, Friendly and Worth Visiting
column3: I have lived in Santa Monica for many years and taught at Santa Monica College for years. Things have changed in Santa Monica and not all for the better. There is now a metro rail that comes here and since then the traffic has become almost unbearable, but once you hit the ocean it is all worth it with great local restaurants, the Pier with all its rides and fun games and nearby are the street performers.
Was able to get out here before sunset and take amazing photos with sunset in the background. Not way too crowded either or loud, plus is the location of the ice cream shop nearby!

We went close to dinner time and the Pier was crowded. There are restaurants on the pier, carnival rides, people fishing, street performers and small souvenir shops. We stayed to see it all lit up at night. Very cool!
Great atmosphere and great photo opportunities. Nice walk to Venice beech and back. Easy access via Meteo fro Hollywood.

When tourists want to see Santa Monica what they should do is visit the 3rd Street Promenade between Wilshire & Broadway, walk west to Ocean Avenue for beautiful restaurants and across the street is Palisades Park with its beautiful view from high atop a cliff above Santa Monica Beach. From there you will see Santa Monica pier which surprisingly has a roller coaster and Ferris wheel. Sunsets are always stunning and the view includes Malibu and mountains to your right (north).

column2: Best place to stay if in LA
column3: Stay here if visiting LAHas all the shopping and close to airportGreat beach walk and can walk/bike to Venice beach with a little effort

column2: overseas visitors tick it off the bucket list
column3: we went on a weekend but it is probably crowded any sunny day, nice walk along the pier lots of touristy souvenirs lots of photo opportunities or just take time to people watch

Enjoyed the view of the Pacific Ocean. Even though the sun was hot, the cold ocean breeze made it bearable! There were a lot of people on the Pier, which was very crowded. There were many restaurants near 3rd street to try as well!

Being an experienced traveler i have seen better beaches. Santa Monica beach just wasn't one of the better beaches i have seen. The sand did not look that nice and clean and the water looked dirty. From far i definitely enjoyed staying in the Santa Monica bay area over other areas of LA like Hollywood for example.

column2: Historically cool, but tons of people
column3: Stopped by over July 4th weekend and battled about a million people. Parking was $40 and the lines were huge. It's cool to see it and it's been in a bunch of movies.

column2: Great beach to go in LA
column3: Go early parking fills up fast the pier is awesome great food awesome views bring sun block and plan for a great day at the beach
Spent a day here,large beach but not crowded,plenty of room for everyone.Went on the iconic SANTA MONICA PIER well worth a visit

column2: Have a swim in the pacific
column3: If you never tried to swim in the pacific, here's your chance.On the beach lifeguard are ready to help you out. The water is nice of temp but there are quiet some waves, so do not try as a novice.On the pier there's a lot of attractions ( like a carnival) and a nice vibe. Some are trying to catch a fish on the hook, others stare to the ocean. If you 're lucky you might spot some delphins.Just along the pier on the beach one can shower. There are a lot of public parkings on oceandrive with various prices. Nice place to visit!

column2: Do not go here for a beach
column3: Wasted time here walking the boardwalk when what we really wanted was the beach. SO crowded you couldn't even have your own space. Locals selling fruit rather forcefully. Cold day and cold water. Wish we had gone another 30 mins to Malibu.
This is over rated and tacky, the beach is impressive and worth seeing but the whole lot is a bit desperate.

column2: Fablous place great sea food celebrity resturants all over the place
column3: Great beach amazing place to spend whole day , great food specially sea food , loved the prawns and grilled fish .

column2: Great place to shop, eat and play!
column3: So much to do here! Great food, awesome shopping and fun for everyone. We had a great time exploring the area and walking around.

column2: Not very impressed with the rides.
column3: We just didn't feel the rides were very exciting. the pier has an old fashioned feel and very crowded but the rides were expensive and short. The location is very beautiful Cali beach scene!

The Santa Monica pier is like any other amusement park, expensive and a bit seedy but OK for an hour with kids. The beach next to the per was fine if you like to swim and body surf, which my two grand-daughters, ages 12 and 10, do and did. The area gets crowded so get there early to get public parking, at $12/day, which was fine.
Santa Monica is a beautifu place to visit & walking along their water & beaches is wonderful & enjoyable!
A great way to spend a few hours relaxing in the LA sun. The further north that you go up the coast the quieter the beach becomes.

column2: Santa Monica Bay is a Great Place to Spend Time
column3: I lived in the Santa Monica area for 35 years and Santa Monica Bay and the beach is terrific. A good way to spend a day. Also there is Santa Monica Pier which is popular and has amusement rides. Santa Monica Bay is just beautiful to look at. Also Palisades Park along Ocean Ave in Santa Monica which over looks the bay is also very popular as well. Summer months, especially on weekends and holidays is a challenge to get in to Santa Monica. Parking can be very pricey during those months. The best way is to take the Metro Expo Line to Downtown Santa Monica and walk four blocks to the pier and the beach.
4stars as it's a nice beach but there's nothing special. The sand is soft and worth checking it out, but no need to spend too much time!
Full of life, lots of options for eat around, lots of options for activities all around the pear.Be careful and not to get trapped with fake offers.
We rode bikes from here to Venice Beach, it's a great facility and very popular. Plenty of things to amuse on the pier and a couple of drinks goes down well.

column2: Love the end of Route 66, which we had just driven.
column3: Great time. Love the views. Great music on the boardwalk.lovely day. Carlos had helpful hints. He als took several picture of us and then left us to explore for ourselves.

column2: Rent a bike and see the sights!
column3: I rented a bike and cycled from venice beach to santa monica pier on the costal bike path. Was really relaxing and a great way to see the sights. Beach seemed relatively clean and their are lots of shops/stalls to buy souvenirs. There are a lot of homeless people but that seems to be the case across the whole of LA but on the whole I felt safe and had a great afternoon out. Be aware that parking in this area is a nightmare - the street parking is limited and the car parks that are available are really expensive ($20 flat charge). Not too bad if you are spending the whole day but too much just for a few hours in my opinion.

Spent a afternoon there with my friends. Nice to see all kinds of different people and have a beer on a beach from TV shows. Even though it is nothing special, with a nice wind breeze you feel part of it!

column2: Very Crowded when its warm here
column3: The Bay is crowded, expensive and very hard to find parking during high temperatures.But if want to see a great beach and some mighty fine looking folks and some mighty strange folks. Then by all means come on over.
Water is cold and dirty. View of Santa Monica no big deal. View of the Malibu hills are awesome!! Nice ride out in the bay on a sunny day!!
came here on our way from hollywood nice area beach was very busy some weird characters nosing about but i suppose you get that everywhere nice place to bring kids lovely beach area
Just like TV.love it!lots of homeless people.beer is pricey.no smoking anywhere.great farmer market.not too much of police presence.weed is 1 question away :)

column2: In walking distance from Su Casa.....
column3: it took us about 20-30 minutes to walk there and it was so nice!!! the walk on the boardwalk from Venice beach to Santa Monica Pier is not only relaxing, but peaceful and full of entertainment along the way
Plenty to see and do and close to all that LA has to offer.Great safe beach and a visit to the pier is a must.

column2: Far too many people at this time of year
column3: We would have loved to have visited the Santa Monica Pier, but it was just insane how many people were there at 7pm on Tuesday night. Parking was impossible, I'm just so glad that we have actually done the pier previously.
We spent a sunny afternoon on the boardwalk and pier. We were able to take beautiful pictures and enjoy a coffee and churros.

Glad we had a day out of LA city and pent it here. Had a lovely walk along the pier which marks the end of famous Route 66. Buy the T shirt to show you've done it! But there's more to the town than just the pier so stroll along the beach front and see the muscle men exercising, relax in a beach front cafe and watch the whole world go by. Life has a different pace here. Expect the usual street traders and 'artists' as well as homeless wanting spare change.
Beautiful view, lots of fun activities and carnival food or restaurant food available. I would recommend going to watch the sunset

Santa Monica Bay really begins in Malibu and ends in Palos Verdes. It is vast and varied. Its best seen on the excellent bicycle path that runs for most of it length. Santa Monica Pier and Venice are interesting of of course. But what I find most interesting is that large pockets of it feel like you are on a deserted island. As greater :Los Angeles has 14,ooo,ooo people I find that fascinating.

The Santa Monica pier is great for activities. HOWEVER, because of storm drain run off, this is a place I would avoid swimming this summer, especially near the pier. This beach received a "D" grade for water quality from Heal the Bay.

column2: No trip to Los Angeles is complete without visiting Santa Monica and it's beach
column3: Many of the beaches around Los Angeles are wonderful and the Santa Monica beaches and the bay are really special. I love to walk the strand, walk the famous pier and in the summer go to the beach. My advice if you plan to go to the beach on a summer weekend, get there early as parking and traffic get worse as the day goes on

column2: Always too crowded and parking is a major pain!
column3: Santa Monica Bay, specifically the beach near the pier is too crowded and parking is expensive and hard to find. I usually go there a few times a year with my family.

Living in the Caribbean islands of Trinidad and Tobago affords me the wonderful opportunity of being surrounded by beautiful beaches. My visit to Santa Monica Bay brought a homely feel to LA for me, just with LA flare. There was so much excitment all around, from the excited tourists, pets, street entertainers to the kids in the amusement park, sun bathers and diners. Above all the breathtaking views, refreshing wind and good eats made it special. What a time, beating the sun, hearing the sea and strolling the sand.
It's pretty. Better ocean views south of LA in my opinion. There were a lot of mentally ill people ranting and roaming.

Loved loved loved Santa Monica and a must visit. Beach is beautiful, pier is really fun with lots going on, third street promenade is a great shopping street just for the entertainment etc x one of my fav places I visited on my tour of California.
We rented bikes and rode around Venice and Santa Monica beach. Get there early, if you want cheaper parking. It gets really crowded the closer it gets to the weekend. The pier is fun and lots to do.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is seen in so many movies and TV shows you might want to see it
column3: Santa Monica Pier is an iconic symbol of the beach culture in the L. A. area. There are shops restaurants, amusement rides and performers and artists who pay for spots on the pier. There is a parking lot on the pier itself which is cheaper than the large beach lot which costs $12.
Good to see, but nothing special. Better beaches in NZ and Auz. The beach is wide and there are lots of shops and souvenirs to look at.

column2: Breathtaking Views and Lots to See & Do!
column3: There are so many shops and restaurants and rides on the Santa Monica Pier, itself, and the beach offers plenty of room for everyone. Fishing off the pier, playing in the waves, or simply people-watching... and you can't beat the gorgeous scenery all around you! You might even get lucky and sea a California sea lion hanging around the pier (we did!).

For couples a romantic walk along the beach or pier.Lots of retail therapy in the area.A new Wyndham hotel on the waterfront.A newish train line into the downtown area.Some buskers at the pier and activities for children.The train is much quicker than the bus and a slightly better clientele.You need to walk a bit from the station to the pier and then along the pier .if you can't walk for 10 minutes this is not the place for you.
The beach is very crowded full of entertainment, restaurant, street artistNice view for sunsetCan't get down to beachQuiet far from place we stayIt's good one
i liked the pier a little over rated but check it out if your into boardwalks. didn't go to the water

column2: Santa Monica beach better than Venice
column3: We walked to santa monica beach after visiting venice beach. Kids like the rides. It was much calmer, relaxing than venice beach. less freaks.
The beach is large and kept clean. The pier has fun rides, shops and restaurants. It has the best year round weather. The 3rd Street Promenade has every store imaginable with people from everywhere.
A great place to visit with the kids. Though it is one one side of LA, it is accessible via the metro which is a good thing as LA traffic can be bad. I did it staying at Hollywood and used the metro.

column2: Santa monica's beach is always magical
column3: Great place to visit, very long beach and nice sorroundings the ocean is unique. it gives you a sense of infinite.

column2: A must visit - walk right along from Venice Beach if you have the energy for 5 miles plus
column3: We did a great walk right along the beach from Venice beach to the pier and back. Was great to see LA life in full swing - walkers, joggers, cyclists - everyone going about what they do. Santa Monica a little more gentrified and Venice Beach more alternative/edgy great to see both.
Lots of people. Beach was too cold for most activities. Pier has rides and carnival atmosphere. It was interesting to visit but not our favorite activity in LA.
Wow, thought it would be really hot. But actually the water was really cold. Not too crowded. Very clean with some nice bathrooms, shops for souvenirs, food. Check out the fish tacos!
I took a Hop On/ Hop Off over to Santa Monica and loved the beach! The ride over was fun, too!The beach is as beautiful as you could imagine. Lots of fun things to do, for sure!!

One of the best places to visit in LA... Although it remains crowded at all times but still the charm of this place never fades.... Awesome views of the sea, people (especially children) playing on one side and buildings and cars on the other... Lots of eating option around the beach... Do not miss it... You will like it once you are there...
It's a nice beach for anyone who wants to eat by the pier at the restaurants, do a little shopping, walk around, Go ride the Giant Carousel wheel. It's fun to be entertained here

column2: Quick Sigh Seeing Stop on LA Weekend
column3: Stopped by this beach Friday afternoon while on 3 day weekend to LA. Beach was pretty crowded but parking available relatively cheap about one block away. Actually free for first two hours. Bustling with activity and things to do, places to eat and numerous street musicians. Stopped on pier for cold beer and people watching. Great short time visit
Lovely trip to Santa Monica, clean beach, very busy with plenty going on and a huge selection of restaurants to choose from for lunch.

column2: Nice clean beach, nice pier and nice people
column3: It can get quite busy after about 3pm but I went early and I enjoyed it. I am not normally a pier person so that's saying something. Worth a visit. It's nice to just hang out. I'm not sure what makes it a 'tourist trap' - I mean, they sell postcards etc. but that's every pier. It's full of both tourists and regular everyday locals. It's a good place to be. I just relax on my own. Also you can get City wi-fi here (it's free). You may be snooped upon, however but I really needed to use it as I had to do my flight check-in.
It is great to have this spot right next to LA, it is still buzzing but offers a more relaxing stress free setting where you can walk, shop, dine and swim.
The beach is very clean and a nice place to spend a few hours. There is also a pathway to walk or bike along if you do not want to walk on the sand.
Visit for a stroll while in the Santa Monica / LA area. Easily accessable. Large car park, $12 fee. Nice view of the Santa Monica shoreline.

column2: A tourist trap, but nice to visit
column3: Santa Monica is very nice beach and the pier is a fund visit, however it can be overrun with tourists most of the time
The view was pretty. There were a lot of people walking, jogging, and riding bikes. It was a little hard to see too far out in the ocean because it was a cloudy day.
Great beach and a great place to spend a few hours.places to eat and drink at the pier and then you can go walking along the beach.the beach is very clean and tidy.

This is an icon that should not be missed. People just wonder along enjoying ice cream and stopping along the pier to gaze out over the ocean. The restaurant down the far end of the pier was fantastic Hispanic/Mexican food. Huge meals and very tasty, but popular so you may need to wait for a table

column2: Any day here, beats any day there
column3: OK, First things first ~ find parking. The beach lots are reasonable and usually have spots available if you can navigate the traffic to get to them, I suggest going two blocks east where the parking is free and un-metered so you can stay all-day. They clean the sand often and even their restrooms are safe enough. The sand goes on for miles and the waves gently roll in ~ continuously!! Slow down, relax and stay while. It does not get any better than this.

column2: walked from Marina del rey to Santa Monica pier
column3: Its like walking down a film set, its clean, fun, vibrant everything you could hope for.My only minor criticism is thanks to 420 it stinks like a herb shop everywhere with massive clouds of it, other than that, its a great place.
Beautiful area at Santa Monica. There are nice beach, pier full of life, amusement park at pier, walk-/ biketrail to Venice. Rent a bike and explore the area. Worth to see.

column2: yes i have an interesting deal
column3: yes i would go on a honeymoon for shailene woodley and daniel lynch in 6 months in los angeles california
The Beach walk between Santa Monica and Muscle Beach is just beautiful.Muscle Beach is so busy and fun with all the different characters along the way.
Such a nice area, walking along the pier and promenade was lots of fun with the carnival rides and food around and the beach was very clean. Even on a chilly day it was a fun trip
Loved exploring down here. So pretty and sunny. Perfect place to get some rays and take photos. Spend the day.

column2: Go here if you have time
column3: This is an essential stop for tourists. Venice beach is a short walk southward. There are fun restaurants and things to do. The shopping is great for picking up souvenirs. You can visit muscle beach and see the body builders. There are street performers and all sorts of artists.
nice beach, clear coastal view and views of the mountains/hills.makes for a great walk path in a vibrant part of town.

Visited on a warm Fall day - promenade provided many beautiful vistas over the beach and bay and a lovely cool breeze to make walking very pleasant. Lots of cool bars and eateries to enjoy and watch the passing parade too, and take time to visit the mall. Don't forget your camera - very photogenic area from Promenade to streetscapes!!

We caught the train from downtown LA which was very reasonable. Admire the views and LA sprawls out to the coast. Santa Monica ideal to stroll along the seafront. Have a long lunch with a beer to two and watch the world go by. All very relaxing.
very busy, but worth seeing. you can walk for ever along the beach and there is a lot of security personnel

Great trip, regret that I was mobility limited with a broken foot, adn time permited only go once in the evening. Beach, pier and surrounding shops easily accessible by train from LA Live area. made the trip possible.

Santa Monica was possibly our favourite place we visited in LA. It is just like it appears in films and television, and I was so excited to look at everything going on. We hired bikes (highly recommend) and cycled down to Venice beach, and it was a great way to take in the local scenery and cover a lot of ground.

column2: Good views. pleasant beach and pier, but extremely busy in the summer
column3: Visitors would find the beach here a very wide beach and there is a well known Santa Monica Pier with a small amusement area on it. The area and streets offer good views and it can be very hard to find parking and the pier itself is very buys and contested over summer.Its a pleasant experience and also its pleasant walking along the beach or up at street level just wondering along and watching all the people go by.If you're in the are its worth a visit.If you hire a car you can easily visit this attraction and later in the afternoon drive through Beverly Hills and then up to the Hollywood Hills sign

column2: Things to do when in LA
column3: We normally stop to eat at Bubba Gumps when in the area. There is a city owned paid parking area where you put money in a meter and then put the receipt inside your car on the dash.On the beach you will see a memorial re: men/women who have died in war since 9/11. This is set up and maintained by protestors, so I keep my mouth shut. However, it is a good photo opportunity.Walk up the steps to the pier and there is Bubba Gumps across from which is Santa Monica PD sub station.On the pier, which is a pleasant walk, there are booths with people selling their wares and further on many people are fishing.There is an amusement park which is lit up at night. Many rides for adults and kids. Not so cheap but fun for the kids.Many people are swimming during nice weather and this can be observed just by looking over the rail of the pier.
Great atmospheres but extremely busy! I would try and go early to avoid disappointment, Great to see some of the famous sites, which would normally be on TV
So much to see and do! The culture is great, loads of happy people and a real mix of cultures. Lots of tourists but still enjoyable. Great shops and the pier is great.

It was really cool to see a place that I've seen on the big and small screen so many times. We didn't partake in any of the rides or games on the pier, but it was cool to watch. Then we just went and sat in the sand by the water for a while. I would recommend bringing a towel or something to sit on if you plan on coming here, unless you don't mind getting a little sandy. There are lots of good restaurants nearby.
We went here on a day tour out of Las Vegas to Hollywood. Quick 1 hour stop to see the Pacific Ocean. To cold to get it but so glad we got to see it.
Great beach, although the water was a little too cold for us, but the kids enjoyed running around and building sandcastles. Beautiful sunset!

well suited city is embraced by the beach which feels like fantastic treasure. It has almost everything if you plan to stay in LA area such shopping malls, theaters, small streets, beach.... You can engage in beach sports as well.

I love bringing my family here to visit-anywhere you find yourself in the area will be sure to enjoy yourself. Easy access from here to other parts of LA makes it perfect for long stays. Here you can interact with locals and enjoy good food and great views.

Santa Monica Bay is your average white sand beach where you can lie in the sun or get on a pair of rollerblades(was surprised to see so few when I visited though). Some parts of the beach are cleaner than others.
If you want to really enjoy a beautiful sunset in LA, this is the place to go. The mix of colors in the sky was wonderful!

This bay has a bit of everything,sand,sea,pier and a cool little town centre. We enjoyed strolling alone the coastline and exploring the pier. Yes there are a lot of tourist which just added to the happy vibe.
Love walking by the pier and playing around in the park. Has a lot of funny activities and different options to eat.
Beautiful beach, very clean and well maintained. There are great cycle ways and the pier is just what I had hoped for.

Tourist trap because of the name you have to see. They have about two old rides, 2 junk stores, 2 restaurants. The board walk boards are the original they are hard to walk on. You have to pay for parking just to see what it is all about. WATER 5.00 so make sure you bring your own.

such a relaxing place and lots of fun and food as well! parking is ok as well! Make sure you visit Bubba Gump restaurant as they have great shrimp obviously and great friendly staff.the end of road 66 is located at the pier so everyone takes pictures there. You can watch the sunset and sip on your fav drink as well.
Took 6 teens to pier for fun and games. They had the best time. There were a group of people working out - circus style - on the beach, so it was a free show! Also had a beautiful sunset.

column2: A bit ecclectic for my taste.
column3: The parking was ridiculously expensive and the crowd there was a little too hip. There is a large pier so you can walk around quite a bit, it has the feel of a carnival.

column2: More beautiful than in pictures and the movies
column3: Very scenic place and all the food joints with yummy food and the rides and the places where you can toss the rings into buckets or shoot the balloons and collect a whole lot of stuffed toys,you are sure of winning at all stalls!and the toys are a deal you don't get to buy them for the rate at which you enjoy playing the games and winning.fun places for children and adults alike
Amazing beach, much better than Bondi or Waikiki! Full of life and character. A lot of people don't like LA, but the beach side Santa Monica and Venice is just great fun.

The beach is extensive and attracts many people. However, you need to walk through some very strange concession stores that made me a little uncomfortable. Stores displaying R rated materials is not suitable for children. They must have other accesses to this beach as it is very long but the one I used as I said was a little seedy. Lots of debris around and it was mid morning on a Sunday.

column2: Massive beach, great to bike ride
column3: I enjoyed hiring one of the Social Bike bikes from the stands. Only $7/hour and you can leave it if you see something interesting!

column2: Pretty average as far as beaches go
column3: Probably didn't help that the weather wasn't the best at the time I went, and the walk to the water feels like it takes forever. But if you're a beach lover and just want to laze about, it's would be alright.
This area on a glorious day is one of the nicest parts of Los Angeles. Take a swim or a walk on the beach great way to relax and it's free.
What a great beach very eclectic bunch of wonderful people. Very clean with bike track on the beach too
Sata Monica Pier is worth a visit if you on LA trip. Easy to park your car and have a litle walk to the Pier.

We did a Starline Tour of the city and beaches of LA and found this area to be quite a tourist attraction.We were given an hour to explore the beach and the pier, which housed plenty of interesting attractions from people singing, making things, painting to actual kids rides.We walked to the end of the Pier, where the Pacific Ocean either starts, or ends, depending on your way of looking at it.It was cold, so dress warmly if its a windy day.Plenty of people swimming and sunbathing on the beach

I did a day trip to Santa Monica pier with my best friend and we had a great day. We sat at the pier, rode the ferris wheel, and walked the boardwalk to Venice Beach. This is a great place to spend the day, especially if you have kids and teens - but it's nice that adults can have fun too!

In my last trip to Los Angeles, we visited three beaches: Malibu, Venice, and Santa Monica. I'd say this was for us the best. Malibu is kind of further North from the city, and not wroth unless you are staying in Malibu. Venice was shocking, bizarre, and not a family friendly place. Malibu, on the contrary, is very family friendly, the town is gorgeous, and it is just right next to L.A. Also, consider you have the pier, which is also a must if you have children like us. Totally worth checking out, and to be sure, a fix destination in all my future trips to L.A.

column2: Great place for a dinner on the beach
column3: I really enjoyed the dinner we had on the beach and the fabulous sunsets as well. Very nice place for a late day stroll and to sip a nice merlot.

This area is very happening. AS the day went on the pier got very busy and filled up with shoppers, Yogis, musicians, families, couples, skaters. I didn't find anything I wanted to eat on the pier. Pretty views

We enjoyed the excitement, shops and eateries on the Santa Monica Pier. A place that is fun for all! Enjoyed the entertainment and the views. Definitely will stop by again on our next trip in town. :)
Great views, great sunsets, great choice of food and plenty of entertainment. Park down near the pier and enjoy.

well spend childhood watching Baywatch and was all excited about the Beach and the activities surrounding it. Now imagine the feeling when you are on the Boardwalk experiencing it first hand. Well, all in all a good vibe end to end. Food, shopping, roller coasters, ferry's wheel, street dance and all this on the beach.. what more to ask for?!Still not satisfied, well cycling, skating, beach gym, gymnastics, skateboarding and happy faces all around... a must visit place in LA. To top this up, this place is more charming during and after the sunset. Just cant miss it.
Most convenient beach, lots of paid parking, bathrooms close to beach. Not a long walk from car park to water.
Nothing really bad to say, good to see the beach and the Pier. Can't really gush about it after leaving near Australia's beaches all my life!
we want there also it was a bit windy but it was great looked at the santa monica pier and we did a bike tour from santa monica to venice beach.. it was incredible..

We visited Santa Monica Bay in September 2016. Once we got here we hired bikes and cycled along through to Venice beach and muscle beach. The route was beautiful with stunning views. Definitely recommend doing this, it's great fun.The Santa Monica Bay has many decent restaurants, great atmosphere with many locals and tourists.
I had an amazing time relaxing on the beach. The weather was perfect . I walked on the beach in the water listening to my music soaking up its beauty
It's a perfect place to spend a lazy evening.. Liked just walking around the beach and enjoying the sound of waves
this is a great place. We rented a bike and ride to Venice beach not too from Santa Monica. One of my highlights of my visit to California.
Fantastic beach experience. Trails for walking/biking for miles and miles, white soft sand, lots to see and do.

Great people watching! Numerous musicians playing for donations. Shops and some rides for the kids. Fantastic views from the end of the pier. Fishing area also. Restaurant at the end of pier was great. Margaritas and local craft beers. Best mojito I've ever had. Very reasonable prices for both food and drink.

Visited the Santa Monica Pier and Aquarium yesterday on a sunny 70 degree day. The views of the mountains to the bay are beautiful. Warm sandy beach was very inviting and not very crowded. The pier is retro, many burger, hot dog, ice cream, churro, funnel cake eateries. There are amusement rides and an arcade. The aquarium is near the carousel and although it is small, it is perfect for the very young child, hands on displays. It is complete with street entertainers , some good, some not.
Had a nice bike ride on the beach path enjoying the nice breeze. Walked along the sand in the water with my mate.

Visited on a hot day. Walked along the pier & watched people enjoying the beach. Had a coffee in one of the many small cafes that surround the beach. Also watched young people enjoying beach activities

We live 500 metres from a beach with a Pier but nothing like this Pier. We went Good Friday and the place was packed, never seen so many people. The buzz around the place was amazing and the people were so friendly

column2: Walking along Ocean Avenue, Santa Monica, CA
column3: Santa Monica Bay is beautiful, especially during the week when there are fewer people. Walk along Ocean Avenue and sit on the benches and just look at the ocean view or walk through the rose garden. This is a must if you are in this area!

column2: Route 66 Ends at the Pier! Check it out!
column3: Few places are more iconic SoCal than Santa Monica Bay. The Historic Pier is still a must-see attraction, even if you don't ride the rides. The well-groomed beaches provide an excellent SoCal experience. As with any beach parking, don't leave anything visible in your car.

I go running at least 3x per month along the cemented beach walk. I start all the way north at the start of the path on will Rodgers state beach then run all the way to Venice beach. All runs are fabulous, plenty of eye candy, beautiful beach sights, active people, pets, artists and sand. I think this is a must see place if you are able to experience it.

column2: Tourist trap but if you have nothing else to do, go for it.
column3: The pier has a few rides, but most of it is tourist tat, cheap stuff and more expensive than you would get elsewhere. It really is fine for a stroll around but dont plan anything around it really. Even the beach is touristy. But a lovely sunset around there so that is worth the trip to Santa Monica.

column2: "It's like GTA., you can come onto the Pier"
column3: This statement totally stunned me. My daughter thought the pier was like a game, but she was absolutely in her element. The pier and the Santa Monica Bay make you feel like that. There are rides for the younger ones and you can walk from here to Venice Beach.Along the way we saw a inta-college volleyball match about 20 games going on at once.Several small coffee shops along the way. walking two streets in there are some small boutiques.Back on the Boardwalk at Venice there are stalls all along the beach side and some shops on the other.You can get to the Pier on the Metro Expo line and walk a block. From Venice catch a number 1 Culver City bus (green bus) for Expo Santa Monica station
Essentially just a fun place in a beautiful location. The ride on the roller coaster is great value and a bit iconic, so worth doing. A fun visit!
Enjoyed the pier roller coaster, then rented bikes and rode lovely paved path down to Venice Beach Skate Park. After return had a great dinner at Albright's on the pier.
Wonderful and scenic beach with lots of buskers. Perfect place to catch some rays, go for a walk or a bite to eat or volley!

If you have a bad time here then you shouldn't travel at all, a carnival like atmosphere but not over the top, the beach was clean, the weather was nice and you might even catch Hollywood in action filming in the area, parking was a little dicey but from other than that the pier was so much fun and prices pretty reasonable and clean restrooms. since it gets crowded and hot (SUNSCREEN) it was an enjoyable day and look forard to going back again in the future

Walk along the beautiful Promenade on Santa Monica's Ocean Ave., and delight in the views of sky and sea, with Malibu in the distance. Granted, it's a "scene" -- all those beautiful people walking with their well-behaved dogs -- but oh, the vistas! If you're visiting LA for the first time, this is a must see, must do! (Or else rent a bike and go down to the beach and ride the bike path!)
Parking info not real good, but rest of experience was great. Lots to do and see, especially if you ride rented bikes to Venice beach and other places.
Beautiful large clean beach....can pick a place in the sand, rent a bike, or stop for a refreshment at one of the cafes along the way.

column2: Its a party at the pier
column3: What's super exciting besides the view,of course, is the carnival atmosphere that is Santa Monica. Any time of day is the perfect time to visit and feel the sea breezes that abound. Maybe you will be tempted by the fast foods and carnival type treats and then look out onto the vast expanse of the ocean and be truly satisfied you came.

Was a very nice beach. Colorful!! Busy!! An attraction!! The view is really nice has the mountains in the scenery! You could get lots of souvenirs there. There are many shops and there are ppl playing music and painting and things like that on the boardwalk!

We arrived early on Easter Sunday with the Metro from downtown LA. We walked all the way to Venice beach and back. Santa Monica bay is a beautiful place to visit. It offered a variety of unique characters along the way. At mid afternoon it was super busy, people everywhere. It was a fun day at the beach. Muscle beach was bustling with activities and very entertaining.

Santa Monica Bay is beautiful with a pier which served lot of eateries around the area ....... also saw some ferries around but we were late for our trip there and thus didn't check out much ...... spend breezy evening on the santa monica beach

Santa Monica is a great day out for all the family, you can park close by (for a not too unreasonable cost) and walk to the bay, the fairground, the pier and shops are all close by, loads to do, without spending a fortune.

Well into September, water temperatures can still hover around 71 Fahrenheit (23 Celsius), making this bay the bastion for local surfers year-round. The spot is a staircase away from Downtown Santa Monica, meaning that visitors' itineraries can include a visit to the beach, a stroll across Third Street Promenade, and an upscale lunch all within the hour. Sunsets here are to die for, and, even after a hundred times, locals don't stop to appreciate the spectacle, especially as seen from Ocean Avenue.
Very beautiful and very clean beach. I wished I could stay longer. It was a beautiful area. The pier was not too impressive and kind of pricey!

Wonderful pier with rides, sideshows and restaurants. Can walk up to the Mall. Also try the famous Clam Chowder in a bread bowl, delicious. Can also book tour to Disneyland from the Pier. Its the end of Route 66 so good to see also.
I prefer the downtown of santa monica ! the beach is ok but not more than this... go to the center for a walk it's very cool!

A really beautiful and very clean beach, and also very family friendly. The Pier itself has loads on there to keep you occupied, with rides and also lots of different shops and stores. The views from the end of the Pier are stunning and you can see the whole coastline from there.

column2: Great place to visit when in LA
column3: I had an excellent day here which is where they filmed Baywatch. A lot of famous people live here so its so interesting.

column2: Great to take a bike and pedal far down the beach
column3: I don't like anything resembling Disney on the pier, but I really enjoyed renting a bicycle and riding on a perfectly paved path to Malibu! I highly recommend going there, but then leaving the pier to enjoy the coast for a nature ride!
Certainly a nice part of town and always a great place to visit or just spend the afternoon. Stunning sunset on clear days and always fabulous with its sweeping coastline.
Great place to go to see the beach. You can swim, surf, fish and sail in Santa Monica Bay. Join the many people who use the Bay for fun everyday.
Very disappointed with Santa Monica Bay. Extremely busy lots of tourists and down and outs. Would not visit again
gotta love the beach, and this one is iconic! If you're visiting or have lived here your whole life you'll always have a good time!

This LA, this is California. For me, Santa monica bay and Venice beach are the best spots in LA, you should not miss it! the califoenian sunset is amazing, the pier is a nice place to spend the evening, and there's a couple of restaurants there. Not worth spending a lot of hours though as there not much to do.(Check out my intagram for my travel photos!:) IG: anamafalda8 )
Fantastic place to just chill out, people full of life, singing, playing music, performing or simply get closer to the beach and leave it all behind!
We stopped here on our visit to Hollywood - was a lovely stop over to walk on the beach and take in the views. We got a lovely day in May 2016 - weather was fabulous
The weather was cloudy and cold during our visit to Sandra Monica Bay, so, we could not "see" the beauty of this area.
What a beautiful beach. It has a pier with rides for the kids. A great snack shack. The Maui Tacos are to die for. Bike riding, roller blading, it's all here. It's a must place to go.

The Santa Monica Bay is by far one of the most beautiful places to visit in Los Angeles! From the pier we can see the beach which is considered one of the most beautiful in California. We have seen it in so many movies and TV series like Baywatch and others.The bike track to Venice Beach will also make you fall in love with Los Angeles, if any reason was needed!
Very nice beach with fantastic sand and great view of the ocean. Excellent place for time spending - alone, or with friends or family.
Santa Monica is great love the Pier for great views of the coastline from the Ferris Wheel a must do here
This is the bay where we have to spend evening while you are in LA, Santa Monica Pier and attractions and events around. Must see place in LA, preferred to visit in the evening after 6pm

column2: a nice place to get away from LA
column3: Santa Monica is about a 40 minute Metro ride from Downtown LA. It has lovely beaches and a great shopping centre. The restaurants on the seaside offer great food at affordable prices. THe pier gets very busy so come early. IF you need a day away from LA get down to Santa Monica and relax. I wouldn't bother making the walk to Venice Beach - it's dirty, full of homeless people and the dinning options are poor. I loved Santa Monica.

We visited on a Sunday afternoon, so it was pretty busy. We did not buy anything or do any of the rides. We went to say that we saw the site. If it is your first time visiting CA then it is a must see! We parked in a ramp that allowed the first 2 hours to be free. It was in the mall ramp.

If you're looking for one of the best beaches in Southern California, look no further than Santa Monica bay. It has everything that you go to the beach for. Great place to spend the day or even an hour or two!

column2: Lovely view and great day to spend the day
column3: I spent only one day there and could've spent a lot more. It's a peaceful place with amazing views. The sunset is gorgeous and you can find a lot of great entertainment at Santa Monica's Pier. Make sure to look for the guy playing violin, he'll blow your mind.
Spent a while here walking around. We enjoyed ourselves. We were on a limited time schedule but I would like to go back and stay close by.

It is very clean and well maitained beach.A lot of beach activities are there. Famous TV serial Bay Watch was filmed on this bay.There are good rescue and security arrangements there.we enjoyed a lot.
I took my daughter here several years ago and was happy to be able to take my son on this trip. It is a great place to visit and one of the best places to people watch.
We had a nice and enjoyable day, walking along the pier and waterfront in Santa Monica. Visited a few shops, had coffee and ice cream is some of the many outlets close to the beach.

column2: great day for family and friend
column3: Relax, shop, eat and do not miss to visit to Santa Monica Pier Aquarium which home to more than 100 species of marine animals and plants  all found in the Santa Monica Bay.

column2: Dont forget a light jacket for sunset
column3: This is a 'must go' place. The sunset is incredible. You will see a lot of artists performing on the pier. However, it might get a little cold at sunset so dont forget to take a light jacket with you.

column2: You must visit if you are with family or not.
column3: We travelled with our sons 6 and 8 at the time. The area is great for the Pier, shopping and dinning. You should go to spend the entire day! Start off on the beach walk the pier, do some rides, walk up 4 blocks into a great open shopping area, with lots of very nice restaurants in all price ranges.Very safe are to walk and shop, and great access to both cabs and Uber. We just loved it!

column2: A must place to visit while travelling
column3: Were from the UK and decided to travel the USA, this is a must place to visit, famous and on the bucket list. thats another one ticked off the list :)
We went to Venice beach first, and Santa Monica Bay is much more our style.We had a great time even when it was busy.

column2: Pier needs a makeover, beach is beautiful!
column3: We went by Lyft. Was a little disappointed with the Pier. The theme park did not open till late. Loved the beach. Needs makeover. Took great photos. it is the end of Route 66 so a must do.

We had a great visit - rented bikes and biked along the path from Santa Monica to Muscle Beach. The path was VERY crowded, but it was still fun. It was foggy most of the day though, which is a first for me and I've been several times. Parking was a hard to get - even in the morning. It's a BUSY place!
Lovely beach and pier. Nice spot for swimming. We also rented bikes.Great spot in LA to relax and spend a day

this is a big and nice beach. nothing very spectacular other than some children entertainment zone.many holiday makers on a sunday.it is clean bathing area is also good.but the best part is the santa monica town nearby.a very cute smallish but very vibrant area to pass a couple of hours.the beach and the town is well connected by los angeles city buses.
A very pretty place, didn't have a lot of time to explore, but the beach is nice and the views of the park where nice. Did get a home made churro from a gals churro stand and it was great!!

column2: What a local beach should feel like
column3: so much choice here - the tourist promenade, huge deep long sandy beaches, life guard hut photos, and even plenty of spots to be in your own world (FEB)

Santa Monica is beautiful, but sadly it was very foggy/misty when we went due to the weather being so hot. Great views when better visibility, but still a lovely place to go for a walk along the beach or the pier.

We enjoyed a nice stroll along the pier and caught some sun on the beach adjacent to the pier. Had a nice lunch in Santa Monica at a local cafe/diner. The beach was clean and we enjoyed our time lounging.

It was a good experience to visit Santa Monic. It is a peaceful ares with fresh air breezing from the Pacific. The area is well maintained with no high rising buildings. The people need appreciation for there love to preserve their heritage and don't allow commercialisation to take over.

column2: Amazing beach to chill out at
column3: If you like to walk come here , or if u like just chilling out and watching the day go by come here too, had fun down at this beach just watching every one on there bikes roller blades and at the mini park on the pier.also the gym thing on the beach for every one to use, really nice on a sunny day,

We bought tickets for Pacific Park for Sunday because it is open fome the morning until night on weekends. It was cold and foggy but the two teenage boys had fun on the rides and my wife and I enjoyed the shops and got a hamburger.
Wonderful family beaches with loads of original fun seaside activities. Great places to eat really clean easy parking

I come from Greece and I am used to beautiful beaches and the sun. I did not expect to live this experience in LA though. The beach is really big, almost endless. The weather in March was hot enough to enjoy the ride and the walking but cold enough not to swim.
it is a worthwhile place to see there are lots of boutiques and performers there is no charge to go on the pier it is a perfect place to take pictures of the beach

i wanted to show my husband the Santa Monica Pier that I grew knowing. We live in Florida but made a visit to the other coast for vacation. So we went to the Santa Monica Pier in the morning and it was already crowded, which is fine. But there wasn't really anything to do. Some vendors and street entertainment ( I use the term loosely). There is a small amusement park but we weren't interested as it was foggy and chilly. Who wants to ride a Farris wheel in the fog when the whole idea is to see the ocean and you cant. So we were hungry and saw a restraint at the end of the Pier. We headed to the restraunt and went in. It's 10:30 in the morning and turns out to be a Mexican restraunt that only serves lunch and dinner. So folks were drinking margaritas and bloody marys. We were Hungary so we ordered anyway and the food was so bland we couldn't even finish. So we walked back to the car and left. Very overrated and nothing like when I was a kid. I know things change, I get it, but a tourist destination like this is going to waste.
Nice beach for a walk and to check out all the beautiful people walking by dressed up or in swimmers
An enjoyable evening spent on the Santa Monica Pier watching the sunset and having photos taken at the 'end of route 66' sign.
love hanging out in santa monicait has really cleaned up it s act and is even family oriented even more so.feels safe. wonderful beach.

We peddled our bikes through here. A lot of people headed to the pier but this area seemed a bit cleaner w/less people on the beach. I would definitely say that you need to visit here....such a lovely beach. There are a lot of bathrooms along the coastline making it convenient for everyone. Volleyball nets here and there. I felt safe and relaxed here. I want to go back and enjoy the sunshine.
My family had a great time hanging out at this beach. It is HUGE! great beach location, and we had a fun time walking around. Parking was great near the beach as well.

The beach in Santa Monica near the pier is a large beach. The pier is also a nice place to visit. There are a number of restaurants, street performers, and attractions there. The beach is clean and it is busy. There does seem to be a need for more or closer parking but none of my group minded walking some.At night the whole pier lights up. There is a Ferris wheel, a roller coaster, and all kinds of bright lights and colors. It's really nice to see after sunset.

This is the beach that everyone in the City of Los Angeles goes to sun, swim, and surf. It is great for all of these things. It is relatively clean, very accessible (Expo Line Train stops two blocks from the Pier and main beach. There is all kinds of food, vendors walk the beach in Summer, and there are public restrooms all along the strand. It is rarely crowded, so no need to stake out a spot early. Parking gets steep in summer, but it's worth the convenience if you have kids.
I love going to the beach in Santa Monica. The promenade is a great place to go people watching. Quaint boutiques line the promenade.

Loved seeing the pier and playing in the arcade. Also loved gymnastics rings, bars and swings on the beach. Snacks are good--typical fair food is fun to grab while walking. Close to a nice mall with a variety of food choices.

if you are in LA make sure to visit this place. absolutely amazing.. everything costs a fortune but its worth a day trip down to soend time on the beach .. have a drink by the pier.. or get a workout in at the original muscle beach sight..
The atmosphere is electric and worth going to. Need a day to see everything on offer. Good shopping and restaurants.

The pier has an amusement park with an unlimited wristband for $30 or included with the Los Angeles Go Card! by Smart Destinations. I loved the view from the Ferris Wheel. If you use a Go Card, make sure to go to the Aquarium that is also at the pier. It was closed when we were there. The pier also has restaurants and did I say views???? Views! We did the 2:30 Starline Malibu tour that leaves from the Pier and found out that Arnold owns a building right next to the pier that he lives in and also owns many, many properties in Santa Monica. Make sure to also visit the Promenade if you are in Santa Monica.

We drove here after hiking up the hollywood hills to get a closer look at the sign. This was such a nice way to finish the day. The weather was perfect, we found parking easily (just put in Google maps Santa Monica Pier Parking) Had lunch on the pier and ended up hiring bikes to ride down to Venice beach. Great day would highly recommend this.

We caught a public bus to the beach from the hotel and it all worked well for very little cost. We joined the crowd on the Pier and just walked around like tourist do and did some shopping. A nice shopping area with no cars, you could spend the day there. The beach looked okay, not to crowed, but it was January.
Went to Santa Monica Bay which was just lovely to walk along and relax. While walking along we saw a seal making it's way up the sand on the beach. very special.
You get the beach and a carnival in one... Yes please! i love the Santa Monica pier and the whole area is so nice to go visit.

We were very disappointed having stopped here on our journey to LA. We were greeted by two homeless men fighting on the floor with each other. Im glad we stopped to say we'd been, but I wouldnt rush back...

Kick off your kicks at the end of Route 66--- and wade or swim in the ocean. Public light rail takes you within a block, and you can enjoy various restaurants or activities on the pier as well. A must see.

This was one place i wanted to visit and I wasn't disappointed. We loved it. When on the Ferris wheel  It was fun as I hadn't done this since I was a teenager. Lots of Pepole entering, music  the view was awesome

This is s the cleanest beach I have ever been to! Super impressed!!!!! There are a lot of fun things to do that most beaches don't offer - monkey bars, grassy area, swing sets, rope climbing...and the pier - whoa! A full carnival with rides, games, and food...not to mention fishing! We will be back!

column2: Fun place to visit and ride a roller coaster
column3: Santa Monica pier was exciting and fun. The food is good but a bit overpriced. The shops were fun and we had a fantastic meal.
A nice beach with pier and lots to do there...bike strand with rides and a lot of restaurants...Parking is a fee

column2: SM bay wonderfully diverse in so many ways
column3: Santa Monica Bay extends from point Magu and Malibu on one side all the way to Palos Verdes Peninsula on the other. In between are several diverse and colorful communities to explore. You'll see tens of languages, see shades of people and hair across the rainbow; see tolerance, funky musicians, liberals, hippies, homeless, and even some drugs, through to hipsters, and gentry conservatives living in multi million dollar beachfront homes.The best way to explore is on bicycle since the bike path extends from Will Rogers State Beach Park all the way through to the beach communities of Redondo and Manhattan Beach. In between are the colorful spots of Santa Monica with the third street promenade, Santa Monica pier and the Palisades, heading south Venice Beach is a must see top attraction in Los Angeles. From there, don't forget Marina del Rey and especially walking along the breakwater of the marina channel. If you have a dog this is truly a place to strut. You will meet friendly people who live in this area with equally friendly dogs, and get a sense that this is a true community.Also, as a sailor, Marina del Ray is a fabulous place to charter or rent a sailboat, go fishing or parasailing. If you live here and have a boat I don't need to say more! Typical days have beautiful Westerly winds, mild swells, great sea life spotting's including sea lions and dolphins, and great coastal cruising. The adventurous should consider going to Catalina Island where there is snorkeling, scuba, and kayaking.The restaurant scene is equally diverse and fabulous, ranging from Malibu chic, to Venice Beach laid-back and funky, to just plain good eating!If visiting Los Angeles I suggest you stay in a hotel in one of the beach communities since there's so much to do along the Santa Monica Bay .

Santa Monica beach is too much crowded, at the same time their are people who covers lot of area to showcast their talent. Though it is good but government should allocate some places to them. It can hinder some of you observation which probably would like to take a view for those areas. Lot of small and big restaurants and street foods are available.

column2: So much fun and complete tourist attraction
column3: There's a magnet to visit Santa Monica Bay each I went to LA because I think it's a great tourist attraction...and everything's within walking distance. And I think it's a complete one: the pier, amusement park, the beach, the sight of Pacific ocean (especially at sunset time), restaurants (at the pier or streets nearby), the shopping area (at 3rd street promenade) even street entertainment by street dancers... Really enjoyed the crowd at the pier even if we only walked along the pier, especially during sunset time. Many restaurants at the pier although a bit pricey and almost always occupied. And when the night comes we could hangout at the bars and restaurants along Ocean avenue or do some shopping or just window shopping at 3rd Street Promenade. So much fun!
Everything you'd expect from a busy pier; rides, families and noise.Make sure you take your camera on the ferris wheel...

Santa Monica Bay offers beautiful, clean beaches (although crowded during the day). Beautiful area to take a stroll, offering lots of shops, cafes and lovely views. The bay & iconic pier are easily accessed by public transportation

column2: A Must for any stay in LA
column3: We took the tour bus to Santa Monica, walked the pier, and walked to Venice Beach and the Venice Canals. Bike hire is readily available and if you use the tour bus a discount applies. Great for people watching, especially on a sunny Sunday.

Whether travelling alone, as a couple, with friends -or like us- with two older teenage boys then a stop at Santa Monica Pier is a must. We were there in December and the Pier was streaming with people, food, entertainment and plenty to see and do so I can only guess how vibrant this must be on a summers day. Seeing the Pier and the Bay from the top of the Ferris wheel is a must when you make this stop and even with the crowds we didn't have too long a wait in line.

Visiting LA you simply must visit it's most beautiful beach and a famous fun pier. Beneath the pier is a huge parking lot, otherwise it's difficult to find parking in the streets around.The beach is very wide and long and it's fun to walk it even in winter time.The pier, apart of many other similar piers on California coast is converted to a fun pier with many rides, arcade games, restaurants and so on. Great 3 hrs spent.

column2: Popular bay closest to the city
column3: Amongst the beach side view points Santa Monica bay is popular because of the Pier ... there are shops and restaurants on the pier. It got chilly in the night with cold breeze. Enjoy the Taco's etc on the pier.

column2: Go to spot when you are in LA
column3: Iconic spot to visit when in LA. Beautiful views of the pacific. Very busy, a must see when in LA. Lots to see and do. Great for people watching. Had so much fun we went almost every day!
We loved the beach, but didn't really hang out on it that much. We went to the Pier and enjoyed the rides! Next time on a warmer day, we will have to go back!

column2: Visit this anytime people will flock here
column3: I enjoyed walking on the pier. The original merry go round that was filmed in several movies is here. You can get plenty to eat, drink or desert ice cream, funnel cakes, or churros.

column2: Fun and beautiful beach with plenty of people watching
column3: Great place to people watch without venturing too far from downtown LA/Hollywood. Several restaurants/bars to eat at near by. The place does get crowded especially on weekends, but that's pretty much a given anywhere in this town.

Santa Monica is a totally different feel from downtown LA. The vibe is so carefree and we enjoyed our time here so much! Walk the beach, bike the path, have fun on the Santa Monica Pier, get some eats, Rollerblade, walk your dog. There's tons of stuff to do with the beach as your backdrop! Stunning!
Clean sand to have a sun tan, nice walk along the beach, place to rest or work (writing books or thinking about projects).
we loved Santa Monica pier there is so much to do and the people are fun and full of life, we had a blast
Got here after dark and with all the lights it was so pretty. There is a lot to see its close to shopping stuff to eat. We got out and walked and walked. The area is clean and safe.
The Santa Monica Bay is gorgeous! The beach stretches on and on and on! It is clean and beautiful. The beach is also accessible by public transit. There is a lot to see and do in that area.
The beach was good enough. Not that crowded. A good place to relax and get an escape from the busy life of LA
Santa Monica pier is crowded nice place to see the beach, it is carousel inside the building very busy on weekends. Regarding the food not problem variety to choose.

Santa Monica is a great place to visit. You can easily walk and cycle around the city. And if you are in Palisades Park, you can look over the bay. There are usually plenty of yachts and boats. Having said that, this is not exactly one of the most stunning bays in the world. The peninsula south of Santa Monica is rather dtab. But the sunset is gorgeous.
Worth a day trip to experience the Californian Coast lifestyle - all glamour and cocktails. Beautiful beach although busy at weekends.

column2: It was an amazing place with crowds on the pier, good restaurants & great beach
column3: Caught the Metro to Santa Monica for a look and was amazed. Large crowds on the pier, good restaurants and even an indoor carousel. It was really interesting and well worth a visit

column2: Just to say youve been there
column3: Santa Monica is a very nice place. The beach is large and clean. The pier is average, if you've ever been to a boardwalk/pier with rides, etc then it will probably seem the same as most. It does however offer great sunset views and the pier is also the western terminus of the famous U.S. Route 66. If you are there for sunset stay for dinner! There are a lot of good (some famous) restaurants close by. Have fun!
Wonderful restaurants on the Santa Monica Pier. The larger restaurant is close to the beginning of the Pier and the smaller restaurant is further out. Eaten at both; both devine!

I spent my day in Beverly Hills, the day was sunny and a bit hot, but as I was getting closer to Santa Monica Pier, it got foggy and cold, but when the sun was about to set, all the clouds went away, it was a beautiful sunset, and the shopping mall in front of the pier is beautiful

column2: Bike riding next to the beach
column3: Great place to spelt the day. We hierdoor a bike and spelt the day riding along the coast. On the wat there a great places to stop for a drink and lunch.

column2: You can feel the love for the Ocean.~
column3: I love Santa Monica! The pier has it's own unique vibe that everyone should experience. I love the Aquarium and definetly recommend checking it out. Even just to donate the admission and say hello to the sea life they have, the Aquarium is worth a stop for all. I love the Zoltar machines on the pier and always stop for a fortune from him at the arcade. Great place to visit and admire the Ocean from.

column2: Must see on your visit to Southern California
column3: Santa Monica offers so many attractions in terms of restaurants, shopping and site seeing. The view of the Santa Monica Bay is historic.

Whenever we holiday in LA we make sure to spend some time in Santa Monica and last week was no exception!!This is one beautiful, amazing, breathtaking place!!From the fantastic shopping and eating on Third St Promenade, with its chilled Californian vibe, street vendors and vast array of shops for all budgets to the breathtaking views from Ocean Avenue, beautiful gardens and that Cali breeze!I could sit and look out on the ocean and beach, all day with the stunning backdrop of Malibu in the distance.I'm lucky enough to live on the coast in England, but, if I could live just one other place, I'd pick Santa Monica, hands down!!Make sure you include a visit in your plans: you won't be disappointed!!

column2: I didn't know beaches could be so big...
column3: Its almost never-ending... Its so beautiful and sandy (which means a lot to me as I live in England...). The walk along the beach was amazing, lots of random stuff going on, markets and things to do/see/buy. A must to visit and get a tan!
This is a typical beach area. The pier/boardwalk adds an interesting aspect. Some sketchy characters around at times. Fun arcade on the pier.

We stayed in L.A. for 5 days. We just loved Santa Monica. You can go to the mall, walk down the pier, take photos or just sit down and enjoy the Pacific view!! If you rent a car, it's nice to drive from there to Malibu (10-15 minutes). Also you can find nice touristic shops as you're heading for little Venice!

I'm not a big fan of commercial, touristy sites - and the Santa Monica Pier is just that - that being said - there is an excitement which can't be denied and being right on the beach makes for a fun stop.

column2: Not much to do on a cold January day
column3: The beach was fairly empty on the day we went. Although it was 50 degrees that day, it was cold because of the breeze from the ocean. The amusement park looked fun for little kids but otherwise there didn't seem to be too much else to do.
So fun to walk the beach and see all kinds of people. Really loved the famous pier. Eat at the end of the pier...it was awesome

Every day I thank God for letting me live here. I'm so lucky. This is one of the most beautiful places in LA, maybe in the world. Miles of wide, gorgeous beaches, great surfing and swimming conditions, life guards on duty most of the time, fabulous boardwalk, bike rental places, clean bathrooms and more! A must see!

column2: Spontaneous trip turned to our favorite place.
column3: We decided to check this pier out because we were visiting in LA spontaneously. Heard a lot about it so thought to try it out. My boyfriend at the time and I had an amazing time. We decided to try out the rides on the pier. I couldn't stop giggling so much on one of the rides, and he just absolutely couldn't stop being amazed when seeing me laugh.
