We also walked the whole pier which is absolutely gorgeous at the end, the talents that performed on the pier were very entertaining and pleasant to experience as well. We definitely returned multiple times since then.

column2: Lovely location, great way to chill
column3: We visited with local friends and it was a lovely way to,spend a couple of hours. The beaches and pier are immaculate and the 'lovely' people are everywhere. There are some nice gelaterias and cafes along the way, where you can sit and chill in a lovely location. It's a cost free and lovely way to see the area.

column2: The pacific sound fAb lashing the Sandra
column3: I think I was expecting more, and it didn't live up to my expectations. Not much to do and the shops cafes and bars seemed tired but perhap better in the sunshine

There are a lot of better beaches North in Malibu and Ventura and way better beaches down in Orange County and North SD county. If you are just on a layover from LAX for the night, you could hit this beach.
My boyfriend was excited to see this a few shows he watches have been set here. Was really nice to watch the sunset and listen to the busker. We brought a few souvenirs too.
you have to pass by and take a picture pretending to be a Baywatch! it's just a beach, i know...but it's THAT beach!

We drove from Downtown LA to Santa Monica beach. Its little over an hour drive and is worth spending a day at the beach. Its a long coast and some fun activities to do at the pier as well. The beach is beautiful and is well kept.We went with a kid and the little one thoroughly enjoyed herself. Must visit when in LA
We walked the beach from Venice and really enjoyed the sound of the waves. We found a cool shell that was round and had the shape of a plant on it. .The pier was amazing.
It need to be cleaned on coast line need clean up crew but was able to walk up coast. the weather was unusally cold but tolerated with jacket.

column2: Worth a trip - especially by Metro rail
column3: Loved the train trip. gives you a feel for local living. Santa Monica has interesting shopping. Bloomingdales lived up to expectations - classy and expensive! he Pier was fun with some great buskers. Food choices from take away to seated dining. Views fabulous and local wildlife (squirrell) cute. Very windy so tale a jacket.
Absolutely love this place. The pier is so much fun and the beach is very picturesque. Fun for all ages
Great view of the ocean... Friday nights are the happening. Beach is great. Excellent place to visit alone, with a friend, someone special or just take the family.
Perfect place to sit back and enjoy the weather and view, or to indulge in some food or activities. Beautiful.

We went to the Pier with our school choir as part of their trip to Disney for a performance workshop.... What a beautiful stop. If it were just a bit warmer, I could have stayed all day!!! Beautiful views. Love watching the waves. Enjoyed the people watching. Perfect pier setting at the ocean!
There are so many things to do in Santa Monica Bay that you would need more than one day. Walking there, visiting the pier, enjoying the view... Great and relaxing place to visit.

Soooo pretty! After spending half a day at Santa Monica Bay, we felt completely relaxed. Lots of different activities to choose from, plenty of restaurants and bars. Even in january, we had a perfect beach-day in the sun. 'Made a memory' in the Pacific Wheel.

Had our driver take us to Santa Monica Bay pier and it was just as I imagined it to be. Quit colourful and busy walking the pier with the fun attractions and the scenery is spectacular with the beach and ocean. A must see. Allow some time to explore it all.
This place is beautiful scenic and very well kept. We visited in January on a sunny day and it was not overcrowded

Maybe going on Christmas Day is a bad idea if you try to go to the pier, but the beach was clear and very clean. Some walkers, bicyclists, families with kids....a peaceful beach scene. Of course finding a place to eat other than the pier on Christmas Day can be a challenge.

column2: We had a nice time just walking around
column3: It was nice just to relax for couple of hours before we hit the road again to Vegas. It was a little crowded, but nice weather for a walk with our little dogs.

A different experience every visit. The regulars include swimmers, surfers, cyclists, runners & visitors suntanning. You may see a commercial or tv taping near the pier or in Venice. Relax, sitting on a bench or rent a bike and enjoy the view.

I don't tend to recommend going to the beach at Santa Monica to those who are visiting. Mostly because it is already overrun with tourists and I don't think you get the real LA experience. I'd recommend going down to Hermosa or up to Malibu for a real LA local feel.But if you must go down there, there is a lot to do and there are lifeguards at the water and there are always a lot of people of all ages playing. Either side of the pier will be crowded.

We were visiting LA over the new year and had to visit to say we had been there. The beach is ok but a long walk to the water from the shops. Being January no one was swimming but there were people using the ball courts and skate park. The many small shops selling clothes, souvenirs and food were fun to check out.
Nothing crazy special, but a good place to kill a few hours if you are sightseeing. Kids will have their attention all over the arcade and other spots along the pier.
This is a very nice beach. There are bike trails and running trails. This is not far from Santa Monica pier.
A famous piece of LA seen in many tv shows and movies, seeing it in person was quite an impressive experience.
Good place to visit in sunny days specially for children.Go early to find good parking (3$/hr or 8$).Near the beach there is a good place for shopping and walking.Rides are good (5$-8$ each)

column2: Going to LA? Make Santa Monica a stop on your itinerary
column3: Going to LA? Make Santa Monica a stop on your itinerary. Be sure to come off peak times as the problem with parking can be a bummer. And while here walk to the Third Street Promenade for a nice meal or to see the street entertainers.

The pier and beach are famous but not necessarily any more interesting or beautiful than many other piers and beaches throughout the world. Access to the pier and beach was convenient and parking at $8 for the day was fair. Be warned - restrooms seem to be few and far between. I looked at the various signposts for pedestrians and found no mention. In the end I had to walk all the way back to the pier because I knew there were restrooms there. I think Santa Monica could do better in this respect.

Visited this place in the last week of December 2016. It is a nice place to enjoy with family. Enjoyed the great location and the view. People enjoy rides near the Pier. Take adequate warm clothes as it becomes very cold in the evening.

column2: From Mailbu to Palos Verdes, the vast shallow bay boasts several piers
column3: Malibu Pier hosts my family best right now with Malibu Farms Restaurant, good sport fishing, and general ease of parking to observe surfing and kayaking..

I took the day city tour to Santa Monica and really enjoyed the view and location even though i did not swim because it was cold. The beaches are very wide and the view where you see mountains to the right is amazing. Lots of restaurants and Cafes nearby on the main street. Worth visiting specially as the the entertainment area nearby
What a great day from the seals to the performers what a lovely place to visit I will be back again.

column2: A nice way to spend the afternoon
column3: We spent a couple of hours on the pier and walking along the walkway. A nice way to spend the afternoon, the weather was cool and a little grey so not everything was open. We travelled from Hollywood via train.
Water is refreshing, meaning cold! Feels great. Go early to get parking near ocean and go to lunch before noon for your pick of restaurants. The beach is pleasant and lots to see besides the ocean.
This is a beautiful place to see and good for a relaxing walk . It would be great in Summer , we went in winter but was still lovely a must visit there are placing to eat along the way

The town is full of good shopping and some restaurants which look worth a visit but when my late husband and I did spend time there, we were shocked by the number of homeless people sitting under trees with apparently " no place to go ". When a country as wealthy as the USA does nothing to help such people to get back on their feet one does feel that there is a certain lack of compassion and empathy pervading such resorts as we found the exact same thing in Santa Barbara.
Had to ride the famous ferris wheel. Cute place. Located right on the beach amid the mountains. Shops and places to eat with rides. Not big, so don't expect much, but a must see in Santa Monica.

column2: Visit for the history and the pier
column3: A fabulous beach ,walking distance to the shops and entertainment and you can walk to Venice Beach from Santa Monica Bay (About a half hour).Pier is a bit tired - reminded me a bit of Weston but its iconic and the end of Route 66 so just another place you have to go just to say you have been .It was cooler in December but I would guess in the summer the beach will get packed .Worth the drive from Central L.A

column2: Must be wonderful in warmer weather...
column3: Very nice in December, and see great potential in warmer weather. Not so many people when I visited in December-which might have been a great thing. However, walking around, it seemed to have very much to offer in regard to relaxing, eating/drinking, enjoying the American/Californian dream. Must have a wonderful sunset if the weather is cooperating.

column2: Always a nice place to walk.
column3: Went for a walk here during the sunset right before Chirstmas. Beautiful views of the ocean, the pier, and Malibu in the distance. Can't imagine any place feels more like "California".

Santa Monica Bays nickname is the Queen's Necklace. Great beaches from the beginning of Malibu to Palos Verdes. A great bike path the entire length with places to eat and rent bikes. An added attraction is that at times you see Dolphins playing.

column2: Beautiful place to visit while in Santa Monica
column3: We were not sure if we shoiuld get here or not. Luckily, we decided to get there. Nice and exceptional view.

column2: Santa Monica: the bay AND the city
column3: I love Santa Monica and enjoy spending time there. The beaches are beautiful, wide and white sand, very organized so you can enjoy the services (bars, restaurants, shops, ...) - I like walking from Santa Monica to Marina del Rey, via Venice, few kms on the waterfront street, few others on the beach. It is nice to stop and have lunch in one of the many beach restaurants (love eat with my bare feet in the sand) and then continue. Also at the sunset is very nice, you can imagine the sight. A little too crowdy in the week ends during warm season.I also disagree with reviewers that wrote that the city is not nice. I live there for a while and enjoyed it a lot. It is an easy city, with nice restaurantes and bars, nice shops, lot of events. I even liked walking the quiet streets to reach the ocean. It is convenient and close to everywhere in LA.

column2: Good beach for strolling and sunset
column3: The combination of wide white sand, Santa Monica Pier, view of Santa Monica high rises by the beach is worth a trip to Santa Monica Bay. Strolling on the beach for sunset and listening to music on the beach gives you a sense of vibrant beach in the city. After sunset, go to a few nice restaurants on Ocean Ave or at the Pier or just trolling along a nice Palisade Park. To walk on the beach, you can choose to walk on wood path or sink your feet in the sand. If you go there by car, you can park on the beach. Travelers can use Los Angeles Metro (E-line) to Santa Monica (about 1 hour from 7th Street/Metro Center. Leave the city around 3 pm to catch the sunset and the activities on the beach and in the park.

column2: A nice break on your way to LA-San Francisco
column3: A beautiful beach, but the city that surrounds it is not very interesting. It's mostly the beach. And it is a beach, a nice one, clean and wide.

column2: Santa Monica pier parking lot is nasty
column3: Trash, gum and condoms littered the parking lot. You'd think that the city of Santa Monica would make an effort to keep it cleaned up.

column2: The beauty of Santa Monica Beach and what it has to offer
column3: A beach you must visit when you go to Los Angeles. The beaches are so wide that no one can even imagine. As far as walking and cycling go, this beach starts as a boardwalk pavers for walking only, then there is sand. After that right on the sands there is a paved path only for cycling dividing from north to south and south to north . That is what makes it so compact.. the best part is the pier. The pier is also an amusement park with roller coaster rides games fairest wheel and lots of things to do. There's even a burger restaurant called Rusty's burgers right on the pier. This restaurant overlooks the ocean. On the pier there is something most beaches don't have is a first aid building for lifeguards on the pier. The water is cold though.. this is one of the best beaches in California and should be voted as one of the top ten best beaches in the world. A place you have to go to....

Best bet: go there any time but winter. The pier is a quirky, fun place to visit. The long pier is fun to walk while taking in the views around. Get a snack, fly a kite, take pictures or just have a good time with others. The day we went in December was wet, cold, and windy. didn't stay long.
Santa Monica bay is a nice sweep of beach but not a place to spend time at in winter. Nice pier but not as good as Brighton.
awesome beaches. We went in November so it was quieter than usual but was worth a trip to have a look. Great buskers
Lunch on the pier is a must and a quick drink at the bar at the end. really shame we didn't have enough time to explore the whole area.

We had a nice stroll around the beach, albeit a little cold. I was surprised at the trash that was lying around the beach and in the water. I did see a couple picking up garbage. Looked like they do this on a regular basis.
Some garbage, people were mostly friendly. Loved walking around and checking out the local shops, some great coffee shops!

We had a spare day in LA so decided to take a trip to Santa Monica. It was well worth the drive. We were fortunate to get the Black Friday sales so the shopping alone was worth the trip. Then we had a lovely wander down the pier, checking out the sites.Its definitely a nice side trip from LA if you have a car.

column2: really fun beach, although surprised by the trash
column3: We were just here for an afternoon after arriving in LA before our visit to Universal Studios the next day. We didn't check out the pier, but could see the large Ferris wheel from where we were. The water wasn't as warm as I was expecting it to be in the summer, but the waves were great and we had a lot of fun. I was surprised though by the amount of trash all along the beach even though there are garbage cans also along the beach.
Santa Monica is a really lovely place to have a look at and walk through! The bay is beautiful and the pier is lots of fun!

column2: Good outing on a sunny day to the beach
column3: More than the beach its the walking around the shops, eateries and mingling with local culture. we had good sea food and drink at the bubba gump restaurant
He took us a bit less than an hour to walk from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier and it was really nice how much is going on in this place.
Great experience. Loved the pier. Great place to people watch too. Would go back and recommend for sure

Take time to visit Santa Monica, wonderful, lovely walk with loads of people doing activities, exercise etc on the beach. You can also rent bikes and there is also a fair area with ferris wheel. Really enjoyed our walk along here taking it all in!

column2: Wide, wide beach with glorious sunset...
column3: Just walking along the boardwalk of Santa Monica Bay was quite something - walkers, joggers, cyclists, skate-boarders and 'skaters with townhouses to one side, sea to the other and then the sunset over the ocean - golden reflection with the life-guard shelters as silhouettes - wonderful experience!!

Very family friendly area. The Santa Monica Pier has rides ( ferris wheel etc) on it, restaurants. very clean . Safer than Venice Beach/ Muscle Beach area. The beach itself is very very wide and very clean and well kept. We went in Dec. and although temperatures were cooler, i was still going surfing ! My daughters declined. Walk in shorts with a sweater.

The pier has become a fantastic spot for everyone: families with kids, couples, singles, and now Pokemon Go Players! I couldn't believe the number of different pokemon I caught. It was amazing and unbelievably fun! Can't wait to go back!

column2: Not only do movies and TV shows happen here....it is a beautiful long, well kept beach......
column3: Santa MONICA is my favourite place in Los Angeles and a jog on Pacific Coast Highway with the Santa Monica Beach below a highlight for any traveller.Driving through and stopping at the Santa Monica Pier a great experience....plus don't forget a bike ride can be memorable and this is for sure a good family experience,so people are basking in the sun on the beach and jumping in the water-mostly cold-for my tropical taste.The views over the Pacific Ocean are awesome.

column2: A bit upmarket of Venice Beach, plus it has a pier
column3: This is more family friendly (i.e. safer) than Venice Beach and has a pier with theme park and good restaurants. Its a lot more interesting than Venice anyway unless you are into hippy culture. You can stop here on a Starline bus orange route but if you have to change to the red route at Beverly Hills I'd recommend being on the return bus by 2pm in winter to avoid returning in the dark.

column2: Great Place to Watch People - Santa Monica Bay
column3: We have been to Santa Monica Bay numerous times. Its a fun place to go to the beach. There is a walking and biking trail.Its a good place for power builders and skaters.The views of the Pacific Ocean are scenic. There are iconic places such as the Santa Monica Pier.

column2: Bike Riding Fun on the Santa Monica Bike Trail
column3: We actually started our bike ride at the Will Rogers State Beach and rode past the Santa Monica pier. Was so beautiful and a fun ride! Then on another day we started at Torrance and rode all the way to Will Rogers State Beach - 44 miles down and back! Super fun bike ride and lots to see!

We stayed at the Hilton LAX and they arranged a bus service which picked us up a 2 minute walk outside the main doors. Takes about 25 minutes to Santa Monica Bay. Was around $8 each with return and allowed you to spend the day exploring! Well worth it. You can walk along the promenade (watch out for joggers and bikes) and such wonderful homes you pass. Lots of quirky places to eat and everyone seemed very friendly and helpful. Fun day trip!
Such a great beach to visit. Great for people watching so many different walks of life. Its all here, cheap parking food even entertainment by the locals loved this beach.

column2: Very scenic and peaceful, yet in the middle of Santa Monica.
column3: The beach and pier are great places to soak up California. A short hop from the Getty and a great counterpoint and place to watch a sunset or two.
So much to do on just the pier - great restaurants, video games, amusement park rides, street vendors, live music, and of course great views of the beach, ocean, and the surfers.

column2: The Focal Point Of Santa Monica
column3: Whenever I come back to CA, I always go to the Pier just to view the sights and the people. Very interesting collection of humanity.After that, walk around SM especially the 3rd Street Promenade. Plenty of places to eat low budget or high budget
We spent a whole day at Santa Monica Bay!!! The beach is amazing!! Next time I will stay in a hotel at Santa Monica!! I loved this place!! I think that i can live for ever there!!!

3rd street is a nice place to shop and dine however the general area around the beach smells like urine and is brought down by all the homeless sleeping in the parks, not really a nice place to take the family or children

Can't go to Los Angeles without taking time to go to the beach. We found parking, pricy parking, and enjoyed a relaxing stroll on the sidewalk and then took our shoes off and walked down to the waters edge and walked there for a bit enjoying the sun and the surf and the seagulls. After we climbed up onto the pier and chose a restaurant overlooking the ocean and enjoyed a leisure lunch. Nothing beats time spent on or near the ocean!
Really disappointed. Beautiful place but there are too many people living on the streets. The restaurants are nice, there is free wifi on the streets but will not return.
A place where you can meet lot of people. Some people with street skills, a view of long beach, 3rd street promenade etc.

We strolled down the pier and watched all the activity going on around: street performers, people fishing, playing volleyball on the sand courts below, some people surfing (although the water was very cold), and the most interesting was some girls doing yoga on surfboards. There were lots of little shops to browse and coffee stands along the way. This was also the end of the famous Route 66 so we had to take pictures under the sign.

column2: For being a city beach is really pleasingly
column3: Hardly bath temperature if you are not wearing wet suit like this in the month of November.The beach is huge and the advantage of its proximity to Santa Monica, you can easily walk to find everything the city offers. Significantly more peaceful than the neighbor Venice Beach
Although being from Chicago, and one of the greatest Piers (Navy), I was impressed. Nice Shops, restaurants, and talented performers lined our walk to the end.

column2: A place to tick off your list
column3: We walked from Venice Beach to Santa Monica which was very pleasant and great to see so many people out and about. The Pier is very old world which possibly appeals to some but a quick look was all we needed.
Beautiful beach, the boardwalk is fun. You must ride the merry go round! And walk on the sand it's actually warm!

column2: tI was just how I have seen it on TV
column3: Had a great day on the pier, walked along the beach. I couldn't get over the amount of rubbish bins along beach it was great to see,we should do the same in Australia. Great shopping.

column2: Great if you like watching people
column3: The Bay is a great place if you love watching people. If you don't, this place is not for those who want peace. It is over crowded but the views are amazing!
Great way to spend a afternoon, lots of restaurants, and good people watching. Shopping close by. Don't miss going to bubba gump.

My visit to Santa Monica Bay was on a beautiful sunny day. i went with my family.The sea breeze rushed through my hair. The sea gulls were flying around.there were not many people on the beach.We sat on the beach for about an hour and then walked to the nearby shops and restaurants. We had lunch at a restaurant. After that we walked around checking out the many shops. Then we returned to the beach.The sand is beautiful and soft. It was a day to relax and soak up the sun. There were more people in the afternoon - and a good time to do some people watching.Nearby is the yachting harbor and boats for hire.

Such a beautiful beach.You can just sit over there, get a drink, take a rest.you can get there by taking the bus from the downtown.And there are shopping mall near the beach, you can go shopping after taking a rest on the beach.

column2: Just wanted to have a little fun..
column3: Thought I would head down to the beach to catch a sunset on a sunny L.A. day with temps. at 90 degrees in November. Lots of activity from the beach to the pier with a great diversity of people. If you do not like crowds you may be uncomfortable here but it is great fun and better people watching. Also, no shortage of ways to spend your money. The sunset was great and of course the traffic afterwards was bumper to bumper but still worth the afternoon.

Such a lovely day out just strolling around people watching. There are a good few rides and food areas but they are very overpriced as to be expected. The ocean view and LA is amazing from the ferris wheel. The beach has white sand and when we were there it was not overly busy. Not many swimming, seemed to be more surfers. Loved it though, must go in LA.
A fantastic place with the waves from the Pacific Ocean. A beautiful pier right out to Ocean. Lot of attractions, nice restaurants a the Pier.

No visit to LA would be complete without a trip to this famous landmark. The food is rather average but the photo opportunities are tremendous. Shopping and eateries back from the beach are better value.

Loved the beaches and Santa Monica pier. We went on the Ferris wheel it was fab we felt like kids again. We went for a walk along the boulevard to Muscle beach and Venice beach. It was great loved watching all the people doing there exercises.

Awesome place to wonder around and sooo much better than Venice Beach down the road. The pier was fun with the usual touristy things one would expect but it was so great just to walk and take in the sense of recent history surrounding the place.Do it!
We stayed in a hotel right by Santa Monica Pier so spent some time down by the bay. Always plenty of hustle and bustle and very busy, but very beautiful and definitely great to see.

We weren't overly impressed with Santa Monica Bay. Yes, it is nice, but there are much nicer beaches in Europe for a fraction of the price. We had a good time walking and chatting away, but it was nothing special.

column2: You got to love Santa Monica
column3: I am not really someone who loves the beach but every time I am in LA I make sure to pay a brief visit to Santa Monica. I really enjoy the pier, especially in the morning when its not so crowded as in the afternoon. The pier has something magical to it that I can not explain - maybe its the fantastic view over the Ocean, the smell of freshly brewed coffe from the pier shops in the morning, the joggers, the view over the beach...The pier has great views of Santa Monica Bay and the beach, you can also see Malibu and Venice from there. The beach itself its huge and very clean. There are loads of shops, small cafes etc. its my favorite place in LA! Public transport is very easily accesible and gets you just about anywhere in LA. The Starline "yellow line" Tour also starts one block away from the pier.

went here for the entire day with my husband and enjoyed the 3rd street promanade shopping and a walk onto the pier. it was a 34 degree day and we enjoyed a nice icecream and the views from the pier out to see and looking back at santa monica are lovely

Santa Monica Bay Beach is a great place to spend a nice day. The beach has clean and soft sand. There are Life Guards stationed and food is readily available. If you are lucky there are Wales and Dolphins not far offshore.

We visited on a Sunday late afternoon and it was absolutely packed. Parking was difficult to find in their lot adjacent to the pier. The pier itself was wall to wall people. Overall, it was dirty (the bathrooms were awful) and seemed run down. We expected it to be as charming as it appears on TV and movies. Reality wasn't even close. Just seemed like an old carney. Bummer.
If your traveling with a walker rollator don't waste your steps. This is a very small amusement area with rides and food. It would be nice if you got money to burn on children.
Nice to get away from the big city, Nice beaches and walks, Nice walk out on the pier and not to far from downtown LA, if you have the time go and visit this iconic beach

column2: Great place to visit with Restaurants
column3: Great place to visit. It has 2 different looks: at bight with all the lights and during the day when you can have a walk on the beach.All kind oh Restaurants at walking distance.
Great for a walk, run, workout, lazy laying anything :-) the beach is HUGE! have never seen anything like that, looks like a construction site in reparation :-)
Beautful, clean beach. It is a nice walk out to the end of the pier. There are a variety of shops and restaurants on the pier as well as random entertainment.

Take the bike path from Marina Del Rey and south. You can also start from the Santa Monica Pier. Only there's a long detour on city streets to reconnect to the bike path in Marina Del Rey. Hence the suggestion to start in Marina Del Rey and head south. The path hugs the water and is a great way to enjoy the beautiful coastline. Great for families or couples. Bikes are $20 for the entire day....one of our favorite outings!
Having got a free shuttle from our hostel, we spent a few hours on the pier, trying the big wheel and people and seal watching. It's a great place to while away a few hours.
Some stunning beach views, trendy cafes. Not the best beach to swim as it is a little polluted, but a gorgeous location.
A Must for the lovers of Sea, atmosphere and much more, a good walk to Venice Beach, Bubba Gumps and the SUNSET OVER THE OCEAN. Just perfect

If you ever go to LA, you HAVE to see the pier in the day time. When we went, it was packed with all sorts of performers and entertainers. The performers, for the most part, were great. There was classical guitar, a really good R&B man dressed to the hilt in sequins, an old man doing a pretty good Bo Jangles, and even a magician doing card tricks. He was actually pretty good! That's just to name a few. We bought a CD from one of the guitar players. Nice memento of the visit.It was nice to stand and watch the waves run under where we were standing. The beach beside the pier had all sorts of bathers and body surfers. Remember, this is October! It was just all round enjoyable.

column2: Not as cool as people said it was
column3: We went at night, so perhaps we majorly missed out. But it wasn't quite as fabulous as we had hoped.
Overcrowded, overrated. Nice to visit it, as it is the end of Route 66, but other than that, nothing special.

column2: Beutiful to see the end of route 66
column3: Seen as part of the tour from the Hotel fantastic veiws of Santa Monica pier and able to walk around local area

column2: A Fun Walk & a Great City
column3: Santa Monica, and the Pier is a 'must do'. Heaps of shopping in the city. and a fun journey out onto the famous Pier. Make sure you do the boardwalk between Santa Monica and Venice Beach, you might just see a movie star. I did! And dont miss the bargain shopping for quality clothes and items at T.J Maxx.

went by train from LA to Santa Monica for the day. A little chilly to swim but just walking along the pier and beach and seeing all the activity is a must. Plenty of places to eat, shop and people watch. Our 'Boys' (oldies) hired bicycles and rode down to Venice Beach while we shopped! ha ha they could hardly walk the next day

Santa Monica Pier is a throw-back to the era of side shows and rides, cotton candy, burgers, souvenirs and -- these days -- Pokemon sightings. There is parking (on the slightly expensive side) right down at the pier front, and walking of the pier is accessible and easy.We were there on a non-holiday weekday when the weather was pleasant and the crowds were reasonable. An enjoyable walk around the pier offers an opportunity to shop, eat, have a drink, people watch, play side-show games (OMG they still have a working whack-a-mole!) and also walk along the waterfront on the beach.It's an easy and pleasant way to spend a couple of hours on a nice day.

Took the METRO from LA out to the Santa Monica Bay which was nice since it ended right near the beach. The walk to the beach, on the beach and the Pier was very fun. If you have an afternoon to take in this site I would recommend it. The pier itself was very nice to walk around.

column2: One of LA's more appealing areas
column3: Even in Autumn, this beautiful beach / bay is one of the better parts of LA - by comparison to the gridlock of the freeways, you can enjoy the views and almost feel peace and solitude here. Good for walking on the sandy beach or the footpath.

From the boardwalk and great pathways, to the beach, and the big pier, this place was hopping with activity and people milling around, relaxing and having fun. The atmosphere was easy going yet vibrant. Beautiful and scenic. We enjoyed spending a few hours here on our last visit.
There is a boardwalk to walk along the beach if you don't want to get Sandy. This is a good place to take pictures at sunset.

column2: Buy some water before go to the pier.
column3: The view was excellent, endless ocean and white sanded beach.and the park along the beach was very well maintained too.Many street performers at the pier so good to browse for about an hour.But at the pier, everything is pricey. Especially the water.$4 for one bottle of water seemed way too much for me.Make sure you have a bottle of water in your bag before head there!
Concerned at number of homeless, if you are in that position at least you would be warm. Some kind folks went round with food and clothes parcels.
Friends said to go here, and wish i had stayed here, it was lovely, one of the best places.Would definately go back.

To a cab from Hollywood Boulevard down to the pier for a day trip, It was such an amazing place, So many shops and things to see.We took a long walk down the beach along the surf and back to Bubba Gumps on the water for lunch, Then down the pier to people watch and check out the fisherman fishing and dropping lobster traps.Over all it was worth the $30 cab ride to visit such an amazing place.

We had a walk along the pier and spotted a friendly local sea lion at the end of the pier who seemed very friendly and happy to pose for photos. We then went for a swim in the sea which was lovely and refreshing. Beautiful views of the coast over to Malibu and a beautiful sunset.
We spent a few hours down at the beach. Good place to hang out for a while if you are a beach person

column2: Lovely place to spend an interesting day
column3: We have just returned from a second visit to LA and both times Santa Monica Bay has not disappointed on both occasions, in fact we visited twice this time!!The shopping area is packet with lovely shops in a pedestrianised area and every where has a lovely clean spacious feel to it with lots of eating places for everyone's taste.A walk along the promenade is a must that houses arcades and children rides and some of the best entertainment singers/artists we have ever seen in all our years of travel - you can easily spend a few hours if not a complete afternoon just sitting and listening to them - we did!!! And even brought a CD off one of them fantastic!!!We parked actually on the beach front car park so we could visit the shops then walk back to the car to get our towels for the beach - which is just adjacent to the beach ideal spot
Recently visited on a Sunday afternoon when the pier was packed. My girls enjoyed the touristy shopping and playing in the water. It's not a relaxed scene but a good stop for a tourist beach visit.
Great beach, the pier (which is nice for kids) and many restaurants and bars in the surrounding area.
One of the nicest view and sunset ever. Great place to take a walk, exercise, surfing and beautiful clean beaches. Also very romantic. It is a must see.

Came here on our first evening, wanted to go to Pacific Park but it was closed (8pm) but was nice walking up and down the pier. Lots of people selling curious items and entertaining the crowds. But as my title says 90% of people that were there was Pokemon hunting. Yes I said it. It was crazy. I live in London and I have never seen such a craze in such a relatively small area where you see everyone on there phones catching Pokemon. There is even a sign which advises everyone to play safe. Not going to lie I did whip out my phone and start to play and yes the reason why it is so popular is because you can literally get any Pokemon there in Santa Monica Bay.
Really nice stores around, and beautiful beach and breeze .... love walk in Santa Monica.... a lot of people. I was on december, you have to have a sweater ....

column2: Great place to unwind and chill out!
column3: Used the metro to come here for a few hours. Despite being busy it was a great way to relax and have a paddle in the Pacific and the Pier is excellent. Plenty of opportunities to buy a souvenir or get something to eat and drink and there are the fairground rides for those who fancy them. It's also the end of the famous Route 66!
Great place to spend an afternoon either people watching or having a delicious fish and chips dinner!
What an enormous beach to see. Plenty of shops in the area, plenty of restaurants and yes plenty of people. Easy to get to fro LA on a bus.

column2: Free, Beautiful, Great Place To People Watch
column3: The reason I placed four stars instead of five, is because you need to be a bit careful at night. During the day, it is a fun place to visit. It is a nice beach, execellent restaurants near by, and it's free to visit!

Never really considered walking along a beach front as being a tourist destination or attraction but on reflection I suppose this particular beach front does hold an attraction to most people. After all this was the birthplace of Muscle Beach.Quite a laid back seaside atmosphere, all the areas along the promenade and beach path are well maintained and clean and to kill a few hours during a weekend afternoon this is a nice place to just hang out, take in a drink and watch the body beautifuls even if the typical Californian beach goer, nowadays, does not exactly match the stereotype.
Never get sick of visiting the pier. Just love the vibe and great feeling about this place. Great spot to just people watch
Santa Monica Pier is a truly American icon. A must visit for first time visit to LA. Just strolling around, watching people and the scenery.

column2: Don't necessarily 'love' it - but it's kind of a must-see
column3: It's an important L.A. landmark and well worth some time to experience year another side to this overwhelming city. The array of experiences are unlike any other city I've been to. Pier is fun, if you are into these kind of things, but for me, seeing it and being there was the objective. Plenty of parking. A few restaurant choices on the pier - opted for Bubba Gump. Good sunset views. And worth hanging around till dark to see it all illuminated.

column2: great fun for adults, kids, families!
column3: Without a doubt, the Santa Monica area is a top destination for Los Angeles! Starting at the 3rd Street Promenade (there are many parking garages on 4th street), this 3rd Street is a wide pedestrian-only walkway that has been blocked off to auto traffic. Lined with shops and restaurants galore, with the upscale Santa Monica Mall at the South end, and with street performers (most have some talent, lol !) this place can't be beat for fun and sightseeing - day and night!Santa Monica Pier is a short 10 minute walk or 3 short blocks away toward the ocean coastline. The pier has arcades, rides, food, and vendors. More fun!Also, heading North from the pier on Ocean Ave along the cliff is a famous leisurely and scenic walkway used in movie sets. It provides a great view of the beach and the Pacific Ocean.About 1 mile south of the pier along Main Street is Old Downtown Santa Monica, which is another quaint place with shops and restaurants. There's plenty of pay-parking along a narrow strip that runs parallel to Main St.

Beautiful day, which made it a great time in itself. Ubered over to the pier as the Getty was closed on Mondays, but didn't know it. Walked along the 3rd St pavilion and then out to the pier and along the path past the volley ball nets and sat awhile watching the skaters and board people. It was fun, but mostly because of the day- great for people watching in CA, but has nothing on our Ocean City, MD boardwalk.

We spent about an hour on the pier and really enjoyed it! We walked along the beach for a little bit and explored up on the pier. Lots of souvenir shops and some restaurants, and also the carnival type rides. The big ferris wheel behind you makes for a fun picture. The sunset was beautiful!

column2: Fun in the sun on the pier
column3: The pier is bustling with a funfair, street entertainers, stalls and eateries. I recommend a walk from the pier to Venice beach along the promenade a pleasant walk of about 2 miles. Muscle beach for the athletic (or those who just wish to watch) is a couple of hundred metres from the pier. The sands of Santa Monica beach are expansive and uncrowded, a good day/afternoon out in LA.

column2: By far the best beach i have been on
column3: Its by far the best beach i have been on. Amazing all the way as well a good experience at Bubba Gump shrimp factory. Loved every minuted.

We had a great time at Santa Monica Pier, we went at night so the Ferris Wheel looked incredible with the changing lights, the ocean was beautiful while walking along the pier. Had dinner at Bubba Gumps, that was amazing, a great last night in LA.
Definitely worth a visit to the beach. Breath-taking view and free WiFi is available throughout the Santa Monica area.A place that it is a MUST go!

Sunsets behind the pier and the beach area are stunning. Great restaurants to enjoy with friends and relax with a drink as the pier comes to life . Stalls and fairground look fun. Take a stroll around great people watching. Public buses all end up here so cheap to get to.
Great pier and beach with plenty to see and do including the carnival rides and souvenirs to buy. Street performers add to the vibe. An LA must see.

column2: Nice to see if you do not live near the ocean, but traffic is rough
column3: If you are coming from the Midwest and rarely get to see the ocean, it is definitely worth seeing. Since I live in San Diego, I think that the beaches are nicer and significantly less crowded here. It can be difficult to find parking much of the year near the boardwalk, especially.
This is a really good, shallow, long beach. Great for kids and non swimming adults. The pier and rides are nearby. Parking is limited.

Such a lovely beach, and the walkway is filled with people selling little trinkets. There's lots of street food to choose from, and in general the place is must very lively. It was lovely spending a day there.
First you have to visit the pier: the end of the legendary Route 66. You can't miss this. Crowdy but a nice place to visit.

wonderful experience , its a lovely lively beach. just take a bicycle ride from there its fun to ride. you can catch a metro from hollywood blvd and reach up to santa monica. metro station is close to the beach.
We live close to the Atlantic and have vacationed there for 40+ years, so it was a great opportunity to put our toes in the Pacific again!
We ate our bag lunch on the pier and watched the Sunday crowd--both on the beach and on the pier--mimeists, musicians, all entertaining

column2: Live Near Atlantic Ocean . . . Had to Touch the Pacific Ocean While There
column3: We loved Santa Monica Bay. The beach was so clean. Visited son who lives nearby. I can see why he loves California so much. So many places to go and sights to see. Ate at the seafood restaurant on the Santa Monica Pier.

We had to go visit the famous Santa Monica Pier while in LA. Area is just ok. Lots of homeless wandering around. The whole area could use a facelift. It's the end of the line for Route 66. Great views from the end of the Pier. Nothing to write home about but the destination was more significant as a traveler. Should you see it? Sure, but there's nothing special there other than some cheap souvenirs but the views are worth the trip

I live near this bay. With only a few steps uphill I can view its wonderful half-moon curve. I drive along it many days and walk on its beaches other days. It is full of moods and colors and every shade of blue-green-gray. Somedays the waves lash angrily at the beach and others lie barely frothing. Whether seen from a vantage point up in the nearby hills or from the sandy beaches and waters edge it is an everchanging and always beautiful sight.
Lots of activities to do on the pier, lots of food and drink options and makes a great walk in the sun!
Such a beautiful place, I highly recommend renting bikes and riding to Venice beach its only 20 minutes and its stunning!! the pier is GORGEOUS at sunset and you will take the best pictures ever.
we did get off heir from hope on hope of bus but pier so full of people we did not go on but nices to walk along by sands

column2: All I though it would be!
column3: Crowded but worth it. Rode on the wheel and took in the views that where spectacular. Buy the bundle for the rides since each is $8.00 per person.
wonderful views and fun With the Pier but beware,there are broken glass in the sand and dirt is lying around
cold out there but the beach is nice and the restaurants on pier are good, good for few hours but do layer up at it gets too cold in evening!!

The Santa Monica Bay is very beautiful and there is a lot to do they haves rides, performers and a variety of places to eat. It is also close to a mall so you can shop till you drop any and every store you can think of is in that area.

our 1st day in the USA and 1st place to visit. Hard place to Park on street but there is a shopping centre on Broadway ( I think) or Santa Monica Blvd, that's good to park. the Pier is great with terrific views. the city is clean and modern and nice place to visit and of course the end of Route 66. we had done much of route 66 on previous trips so great to see the sign

Yup, it is quite nice. If you are bold and cold-resistant enough, you can even swim in the water (I personally liked it really much - and after few minutes in the water it is nowhere near as bad as it seems). Nothing out of the world, but nice enough to visit. Plus it has lovely atmosphere.
Old and dirty. Theres lots of homeless and drop kicks hanging around here. Toilets were filthy. Carnival seen with lots of stalls and shops .

We took a trip on the Metro from Hollywood to Santa Monica Bay. It was a beautiful sunny day and it was so nice to walk along the beach. We also walked along the pier and had lunch at the nice restaurant at the end of the pier. Among other things the pier and area contain shops, restaurants, a large ferris wheel and other rides. We passed Bloomingdales on the way to the pier and being from Australia checked it out. This was an enjoyable day.

column2: Fun place to see the ocean
column3: Was nice place to see the ocean and entertainment on the board walk. Shop are nice and fun place. Nice beach and showers also.

It's a cool place, even in a big city there is time to escape to the beach. The best time to get there is early in the morning, there is less people and you get to walk around with no problem, specially if you wanna take pictures

Visited Santa Monica in September 2016. A lovely place, with lots of shops, cafes restaurants around. The pier was really good, but our favourite was Vanice beach. It's a 45 min walk along the promenade (a beautiful sandy beach) or a short bus journey away, and has a fabulous atmosphere, with arty stalls and plenty of souvenir shops. Really enjoyed the street performers near the pier, brilliant!
Very busy as popular visiting place for tourists but was worth the experience and was part of our Insider Tours LA in a Day experience. Worth the trip.
we went on beach sand, relexed a bit, then walked in pier, had lunch here, there are so many food choices. we watched street performers etc. many things to do here.

column2: totally fun day. The beach is beautiful. the parking price is r
column3: the parking price is reasonable. the beach is clean, there is a small aquarium which has interesting sea life exhibits indigenous to the bay. The pier has shops, is wide and easy to stroll. The Amusement park is delightful and the best part of being on the rides is soaring over the ocean and seeing the surf roll in. The ferris wheel allows panoramic views in all directions. Definitely a must-see on a list of things to do on a short visit.
So much to do in Santa Monica bay, you can enjoy the board walk or relax in the water. California weather is amazing. the beach is much better and cleaner than Miami and more of a family atmosphere
Best stop for stroll on pier with interesting shops and fun photo opportunities. We rode the Ferris wheel and that gave amazing views

There is no shortage of beaches in the LA basin and Santa Monica has the unique appeal of being so close to many diverse attractions. It is a long hike down to the water but worth the trip. We prefer to be on the north side of the Pier to enjoy the view of Malibu and south to the pier. Parking can be a bit of a challenge so avoid the lunch time rush.
Santa Monica bay streaches in both directions for miles. Soft, white sand and so much space for everyone.
On our tour we stopped here and what a lovely place. If you ever get the chance you must visit. As it was part of our day trip did not have enough time to explore but will go back.
nice clean beach and lot of shops. perfect for a day outing with kids. lots of cafes and restaurants
take a factor 50 sun lotion no shade lots going on loved it x worth a visit and park on the pier $3 an hour not charged more than $15 x

This is a great place to spend the day or even just take a quick jog/bike ride. People are quite friendly, the environment is nice, you have lots of options of other activities to do nearby. The gym activities are also fun, and I enjoyed watching more athletic people do the different obstacles!

column2: From Ferris Wheel to Beach to Fine Shops & Restaurants
column3: Santa Monica turned out to be one of the gems of our trip to LA. On the plane from FL to LAX we met a young script reviewer and started a conversation. He recommended Santa Monica to us so we gave it a try. People were so friendly, the weather perfect (no humidity), and the beach was beautiful. We walked out on the pier first and was pleasantly surprised how clean it was. Some of the street performers were excellent singers, especially the one in front of the main restaurant and behind it. Made me think they could have gone professional if they wanted another life than cool breezes, good food, and nice folks. Food abounds here as do little shops and many rides. We loved Santa Monica so we decided to stay longer and started to browse the streets. There were many restaurants and shops we enjoyed. A Promenade with name brand stores is part of the scene but that day we spent more time with the locals. We even enjoyed their library.
Every time we go to Los Angeles, we make time to sop by the Santa Monica Bay. It is truly a relaxing and fun event. Lots of sight to see, street performers and great restaurants.
Gorgeous beach, so clean and tidy and well manned by lifeguards too. A lovely bit of coastline, slightly touristy but it doesn't take away the beauty of the place.
...and I guess I'm not the only one! What a blessed place, really! It calms you down the minute you step foot on that beach...not the waters, though! Wonderful waves, but sooo cold!

column2: Nice to get out of the city
column3: Weather was beautiful. Went on the yellow route hop on hop off bus. Great for families with the rides for the children and nice to walk along the beach

All the fun of the fair on the Pier!We visited on a Saturday and it was really busy... lots going on from jugglers to buskers to puppet shows..I thought it was a bit grotty myself, lots of rubbish lying around and I found the amount of homeless lying on park benches quite disturbing!
Santa Monica Peir; theme parks, views, awesome sunsets, and dining. This place is awesome to go and explore with a theme park on the peir, beautiful scenery and lots of food options.
Amazing atmosphere on the pier - thousands of visitors, lots of live music, people from all walks of life - fab!

column2: Experience the LA life @ Santa Monica
column3: Loves Santa Monica. It has everything you may want- one of the best pier- theme park on the pier- great lookout into the sea- long beach with activities- enjoy dinner @ sunset at nearby restaurants.Great place to spend the day with family; and there is something for evryone.

column2: The Oldest Merry-Go-Round AND the Only Solar Powered Ferris Wheel
column3: That a theme park sits on an ocean pier boggled my mind! There is also a roller coaster on it as well as a few restaurants and lots of artists and performers. We watched the sun set from one of the restaurants. It was beautiful.
I love Santa MonicaI used to live thererestarants/ shopsnearbywlak on the pierMain Street has many restaurants3rd street promade - stroll at night

We stayed in Santa Monica for one night and it's a great spot. Had to visit the pier as this is what we've seen on many movies.Relaxing early morning without the crowds. Next time will visit at night and enjoy the rides.
wow what a wonderful vibrant place to visit, the atmosphere was electric, it was swarming with people but still something not to be missed

U have to visit Santa Monica if u want a good taste of the LA life ! U will be able to see some breathtaking houses and maybe have some shopping in those amazing stores ..u need the whole day to enjoy this amazing place
Santa Monica is a beautiful place. Once again you have to pay for parking. They have the Santa Monica pier where they have rides for entertainment. Recommended place to go.

It is a must see just to see how the other half live!!Gazing at the windows with no prices visible says a lot!Also a good reminder from several films, including Pretty Woman where try popping into the hotel which is beautiful!

One of the best place in California.The place you've ever heard! the long way to the beach, the pier, the sunset and the muscle beach through. this is california.The seasons do no exist here, is Always sunny and beautifull from everyway you look at. Even better if you can visit during business trip in USA.
We went to Santa Barbara before we go there and it was more organized environment than it is, the view in Santa Barbara is more better with the ocean, mountains and the houses

What a beautiful beach and boardwalk with loads of lovely restaurants and bars and amusements for the kids. However the amount of homeless people sleeping rough and routing in bins for food is hard to look at.

column2: Massive hire a bike or take Segway tour.
column3: The place is full of posers and salt of the earth types. Visit deans bar and walk to the end of the pier.

A beautiful beach and a fun time for the entire family on the pier. Cool arcade for the kids, plenty of rides and entertainment. If you are setting up for the day on this beautiful beach I would recommend being at least 300 yards south of the pier. Close to the pier seems to attract some undesirable individuals.
Lots of fun to walk on the pier, have something to eat and people watch. Also viewed beautiful coast line.

Took the open air buses down to Santa Monica and enjoyed a walk along the pier with a ride on the Ferris Wheel. Lovely views in both directions of the beach. Definitely want to return to this area to explore it some more and ride bikes along the promanade.

It's iconic in the sense that over the years there's always a TV show or movie that features the pier and / or the beach. And as it's officially touted to be the end of Route 66 gives it even more prominence. All in all an enjoyable 2 hours spent.

We went to check out Santa Monica and really enjoyed it. We went in and body surfed the waves which was great fun. The pier is alright if you like tacky fairs. We went into Bubba gump shrimp which was nice. There are alot if homeless people in Santa Monica showing that some work needs doing to help these people by the state.Parking is in abundance and not too pricey.

its lots of fun to either walk along the beach to the piers or to ride a bike on the bike path which can take you to Malibu or past the airport going south. But due to the marine layer it can be cold there or at least 10 degrees cooler than elsewhere in LA at a minimum. You can park on the lots near main street or try the ones on the beach. 6 hour max on the lots near main st but you can refill. Get there early on the weekends as it fills up. There are toilets and showers to wash off your feet from the sand. Water temp is nice right now.
A great place to walk the shore. Great place to end up after driving through LA all day. Easy to find and plenty of food options

column2: When you think LA think Santa Monica
column3: When people think of LA, it's not the downtown CBD it's the beaches, palm trees, publicity photos and movie locations..this sums up Santa Monica! You get what you expect to see. Yes it's very busy at weekends but this adds to the atmosphere, it appeals to all sorts, young, old...all having fun! The beaches are beautifully maintained, there is ample car parking which is not at all expensive. When we visit, we always rent the bikes and enjoy the cycle trail along the boardwalk, it's a fantastic way to experience this beautiful area. Common sense prevails with your safety, anywhere there are lots of people you always need to be vigilant with your possessions.

column2: The Beach You See in the Movies
column3: Come rain or shine, you will not be disappointed. The pier is fun for kids and is not horribly expensive. The arcade is fun for adults as well. Walk on the pier, visit the old Carousel and take the stairs down to the sand. It is fun to walk under the pier and see the waves break through the pilings. Views are spectacular and you will see all sorts of locals fishing for the day, old-timers sitting on benches, children and people from around the world. Don't miss the famous entrance sign at the top of the walk way. You can park on the pier in the reasonable public lot. Rent a bike to bike to Venice or bike north along the bay for spectacular views. Plan to spend several hours if you have them.
The beach was very empty for a summer day which made it good to relax. It was nice but nothing memorable.

column2: D Sunset and beach you don't want to missed!
column3: I came here to see the sunset and I did managed to capture it from the top and also by the beach. The sun is bigger than the one that I usually see. Love the photos here thought I didn't have the time for beach activities.
I thought it was beautiful and relaxing but was disappointed that the amusement part of the pier was smaller then I thought. I was happy we went to say I had been there.

II feel like I won the lottery of birth being born here and a native of southern Cali. Santa Monica has always been my place. Growing up spending the summers on the beaches nearby and enjoying all that bay has to offer. From the best restaurants on Ocean to the great clubs on PCH not to mention the pier and promenade.Though much has changed since I was a kid, it's still has that small town beach feel.

column2: KMA at the end of Route 66
column3: The pier is much smaller than I anticipated and the Ferris Wheel was smaller as well, but is a fun things to see as a tourist. There were some nice medium scale restaurants there as well as some not so scaled eateries. Funny thing is I thought there were two sides to the Pier, but there is only one size. the bathrooms were surprisingly clean and view from the Pier was awesome.

Amazing vies, amazing atmosphere, loads of photo opportunities. The beach and the public toilets extremely clean. The amazing sights of ppl working out and doing high bar tricks very interesting.Much better than Venice beach/walk which was dirty and smelled of drugs.

column2: A must for Tourists and Locals alike
column3: Visiting the Pier has become one of the outings that I love. This place has a way of taking all of your cares and thrusting them into the ocean...and you will be glad it did. Upon arrival, take in the scenes...smell the food...enjoy the dancing and laughter and just let your hair down. Along the pier you will find an array of shops, eateries all of those staples that you've come to expect in a beach setting. The costs associated can be within normal range if you desire to just pack a picnic and eat on the beach and then perhaps walk the pier. That's perfectly doable. During the summer months (every Thursday) there's a free concert with well known acts, (e.g. Mavis Staples was there a few weeks ago, as well as, the Ohio Players) that will take you back in time when music was fun and life was easy...nevertheless, enjoy yourself. Have a great time and remember, life is to be enjoyed no matter where or what state you may find yourself in...
Love this bay. The view is great and the sunsets on the bay are magical. This is a must see if you travel to Los Angeles. Go to Santa Monica to view.

column2: Visit to LA incomplete without visit to Santa Monica
column3: Walk from 3rd street Promenade down to the pier. Stroll from Santa Monica to Venice beach. A visit to LA is not complete unless you stop by Santa Monica. This is a must. Take a dip in the ocean, walk down the pier and take a ride on the ferris wheel. Good eats all around.

It was very busy!!! but very pretty! we did not drive there (thank goodness) because the parking lots everywhere were PACKED!!!! if youre into pokemon go theres a lot of water pokemons around! the shops are good and the performers are good
It's good place to visit it in California to have good memory with your family and enjoying what view of the Water and Ossining

column2: The Main Beach area of Santa Monica Bay & Santa Monica Pier.
column3: This is a very popular (and busy) Beach area along the Southern California coast. That's probably because there's more to see and do around here. There's lots of parking, but, you have to pay, almost everywhere in this area. And, check the signs to see if the water is ok to swim or surf.

If you've been to Blackpool, then you'll find Santa Monica pier familiar. Obviously the sun is out, and it lacks the scent of fish and chips carried on the bracing Irish sea wind, but at the end of the day the amusements and fun fair are the same as Blackpool! Even so it was fun and made a very kitchy end to our Route 66 adventure

We stayed at this nice and clean beach for about 2 hours in the afternoon and continued on the nearby pier for a nice evening walk despite the crowds. Be prepared to spend 12 dollars for parking in the beach parking lot - or if you are not staying too long get a better deal with hourly fees in some of the nearby parking structures.

column2: Visit to Santa Monica Bay - Labor Day 2016
column3: Beautiful, spacious beach that offers many restaurants and places to view the beach/ocean on the main strip as well as a carnival, restaurants and eateries on the Pier. Live music can also be heard on the end of the Pier.

column2: Nice way to spend a day
column3: Santa Monica Pier is a really nic eway to spend the day. We wnt to the aquarium, rode bikes along the beautiful bike path, went to the pacific park amusement park. we also went on the malibu tour of the stars homes which started from the pier. We also went down to the beach. It was just so beautiful and a great way to spend the day. It also is pretty close to LAX airport.
The views from this beach are incredible.Its very relaxing and theres lots to do including renting a bike, beach games, surfing and visiting the pier which is a must. Lovely restaurants and good fun
great food great drink and great music and wow great place,wish we could have stayed longer but we will be back
The beach is lovely with stunning views. The pier is good to grab some food, great sandy beach with lots of space.
Nice beach if you don't know the ones in Florida or the Caribbean just to mention some. It's a great place to walk, but the water are too cold and place too touristic.
Even though it was very busy it was still beautiful and very relaxing. Huge beach and pier with loads to do.
Only wanted to stop for a quick drink, stayed an hour. Reasonable food at the Mexican place at the end of the pier.Car park fairly expensive and a long wait to get on the freeway
So busy you couldn't move - a bit like Brighton but on a bigger scale and without the quaint pubs. Traffic is absolutely crazy and finding parking is difficult

There are beaches and there are Beaches. Have lived here for 35 years. There are very urban sections, wild and crazy stretches and laid back gems off the beaten path. Walking to the Marina jetty at dawn thru the Ballona wetlands is quiet and meditational. Mostly only the seagulls and egrets are up and scoring breakfast fish. Washington street pier is a joy in the early morning. The early surfers are out. Locals gather at the "Cows End" for coffee. If you want urban beachside mad-ness then Venice is the place for action. Each season and micro environment has its charm.
Typical California Beach, with lot of sand and space. Suited for families and kids will have lot of things to do, apart from enjoying the waves.

Stopped off here as the end of Route 66 is on the pier. Plus it's on grand theft auto and my two sons wanted to see it. There seemed to be a few homeless people on the beach. We were only there for few hours it was ok but not nicest beaches I've been on.

column2: Lovely Beach to hang out on .
column3: We had a few hours spare and were feally a bit tired so headed down to Santa Monica. Beech is spotless and friendly. Parking lots are ample and run along side the beech Mainly families.Recommeded

We planned a 1 day trip during our stay in LA. We took the metro to get there which was quite convenient.We felt Santa Monica Bay a bit disappointing. It is basically a crowded gathering place with some attractions. The beach area was not really special.The city center was nice with lots of stores and live entertainment on the street.

Such a lovely place generally, a great feel, nice and clean. Pleasant to walk along, featuring wonderful views and a refreshing sea breeze. There are fantastic shops on the promenade and along the pier. Lots to see, with entertainment of all sorts, singers, street entertainers and those seeking fame and fortune. We loved it and went back twice over our 10 day trip. Would be a fantastic place for a beachfront holiday. The apartments might be pricey but it would cheap to live and the food is clean, varied and affordable.

By far my favorite spot in L.A. area. I've been there twice, and I do love the Pier. When I visit the pier every time, I feel like I am in a different world - huge beach, warm water, pier with attractions and stores. Fishermen at the end of the pier, friendly people (tourists, too lol). How much I miss this spot....
this is not just a beach, it is great there. But it has a lot more its a great area to visit, Shopping eating and very clean. Lots of street entertainment

The beach is very clean and family friendlyAll the beaches from Marina Del Rey to Santa Monica and beyond all run into each other.Mother beach at Marina Del Rey was very quite, and so was Venice beach and Muscle beach, these beaches were more for the gym show offs and the traditional sea side shops. and were covered with loads of home less people who actually live in in their little home made shelters all along the beachfront. get up early and see how they actually survive, they do not bother you.Were as Santa Monica side was more like a proper seaside beach that we are used too.

Plenty to see and do in Santa Monica. Spend time people watching on the pier and taking in the rides (which are a bit pricey unless you get a wrist band). Walk along the amazing beach. Shop and dine on third street. Love this place! Cool California at its best!

column2: Enjoyed the beautiful beach and great for people watching!
column3: A gorgeous day at the Santa Monica Pier. It was in the 70's and since I don't see the ocean (I live in Las Vegas) it was a welcome sight. Bought a coffee at the Coffee Bean and just enjoyed watching all the people. Great access via Metro station
The water is beautiful. Beach gets crowded. Parking is reasonable. I'd recommend spending the day here.

column2: great hang out day or night
column3: It looks just like the movies - great hang out for sunset and evening. Surprisingly quieter than I expected. Really a great way to end the day.

Santa Monica has such a lively eclectic feel. There is some thing for every one to do whether it be sitting on the beach, eating at the great restaurants, shopping or catching a movie. Love it there!!

From the boardwalk where you can ride bikes/skateboards, etc, to the shops, Gold's Gym and even the skatepark, there is so much to see and do. Constant police presence for anyone concerned, keeping things in order, definitely don't miss out on the workout area close to the pier, where you can partake in all sorts of gymnastic equipment like bars, rings and ropes-Love this place!!

Great place to go day or night. The beach was the calmest of all beach cities. Great cheap parking by the beach in city lot, only $2 per hour. Be prepared for a long walk in the sand to get to the ocean.

This was great! We drove and parked on the pier. Walked around and took it all in. Great to be in a place weve seen in so many movies. Lots of rides, food to eat and even fishing on the end of the wharf. Definitely a must!

column2: One of the best and happening beach
column3: It is a nice long strip of clean sandy beaches, very popular; so many people rush on weekends for fun time with family and friends. The pier hosts a lot of activities for kids; along with some nice food joints, and of course loaded with the performance artists - more in evening time. Found many people do fishing on the pier side.My several trips to relax on random weekends so far never disappointed. Offers fun for all ages. I found my quick bike ride to nearby Venice beach also very enjoyable.Overall fun packed place for all!
Go to Santa Monica beach and visit the pier. If you are driving then parking next to the pier is only $12.00. Take the walk down the coast to Venice beach and see the wonders that await you.

Santa Monica Bay has it all.Taking time out away from the hussle and bustle of LA city, this short trip to long nice sandy beaches and clean ocean is a must to relax. It never gives the impression of over crowdedness as there is plenty of space. The waters are safe and clean.

column2: A Throw back to the Old Days
column3: Who doesn't love a visit to the beach? But there is also a boardwalk here with rides, food and attractions. There is also a walk/bike path that runs for miles, so if you want to run or rent a bike and ride, it's a fun day at the beach.

My dream of dipping my feet in the Pacific ocean on both sides of the world was easy,,they had a board walk almost down to the water,,while we were there they had 3 emergency trucks come roaring up to the underneath of the board walk,,not sure what but was disappointed with the baywatch guys,no muscle's there and they wore singlets,,the pier certainly had days of entertainment on it,,we didn't get enough time to walk to the end of the pier but what we saw was great,,even bought a small bottle of Santa Monica Beach back with me,,,you really needed a few days to visit this pier,,,just amazing, even had a scary rollercoaster on the pier,,,not my thing but it was being well supported with people wanting rides,,,

column2: Great Beach, The end of Route 66
column3: This was a great place to go for a day, walk the pier, have lunch and see where Route 66 ends on the pier.

Santa Monica pier is exactly what a pier should be. Next to sandy beaches with plenty happening along it's entire length.There are street artists performing, restaurants, people fishing, gift shops, fair etc.etc.We spent 2 hours just walking to the end and back.Also, this is the beginning (or should it be end?) of Route 66.Highly recommended for everybody.

column2: Relaxing place with nearby shopping area
column3: Good to relax at this location with beaches, pier, shopping area. It's definitely a tourist destination for fun, relax, eat and shop.
loved the sand, ocean and the pier. so much going on then walk to the ocean and peaceful.great carousel; games, food, fun.
Great beach but traffic from Los Angeles made the short trip a 2 hour journey and parking in Santa Monica is horrendous.
Nothing special there...a lot (I mean A LOT) of people hunting Pok茅mon...crowd place, windy beach, dirty shore, questionable water quality...i dont know...it's meh.

column2: Santa Monica Beach & Pier -- Iconic Must-See Destination in LA
column3: Beautiful views from the Pier. If you go at night, and look northwest, you will see the lights of "The Queen's Necklace" along the shore. But try to time your visit to the Pier for sundown. That's when you see the symbols of Santa Monica -- the ridges of the SaMo mountains descending into the sea at the northwest mouth of the Bay, the sun setting over Point Dume, with the waves crashing on the beach. You will notice this symbol on all SAMO street signs and public works.The beach itself is pleasant and generally pretty clean, but is crowded on nice weekends (which is most of our weekends.) Be sure to come early if you want parking on or near the beach. Santa Monica has a great park system all along the beach. Enjoy the bike trail, volleyball nets, acrobatics arena, kids play areas, aquarium and of course the iconic Pier with its carnival-like amusement park.
Great place for family or couples. Very clean city and great beaches. Tons to do with shopping, food, and outdoor events.
Don't miss the Pier! Nice rides, huge arcade, beautiful sunsets. It was Coney Island on the West coast.
Excellent bike path the entire length of the beach, also onto Venis Beach, has plenty of fresh water access to refill bottles. There is good access to the Pier and its attractions.

column2: Beautiful beaches, body surfing, and the pier is old-fashioned fun
column3: Beaches closer to the pier are more crowded, but there is plenty of beach space in the bay to always find a good spot as you go north from the pier. Lots of easy parking in lots adjacent to the beaches. Good body surfing/boogey boarding. The pier has arcades, fishing trips, live music, lots of people biking and rollerskating/skate boarding, and many good restaurants along the beach and around the pier. 3rd Street open air mall is nearby for any type of shopping you like, plus lots more fun restaurants and bars.
Parking cost a bomb and you are just close to a highway...that is not what I call a beach. No wonder it is empty!
Wide sandy beach, surfers, bike path, roller coasters, rollers, santa monica pier for restaurants and souvenirs shops, skate park, etc,.

column2: Great beach with plenty to do
column3: The beach its self is really nice and is big enough that you can get room to yourself if you like.We went when the weather was really hot both the beach and sea were really great.The pier and the town are also good areas and help to break the day up well, muscle beach is walking distance also.

column2: A perfect Way to Spend the Afternoon
column3: We were a little ways off from the pier in the middle of the day. It wasn't over crowded, and pretty easy to get to. Waves were minimal, lifeguards on duty. Saw a lifeguard spot an undertow and get people out of it before it became a problem. Our girls swam, napped on the beach and had a great time. Highly recommend.
This was the final stage of a Route 66 coach trip. The trip of a life time! We dined at Bubba's afterwards.

column2: Santa Monica Bay has it all
column3: Santa Monica is great. HUGE, EXPANSIVE beaches with all of the sports available to you, volleyball, sand castles, food, a beautiful boardwalk, surfing, paddleboarding, kayaks, etc, are all here. Parking is easy and available within a short distance. Great place to spend the day with family, friends, etc.
E only thing here is to see is the santa monica pier, thats it. Leave your car away from the pier, the parking is a total rip off near the pier.

column2: Horrible and Glorious and part of the Definitive L.A. Experience!
column3: There's nothing like character watching, chotchkis buying, bike riding, and druggie observing on the strand at Santa Monica Bay. While the beach is fairly clean and inviting for sunning and bathing, the real action is on the strand that spans from down south at Manhattan Beach and goes past the Santa Monica Pier. Here you'll vie with rude cyclers, crazy weirdoes, delightful beauties, muscle men, and older tourists with gaping mouths in disbelief. In other words.the full gamut of life in L.A.be there or be squareand don't forget walking shoes, sunscreen and sunglasses. Welcome to Hollywierd!

This was very much on our " to do " list when we came to Los Angeles, it was an easybus journey from our base in Sunset Boulevard. It was very busy when we visited(the price of fame!) The pier has lots of interesting rides, there are lots of food placesand souvenir stalls. It is worth taking a short taxi ride to Venice beach (past thehotel California!) to see the athletes and bodybuilders there.

What a great place! So picturesque, lovely holiday vibe, full of people from all around the world. My husband and I rode the ferris wheel and the rollercoaster - excellent! The beach was lovely too. Great bars and restaurants to choose from.

Santa Monica beach is a very wide beach with enormours surf rollers that alone is a spectacle to see. Many bronzed surfers make it a happening not to be forgotten.Easy to reach by car or bike that are everywhere to rent.Nearby city of Santa monica is a good city to explore, nice shops and hotels
The mass of humanity takes away from the beauty. Specifically the pier. Coming in and going out was in a massive line of people- just ridiculous and not enjoyable. Dirty. Skip it.
We expected more from Santa Monica. Basically its a nice beach with a very average pier. There is nothing particularly special about it.

This is not only a beautiful place to visit, but it is full of places to go and see. In the evening you can see people using rings, climbing ropes, and does varies balancing actives. The pier offers so many things to do and places to eat. The 3rd St shopping area is fantastic with great places to eat. Hotels here are beautiful!

The pier and beach were over whelmed with people. Parking was a problem so we rented bikes. Ocean was nice and no real problem with the people. I would not consider it friendly for young kids (beach OK).
This place is AMAZING. Fun for ALL!!! Santa Monica Pier is one of the best. Tons of activities and sites to see nearby.

column2: This is what a California Beach Looks Like....
column3: We were here on holiday from the UK and wanted to see Santa Monica Pier as we have seen it in many films and on TV. It did not disappoint. The town of Santa Monica is very pretty, and there was a farmers market on the day we went. The beach is big, wide and looks exactly like we expected, including the lifeguard stations!!Handy tips...1. Park a few streets away from the beach and you will cut your costs significantly.
