We parking in a city center (or centre as we call it in the UK) shopping mall car park and got 90 minutes free then $1.25 per hour. The beach cost was $12 up front for the day - if you can get in.2. Be prepared to walk. The town is lovely, we walked miles without realizing, and the beach is also great for walking the shoreline bare foot.3. Get there early. The traffic in the morning was tolerable. By lunchtime it was crazy.

We parked in a lot and it cost $8. We walked along the beach on the sidewalk, which was really nice. There are people roller blading, biking, skateboarding, running, etc. The sidewalk is set up for all these activities. There were tons of activities happening on the beach. We went to the pier and there was a free concert going on. We didn't stay for the concert, but we walked around. The pier is pretty touristy. The beach itself is beautiful. Public bathrooms are provided all along the beach which is nice.

Staying in Santa Monica for an evening. So had a good look around and this place truly is beautiful. The beach, the pier, the cliff viewings the shops and promenade. Just so different and chilled. A proper must-do place. Fully recommend.
We went at night and there was a free concert on the pier. Plus the beach was open, so we could walk along the shore.

Santa Monica Bay is a tourist site many come to by name only. Featured in many movies over the years, and in the 18 years I have lived in the area has changed a lot. What hasn't changed is the vendors trying to get you to buy cheap substandard items.Lots of trash on beach, but that is the fault of the beach goers.Not a big fan of unleashed dogs on the beach, especially when its posted about leash laws.

column2: Fun, Fun, Fun, Looking for the "Beach Boys"
column3: If you are in L.A. you can't miss the pier and Ocean drive. Stunning sunset and a lot of attractions for the kids. Maybe you need to be in your 50s or 60s but you will have the nostalgia of the the 60s,m go there and listen the music of the Beach Boys or Hotel California
Stunning and came here in August 2016 and so pretty and a great way and location to watch the sun go down
If you are in LA then you would have to see the pier and bay very touristy and the water in the bay is not very clean but you gotta go

The view as you arrive off the bus, looking out over the cliff to the sea is stunning. Enjoyed strolling along the beach, the Santa Monica Pier and Muscle Beach. check out the amazingly talented people strutting their stuff. Try a yummy Japanese hotdog for something different
took the kids for a day at the pier and to see all the crazy stuff. we all had a blast and were able to experience some pretty cool things on the pier. food is a bit pricey, but worth the fun time.

column2: Nice place to visit but Pier overcrowded
column3: Nice shopping area, enjoy the stroll along the beach but don't hope too much about the Pier, it is overcrowded and was not the most enjoyable part of our visit

The Santa Monica Bay is not the cleanest beach but it is one of the few on California's coast that doesn't have a big decline from the sand to the beach which I appreciate. The pier is fun to take a stroll on and see the few businesses there including a Bubba Gump's restaurant. They also offered a Twilight Concert Event Series over the summer where bands would play for free up on the pier. There are lots of small nice sitting and park areas. It is blocks from a great shopping and dining district of Santa Monica where you can get better food and souvenirs than from the pier. This is the least fancy of all the beaches I visited but it was worth seeing and I good a good sunset picture from the pier.

column2: Lots of people, shopping, eating, beach area and ocean
column3: We came on a Friday afternoon. It was packed and very hard to find parking. There is a ton of shopping and eating if you want that. You can also walk down to the beach area. The pier a Farris Wheel, small rides and some carnival type food. You could easily spend an entire day in this area.
Fantastic place to visit with so many different things to see. Plenty of eclectic people to watch. Great use of bike lanes to keep pedestrians safe

column2: Great beach location - full of atmosphere
column3: Visited Santa Monica beach on our first trip to L.A . The beach was busy as it was a beautiful day , but it was easy to find paid parking right next to the pier . The pier itself was lively , with rides and side shows but there was a great atmosphere. Lots of families having fun .

column2: Great place to spend the day!
column3: This pier and all of Santa Monica are beautiful. The beaches just go on forever and are amazing. We walked the pier, had lunch at Rusty's Surf Shack which had great Fish and Chips. We walked the beach all the way to Venice beach which was a lot further than we anticipated. Our waiter said it was about 1 1/2 miles. This might be driving, but walking, it was more like 3 miles each way. Awesome places!
Best beach for families. We were really satisfied with the beach, the activities, the weather and the place. Santa Monica is a really great holiday place to be.
Here you can have fun, swimming, riding bicycle and if you like photography its the right place to shoot sunset .. Enjoy your trip
We enjoyed the beach along with the pier and even went fishing for a couple hours. Kids found more entertainment with all the pokemon!
After a 14 hour Flight from Australia this was my first stop in my Hire car, took me a while to get in the right direction but when I got there it was ok but guess I was expecting more.
Nice day away from the heat of the city. Easy access lots of shops and restaurants and pretty clean . Lots of parks and walkways overlooking the ocean.

Visited the beach at the weekend on a cloudy day. It was almost empty, the view was great. There is a parking lot to leave your car by the beach, which wasn麓t expensive. There are also, free of charge bathrooms by the beach. I really enjoyed a walk, away from city rush.

A walk through the Palisades Park and the Promenade of Santa Monica is fabulous. Everything is so clean, well kept, beautiful landscaping and stunning ocean views. Many shopping and dining options to chose from, we chose some fabulous crepes.

We had brunch at Del Friscoes and it was delicious. Then we walked the Santa Monica Pier. It was scorching hot but extra windy too! Its a lovely place to go for a walk, have a look around and take in the sights and sounds. Its hugely popular for holiday makers with their families so be prepared to walk at a slow pace. The pier has lots of little performers and shops to visit as well as a theme park. Take your time to take loads of pictures!
Nice experience for all ages. Usually very crowded but a nice atmosphere. There were rides and games for all ages. Make sure you wear comfortable shoes and bring a swim suit.
Been here several times and never fail to have a good time. Enjoy the lovely stroll down the pier and people watching.

I love coming to this place at night, day or evening. During the summer, fall, winter or spring. During the summer months it can be overcrowded with a lot of families and people visiting. Yet, I live in California I am used to that. It is great for people watching. Parking is not too bad. Just get there early otherwise parking does fill up. Nice walk down the boardwalk and the pier.
We rented bikes and cycled from Santa Monica to Venice Beach. My wife thought this was the highlight of our trip!
The beach is is a real Baywatch beach with coast guards in their beach cabins. The pier looks like one big fair. It is fun to walk the the Santa Monica Boulevard. (Ask Cheryl Crowe)
Beautiful place close to LA. Fantastic vibe and lots of great shopping and restaurants within mins of the pier.

column2: Kinda overrated. The bike ride was great!
column3: Santa Monica Pier is not really my first choice attraction but the bike ride along the shore to was great.

column2: Crowds are part of the fun
column3: This bay has been featured in so many movies. It can get crowded, but I think that is part of the LA scene too. You can walk around the peer area too and there are plenty of food options. I would avoid it on very hot days because many people go and it will not be as fun.

Used the hop on-off bus to visit here throughout our LA stay.This was a nice distraction to busy parts of the city as it was cooler and more comforting being at the seaside. The pier is good, filled with restaurants and bars and good viewing platforms.Visiting here would be essential for anyone in LA.

column2: Busy bustling place but fun and relaxed
column3: We spent a week staying at Santa Monica and enjoyed leisurely strolls round the bay, time on the pier and cycling up and down the beach cycle routes. We will definitely return!

column2: In harmony with Nature in this strip of Santa Monica Beach
column3: On a sunny and breezy day, it was a good feeling just walking along the Santa Monica Beach. It's a wonderful feeling watching the world pass by, after shopping and having a quick bite.
Great place to enjoy the beach or just walk around.Lots of nice restaurants in that neighborhood.Plenty of public parking areas that are very reasonable.
Can visit if time permits. Good for a long walk. Nothing that cannot be missed so do it if you have enough time to spare. Lots of eating joints around.
Love the park , but not the birds they eat my ice cream!!!!Very touristicAvoid weekend....Love to eat at bubba gump.

column2: Great beach but can get crowded.
column3: Great beach but I do not know when is the best time to go as it can get crowded. The place offers fun and entertainment for everyone; with dining and shopping options by the beach and on the main strip as well.

An almost unending beach walk took us from Santa Monica all the way to Venice Beach and back. Quite a walk but on a lovely day you can not only take in the scenery but the people watching is great too. Well worth it albeit ultimately Venice Beach was rather seedy and down market compared to the bay around Santa Monica
Great beach to spend for a day. The pier has got a lot of lunch and dinner places. So everything is nearby.

column2: A great place to spend a birthday
column3: As part of our trip to LA we spent a day here.There was a great atmosphere.A wonderful bay,although somewhat crowded.A great history of it being used for films,not least Bay Watch.We went along the pier and went into the first restaurant,which happened to be via a lift.The food was great with enormous portions.A lovely view of the beach from the table.One should however plan when to leave as the traffic in LA is horrendous and consequently slow. I would certainly advise going early and returning early.All in all a great experience.
lively .. with variety of people you can enjoy the beach .. surf or just enjoy the sand.. very close to the metro subway

We had a chance to see this Bay from several different beach locales. While we were not able to go north to Malibu, we did find some incredible views from Rancho Palos Verde. The road around the mountain in the SW corner of the city does provide some incredible views from a great walking path. The bay lined with beaches and flanked by mountains is an incredible thing of beauty.
This was a lovely beach to spend a day at. There are also a good variety of eating places in the vicinity. Water currents are a bit strong so be careful if you visit.

We took our Family to Santa Monica Beach. It was so much fun, so much to do! Between the Beach itself, shopping and wonderful food, we didn't want to leave. Very safe place to go and spend time with Family and Friends!
I took my grandchildren not once, twice! Doesn't matter was foggy we like to put our feet in the water.Diner, walking and enjoying the time!

The bay is beautiful. It feels so good to just walk across the same. I went in Jun so the weather was a bit hot but there was a cool breeze. take your time and just relax on the beach. The pier is also great. I like the evenings there due to the scenic beauty.

I used to enjoy going to Sta. Monica Beach. While living in Hollywood, it only took a short bus ride to get there. For those who loved the two-legged sights, there were many beautiful ones there. I was, still am, an avid reader. There was always a book or two that went with me. The sun was kind and loving to me. One afternoon, I fell asleep on my stomach for about four hours. No sunburn, but a bit pink around the edges of my swimsuit, which faded within a couple of hours. Not everyone is that lucky. Remember to bring a lot of water with you though. The prices keep going up and up.
We really enjoyed walking there. A beautiful place to see the sunset and take some pictures. Very quiet
Wonderful beach with an extensive sand lane. Sunrises and Sunsets are beautiful as no other close. Do not miss Sta Monica Pier.
This is a very nice Beach, in wich you can be on. This has a very nice Nigth live and day live. Totally recommended, especially Santa Monica Pier.

column2: Take a stroll down the boardwalk and just take in the vibe
column3: Take your time, eat great food, some of the people you discover just make you smile. Extensive walk to Santa Monica Pier, then back through Venice beach, always stopping along the way to check out the many stores, great time had by all. If you can stop off at Shutters at No 1 Pico.
this bay is very beautiful, if you decide to walk to venice beach make sure you have on plenty sun screen and good walking shoes, its about 3 mile walk to and 3 mile from, lololol
Beautiful view from the pier, nice place to spend a day on the beach or walking around. Santa Monica has great places to eat. Joe's pizza is the best, just like New Jersey.

Me and friends and the kids came here recently. We sat on the beach for a few hours. This is right in the middle of everything. All the hotels and yummy restaurants are close by. Lots of family activities. Bike riding and the pier was fun! We got unlimited wristbands and rode the rides on the pier. Wonderful Day!
Really enjoyed our trip to Santa Monica on the hop on hop off bus, through Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Amazing beach and lovely old pier with gorgeous old roundabout! Beautiful beach.

column2: Los Angeles most famous beach...HUGE beach
column3: If you need to relax a little bit from the stress of LA, this is the right place. This is so huge, large, wide that even in a crowded day you won't have many people lying down close to you.

Great place to visit loved it, crowded beach but thats expected, typical tourist place, reminds me of when i was a kid and enjoyed the Jersey boardwalk and nice beach. Just to bad the rude inconsiderate people dont pick up their trash.
It was very crowded and hard to find parking. Beach was a bit dirty. It's good for younger population and families with teens. It is not a luxury place and it's noisy.

I hope that all traveler don't expect too much on this bay because there are nothing too special about this bay. I think many bay or pier out there is better than the one in Santa Monica. However, it is not a bad idea if you really want an ocean side visit when you don't have any where else to go.
Really enjoyed the shops and relaxed at,osphere on the pedestrian zone, the pier and beach were great too

column2: One Of The Coolest Places On Earth!!!!!
column3: Santa Monica Bay, and the pier and it's surrounding areas are not only must-do places to go, but arethe perfect examples of Southern California.There is ALWAYS something to do there, and the people are absolutely amazing.Santa Monica is honestly one of the friendliest places in California.

I loved walking and taking pictures on the Santa Monica Pier. I went their last year and the year before that. I love walking and seeing all of the families having a great time on the beach. I shopped at the stores and loved the breath taking view of the ocean.

Maybe because it was hot , maybe because it was crowded, maybe because it smelled like grease, I would not recommend this pier in the summer. Try it in the fall or winter. Only good part , the end of route 66 is on the pier.
A lovely place to visit. The view is beautiful and there are many things to see and do. We ate some Mexican food at a restaurant at the end of the pier. It was very nice.

Santa Monica is a must to any one who comes to LA. The beach, the pier, the restaurants, Promenade, Main St. Ride a bike from Sta Monica to Venice at the beach on the bike path is one of my favorite things to do.
the beach is beatifulwe're there early in the morning the sky was grey and no shops opencharge for parking take about 10/12 dollars

We stayed in Santa Monica on our final 2 days when we completed the Route 66.It is a beautiful way to end a long adventure.The town has many interesting shops and restaurants,but if you want cheap eats try the many diverse catering vans which line up along the street next to the beach.The pier is the highlight it is amazing and we spent a lot of time just strolling along people watching and the many fantastic performers who play there.Don't miss "Rock n Roll Jesus " one of the best buskers I have ever seen.We hired bikes and rode the 5 miles along Venice Beach to Marina del Ray.You can hardly believe that you are still in L.A.Well worth a visit if you are in L.A.
Wow, wow, wow.The bay and pier are a hive of activity. From street singers, to dancers, to fishermen.The beach is clean and the sea inviting.This is ourely a beautiful place

Nice area with a beautiful ocean side and a nice peaceful walk along Ocean Ave. It is quite crowded, especially on the pier. It is, however, also not too hard to avoid the large crowds. A lot of great shops and restaurants just a few blocks over from the ocean.

Of course, you don't go to the Santa Monica Bay for peace and quiet. It is crowded, noisy, commercial etc, but it is still a nice change from the streets downtown or in Hollywood. Dipping the toes in the Pacific is never a bad idea.

column2: WE LOVE SANTA MONICA PIER AND BEACH
column3: Hey guys my kids and I decided on a quick trip to L.A we were upset it was so short when we realized how beautiful it was. We went to Santa Monica pier there was so many things to do and the amusement park was fantastic it's a must if you go that way. My kids bought everything you can think of hats jewelry painting we even watched a street dance that was really interactive the beach is just packed I mean packed we found a spot rented an umbrella and enjoyed everything the only downfall to my trip there was everything I got was either on snap chat or video that didn't save I have only 1 pic of the kids while we were having our lunch on the beach but have I lead you wrong in my other reviews? This place is a must go and bring lots of money because if your anything like me you want to come back home with the entire santa Monica goods the amusement park was worth the price I believe I paid 30 something for both for all day play they also have free WiFi on the pier. OMG and you have to take a walk up to Bloomingdale mall oh boy I can go on we can't wait to go back! Enjoy:)
It's a must visit for tourists. It's tacky, bogan, a rip off, and just there to grab money. Many homeless are around but don't let that scare you. The beach itself is dirty but the views are amazing.
Loved being by the pier and beach and watching the sunset. Its a beautiful area and cant wait to come back.
sugest a walk from venus beach along the board walk to santa monica beautiful white sand beaches . lots of small boardwalk shops cafes and restaurants , and some very interesting characters .
Fun for the family on a sunny afternoon. Variety of activities/action, great for People-Watching. Souvenirs abound.
This beach was very busy lots of people showed up at about 9 am. traffic was brutal. try and park next to the pier.

column2: So much history... So much fun!
column3: Went with our kids to this check out the Santa Monica Bay. It is rare where we live in Boston to have this many beaches right where there are huge cities. This is an example of that. They have woven both together in a really fun way. Can't miss it. So fun to go even if you don't go in the water, the people watching is worth it. Loved it!
A great way to spend a day with the family. I love the sunset, beach , restaurant and the shops. Its a long walk from the parking lot but its worth it.
Not white sand as we were expected. Too many tourist. found garbage over the beach which needed to be cleaned in a timely manner.
Great area, views are gorgeous, buzz was awesome around area, the pier was good fun, big wheel recommended!

All is beautiful and quiet...even though there lots of people there...as you approach the ocean it becomes calm...you hear the ocean''s wave with its blue color...it's amazing...even the sand has a magnificent color...I love it!!!

column2: Great place to take the fam or ride a bike
column3: I was dreading going down to this famous beach, but we went midweek and were still able to find close parking and there were too many ppl. Went up on the pier and also got a bike rental. One my highlights of my trip to LA
over rated! expensive to park. heavy traffic . very crowded. rides and trinket shops. people begging for money.

We had a day here along the beach area and eventually onto the Santa Monica Pier.What a fantastic area. The place was spotless and we felt safe here even though there were several obvious homeless people sleeping o the grass verge as you approach the beach.The Pier is like Blackpool's piers with the shows and a mini rollercoaster.There did seem to be a lot of British style establishments which made us feel homely. I really liked the place
We have visited Santa Monica during the day, but the real treat is at sunset. Beautiful views and a brief walk on the beach. Walking distance to many restaurants and shopping.
You can eat, walk, have fun or sunbath, basically all the things you want to do by the beach! A bit short of parking spaces...

column2: Enjoyed the day at Santa Monica. Rented bikes and rode to Venice Beach. A very fun day.
column3: Would recommend this visit. The beach is beautiful and loved the pier and restaurants. It would be a good place to visit with children.

We escaped the horror of Venice Beach and walked up to Santa Monica. We crossed the invisible line and everything got nicer around Santa Monica. Its so touristy it hurts. But the pier was great to get the cool pacific sea breeze on a very hot June day. The weekend crowds are mental!
Living in the city, I'm always happy to visit Santa Monica. There's a fun loving, active, yet overall calming vibe. The air is fresh and the views are absolutely stunning.
Sand, beach, waves and mountains all make for a beautiful romantic view.The beach is huge and very windy.Did I mention it gets very crowded

We're were staying in Hollywood so we caught two local buses to Santa Monica went to the pier to see the end o route66, there were entertainers artists and various other amusements. For sun lovers you have excellent beach and the sea and i you want good shopping area and food for all tastes.
A nice day it would have been better it was a bit over cast and cool but the beach was nice. The sand is very corse and hard. easy to walk on.

Don't get me wrong, I love Santa Monica Bay - but it's the parking, the huge amount of people (on weekends and weekdays) that just make me so ... angry. I would rather go to the 3rd street promenade than go onto the beach - unless I want to worsen my day.There's a water shower place near the pier so if you want, you can rinse off after jumping in the ocean. However, a lot of people rinse other things off too - like soda spills, dirty feet from walking on sand, and other things. Bubba Gump here isn't as good as others in Anaheim, so - all in all, three stars. Max.

Renting bikes and riding the bike path along the Santa Monica Bay is really nice. Bike rentals are cheap and have kids seats for little ones. Also easy to find surf lessons and cafes down there. It's beautiful and classicly Los Angeles. And it's always cooler at the beach, so great place to beat the heat of summer.

The Santa Monica Bay is what you would expect from a world class beach. It has a pier with rides like when you were a child and there are food options and tons of sandy beach and beach volleyball. Lots of people and very active area. If you are looking for a more quiet beach location, just go north up PCH to Will Rogers beach and that is absolutely beautiful and much less crowded, but just beach and a snack shack, as opposed to Santa Monica Bay which is full of activity and people. No matter what, the beach is magnificent! Remember you will probably need to pay to park.
A very nice place to go to, but lots of people on that sunny day we were there. A place I can recommend, if you want to swim, or just walk around and enjoy the environment.

column2: Interesting for a quick trip in and out
column3: While in Los Angeles on business we had a few hours to make a few stops in the area. We've visited the pier, more or less to say that we've been there. A total of about an hour to 1 1/2 hours is all you really need to allot to this attraction. A pier, a bunch of vendors and eating places with a few rides here and there. On our particular visit, it was a hot day, so we were not interested in spending more time at this location. I personally liked Venice Beach much better if you want to get a real California vibe.

column2: Maybe ok for others, wasn't my thing
column3: The pier was kewl....decent restaurants, but what was an epic fail was the shopping.....I was hoping for little places where you could buy from local vendors selling things I couldn't get elsewhere, what I saw was the same ok shirts and sand with fake shells in a glass jar....a huge disappoint, that can be made amazing, but lacks follow through!
Nice place to relax and spend quality time with your family and take some amazing pictures! Parking can be a bit of a problem but taking the golden line metro train can solve that.

One of our newest traveling destinations and things to do it to visit the Santa Monica Beach Pier. We love this place. The people, the food, the beach, the entertainment, walking across the bridge, the promenade, it goes on and on!
great place to eat, have fun & watch the world go buy.bike rental is possible tooeasy parking available as well.
Very nice but look out for panhandlers. there are more of them than people,can't the city find a place for the homeless besides the beach?
Excellent beach, white sand.Good facility around, some nice dining option.Excellent view, there are also lot of other games and activity zone for the kids which is great.

We went to the pier in the evening. It was a lot of fun. The kids enjoyed the rides and games. They also went into the water even though it was dark out. The neighborhood seemed a little sketchy. We were nervous walking from the parking garage to the pier. However, we felt very safe once we reached the pier.
Spent sometime here as we stopped on our journey for a break. Very nice place and the wildlife is a bonus. Very clean and busy but no wonder as its a very nice bay area.

It is a wonderful experience! We ride the attractions and we walked. We really enjoyed our visit! If you are going to LA, you must stop at Santa Monica Bay, it is a great experience and it is gorgeous.

column2: On a good summerday this is a must
column3: We had lunch at the mexican restaurant at the end of the pier and took a walk along the beach... on a great summer day .... PEFECT day ....
Don't believe the hype. Parking is expensive, pier food is expensive - totally not worth it. Will definitely not visit again! I'd rather go to beaches near San Diego.

column2: Fun day riding down the coast.
column3: My boyfriend and I hired bikes and literally road down the coast to be in line with LAX. it was a beautiful and easy ride with plenty of fun stops along the way. We did de tour a little as well to get in a feed at In and Out.

nice beach.. if you are with your friends, no babies, no luggage, want to roam around empty handed, this is what you could do to save time and energy.. park your car in the parking lot opposite to beach.. rent a bike.. start pedaling it.. drive along the beach.. drive to venice , look around , take snaps.. come back to near parking lot.. leave the bike.. walk to beach.. sit relax enjoy the sunset with some hot snacks.. you ll love it..

Nice beach to hangout during the week. There aren't that many people here during the week and it is empty and relaxing. Bring an umbrella and chairs and blanket and sit down and watch the waves roll in.
I suppose I was expecting more. Beach was ok, but too many stores selling silly trinkets on the Pier took away the atmosphere and distracted you from the view.

Came from Pennsylvania and wanted to see the California coast - Santa Monica Pier was on our list - Went 7 oclock in the morning to see the morning sun and maybe surfers. I took a breakfast basket to eat on the pier to people watch with my daughter. Homeless people were all around us - One eating from a trash can that my 15 year old daughter couldn't believe. Another young homeless guy begging for money at the street light - 5 more sleeping in the park about one block from the pier. 10 morning waiting in line on the next street in front of the parking garage. We live only 10 miles from Philadelphia and see old elderly homeless people everyday but I guess with Hollywood entertainment - I never suspected this - so young - if anything to come away with was that my daughter got is a life lesson to see young people homeless and looking in the trash for food. No surfers, only people with their metal detectors and no sunrise during our whole stay in California with all the smog and haze in the morning.

Loved our visit to Santa monica beach. Rented bikes from just under the pier for the day and rode up past Venice beach and looked at all the stalls. Finished by sipping cocktails at one of the restaurants on the pier watching the sun set

I went on the Hop on Hop off bus tour that got me to Santa Monica. This beach is beautiful, the water was refreshing and not cold at all. I would go back there in a heart beat. The waves were super high so you couldnt swim out super far but the waves came up pretty high near the shore so it got you all wet anyways. Beautiful view. The life guards are always on watch and supervised everyone well. The pier was packed and full of people and the rides looked super fun. There is fun for everyone there. I would tell anyone to go to this beach.
We stopped here during a bus tour of Los Angeles. It's a big beach with plenty to do - restaurants, arcade games, shopping. We would have loved to spend longer and walk down it.

Although the traffic is an absolute nightmare getting to and from this beach, its so very worth it. It is well maintained and that is likely from the very vigilant life guards and security guards. We went on a Friday and they were actively monitoring the beaches very well. We didn't run across anyone too crazy (a few thong bikini's, but no panhandlers or side-show freaks) and felt safe the entire time. There's a great selection of places to eat on the pier, so you don't have to lug a giant cooler of stuff, just a few drinks.Also, there are guys that come around selling umbrellas for $30. They are work every penny. We gave ours to a couple when we left, but we were there for 9 hours and that umbrella held up to the wind the whole day.
Visited the beach while on a tour of LA. Beautiful area with breathtaking views of the Pacific ocean. Must see.

Drove down Hwy 1 from San Francisco, really looking forward to this area. Interesting to get out of the car, have a walk, have a swim if you're brave enough in July. Very disappointing - CROWDS of people, pushing, shouting, swearing, overpriced, over-rated, beach a mess with litter.

Every tourist visiting LA heads to Santa Monica Beach and Pier. The Expo train from downtown LA just started running and conveniently and cheaply brings you within a couple of blocks of the beach and pier. The bay is huge and you can see north to Malibu. However, compared to how it was when I was a teenager, I think what they have built is incredibly ugly and it's way too crowded for me (except in winter on cold foggy days when there is hardly anyone around, except for the multitudes of homeless and/or drug addicts). It is less crowded if you walk to the north (most people head south towards Venice Beach). It is not disabled or elderly friendly. I think there should be more benches for people to sit on as well as grass and shade trees planted down by the beach (yes, I know there is a drought).
The beach is huge with playground, lots of sand and excitement, and the pier that seems a city in itself with a great food, souvenirs, and amusement park. Great for all day family fun!

column2: We love to ride bikes on the path.
column3: It is so beautiful to walk or ride bikes on the beach path. It is fun to people watch. We like to sit and watch the ocean.

column2: Catch the bus! It's so easy and well worth the visit. Santa Monica Beach is gorgeous.
column3: We were a family of 3'generations, 3'adults and 3'kids under 12.We caught the bus from Beverley and Fairfax and the ride took about 45 min all for $1.75 ad and $1 child, with a great free tour on the way. We had a wander around Santa Monica looking for somewhere with a view for lunch and we're lucky enough to get a window from table at The Lobster looking down at the pier.After a wonderful and surprisingly affordable lunch for such a lovely place we walked it off by strolling around the pier and watching the kids enjoy a couple of rides. We then walked (well the eldest and youngest only made it half way and then flagged down a pedicab) along the beach front walkway to Venice Beach where some had E-NORMOUS icecream sandwiches, and others had a beer before catching another bus back to our hotel. Cost again $1.75/$1 .... A great and very affordable day.
Many great places to get your gifts to bring home. Beach is great. Was a little cool when we were there.

column2: Great place to visit good times
column3: Always a good place with great ambiance, the weather was great and lots of activities when traveling to Santa Monica you must check this out..

column2: A Must See - Santa Monica Pier
column3: A beautiful, clean beach with a fun pier of amusement rides, restaurants and souvenir shops. At night with all the lights on it is magical. You can go to the beach or just hang out on the pier and eat and sit and watch the ocean and the seagulls.
If you go to LA definitely most go there to spend a day so you can walk around or go biking through the bay. It麓s really pretty to visit.
This is beautiful. Visit it. The beach is stunning, the pier is outstanding. We loved it & wished we had more time to explore it.
lots of nice shops and eateries, beach is very clean wonderful place to take the family, rides on the pier for everyone

Stunning beach for the everyman. Lots of room to lay out and relax. Only one word of caution. When entering and leaving the beach, watch your steps for dog "plops". Some owners aren't as diligent with clean up as they should be.

I was there with my boyfriend pretty much most of the week. It was summer and hot, so we would catch the bus for an hr just to escape the heat at home. Had so much fun meeting new people playing in the ocean, walking along the pier. Going for a walk down the promenade was fun.

column2: This is the reason I live here!
column3: I love the Santa Monica Bay and it is the main reason that I put up with everything else, the politics, the traffic, the high taxes.The Bay is worth it-to play in the waves and get my exercise there makes it all worthwhile. There are good showers that are free too. Learn how to dive into the waves before you go out past your knees though and I recommend a boogie board or shortie wetsuit and body surfing flippers if you want to go in the water for the whole week or summer.
You see Santa Monica area on TV, but it's not that great. Kind of cheesy pier and somewhat dirty and crowded. I doubt I would go back.
Great place to park up, explore the shops then walk the sea front to Venice beach, gets very busy over weekends
Nice to say I've been there. Walked along the pier...watch the 'muscle' men workout on the beach..ate an icecream and wandered around...

column2: very crowded and alot of homeless
column3: We went there with a tour. We walked down the pier. There were a lot of homeless asking for money. The tour guide warned us about "Medical Pot" being legal. The odor was very present and people were asking for "munchies for their Weed".
A family friendly beach with lots of food options from fast food to restaurants. Santa Monica beach is very beautiful, it's where bay watch was filmed.
If you like beach and you like surf, then you need to go here. No need to go as far as Malibu but a lot of space to get entertained here

Nice Beach, has a board walk to walk from Santa Monica Pier right down to Venus Beach, sand is swept every morning all is kept ready tidy, has lots of public toilet blocks and lifeguard lookouts. . Really nice to walk along in the surf too, so you can safely get your toes wet walking barefoot on the wet sand.!

Another great place to see, however DO NOT GO ON THE WEEK-ENDS. So crowded, the younger generation might be able to put up with the crowds. Being of the older type we should have done this during the week. Lots of coffee shops, restaurants, but week ends hard to get a seat at these places. We went on a Sunday and we didn't even get down to the pier due to the crowds, but having said that it was a public holiday on the Monday, so may have been wrong time. But worth the visit. Again we took the train and so easy.Kristine de la Hunty
Beautiful beach nice for biking, roller skating and just enjoying the beautiful evening. There are many restaurants on the pier with many street performers.

column2: Lot's of People but a Must when Visiting LA
column3: The pier is very crowded but it was a great to walk and play in the sand for a bit. If you are going to eat in the restaurants call ahead because the wait could be long.

column2: Great place to catch some sun
column3: One of the cleanest beaches in LA, great people watching, water is clean for LA standards, great food and drinks nearby, 3rd st promenade is close as well

Not much to say apart from: just go there, enjoy and feel like you are part of an american movie! Walk around third street for shopping and snacks and drive to Adelaide Drive for an amazing view on the ocean at sunset.

column2: Nice stroll on a beautiful beach
column3: We enjoyed seeing and strolling along Santa Monica Bay boardwalk. There seems to be endless sand and some neat shops to browse around in.

column2: Very crowded and no public toilet found
column3: A lot of people on the beach, beach was dirty, not so many public facilitates. Not so nice if you want some quiet fun time near the sea.
We had booked a private tour of LA and the Pier was included. Great and beautiful place. It was a hot day but not too crowded.
Well worth the stroll out onto the pier. Usual mixture of strange street theatre. Small fairground at the end.Great beach views.
Lots of shopping. Lots of good eating. Lots of fun. Go here. Of course it's a must do in LA - why would you visit here without seeing Santa Monica Pier. Great for the entire family.

My children and I first time visiting the ocean ever and it was amazing and more then I expected. There are rides, games, food, and drinks for sale. It was windy and we couldn't find a parking spot the one we found was 25 and it was across the street. Other then that it was perfect. Walking through the pier and just enjoying each other's company and the water was stunning. There were a couple of rowdy people in the night we weren't used to that so we left. This is a perfect day trip.
The views in this bay stretch all the way from venice beach to malibu. Its a very wide beach with lots of room and a softer surf than some other beaches in the LA area.

If you like oceans, beaches, food and carnivals, this is the place for you. It's also the end of the famous Route 66 road, which I actually traveled a few years ago. The Ferris wheel is very nice to ride. It's on the edge of the pier and it feels like you are right over the ocean.
Arriving one hour before sunset is highly recommendable. Plenty of space and easy parking. Can be very crowded.
There is something about the Santa Monica bay which will attract everyone with a young heart. Good place to surf, or just spend an evening with your loved ones.

column2: A great side trip on any visit to LA
column3: There is something for everyone in the Santa Monica area, from a variety of great dining, shopping, and outdoor plazas, to the beach, which has great views of mountains and some cute harbor seals, to the Pier where route 66 ends, and you can do a variety of rides, get a "sharknado" picture on the ferris wheel. Plenty to see and do here.

As an Angeleno who grew up in Santa Monica, then ended up working in Santa Monica for 20 years after college, I can fairly say that Santa Monica Bay/the Pier and the Promenade are not what they used to be. Far too touristy, the big box shops have edged all the charming mom & pop shops and restaurants out of the way, and service in the restaurants is (for the most part) absolutely terrible - when they know you're here on vacation and probably not coming back anytime soon you're in for inattentive, unfriendly, non committal service and complete lack of attention. The exception to the rule - Ye Olde King's Head pub on 2nd and Santa Monica Blvd. that maintains a loyal ex-pat clientele and is attentive and friendly to all that pass through their doors. I used to play video games in the arcade on the pier as a kid, and have countless photos of me on the carousel. Santa Monica Place (the mall) seems to be built with only asian tourists in mind - all luxury brands, and mediocre restaurants. Better bet is to take a drive up into Malibu to enjoy everything that Santa Monica used to be, and is no more.

I chose to visit on a Saturday and it was very busy down there. I'm not a lover of crowds so perhaps my score of 4 is unfair. Overall it was a very nice resort with good restaurants along the coast road and a well stocked shopping center behind. A few street performers as you would expect and well worth the walk over the wooded planks of the pier.I would visit again but on a less busy day

If you have a chance visiting L.A., do not miss Santa Monica beach. This beach is very big and long. And you can see tourists here to enjoy the sea and sun-bath. There is also a Pacific Park here, and I think both children and adults can have fun here. And just a few blocks nearby, there is a street foll of stores and you can just enjoy shopping or wandering here. The atmosphere here in Santa Monica is leisure and ease. Just get rid of your annoying stuff and enjoy the sun and sea here in L.A.

It was overcast and kinda cold when we were here- I guess that is normal for June? The water was too cold to really get in too far. But there were still a fair few people there still. They were having some sort of a festival so there were a lot of booths and what-not. But they had entire blocks closed off in preparation. We didn't stay long enough to really see what it was about- due to time constraints. But even though we had to park a ways away it was okay- pretty easy to get back and forth.

column2: Worth the Trip if you are in LA
column3: Spent about 4 hours here, lots to see and do. Pier walk was nice, some entertainment and a few spots to eat as well as amazing water views. Ate at The Lobster, great service and food...would definitely go again....great view of the water while you eat. Shopping about a block back from the Pier was also fun and there were some interesting shops to view....no traffic in this area. Tesla Showroom was a treat for the fellows. The taxi ride was pricey from our Hotel but this was definitely something we didn't want to miss.

Santa Monica Bay/Beach is a great time. It is relatively clean and swimming is safe and there are life guards most of the year. The Pier is near--right next to the beach if you park at the Pier parking area, which I suggest.You will walk from the parking and in about 1 minute be on the sand and in three minutes be in the water. You can just lay on the beach, swim, or rent a bike and ride the very safe bike path. You can walk up to the Pier, which is so much fun or have a great meal or a snack.There is a lot to do. Tourists are welcome and it is a local hangout during the summer.Put all your valuables in the trunk of your car. Your wallet in your front pocket. The area is patrolled and safe, but let's be smart.Have the best time in Santa Monica.

This is one of the most beautiful beaches I have every had the pleasure to swim at. The water temperature was fantastic and we really enjoyed ourselves. After spending some time in teh water we decided to take a walk ont he pier nearby and it was a great carnival atmosphere on a Friday afternoon. The were lots of musicians on the pier, comedians and people selling interesting wares. While all the prices are touristy they were some intersting stuff available for purchase. While there are a number of rides on the pier we were not really in a mood to try any of them and we walked along the beach to end a perfect a day.

The Santa Monica Pier is a fast moving, exciting entertaining environment. Be sure to also take a walk along the boardwalk and to also walk on the beach. There is a lot to take in, but sometimes the business and excitement is just what one could use.

column2: My favorite place in the whole country!
column3: I love this place. I would live here if I could. Best time ever, from the food to the entertainment. You never know what celebs you may encounter here either!
Fun and touristy place to people watch, grab something to eat, rent a bike or paddle board, with the sun set, take a stroll.

Think Baywatch and you're thinking of Santa Monica bay, the home location of the show. While it is free to walk along the sandy beaches, parking (when you can find it) will set you back about $20. While it seems steep, there are many things/people to see/do here beyond the sun and the surf.The water is very cold in the winter, but is a lovely 70-80 degrees in the summer months. People are generally very nice without an abundance of creepy voyeurs checking out the young ladies/laddies in their swimwear. The beaches are fairly well maintained and lifeguard stations are present, but not always staffed. BTW, if you're looking for Ericka Eleniak or Pam Anderson at the lifeguard stations, forget it. These are professional paramedical, certified/licensed lifeguards who take their responsibility to safeguard the swimming public seriously. With the occasional riptide and undertows, we are lucky to have them on station.The Santa Monica Pier is a world famous attraction with carnival games, rides and shopping. If you want to eat something more than the usual hamburger/hot dog, there are plenty of trendy restaurants and additional shopping on the Third Street Promenade, a short walk east of the beach. Santa Monica beach and the Pacific Ocean is where the I-10 highway begins/ends. The opposite terminus is at the Atlantic Ocean in Florida.

We went in the morning and it was not as crowded. The views and beach are nice. There are restrooms and food trucks were parked close by. You can see where Route 66 ends. Later on in the day the area does become busier.

If you're in Santa Monica bay then you have the pier too, where there's Pacific amusement Park, Ferris wheel, aquarium, video arcade, trapeze school, restaurants, entertainers, artists. Of course, there's the beach that's frequented by countless locals and tourists. Great ocean view and fantastic sunset. We had churros and funnel cakes for the kids and adults during our late afternoon stroll. Fun filled and enjoyable family outing with our house guests.

Definitely a must see if you love the beach and having fun. The pier has a lot to offer as far as beachy restaurants, rides, and games. I visited with a friend and we went on the Ferris wheel, which was fun and served as an awesome photo op!
The Pier is very touristy and busy. We went on a weekend on a nice sunny day but still it was windy and little cold.

column2: Sitting on the dock of the bay
column3: Nice Beach, really could not experience it fully due to the weather or water. Very cool. Lots of people.
Its the end of the line for route 66 with all its attractions and food outlets, wide beach and interesting people watching location.
So beautiful, fun shops and ice cream place called Soda Jerks. Get there early to get parking. Wear plenty of sunscreen :)

Went down to Santa Monica beach area for the day. Amazed by the surroundings and beach. The coastline looking back from the end of the pier was stunning. Great place to visit and mingle with locals on a weekend.

Me and my Fiance visited this beach for a nice day in the sun with a lunch packed in our bag. The views offered at this beach cannot be compared to any other beach I have seen in California so far. The water is a beautiful blue and the famous Santa Monica Pier makes it look even better.

column2: Rent bicycles for the best view of the whole beach and to people watch!
column3: A fun spot, a must see in California. Go on the ferris wheel...get lunch on the pier. The pizza is great. Way too many sights to name here. Lots of fun.
I loved my visit to Santa Monica. Really peaceful and relaxing day. We went lying on the sand glazing up at the clouds. Great way to spend the afternoon.

If you are coming to LA you must visit Santa Monica. The Pier is very touristy with shops and amusement rides for the family and a few restaurants. Right across the street is the Promenade with great shops and more restaurants to enjoy. It has a more laid back environment there and makes it a more enjoyable experience. We come here during the summer and year round as the weather permits. My favorite thing to do is just enjoy the beautiful views from the Pier. If you go, go to enjoy the views and people watch, its fun!

We had the windiest day ever, it was literally freezing. I had 3 layers on me and still cold, the birds cannot fly up... imagine. However, on a sunny day, I can only imagine how great and fun this place can be. Will definitely return

Santa Monica is a delight, the town, the beach and the wonderful Santa Monica Pier. The Pier has something for everyone from 6 to 60 and is easily reached from several areas on the Santa Monica broad walk.
Really enjoyed walking around Santa Monica Bay & the town. The place was really buzzing with tourists, bars, restaurants & of course, the beautiful beach. Great spot for people watching too.
The parking is very expensive - 12$ for nothing, the pier itself wasn't thrilling as I thought. it's a tourist trap and noothing more and I reccomend to avoid this attraction

The bay and pier is a great way to spend the day both with the beachside and also going on the rides on the pier and enjoying something to eat and drink. I loved the ferris wheel that went out over the water and spectacular views.

column2: Sorry, Angelinos, but it really isn't all that great!
column3: Blame it on parochialism or arrogance if you like, but we spent some time there on a grey day when the Route 66 tour we were on ended right at the plaque dedicated to the iconic and much-loved Will Rogers. We then walked along the beach to the Pier and searched for a half-decent wave. We looked in vain. It must have been REALLY cold in the water because, although there were many people "sunbathing" (where was the sun hiding all the time we were there in 70F temperatures?) very few ventured in to the water. The sand reflected the clouds, grey and uninviting. When I think of our generally sun-drenched Australian beaches - now THEY are golden-soft and the waves are substantial to challenge most board riders- what we experienced on that one day was, frankly, dispiriting. We had previously stayed at the far more interesting Huntington Beach, oil rigs'n'all, and the contrasts were quite marked. And my parents lived in Santa Monica before World War II, so my predisposition was skewed entirely in favor of the suburb and its amenities, hence my overwhelming sense of disappointment that day. On the plus side, there was a very good range of well-priced restaurants, the Pier was interesting and the ambience was upbeat. Pity about the sun and surf, though...

I enjoyed the Santa Monica Bay. There is plenty to do in Santa Monica and the Ocean is Beautiful. There is also a nice bike path that connects all the beaches near by which is a lovely bike adventure.

column2: good place where you can spend half a day
column3: This is a classic location where you can spend sometime with kids and friends at the beach. Australian, dont expect this to be better than Bondi. It's different style. Aussie beaches looks way better, but the the atmosphere here beats it.

Head out here from LA and let the sea breezes blow away the town's smog. It's a beautiful place to visit and has a lovely atmosphere to soak up. The pier has often been used in films and feels very familiar to walk along and you can listen to musicians playing, hoping to get their big break by being discovered here.

Spend time on the pier soaking up the sun and atmosphere, ride the solar powered Ferris wheel ($8) then stroll along the beach towards Venice Beach, an easy Mike I r so. I we sunned ourselves for an hour or so - water was too cold on the last day of May.

During a driving holiday around California we stopped at Santa Monica and I would recommend the same to anyone who is going to be close by. The beach was clean, there was a lot going on and there was friendly atmosphere.

column2: One of the famous place _ Santa Monica Bay, CA
column3: One of the famous place in the world - Santa Monica Bar, California, beautiful beach, nice pier with a lot of activity, a lot of fun, Listening to the beautiful sound of the violin, and watching the dolphin jump out the water, what a romantic place.
There is no way to go to California and don't stop at Santa Monica Bay! It is a very nice place, specially if you are in love with the USA!

column2: A fun visit to the beach
column3: Before leaving LA, the wife and I decided to see the beach since we'd never actually done that in LA itself. I decided to come here because after living in Santa Cruz for several years I'd heard Venice Beach was pretty similar in weirdness, and wasn't interested in that type of crowd just to see a beach. Santa Monica was great, nice looking buildings, beach and restaurants. The pier itself was fun too, just wish we'd had more time for rides.The weirdest thing we saw that day was a guy holding a sign saying he liked rough sex, no joke. Otherwise a good place to visit.

column2: Grew to really like Santa Monica
column3: Lovely beach, good 'touristy' vibe around the pier, good restaurants, bars and shopping area.Good to see the original Muscle Beach area.
I am from the East Coast so reminded me of what Coney Island used to be. Beach was clean. Loved the boardwalk, rides, game and food stands.
Its such a huge beach, its never felt crowded to me. And there are so many wonderful options to do if you get bored: the pier, downtown SM, and the boardwalk! Always a fun visit.

column2: Beautiful beach and very busy pier
column3: A pleasant stroll from Venice beach and a glorious stretch of beach. However the pier and the town were teeming with tourists and quite unpleasant. Why oh why do they allow cars on the pier? The carousel is rather lovely, though.
You can't say you've gone to LA without a visit to this famous beach. It attracts all sorts but its a fun place.

Pretty cheap parking, nice to walk along the side walk next to the beach. The homes along the sidewalk were very nice to see and once you get to the strip they had a great selection of food snacks, souvenirs and different activities such as volleyball and basketball. The mountains and the sunset were really nice to see and experience. Everything closed once it got dark.
It is a nice place to go and they have activities to do. A bit crowded though. It is cleaner and nicer than Venice beach.

column2: nice day for a walk along the pier
column3: great views. sidewalk entertainment was REALLY good!!! Long wait at marasol restaurant. boooo!!! Rustys has GREAT service and beautiful waitresses!!! :)

Santa Monica Pier was a combination of great sights. The ocean, the mountains, the palm trees, the pier activity (music, restaurants, artists), the seagulls, and the carnival section. We even saw a seal!

column2: Nice place to visit if you like the crowd
column3: The bay / pier area are interesting to visit and see. It's an ongoing carnival with many savory characters walking around. Plenty of security even though it feels like the locals are strange at times. But, worthwhile seeing

A great spot to see the ocean, get a bite to eat, people watch. Parking and crowds can be a challenge but not too annoying.Didn't see shorebirds and dolphins - water there was not that inviting for a swim. But the views were quite nice.

Located 15 minutes from downtown Los Angeles (if no traffic) this is a must for every visitor. The fabulous Pacific is even more enticing at night when the Santa Monica pier is lit, making it a memorable adventure

column2: Peer Out Across The Ocean From The Pier
column3: A trip to LA is not complete unless you peer out across the ocean from the Santa Monica Pier - at Santa Monica Bay. By far, a wonderful leisure activity to do with family or friends - or solo just to ponder life.Be sure to plan a visit at sundown.Walk all the way to the end of the pier and sit in the bleacher seats - get your camera ready and take lots of photos at just the right time within a 2 or 3 minute time frame to really see the sun disappear below the horizon. It's wonderful.Be sure to take the nice walk from the pier south about a mile on the walkway that connects to Venice Beach (or you can rent bikes - that's really nice).

column2: A busy beach area with boardwalk and lots of carnival type things to do
column3: If you are in the area, this is a good spot for eating carnival type food and people watching. I think you'll find a couple of really good restaurants nearby, a few blocks in from the beach.

column2: nice beach, nice pier - when the weather's nice
column3: It's a pretty cool place to chill if you want to relax. You can also ride along the beach, which can be nice as well. There are pretty good restaurants near the beach.

column2: It was last minute decision to stop there
column3: We spent few hours walking the boardwalk, eating at the restaurant, watching the waves and wildlife. So many things were going on on the pier, very busy and colorful place ! Definitely worth the visit.

Santa Monica Bay is a nice little touristy spot with a few restaurants, lots of independent merchants, musicians and few mini rollercoasters. Lots of Beach goers Abit expensive though. Crowed when we went but surrounded by excited, unique and interesting people to watch.

column2: Beautiful place to visit for a day - very expensive off the beach though!
column3: The beach was just beautiful... and up the road you'll find very high end shopping and delicious food. A great (and very clean) area to visit for a day if you are in the LA area and want to get away from the dirty parts of the city.
Strolled the pier and had lunch at Bubba Gumps restaurant. Beautiful location with lovely beach and ferris wheel and other entertainment on the the Pier.

This was the end of Route 66 for us, what a fantastic trip. I want to do it again. The people and places we visited, made this trip very special, I want to do it all over again. If you are reading this thinking should it...... The answer should be YES. It is the most amazing trip you will ver do. My advice is, get the book, read them, talk to everyone on the road. Trust your instincts. Go for it

I have now taken visitors to the pier a number of times. I think it is great for a once or twice thing but I am over it. Very touristy. Great views and nice to sit at the end, have a drink at Marisol, and watch the sites.

Santa Monica Bay is one of my favorite places to come and hang out at the beach, people watch, check out the rides and food on the pier and watch the seals do tricks for food. It can get a bit crowded on weekends and holidays, but there is room for everyone.
Lots of walking, but such a beautiful area to walk around, enjoy lunch and the location. We visited in May and needed a jacket.

Nice beach and lot of activities for kids around the pier like the Pacific Parks. Best place to hangout on weekends with kids. Parking near beach may not be available during weekends and traffic congested . I used to park at parking lot at Civic center dr.

Stretching as far as the eye can see with lovely clean, wide sandy shores. Unfortunately there was quite a cold wind blowing so didn't fancy swimming but it certainly looked safe enough. I walked down to Venice Beach - no muscle pumping happening, but the beach walk was lined with cafes, shops, entertainment of all sorts and lots of interesting people. The pier also had lots of shops & entertainment but being shoulder season it wasn't in full swing.Well worth a visit & don't miss the lovely Venice canals.
This beach was impressive. No where as good as Australia but for a Beach overseas, this one was magnificent... Massive amount of sand and the ocean looked very inviting. Pity it was winter.....

column2: Santa Monica Pier - A Must Experience
column3: It is always fun to walk out onto the Santa Monica Pier and enjoy the scenery, the Pacific Ocean, and everyone having fun on the rides. Parking is easy to find on the lots near the Pier. The boardwalk has many places to rent bikes or roller blades. A great and scenic ride down past Venice Beach almost to Marina Del Ray and back to the pier. Rentals are reasonable, $7.00 per hour.

We went in April when we had some downtime while in California for a family wedding. $12.00 to park which being from Dallas I thought was reasonable. We walked the pier and the kids dipped their toes in the ocean. It was quite windy the day we went so it was a bit chilly but the boardwalk reminded me of the old Atlantic City I used to go to as a kid( I know it's changed tremendously). We ate at Bubba Gumps and while it is a chain the food was delish and our server was awesome. We didn't get to go on any of the rides but the carrousel made an awesome backdrop for pics.
One of the best beach I have visited. The water was crystal clear and the day was beautiful. Had fun with the family.
I suggest , rent a bicycle from here and ride to the Venice beach. When you get back have a lunch at Bubba Gump Shrimp. What a nice way to spend a day ;)

-----The beach WAS BEAUTIFUL. It's a Californian beach, what did you expect? I was so happy to be there and the waves were very calming. (I didn't want to leave) The sand is not "pure white" but they do a good job on keeping the shoreline clean. I was able to do a little bit of yoga (I don't even know if I was doing it right LOL) and walk along the shoreline with my cousin; it was breathtaking indeed.Overall, if you are around LA, you must see this pier and beach.You will fall inlove when you see it, and will regret if you don't :)
A gorgeous, clean beach with amazing views. The pier is good fun with rides and souvenirs, In addition, you never know what famous faces you'll see!

We visited this area and were so impressed by the atmosphere, beaches and shops/cafes that we did it again.The 3rd street precinct was lovely with a lovely mix of shops cafes and restaurants. Buskers played as we ate our lunch. It was fab.On our 2nd trip we hired bikes and cycled from Santa monica to Venice beach. An easy cycle- even in the heat. I had a big grin on my face the whole way there and back. It is so beautiful. The beaches are vast and extremely clean.I would have loved to have stayed longer.
between the pier, the beach, the rides, the restaurants and the shops, there's plenty of things to do in santa monica!
I loved walking in the Pier and watching everyone's activities, going into the games and eating there. It's a good place to just walk and think or hangout with friends.

A must do when in LA. Quintessential bayside pier, lots of kiosks, restaurants, rides, souvenirs. It's very touristy, but also very LA. Beautiful scenery, and lovely to be by the water in this large, buzzing city. A relaxed, casual place to visit with something for everyone.
It was surreal send so enjoyable! Love it for kids family and couples. Highly encourage visitors to go. Great location with great shopping and food right near as well

column2: a beautiful place to just relax
column3: A must visit every time I go to LA. Beautiful beaches with beautiful people hanging out. Volleyball and surfing, people fishing off the pier. a good overall ambience. I recommend the original Hot Dog on a stick. It is right below the carrousel.
The pier at Santa Monica is a place you must go! A lot of attractions and beautiful view at sunset!!

column2: Great For Adults And Kids Alike
column3: This is a well known attraction in Santa Monica, which we have visited twice before so obviously we like it.It can get very crowded but was not too bad the day we visited.We parked at a meter on the street.($3.75 for three hours, which is cheaper than lot parking) Nice beach and restaurants plus rides and games for kids and adults.

it is a very good beach nice and clean lots of ammenities the only problem was the beggers that are around the area some can be right in your face if you are quiet and can be intimidating also there is a lot of hippys hanging around and again ask you for money

column2: Must see when you are in LA!
column3: Beautiful beaches, nice restaurants and ocean view! Also good place for shopping at 3rd street promenade. Definitely must see!

Such a great distraction of the busy life in LA. Just walk down the beach with your feet in the water or enjoy the sunlight when you sit there. If you are tired of walking, just rent a bike or skates and enjoy!

We arrived on a cool, foggy morning in April, but still enjoyed walking out on the pier. There were many people sun(?) bathing on the beach, but it was a bit too cool for us. (We're from Florida.) Although the pier is a bit touristy, it was fun to witness the hype. Gorgeous views north to Malibu and south to Venice.Later in the day, after having lunch in town, we emerged onto Palisades Park to find the sun shining brightly. Sunshine significantly changes the feel of the place. The ocean absolutely sparkled, and the air was quite festive with street performers and happy tourists in the park. Santa Monica Bay was one of our favorite places to visit while spending a week in LA.
We arrived and headed straight down the pier, good views of the beach in either direction. We wandered around but we weren't really interested in the fair attractions. So just walked back!

Santa Monica is great. The beach is huge and wide, although the surf was pretty flat. There was plenty of parking and as well as the beach there is the pier with all its rides and eateries. We enjoyed the promenade along the top of the cliffs and down to the beach and the pier. A few homeless people were spotted but were not overwhelming.The main shopping centre was a short walk.

Just standing at the end of the pier on the Santa Monica Bay, (which according to the sign is the end of the original Route 66), is so relaxing and peaceful. I could just stand there all day and listen to the ocean singing its relaxing song.

Now let me just say Santa Monica Beach is awesome but don't waste your time with Venice Beach even for a look.We were happy walking from Santa Monica Pier all the way to Venice Beach but as soon as we got their Boom!!! Tourist trap homeless people, people selling stuff on the street and those damn cd pushers. It took away the relaxing time we were having.Just stay at Santa Monica Beach it's awesome. White sandy wide beaches plenty of room for everyone.

Great family beach with lots of thing's to do.. It's a very busy beach with lot's of parking but be prepared to walk to the prom and eateries in the main area. Shopping center only a 5 minute walk from the prom with lot's of designer shop's and eateries as well as on the prom it's self. Defiantly worth a visit. Make a day out of it.

column2: One of the best parts of LA
column3: Loved Santa Monica, if only its dirty neighbour Venice Beach could take note. Lovely pier, nice beaches but difficult to park, plan ahead rather than just turn up.
A beautiful beach in a great location. The beach is vast and gorgeous and great for swimming. The shops and pier are also great places for exploring.

Travelling from Australia we headed one morning to Santa Monica to experience the beauty of this famous area. The walk to the pier was steep and not easy for my arthritic knees but it was worth it ,beautiful. Unfortunately we had only a limited time and had wanted to breakfast on the pier but nothing opened until 11am. A definite bummer.I wish there was a sign telling you there was access to the beach to the right.I had again a bad walk up to the road (my knees) and then down again to the beach. Could have done with more visitor info signs about other areas in Santa Monica.We travelled to our next location hungry and spent.
Loved the area, beach was perfect. We walked around the streets, took pics on the beach and enjoyed the beautiful scenery
A fun place to visit, offers a variety a restaurants and has rides and games for everyone , vendors and very talented street performers
The burgers on the pier are great. The beach is a long walk from the road but is worth it. Very windy in April, but the walk from Santa Monica to Venice is so beautiful.
Nice Pier, a down memory lane trip. A wooden Pier full of attractions, Candy shops, a carussel, a roller coaster, gift shops and the end of Route 66
It was a beautiful view at night and loved the atmosphere. The restaurants should stay open a little later.

Just like in the movies, it is indeed a nice place to visit in LA. If you don't plan to spend so much time, park right at the entrance of the pier, which is cheapear than the big parking on the other side. It is also within walkable distance to 3rd. Street Promenade.

We drove to Santa Monica from LA yesterday, the traffic was very busy on the way. It was a beautiful sunny day, but there was a hazy fog over the ocean. We enjoyed viewing the high class hotels and shops as we continued our drive down Highway 1 thru Venice. The gardens along the Ocean were very pretty and green and colourful. Santa Monica was busy with tourists but there still appeared to be car parking spaces along the front.
Great family place and nice boardwalk. Has food, games, and really great food carts! Houses on the shore are beautiful as well.

The beach and pathways in front of the water are very nice. Go here instead of Venice, which was a dump. Grab something to eat, walk on the beach. Parking is decent, pay for a couple of hours or all day in designated areas. Nice beach. Nice area.
Great view of the beach and lots of sand. Water is a good walk from the road so on a hot day, plan for some hot feet.

column2: soso beach.. put headphones on so you can ignore the beach bums!
column3: be sure to ride a bike or rent one in this area. Its a lot to see and one of the best bike rides in socal!

The beach is really nice and there is a wide pavement so you can walk along next to it without getting sand in your shoes, if you don't want to actually go on it. Walk far enough and you get to Venice Beach.

The shore is large and clean. I also liked the pier. Riding the old carousel was fun and reminded me of the movie "The Sting", in which it appeared. The pier is a lovely tourist place with eateries and rides, which I enjoyed.
What a nice place to go and chill out. Good restaurant's and shops. I ended up in an English pub and restaurant with the car park opposite excellent beer, good food and nice people.

column2: Great place for a stroll & hanging out
column3: Grew up in this area. Never get tired of the landscape & beauty of the Santa Monica Bay or area. You can stroll or bike ride to Malibu beach or all the way to Huntington Beach. Love this area!!!

We went to LA for Universal Studios but spent one day at the beach. Parking is right there at the beach and the pier for a fee of course, but nothing outrageous. Other beaches in LA I had been to can be very rocky and not fun if you want to boogy board. It was windy that day and surf was high. Made for a fun day. It was overcast too which was nice. There were a couple guys selling umbrellas, sand toys, etc that you could purchase and negotiate on price. There was also a guy selling fresh fruit, which I thought was nice but didn't feel I could trust it. Shopping was close by. Really like the location. It was a far walk on the sand though to get to the water. We were out of breath, ha ha. Had an enjoyable time.

column2: Enjoying a stroll and the pier!
column3: We walked along the beach and ended up on the pier. We did not ride rides but enjoyed listening to local music and spending time together. We thoroughly enjoyed our time. The Marriott-Marigot was a very friendly and accommodating hotel!

We made the mistake of visiting on a Sunday when it seemed that everyone in the whole area was also visiting.We found a really cheap car park across the road which had a shopping centre in so got good vegan food too.The beach is very populated with people swimming and playing and is next to the Pier which is full of rides and new musicians of every style.

column2: Should be a check in your LA itinerary
column3: I visited here at night. This beach is a celebration ! Although reaching here could be time taking if one is staying near Hollywood and hasn't rented a car. But a change of two buses and 1.5 hrs and you are there ! lots of vendors and artists crowd the pier. the walk is amazing , though little tiresome if one is wearing heels :) (because of the wooden path)

Here is the place to be at night or day!Get yourself down here, the sand is perfect the water is quality and you'll make friends anywhere.Take a lot of sun cream, if you have kids they will love it too!

column2: A beach with a pier - nothing special.
column3: Small souvenir/candy shops and restaurants on the pier. Nothing special. The pier at Monterey was much bigger and nicer. Seems like the merchants just want to rip off tourists, selling cheap garbage toys and candy.
This beach area is such an amazing sight. A walk along the Santa Monica Pier is a must do as well. Preferably better on a non windy day. So much beach!!!!

column2: Perfectly sunny day to visit beach and pier!
column3: Youngest son enjoyed the rides. Lots going on - buskers, stalls etc. long walk to Muscle beach which was a priority for my two gym going sons!

A real interesting place. Arcades and ride for the kids. There is also an aquarium under the pier that people are not aware of. It is run by Heal the Bay. Very touchy/feely. Walk south from the pier and see all of the interesting characters at Venice Beach. A real people looking location. Would not recommend walking in the area after dark.
You can just walk on the beach here all day long. It is just amazing. There is also an amusement park at the end of the walk. There are also restaurants along the way.

I live in St. John, US Virgin Islands, so for me, Santa Monica Bay was a huge disappointment. I admit, I'm spoiled! While the beach was huge, the sand was mediocre; the cleanliness far from pristine, and the development overwhelming.Given its' location, I understand its limitations. However far more beautiful and lessdestruction of nature exist and deserve to be seen...

We absolutely loved Santa Monica. We began with the pier and a ride on the Westcoaster...I am petrified of heights so this was a massive leap of faith for me - so glad we did it, screamed my head off, but never again! Great atmosphere and people watching - we had beautiful weather, which really added to it. Make sure you check out the carousel as well. Santa Monica shopping area is also really great and on our return to LA stayed in a holiday rental near the mall, which was a great decision as we were flying back to Australia the next day and were nice a close to the airport.

This is place is so much fun!!Took the yellow line, on our hop on/ off tour bus and spent the entire afternoon here. The pier is fun, from carnival rides, to local buskers trying to get known.For lunch, my daughter and i grab an hot dog, for the food vans, lining Ocean Ave.When then did the 2.3mile (3.7km) walk along the beachfront to Venice beach, to have dinner there. Amazing.Although the water was cold, my daughter loved it.
The Pier will always be a great land maker in Los Angeles, bit lately it's more and more crowded. I still Enjoyed it but only for a couple hours.

I'm not sure why but I was captivated by this beach!! The beauty of the landscape; the sheer size and depth of the beach; the boardwalk and restaurant; the bike path and restroom facilities - and all of it public access!! We actually saw two seals off the pier vying for bait from the various fishermen. Too cute!! I'm definitively going back when it's warmer.

Hit the beach for a run at about 5:30 pm when I arrived in town on a Tuesday. The traffic to get there was slow, as expected. It was a warm night and the place was crowded, but there's plenty of room to run on the boardwalk. Even sharing the walk with roller skaters and bikers.There's plenty of things to watch on your run as well. The sunset over the Pacific is awesome, but that's not all their is. There was a street hockey game going in the parking lot. A 2 on 2 sand volleyball match. And then there are things you don't see on every beach - a lady doing yoga on a pole about 30 feet up in the air. Guys bouncing on trapeze wires (doing some pretty amazing tricks!), and of course Muscle Beach.It's a great beach for people watching as you'll see every kind. Or you can just go for a good run.

It's not that Santa Monica Bay is not beautiful, interesting or exciting. It's just very crowded compared to some of L.A.'s other beaches that are just as great. I prefer the Manhattan Beach Pier area, which is not as busy, but just as beautiful.
This beach was the perfect ending to my LA trip, there was a cool breeze, soft sands under my feet and beautiful blue water! Even if you won't swim you must experience the beauty of this beach!
I loved the vibe of Santa Monica. I went in the end of the day to watch the sundown. Worth the drive.
One of the first places we visited. Great beach, lots of activites for all the family. The sign post signaling the end of the famous route 66.

We went in the morning to the bay, so there was not much activity, nevertheless beautiful. We had a view of the beach from the main road atop the cliff. The mountains at the far end added to the charm. 'Baywatch' fans will definitely want to visit this beach! the restrooms were very well maintained.
Lots of attractions, amusement rides, restaurants, street shows, music, & the beach! Great accessible walking paths along Ocean Avenue overlooking the action from the bluffs.
