Nothing like the Pier, Roller Coasters, Ferris Wheels etc. Beautiful views, transport friendly and an absolute gem!!!

column2: Nicest place in LA to spend a weekend at the beach. You can find here everything you can possibly need for enjoyment.
column3: Wonderful clean beach, hundreds of beautiful bodies around, sport activities including bike and roller blades rentals. Any type of food and drinks. A lot of happy faces. Weather you are alone, with your spouse, family or your pets, there is always a place here for you without limitation. I love Santa Monica bay and the beach. This is one of Los Angeles jems.
A fun place to go in Santa Monica, especially in nice weather. The pier has several restaurants and fun bars, great people watching. Just a pretty and fun place by the water in Santa Monica.

We took a bus to get here which took a long time but the beach was lovely and the pier was really nice. We walked to Venice Beach from here, we were not impressed with the homeless people everywhere. It was in our eyes a dodgy area, but nice to have seen it.

We went at night and walked down the pier, rode the ferris wheel, and dipped our toes in the ocean. It was beautiful! The only thing I didn't like was that the beach was so filthy! I wish people respected it more.

Stopped here for the day after using the sightseeing bus tour, lovely big beach and iconic pier area which are great for looking around and for somewhere to sit and admire the view. Area felt safe too. Nice designated walkway along beach path which you can walk comfortably to Venice beach.
The views are amazing, on one side the mountains go right to sea, the ocean and boats in distance, great restaurants , the amusement park on the pier, lots of tour buses in area
None of our group had been to Santa Monica before so we took a custom tour and I included this so that they could compare this beach to ours in south Florida. Every one enjoyed it.

Great place to spend a day if weather is nice, but beware! we are a family of 4, and used to the sun etc...but the day we were there it was not over hot and we were slow to put on cream- and yes we got burnt! Lovely waves, friendly people, happy place!

column2: Great beach + huge sand area - crowded pier
column3: We parked to the side of the road. When we came back from the beach with coffee, a police was kindly telling us it is that it is not ok to park there.
The water may be too cold to actually enter, but it's nice just taking a stroll on the beach sand and along the bay.

The weather was windy and the water was so cold. ... The huge waves was good. ...We enjoy our feet getting wet and play around for a while. ... very nice clean sand. ...Although there were a lot of people . ... it's still doesn't feel crowded. ... my son enjoy it. ...
This was my first stop out of the airport. Had always wanted to visit, so glad I had a coworker driving me this day. The pier was packed with people. This was another true delight of my week.
The pier was not as clean as I thought it should be and there were a huge amount of homeless wandering it.

We walked to the Santa Monica Pier from Venice Pier and the beaches are great, clean, well managed, surf and lifeguards but as the sun goes down the atmosphere changes to my mind. There are a couple of seafront bars with trendy people enjoying the nightlife that rub shoulders with lots of homeless people and as night fell I was glad that we were out of that intervening strip between the two piers. The lack of other pedestrians suggested that we were not alone in thinking that.The sunset was really cool and given the right meterological circumstances I am sure is spectacular.As it was we arrived at the pier in the early evening and there was lots of activity about but it all seemed somewhat tacky and a little down at heel for my tastes although photographers will enjoy the photo ops. I suspect that at the weekends the atmosphere is different but on a Monday international bad night out we were disappointed.

column2: A nice sunset but a bit crowded
column3: We stop by for couple hours at Santa Monica Pier and walked down the beach. It is always a nice place to visit, but felt a bit crowded. Parking was another challenge here too, but were able to park by the pier. Of course it is not cheap, but what is cheap in LA?
Went to the main street and the pier .... nice walk albeit crowded at times.. keep an eye on the street musicians around... they are AMAZING...
Me and my family spent a day at Santa Monica Pier! Very relaxing and enjoyable! I really want to come back to see the sunset over there!
I didn't go on the beach, but a lot of people enjoyed it. I went on the pier though. There are rides you could go on. I went on the roller coaster which was fun. They had rides for everyone to enjoy.
Nothing special, a nice walk but nothing more interesting or exciting. Not sure we'd go back- though we could see the attraction for teenagers @ night.

Visiting Santa Monica Pier was fantastic. Just walking up the pier, taking in the atmosphere - weather was perfect - it could not have been a better experience. The water was clear and a Seal was playing under / at the end of the pier. Didn't ride any of the attractions, was just there to enjoy what the Pier and its environment had to offer.We hope to visit again - real soon
NIce relaxing place, we enjoyed to tahe a walk, If you love walks and be out there this is the place

column2: gets pretty crowded but the pier is still ok kind of
column3: Its good to spend some time on the west side of los angeles and if you don't like the craziness of Venice beach this is more civilized and the area of Santa Monica that used to be called the People's republic because of rent control and a socially conscious management has gone very commercial and is relatively disappointing now as the shops have upgraded and look mostly empty because of that.....!!! Free parking if you are going to shop

No doubt Santa Monica beach is called as one of the best beaches in the world.... The water here was critical clear... The weather was lovely... And the pier makes it more lively... The trees the breeze... I have fallen in love with the beauty....

Santa Monica Bay/Pier is a must see if your travel takes you to the greater Los Angeles area. We went late afternoon and stayed for several hours. The sunset and scenic views were great to just relax and take in. The pier is full of typical tourists trap spots, but random musicians and performers can normally be found as well.

column2: Had to ride the Roller Coaster
column3: Fun beach with an amusement park on the pier. Of course my 15 year old and I had to ride the roller coaster. It costs $8.00 but at least they let you stay on for 2 rides in a row. It's fun watching the surfers also!
The Santa Monica Bay and Pier is a must see in the area. Extremely nice, some good entertainment  and the very end of Route 66
Unfortunately it was not possible to enter the sea, but we walk the bike lane, much like what we see. The beach is beautiful, also we liked the pier. The place is very beautiful and well attended.

column2: A FEW HOURS IN SANTA MONICA
column3: Nice, broad beaches and pier.it would be nice to spend a whole day in summer time. Unfortunately We passes on the way to San Francisco for a few hours. Great place for beach lovers.Do not miss Hotel California , just to remember "The Eagles".

I went there on March 2016, it's not summer yet, but the sun burns and when in the shadow you feel cold, strange feeling if you are from a central american country where the weather is around 30 degrees Celsius all year long.The pier was really nice and crowded, everything is expensive but the view is amazing, this is a place you have to visit when you are in LA.
Nice pier. You can walk or ride a bike to Venice Beach which I enjoyed. Many homeless people living on pavement and beach. They are harmless, mostly sleeping on ground.
Nice place to spend you time at this place and nice if your with your partner. Really felt rejuvenate.
I loved the huge beach and views from the Pacific Palisades in Santa Monica. The Pier, eh. I have been to the Jersey boardwalks and prefer those.

column2: A little bit of old school LA
column3: We had a quick stop on a city tour at the pier here, it reminded me a little of the pier in Brighton UK.

column2: Fun and Frolics on the Peir
column3: A great experience for Couples, Families, Children, Pensioners and anyone enjoying the buzz of the fairground and the atmosphere of the seaside! Some great restaurants, although can be quite pricey, but you're paying for the location and the view. On one of my visits here, we stayed until the evening, and at dusk a group of people lit thousands of candles on the beach, just off the pier. I'm not sure what the purpose of this was, but the effect was amazing and it really did look beautiful. It added to our experience of the Pier. Also should say we got great enjoyment from seeing the authentic LA Cop Car, complete with 2 authentic LA Cops was brilliant! We even took a picture of them!

column2: Lots of fun for the family or group of friends!
column3: As the title says: This place is great for a group of friends or families to walk around. It is really beautiful for watching the sunset as well, and light gift shopping. There are also games you can play and win plush toys!

"SAMO" is a unique area with these three things with in easy walking distance. BTW the warmer the day the better the crowds. The beach is usually nice and the ocean always great for a "dip". The pier has attractions and rides from dawn to dark. The people and crowds are from all over. Excellent people watching and lots of reasonable food choices too. 3rd street promenade has shops and restaurants galore. Always a bit pricey but really good for window shopping. There are also street entertainers everywhere too. Hit all three and you can be there for several hours easy.
Worth the visit. Make sure you check out the Bubba Gump, and hotel California while here. Always sunny in California

We went to Santa Monica beach after a 12 hour trip from Australia. It was a good way to start our holiday and the pier was just like you see in US shows/movies. It is the end of route 66 and is a bit touristy. Didn't the beach was as good as home but the toilets were very clean and well kept.
Parking is nearly impossible on a weekend, and expensive, but well worth the stop. Go to the pier and take some photos. It's a great place to spend the day if you have the time.

column2: A nice area worth a stroll around.
column3: We liked Santa Monica Bay, it's a pretty area with lots going on. Not quite as many homeless people as Venice, and a bit cleaner.

column2: Nice View and Rides,but too crowded in the afternoon
column3: Paid a swing-by visit at the Santa Monica Beach on a weekend before heading back to San Diego, and I find it to be too crowded and packed with people on a weekend, apparently. It offers a nice view of the Pacific Ocean and a long beach where people are lounging around to sunbathe or swim.The Pier offers a free exhibit about the history of the wharf and has a few restaurants for food and refreshments. And there's the typical carnival rides which actually describe the Santa Monica Pier, which may cater more to the kids and teenagers though ridership also applies to some adults, whom I presume were mostly tourists.The best thing is it is of walking distance from the Palisades Park and the Promenade which is packed with performing artists and brimming with shops, cafes, restaurants and some theaters as well as malls.I reckon a visit is nice at dawn or daybreak, just like the scenery as seen on movies and tv shows that showcase the Sta.Monica Pier.
Muscle beach was really cool. Very quiet this time of year. Beautiful sunrise and sunset. Sand is awesome - beach is wide. Route 66 ends on the pier.
Beautiful beach with a very interesting pier. Don't loose the opportunity to go. The place is great for families and solo travellers as well.

column2: You will feel ecstatic if you love ocean and large beaches
column3: Words are little to describe me feeling of visiting Santa Monica bay. Happy people, so much fun going on and the clean, seemingly endless beach. Don't miss the sun setting in the pacific. The day i visited, a great sitar artist was performing at the pier. Melodies coming out of the Sitar, cool pacific breeze of a December evening and red, crimson hues of the sky. only one word- magical. :)
Santa Monica Bay is by far the most popular beach in Los Angeles. There are a lot of activities to do around there. You can rent bicycle and use the bike road located on the beach.

column2: Pier is must see - especially at sunset!
column3: Spent the afternoon driving over to the pier. Arrived late afternoon, and after struggling to find parking (not an easy task) - walked the boulevard and out on to the pier. It's a lot to take in - full of many characters, colors, and opportunities. The performers there were another story in themselves, but very entertaining. Didn't eat or drink anything there - but found everything exciting. Would highly recommend a sunset view from there - breathtaking!
A bit disappointment considering how famous is this place. It was dirty and many homeless people sleeping in the park.Overall it was interesting to see.
Hanging out around the Pier by Sunset is really cool !nice vibes , musician & artists perfomers along the pierI really enjoyed my time there so much

column2: Very popular place,walking on the pier is free. unless you want to use the rides of course
column3: Plenty of places to eat from low budget to unlimited, Walking and shopping at Sta Monica mall or just stroll on ocean Blvd,or walk down to the sand

column2: You can do better for a beach experience
column3: I'm a beach snob. Not a hideously uptight snob but wound up tight enough to say that Santa Monica Bay is a not a great beach. And I do not like Malibu either. If you really want to go to a beach, get in the car take the coast route down and go about 20 minutes south to South Bay. Go to Hermosa or Manhattan Beaches. The water is cleaner. The waves are more fun. Less traffic than Santa Monica.

Had a great day at the beach and on the Pier! Beach volleyball, bikers, skateboarders, gymnast rings, amusement park, restaurants and more!! Loved going to the beach and having more to do than just lounge or swim.

The beach is clean and wide, the sea cold but inviting. It was crowded on the weekend, but thinned out during the week. We went to the pier a couple of times, riding the Pacific Wheel once. We also liked walking the beach path, from Santa Monica to Venice.

Spending just a moment in the afternoon was a great experience... Although we could find better beach in other parts of the world but it offered different experience. The crowd, the amusement park, the restaurants....hmmmm you should be there to feel the different experience than other beaches...
Beautiful beach and wonderful place to live if over 50. Lots of free things for the 50+ would make this a great place to retire.
Family vacation. Walked the peer. so much fun. Rte 66 end sign an icon all on its own. Loved it.Water was beautiful.

column2: I Do a Conference Call Every Thursday From Will Rodgers Beach
column3: With ample but often expensive parking, you too can enjoy the same beaches that the bikini-clad ladies (and the Hoff) pranced around on during Baywatch.There are great walking and bike paths. You can sneak your dog down to the beach when its not summer and nobody is looking.Look for the trailer park on the cliffs as its the most expensive of its kind. $1,500,000 for a double wide!!! Amazing.Don't be shocked to see sea otters, big ocean birds like Pelicans , and dolphins. I once saw a whale breach about 500 yards off the coast of the beach in Pacific Palisades.

There is something extra special about the Santa Monica area - the shops, the people, the quiet. The best place to get away from the hustle and bustle, explore the beach, read a book, walk in the shops or explore the pier.

I love Santa Monica, the beach, the pier, the Pacific Park, the strand especially. What a great place to bike or roller blade. However, DO NOT leave your bike unattended. There are a lot of thieves watching you lock your bike and if it's worth any money, they're happy to unload it when they see you head off for the water. I see some people lock bikes but take their seats off and carry it with them. That's one way to possibly avoid this problem. They may LOOK like a thief if they steal a bike with no seat. Makes for a tough getaway. But in general try to keep it with you if possible. They have cutters to cut right through the locks. Muscle Beach is a great place to watch people work out or do special acrobats. The swings are nice. Fun area with lots to do and a great variety.
Spent some time walking along beautiful venice beach up to santa monica pier last summer. Lively and great to visit day or night
Despite the cold water temp...probably 50 degrees in March...my son spent about 3 hours in the water. The beach also wasn't that crowded which made it great.
I suppoose it goes without saying that the pier is full of tourists doing their thing but it is quite nice and worth a trip
Great way to spend the day! Lots to see and do! Had to ride the ferris wheel and ate at some of the vendors!

column2: Beautiful place to watch the sunset!!!
column3: Spent an evening here on the pier. Very relaxing and enjoyable! Good food and typical SoCal music......
It's a beautiful place! I took so many photos of the sunset as it was one of the best I've ever seen. It's windy and busy since it's so popular with tourists, but it's worth the visit.
very nice place to go with the family specially to the santa monica pier, there are rides for the kids restaurants with a excellent view, good place to go bicycle riding

This is the end of US Route 66. It is a tourist world, primarily unless it is a nice sunny weekend day and the locals join in putting up umbrellas and playing with sand toys. It is great for people watching and taking a nice long walk. The sand is fine. The artists, including some very good musicians, dot the pier, and are fun to watch.
We see it on the movies. Probably have to tick the box....yes go but it is ordinary! Australia has much nicer beaches & I'm not OZ.

Great place when you come for the first time in LA or Santa Monica.The closer to the jetty, the more crowded.So if you want to have a more intimate experience for away for the tourists, then you know what to do.

In two days of the four I visited, swam and walked two beaches Santa Barbara and Venice by bike, walking and enjoying its landscape as well as of its waters and artists on the pier and trails, all spectacular.

Spent an afternoon here with my daughter she hired roller blades I took the safer option and hired a bicycle and we the path all the way from the pier down past Venice beach stopping for refreshment great afternoon .

column2: Took my out of town visitors from Toronto!
column3: This Iconic and recognizable attraction served as a great place to eat and be entertained on a sunny Sunday afternoon. Kids and adults alike can enjoy the day at the Santa Monica Bay Pier.

Don't go on a windy wet day as the walk along the pier was bitter.It's definitely worth a visit and on a dry summers day the beach is perfect.Across from the pier is a shopping precincts with all the major stores and sow times the odd busker

The Santa Monica promenade is a great place to start if you are looking to do some shopping, or simply head down to the pier, or the Venice beach board walk. with the new added stores and restaurants make the trip worth while..
With an amazing natural beauty it's awesome spot to visit and help to take a break. At the same time will let you remember the Baywatch serie.
Every visit to LA shold include a trip to Santa Monica Bay. Lots of activities for every taste on this and the neighboring beach. The Pier is also well worth a visit.
It was one of our favorite places to visit! It was just a little chilly by the beach.It had lots of good food.
We live on Lake Ontario but no sunset like this one!!! The Pier is also a great spot for a quick snack.

column2: The first pier in Southern California!
column3: This is where it all began. Those that settled beautiful souther California built the first beach pier right in Santa Monica. You can still feel the nostalgia here. There's a carousel on the pier a ferris wheel, shops, and restaurants. When I was here in the early morning before the crowds arrived I got to see quite a few fishermen.This pier is beautiful from all angles even when you can observe it walking on the sandy beach.
Lovelly coastal environment and beach for swimming and relaxing on - wooden pier has lots of shops and restaurants
great place to visit, beach is huge... rent a bike and ride around malibu is just past santa monica pier.
I think the Santa Monica pier area must have been better in years past.. Its kinda run down with fast food spots now and not to entertaining. Maybe if I had kids?

column2: Just what I needed for my trip!
column3: We explored all over LA but I needed the beach. I got more then what I was looking for. The pier had great food and fun rides to ride. Me and my boyfriend had a blast. I think it was my favorite part. So the icing on the cake was the beach. It was perfect the sand and water just perfect. Dont miss this exciting place.
Very iconic, fun to people watch, great if you like amusements, fun food. Make sure you go under the pier too. I even saw the star of The Danish Girl, Eddie Redmayne. He was enjoying himself too.

column2: Fun pier to visit, great boardwalk and huge beach
column3: Visited Santa Monica on a Saturday. It was fairly busy and a great atmosphere.We walked the pier and checked out the views. There were a bunch of people fishing off the end of it so be careful of their hooks if they don't know you're walking behind them! Walking back down a violinist had set up and was playing for the crowd, great to hear! There are tons of people selling cut up melons for snacks and can get to be a little annoying but they are just trying to make money to live like we all are.We rented bikes for $20 a day (or $7 per hour) at the start of the pier and cruised down the boardwalk to Venice. The boardwalk is great, very busy on the weekend afternoons so be aware of others, the morning was pretty quiet.The original site of Muscle Beach still has the gymnastic rings and has posts people set up hammocks and slack lines on. Keep biking down the boardwalk to watch people at the current Muscle Beach!If you visit Santa Monica I recommend renting bikes and biking down the boardwalk to Venice, it's not very far at all and is a nice experience!
Great to stay on the beach (I feel safe there) to do sports or just walk or rent a bike. Cool to see the "urban fauna". The Pier it's very old and nice, you can enjoy a great sundown.

The weather was perfect for our visit in February -- it was 30 degrees and sunny! On a weekday afternoon, it was quiet. The beach was clean, and the water was refreshing to dip your feet into. The pier has bathrooms too.

The first thing you see is the beach and its huge, Venice beach to the left and Malibu beach to the right, beautiful. The pier is ok with a couple of restaurants and tourist shops, also a small funfair. Back from the beach are some lovely shops, restaurants and bars. I really liked Santa Monica.
Spectacular day hiking I went at least 7 miles. It was overcast but it cleared a t the end of the hike. It did not disappoint
I went to this place last year with my girlfriend and we found everything great! Nice stores, little restaurants and clean areas.
Lovely beach and walk on Santa Monica Pier, very clean and could not resist dipping my toes in the ocean. Stayed here February 2015.

column2: Great place to visit; we had a fab few days stop over here the shopping was great!
column3: Lovely beach; great pier; the kids had a great time at the small fun fair. Lots of shops - especially designer ones.

Another beach that is iconic to LA but dirty with litters. Maybe I am spoiled with clean and pristine beaches from back home in Australia but a couple of beaches I went to in LA, I was very disappointed.

You'll have fun people watching, everyone goes there expecting to see an episode of "Baywatch" being filmed..Nope just locals, tourists, and you..Good fun, clean water, no sharks - I mean in the water..On the Pier are nice restaurants, a Carosol ofr the kids, and other amusements. Bring a fishing pole, fish off the pier, never know what you'll catch..enjoy!
Walk along the beach and stare in one direction towards the Santa Monica Pier, turn the other war way and stare at Malibu. Pretty neat place to be!

What can you say - its a huge pier with amusement rides, vendors. fishermen, colorful characters, an incredible view, wonderful breeze, the end of Route 66, fun food, the most incredible sunsets ever, etc......
After many visits to the USA, I was very excited to finally visit the Santa Monica Pier. Highly recommend you add to your list of places to see.
I have heard of Santa Monica song since I was young and when I have a chance to really visit, it's really impressive. No words to describe! You just need to see it yourself and you will love it.

It really is a lovely spot to take a walk and people watch. My mother and I love taking trips together and I took her here and she loved it. The view, the walk, the sound, all very lovely. There's always some sort of street musician along the boardwalk which adds extra entertainment to the visit.

column2: Use Cycle for sure, else dont go
column3: Cycle - $15 for a dayWe were three and cycled till SA to Venice beach.You should also divert the path and go to Venice houses.

column2: Best Bay in LA (the only one really)
column3: This stretches north from Malibu to Palos Verdes Peninsula in the south. You get all kinds of different beach experiences.

column2: Iconic LA, must see for any first timers list!
column3: I love the pier...the fun park on the end of the pier is some unique and it's right outside Beverly Hills. Great food and shopping too!

I was there on a sunday afternoon and It had the best sunset I have ever seen! Pretty californian type of sunset, you cant miss it if you want some quality time with youy hubby. Not too crowded and you can walk to the Santa Monica Pier to enjoy the rides and restaurants.

column2: A bit of a tourist trap
column3: Fun to visit. Did you know it is the end of Route 66? We walked from Venice Beach, which is next to the Santa Monica Bay. Wear comfortable shoes, it is about a 3 mile stretch between the two, but worth it.
OK, it's a beach, with shopping attached, with a picturesque pier. Not sure I'd go again. I would probably try other attractions first.

column2: Good place to watch the sun set
column3: Park on 2nd Street in one of the many garages and walk down to view the ocean and catch the sunset. Can be very touristy (lots of people)

This is a big place, you can actually walk all the way to Malibu one way and to Venice beach on the other. Great place for biking, roller skating. Rent or bring your own. You have surf, volleyball cords, pier, amusement park, foot and shopping all together. The pier also has a large parking lot.Visit the third street promenade just a block back into the city.

Make sure you park down below cliffs on PCH. Watch out for meter police. Typical pier with typical attractions. No bathrooms to be had unless you pay for one in local establishments. Street people everywhere.
Very long stretch of clean beach and a very nice boardwalk on it.Big contrast to the ghetto muscle beachAlso right in front of a major shopping/dinning area so its a very enjoyable place to indulge

We loved our trip to Santa Monica. We lazed on the beach in the sunshine, ate frozen yogurt and rode the rollercoaster on the pier (in the front car, and we got a second ride for free :-) ), then had lunch at a lovely restaurant opposite the pier. We then walked down to Venice Beach and took in all the sights and sounds, and also wandered around the canals (look out for the super cute hummingbirds!), before wandering back up to Santa Monica. Lovely day in LA :-)

I visited Santa Monica Bay in July 2015 and was really impressed by the quality and cleanliness of the beach and boardwalk, the surrounding attractions/shops and the atmosphere on the pier.Definitely a place worth visiting!

column2: A great place on a sunny day in February
column3: Travelled out here by bus which was really easy from downtown LA. The blue Pacific greats you in this lovely bay. The beaches are clean and go on for ever. Walked to the end of the pier which is also the end of Route 66.

The beach area is really well maintened! We liked the boardwalk and the pier. You could easily spend a couple hours there. You could watch some really good local artists. The view from the pier is awesome!

column2: Must-see, must go place in Santa Monica
column3: You haven't been to Santa Monica if you haven't been to the Pier and Beach! When bored of suntanning, just join the feisty crowd in the pier or ride attractions in the carnival. Fun place!
Love this place, is beautiful. In the pier is very windy, so grab a jacket. Its a nice experience. definitely will keep coming back.
Very nice walk along the promenade and the place is not too crowded the wind fromthe sea breeze is refreshing.The funfair caters for all ages, enjoyed the big wheel rides and fun games.
I was in Santa Monica for a cousin's wedding. We spend the day before the wedding checking out the boardwalk on the pier, walking on the beach and visiting the nearby outdoor mall. Loved it.
Still a nostalgic place to visit with amusements, restaurants and the locals. A fun place to pass some time

Prior to visiting I had only seen this location on TV. Walking on this pier and taking it all in was awesome. We didn't indulge in any of the rides or carnival games but we did eat at Rusty's.I loved this place!

Always love to walk on the pier, just to see the diverse people, and feel close to the water. Lots of shops and restaurants for everyone's taste. Neat feeling to be in a place you so often see in the movies or tv.

column2: Tourist and locals both go here
column3: This beach is right next to the pier. It is a nice beach and wasn't too crowded even though it was a holiday weekend. The morning was very foggy and the fog hadn't burned off much. There are restrooms near by and lots of swings and things for kids and adults to play on.
We visited the pier and surrounding shops - nice way to spend a sunny afternoon. Wide variety of food available - we enjoyed Joes Pizza!

column2: Very nice area both beach and town
column3: A very nice area both beach and town you have to visit. The beach is wide and cool with nice sunsets ex. The town has a very nice shopping area and resturants you have to vist.
Every since I was kid, over 65 years ago I've been coming to the Santa Monica Pier! It's a place of joy and excitement and of course PEOPLE WATCHING!

The pier is the end of Route 66 and filled with many restaurants, amusement park, places to fish, great people watching including surfers, and views. The beach is large and good place to enjoy the California sun and ocean. You can certainly enjoy an entire day here.
A beautiful area for swimming. Pristine and clean, the beach is significant in size and the water oh so inviting. The Pier is a great place for wandering views and food, a must do!

We came here just to see the sunset in a short time of 4 hours during our visit to LA. The beach was clean but had no luxury or watersports nearby. The drive was beautiful by the side of Pacific Ocean.
Great place and fun for everyone. Shops, Restaurants, Ocean, Surfers, Fishing, etc. etc. Rides ,Roller coaster over the Ocean!

Who doesn't love the beach? I just wish the water was warmer, but what do you expect in Jan? NOT WARM WATER! However, my kids still got in to say they'd swam in the Pacific. The Pier itself is neat...atmosphere is fun. Walk around is nice.

column2: Historic place with some charm, a little expensive
column3: Historic place with some charm. Not to many choices for eating or entretaiment and they are a little expensive

Be sure and visit the Annenberg Public Beach House. It replaces the long-gone 100 room "beach house' of Marion Davies, mistress of William Randolph Hearst. One 7,500 sq. ft. guest house remains from the days of when Ms. Davies had a 100-room "cottage' by the sea.

column2: Beautiful beach, great place of the family
column3: Went to Santa Monica as part of a tour on a hop off hop on bus tour it was really easy to get .The pier is fantastic fun and great afternoon with the family with awesome variety of cafes around you. It's a must while you're visiting Los Angeles

The pier is a place I have always wanted to visit and was worried it would not live up to expectations. The walk from Venice Beach to Santa Monica was eye-opening with people accosting me every 2 minutes for money or listening to music. Once I was past the shopping precinct, the pier was in sight and I was happy that it met my expectations. Lots of colour, people and great things to look at. The merry-go-round was stunning!
the beach was nice, could just lie there and relax. the iconic pier was there too. pacific park, and the view there!
It is a good walk though its quite far away from the water. Its an excellent place for physical activities: volley-ball, football, etc
Expecting too much maybe? Do you have to be a local to enjoy this location? An unfortunate experience.

column2: The iconic pier, fish tacos, great beach.
column3: It is one of the places in LA that you have to see. Great beach, the iconic pier and a number of great restaurants (with stunning outdoor seating) within walking distance.
Our second stay at Santa Monica and it did not disappoint. This is a great place to unwind after touring the States prior to the long flight back to down under.

column2: A great place to visit for a beautiful sunset
column3: We went to Santa Monica for the evening. We were able to see a beautiful sunset, and enjoyed walking along the board walk to Venice Beach. We also went onto the pier and went on a ride or two. The ride tickets are quite expensive, it is better to buy a pass, but we only wanted to go on one ride before dinner.

The only problem with the bay is that the distance from the start of the sand to the ocean is too deep. You feel like Lawrence of Arabia without his camel making the treck. Doubly worse if you have a lot of "stuff" to schlep along with you. Also a problem between the Venice Pier and the Channel as there are no convenient public restrooms.

column2: One of my favourites in LA
column3: I'm a Santa Monica lover through and through. The pier is fantastic fun and looks amazing at night when it's all lit up. One of the best places in LA to watch the sunset. Hiring a bike and riding to Venice Beach and back is one of my most favorite all time things to do! There are quite a few homeless around the pier but they are generally harmless. Lots of great restaurants around also.

The Bay was great. Although it was a little crowded the day we visited, the beach was still fun and enjoyable. It looks prettiest at sunset. It is fun to wade in the water and spend time tanning on the beach.

This was quiet at the time we went. I have enjoyed this when it was really busy too. The atmosphere is upbeat and very unique. I like seeing the looks of the beach in person since I had only seen it on movies and shows before. Everyone should experience this area at least once.

We planned to eat here and spend some time on the Pier. In reality the pier is rough bolted down wooden planks. I could not roll my wheelchair over it without bouncing painfully along. It was not worth it. We left

Sadly, there appears to be nothing remaining of the buildings or architecture from the original pier of the 1920's. Of course, the same can be said of NYC Times Square. Like Times Square, the pier is noisy, crowded and over-priced ($6.75 for ice cream at Pier Burger). The stairs behind Bubba Gump lead down to Santa Monica beach, joining nature and commercialism at the hip. It's remarkable that an up-scale community like Santa Monica with its premium shops and exotic car dealerships has a pier and beach comparable to Coney Island. Joey Chestnut of Nathan's hotdog eating fame would feel right at home here provided he mortgaged his apartment to pay for the price of dogs. Nearby Venice Beach is the better choice of beach and boardwalk.
The Place features an amusement park, dining facilities, gift shops, an arcade, and designated areas for fishing. You do not need a license to fish from the Pier.

column2: Fun place to go for walk. Great views.
column3: In the 1920's my dad used to dive off the end of the pier for quarters. It has been there long time and is a part of the Los Angeles area all should see. Fun for kids. Beach is right there.

column2: GREAT PLACE TO BE, LOVELY RESTAURANTS
column3: Many people but happy people, all cycling, running, jogging or just walking slowly to look at the scenery. Let me tell tou about a nice restaurant : SHUTTERS on tjhe beach. Sitting inside the restaurant but on the sand. Nice food, nice staff, shame it was on my last day sunday 24th of January. 4 days later, here in my house in the country east of Paris, under the grey sky and the rain I miss Santa Monica, Malibu and Beverly Hills.

column2: You really have to WANT to go into the water.
column3: Let me preface this review with this - I am from Hawaii, where the ocean at the very least is blue green, at it's best - glassy an blue. And if you're outside of Waikiki, the sand is clean, with out chalking up your feet. With that said, Santa Monica is average.Here are some of the not so great things:1. Don't come here from the warm water. It's non-exsistant.2. Parking can be a nightmare if you don't get there early; especially during the summer.3. There is quite a bit of homelessness.4. There are no palm trees near the coast line.5. The sand is a bit chalky.Here's some of the good.1. Lots and Lots of eye candy. Volleyball players, surfers, bikinis, etc.2. A great walking and bike path.3. You can catch a celebrity or two working out and the jungle gym.4. Santa Monica Boardwalk.5. Hot Dog on a Stick.Depending on what you're really after, will directly depend on your expectations of Santa Monica Bay. It's not Tahiti, The Carribean, or Costa Rica, however, if you're looking for novelty, then, you may enjoy a day at Santa Monica Bay
While in LA you simply must take the PCH1 and drive along the Pacific. Santa Monica Bay is simply stunning as is a little further Malibu.
I enjoyed wandering around Santa Monica with lots of shops and good restaurants. The pier is worth a look but very touristy - Bubba Gumps, souvenirs and more trashy souvenirs.

column2: Not sure you should miss this or just say you saw it and save your time.
column3: Like the beach? Like homeless people? Like to be bothered? Like to see the beauty of the ocean from a pebble filled beah? Well then, pay to park close by and be prepared to file a police report!

We had a few hours to kill so we decided to swing by and see what the Pier was all about. We arrived about 9am and the Pier did not officially open until 11am so we hung out down at the beach for a couple hours. We parked in the lower lot which at that time of the day still had plenty of spots available. The sand was clean and it was not crowded at all. There were people performing music up on the Pier and you could hear it down on the beach. That made for a cool atmosphere. Once we went up to the Pier we just kind of leisurely walked around checking everything out. There were a few vendors selling art, clothing, and jewelry. A few people had set up shop in different locations of the Pier to provide musical entertainment. We didn't ride any of the rides since it was a bit pricey, but all in all this place was pretty cool. A nice hang out especially if you are a people watcher and want to just chill.
Visited during the day and again at night. You can walk on the pier, boardwalk, ride the Ferris Wheel, eat a bubba gump. I also rode the carousel :)
It is good place to visit on wk-ends in afternoons as there are street singers at the Santa Monica promenade.You can walk by the beach and then have nice dinner and shopping .

With free entry to the pacific park, it's great to enjoy the atmosphere here even you do not take the ride. Beautiful settings and unlike any other beaches it looked more like a fun place beside a beautiful beach instead of simply a beautiful beach. Magician, food stalls, street circuses and beggars all scattered around

column2: Great place on a sunny day
column3: It is a good public beach, with lot of activity. You can eat, cycle, swim and relax. Great fun to visit.

column2: Great for strolling and celebrity sightings
column3: We enjoyed visiting Santa Monica during a sunny mild afternoon. There's lots of high-end and trendy shopping which is where you might see celebrities doing their errands. Keeping strolling out to the pier where there's some silly touristy amusements. There's eateries all about. Very LA!

I used to work above 3rd Street Promenade in Santa Monica. There were many shops and restaurants that were an elevator ride away and the beach was 2 blocks away. The pier has many amusement park attractions. You can arrive in the late morning for some beach time, see a movie, have dinner, and check out the pier in one full and not all that expensive a day. There is also a great bike trail as well as a park on the bluffs running parallel to the beach below. Lots to see and do.

Santa Monica Bay has a lot to offer. The sweeping views of the open Pacific and LA to the lofty San Gabriel in the background, often snowcapped.It is a big part of LA's beauty and culture.Best sunsets on earth.

santa monica was cool. the weather was gorgeous when I was there, perfect beach weather. this was my first time touching the pacific ocean which was cool just to put my feet in there and say I did it!! awesome, memorable time!

I was not thrilled about it, maybe because the only thing you can do is just walk on the beach and pier. If you are looking for a city's landmark you will not definitely find it here or anywhere else in LA. In any case it was way better than Venice.
We went in the morning. Beautiful beach and incredible view of people playing beach volleyball, surfing and Santa Monica Pier.

We visited the Santa Monica Bay area and Pier and it was so full of love with all the light works and live music in evening. Very romantic. Many couples can be seen there sitting thanks to the view and ambiance of the place. And the ocean, it is so dangerously exciting with so high and mesmerizing waves.The pier is open 24 hours with parking fees.

column2: sandy beach that stretches for miles
column3: not much to say about this place, it is voted as top attraction when in L.A., but coming from the country with really beautiful beaches (im not being bias) this one doesn't struck me as something special.There is a pier on the beach on which you can buy souvenirs and grab something to eat.
Nice beach, lovely historic amusement park but unfortunately totally crowded. Beautiful view, very clean beach.
I always head for Santa Monica when visiting LA. I love the beach and restaurants and the shopping is good with all the stores you could possibly want.
One of my favorite places, it's nice shopping out there as well. If your lucky and visit on a Saturday, you can find a lot of custom cars on the pier.
We loved Santa Monica Bay, walked over from where we were staying in Venice and it was further than we thought but a lovely walk and found Santa Monica was lovely

column2: obvious beauty but is it safe for all?
column3: The pier is a must see and has something for everyone. The natural beauty will take your breath away but the vagrants and thugs hanging out by the pier can be alarming. I actually saw fours vagrants fight each other right in the street. The police really don't seem to care. Be careful.
Not really much to say about the bay apart from the beaches are long and wide. The pair is ok, but better at night when its all lit up. Plenty of restaurants and shops.

This was a good location, nice sandy beach. Parking was $6 all day. The restaurants along the front did not appear to be open, but we were there early morning. Plenty to see on the pier and of course it is the end of route 66

Over fifty miles of accessible coast line and twenty- two public beaches makes the Santa Monica Bay area a perfect day trip for any family. You simply must take a walk on the Warf and capture the actual size and beauty of the bay area. Very clean and safe beach.
Such a great place to vacation. Wonderful restaurants, close to the airport and a beach that you have to walk and explore. Walk to Venice Beach and enjoy!

Possibly the finest collection of beaches in the world, from Palos Verdes to Malibu, there's hundreds of yards of fine grain sand leading to the water's edge. The waves are not particularly high but fun for body surfing and in a few places board surfing. A classic place to be with the Pacific Ocean.
Great place to roam the beach have Buba Gumps fish and chips and in general enjoy the sun. Lovely beach.

Loved the day at the Pier and surroundings,wish I had longer to stay. Food was excellent as was the service. There was entertainment all along the Pier so plenty to see and do if you have children and places too get a drink and sit in comfort.

column2: Peaceful beach and a great view of the bay from the pier
column3: We visited in December when its cold so there's not many people playing at the water except for near the pier. However the pier was more lively. The pier offers a cool view of the bay and ocean especially at the tip and also from the ferris wheel at the amusement park on the pier.

We visited Santa Monica Pier on a beautiful December day, it was a fun time for all of us even thought we didn't ride the rides at the amusement park. Just to walk along the pier, see/hear all the performers, smell the cotton candy and treats from the stands, and enjoy the amazing view of the ocean was all we needed here.I do recommend it for all the family and learn all about the end of the Route 66 road!

column2: Good place to see the beach
column3: It is very close to downtown.You can see surfers and people on the beach. I wouldn't say it is the best beach, but very convinient to visit when you are in Los Angeles.

column2: View of the bay and a small amusement park
column3: We spent the early evening at the amusement park and walking the pier. There is a solar powered Ferris wheel (only one of its kind), roller coaster and other typical rides you would find at a small scale amusement park. There are arcade game areas, food stands, and an old wooden pier lined with artisans selling their wares. The pier also includes several restaurants including Bubba Gumps.
Not much on the pier and beach itself, however a beautiful shopping centre and outdoor shops close by.
The view is amazing, especially if you're there during sunset. Food there is great, and there are also some cool little things to buy on the pier. Definitely a must-see.

Being from the middle of Canada, it was exciting to step into the ocean. What a neat place to people watch. There were all the acrobats and tight rope walkers. So fun to just relax, slow down and watch some amazing talented folks!
Santa Monica is a beautiful city, and the beach is great. Compared to many parts of LA, Santa Monica is clean and nice. LA is much grittier.

column2: Especially nice when it's not too crowded
column3: While our daughters enjoy the rides, we just like the ambiance. At the end of pier there was a large seal lolling in the water and checking us out. I think he was hoping for a handout. The quality of the street musicians on the pier is surprisingly good, but most people are too busy walking to stop and listen.

If you are visiting Los Angeles as a tourist, you of course must come here to see our beautiful Santa Monica Beach. There a boardwalk and bicycle path, but you can also walk along the shore for miles. You can walk and walk until you even reach Venice Beach or stroll toward Malibu. Bring bread to feed the seagulls. They are starving.
A good people watcher, fun eats and shopping on the promenade and pier area. Also well monitored by police I felt very safe.

column2: A must visit place if in LA.
column3: Old fashioned pier with amusements ,eateries and fun-fair--a wonderful carousel with hand-carved horses,Ferris wheel out over the ocean and of course the end of the famous Route 66!The beach is beautiful with the famous blue lifeguard huts in abundance.Thoroughly recommend a visit.

My son goes to Santa Monica beach, south side of the pier, regularly to practice parkour. This part of the beach is popular among parkour enthusiasts, gymnasts, and acrobats for the offerings at Muscle Beach Santa Monica. There is an area for slack rope walking, an area for tandem acrobats doing handstands on top of one another, and various gymnastics equipment. If you're a tourist, it's an excellent place for people watching on weekends, as you can see people flipping, swinging on rings, balancing on top of things, and possibly recognize American Ninja Warrior contestants.The beach itself is broad and relatively uncrowded, considering it's one of the most famous tourist attractions in Los Angeles. Once you get a couple blocks from the pier, there aren't that many people on the beach itself or in the water. There are more beachside shops for buying t-shirts and sunglasses a mile down in Venice, but there are also plenty of stores and restaurants nearby on Main St. or at the Third Street Promenade.On normal days, ample parking is available at a reasonable rate at the Santa Monica Civic Center parking lot. It's cheaper than parking at the mall and any nearby meters. When the weather is lousy, you can usually find parking in the small lot on the north end of Appian Way.

column2: we stayed there quite a while and enjoyed the fresh air...
column3: my wife and me went to Santa Monica Pier the other day and enjoyed the long beach walk as well as the walk to and on the Pier, a few small restaurants with character and a tourist shop, parts of the pier are under construction. Many guys are there trying to catch fish...

column2: Great Views with a bit of Tourist Trappings
column3: I went in December so I did not swim but enjoyed the views of the bay both from above and along the pier. The pier is full of tourists and some of the little shops and randomness that goes with that but it's a fun free thing to do.

column2: Great views, Bubba Gumps Restaurant, amusement park
column3: Amusement park for families, great views of the ocean, Bubba Gumps Restaurant, souvenir stores on site
The whole place was really busy and well controlled. The place was full of shops and restaurants loved it.

column2: Quick day trip before leaving town
column3: I had never been to the Sanata Monica Pier before, and it was beautiful. Checked out the beach and the house around the area. Santa Monica itself was alos great. Tough parking on a Saturday afternoon, and traffice was not good. No left turn lights at intersections, just cops allowing one or two turners before letting the other direction go.
It's a very nice beach, quiet and long beach. Can walk around all day with lots of exciting things. shopping and restaurant here was very excellent!
Nice clean beach, great for bike rides - some nice eateries nearby The Pier is OK - probably best for families

column2: Cali beach, fun place ... where every waiter wants to be an actor :)
column3: Santa Monica is a great place to visit. It's pretty relaxed and fun. It seems that almost every waiter or waitress you meet , is an inspiring actor :) The Area has many fun places to drink, eat, shop and people watch. I love people watching on the board walk to the sand. So many people, from so many places. It's like a special spot away from the plastic masks city of L.A. You don't have to carry a Louie purse to fit in in Santa Monica to fit in. I have been to the L.A. area many times and I keep on going back. The brown you find here... is the sand between your toes!

column2: Even in foggy weather it is a place you have to see
column3: Well, it was fog @morning but have to see Road 66 end point which is located here. We have park in the Santa Monica town parking house but there is a big parking on the beach as well. We did it in the city as planned to do some shopping later. But if you do that (not shopping but parking) and approach to the beach by walk you can enjoy very biec views on the beach from the walk.Pier itself is very big, at least what i've seen. There is a sing of Road 66 and at the end a shop related to Road 66. Lot of stands with souvenirs and food, but beside of it, not much interesting. Just enjoy the view and place where you are. I think that's the best you can do there.And there is a parking on the pier as well.

column2: Volleyball, bike trail, sun, and sand
column3: Attended a volleyball tournament. Plenty of parking in the public lots, as we arrived before 9 am. Good volleyball area, nice clean beach, fun to watch a street hockey game too.

column2: People galore - but fun!!! Yummy mexican restaurant at the end!
column3: Good food, decent portion sizes, a little pricey but it's because it's on the end of the pier, great views of course!

column2: sea and beach. What did you expect more?
column3: The day when we went there was shinny but cold, so we didn't spent much time on the beach, which is a wonderful one.
Come here to experience the beautiful pier, see the beach and do some serious people watching. Great shopping area within walking distance. True LA.

Very calm, beautiful and attractive. Right place for people willing to relax amidst the light-feel offered by the simplicity of the seascape here.Similar to many other beaches in CA, you can hire bikes or walk on the broad walk area but this is the most peaceful beach I have visited in LA. Enjoyed the sea breeze and sunshine.

Walking around the pier and beach area is fun with lots to do and see. It's also a very easy walk into Santa Monica itself for shopping and more restaurants. Hire a bike and ride up to Venice Beach. The whole area is a place I would never get sick of.
Probably one of the best neighborhoods in LA. The pier itself is worth visiting.One of our best days in LA was spent here.

Well worth getting here and walking about for a day. It has everything from peace and quiet through interesting encounters to crowd mingling. The view of the ocean is great and the pier is a cool touristy walk
The beach is nice and along the wooden pier you can find restaurants, musicians, fishermen. There is a big parking place near the pier.

column2: My backyard...iconic, beautiful Santa Monica Bay
column3: I just love this place. I feel so blessed to live in Santa Monica. Steeped in history (all the old movie stars and people like William Randolph Hearst and studio heads lived in mansions on this strand), Santa Monica bay is simply beautiful. The beauty changes day to day...one day the sun sparkling on the water, one day a tempestuous slate grey, one day deserted...save a flock of seagulls...one day filled with people swimming, frisbeeing and flying colorful kites. It is always has been and always will be a 'destination' for me.

If you're in the area for a visit and want to see the ocean, chose Santa Monica over Venice Beach!! The pier was fun, typically priced touristy stuff with artists of varying talent and tenacity. $8 to ride the ferris wheel.The beach was clean and was populated mostly by tourists.
Something for everyone. Beach, food, rides, arcades, midway games, shopping. A family place to visit. Does have crowds. Easy to spend money with the variety.
The beach is beautiful! If you have time, wait for the sunset! The bars around are nice! You can also take a walk to the shopping mall nearby.

Living a few blocks from the ocean, I never tire of the view and the sunsets. Viewing from Palisades Park ( The walkway park at the end of Santa Monica- Ocean Blvd) you see the pier and Palos Verdes on the left and on a clear day= Catalina. On your right is the sweeping view of Malibu with the hills above. An below, miles of sandy beaches with walkways and bike paths Nature at its best.
The surf is good, sunsets are amazing, nice vibe, and water is nice. Water is cold but in the hot summer it feels nice. In winter bring a wetsuit but you will be fine if you don't have one.

column2: Nice place to get away from it all
column3: Great to have a bit of space and room to breathe after being in all those tourist crowds. Yes, there are people but it's not crowded especially if you walk a bit further up or down from the pier. Most people stay within 100m of it. The sea is not really for swimming though, but you can go in. I also liked the iconic surf life saving huts!
the beach was beautiful I was told not to go there but I'm glad I ignored the advice I found it absolutely lovely though some of the bike riders were very rude
Santa Monica Pier is a must see! The water and beach is beautiful and the carnival atmosphere is festive.

Travelled down to Venice Beach and walked along Boardwalk to Santa Monica Pier. Plenty to see and do from people practising gymnastic skills to theme park. Plenty of places to eat and drink. Worth doing.
What an amazing view! Love the access to the beach! There is something for everyone here - fishing, swimming, shopping and just hanging out to enjoy the scenery.

column2: Nice pier, but restaurants can be better
column3: I'm a local and we go there just so the kids can run around. It's worth the price to buy the annual pass if you go often with the kids. they need better seafood restaurants though. There's a Baba Gump, but it's just really ok. It's pretty at night because the ferris wheel is lights up and you can see it miles away from Malibu.
It is beautiful! Took the bus to go there, from Hollywood. it was a long ride, but worth it! Loved the place!

column2: Beautiful Place to Spend an Afternoon!
column3: Here is a place to enjoy a beautiful wide beach on the Pacific Ocean. You can people-watch, eat great food, buy souvenirs, and take great photos! Everyone is friendly and you do not want to leave!

We had to come here to see the famed pier and beach. We took the Big Blue Bus #12 from our hotel for $1 each (1 hour ride). The beach is large, but I can imagine it fills quickly. It was a shame there was so much litter everywhere. You'd think CA would be better. We waded into the water, and man, was it cold! I knew it would be but just had to dip my toes in the Pacific. It was very fishy smelling that day. I didn't care for the sand as it reminded me of the mix between southern USA dirt & soft clay when wet. Really hard to get off, & there was 1 shower to rinse with no foot rinser.
The beach here is an amazing getaway. Fun for the whole family no matter their age. Restraunts are located all around the beach which makes it even easier to spend the day there.

Walk to the end of the pier to see how many tourists there are in LA. Excellent views. Go early morning for peaceful sea views. Wooden board walk on the sand for your tourist photo of the pier and sea.
This is a great way for to spend an afternoon. They even have rides and things for children to do. I even saw people fishing from the pier.
Santa Monica pier is a touch of east coast Jersey shore. although this one extends outward over the water. It does have arcades food and some entretainment

The wind was strong and the day was cold, but it was a pleasant walk along the beach and pier of Santa Monica. There were many eateries and games to keep people occupied, besides a shopping mall up the street.

We had an 8 hour layover in LA so on the advice of the Info Centre lady at the airport we grabbed a bus to Santa Monica. Good choice as we got to see the sights as we went along. When we got off we walked down through a mall to the beach which was exactly as it is in the photos. It was getting close to dusk so major rush to get photos. We walked down to the pier and looked around all the attractions, had photo taken with the Route 66 sign and police cruiser among many. The beach looked enticing but we ran out of daylight before we could down to it. Then it was time to find a bus stop and head back to LAX.It was fun even with the limited time as Santa Monica is an iconic destination and it was great just to have seen it
This place is simply terrific. You can't go home without a walk on the santa Monica beach. It is simply amazing

Is there a tourist who has not taken a selfie from the edge of Palisades Park, overlooking the bay? It's the iconic LA/Santa Monica tourist photo, because it's beautiful. Also the very broad Santa Monica beach is a spacious summer haven, with its huge pier, many restaurants and bike rentals. And, by summer 2016 you can get to it by light rail. No need to worry about parking or crowded freeways, but maybe a crowded beach.

My friend and I wanted to do some shopping in Santa Monica but also wanted to see the pier so we wound up parking down at the pier (I remember thinking that the parking wasn't overly expensive). The Ferris Wheel wasn't running when we got there (10am-ish) but was when we were leaving (3pm). It was windy the day we went, lots of hats flying around! It's a fun place to see, but I'm not sure I could hang out at the pier for ages.The beach there is gorgeous, stunning views, close to good shopping and lots of restaurants.

column2: Timelass charm never fails to impress
column3: Night time on the pier, at the fun fair, riding the roller coaster, the obligatory photo under the Route 66 sign, the buskers, - ah, it hasn't changed and thank heavens for that. The beach at sunset is just magnificent.

column2: Nice place for an afternoon out
column3: The Santa Monica pier offers great views over the Pacific ocean and includes a variety of amusement rides and multiple restaurants to enjoy the local seafood and other delights.

the pier here is what the classic california image any tourist has.the best beach in la. great sand sun and a beautiful peppy crowd. great for a swim or a game and wonderful places to eat across the street.all baywatch fans need to go here for sure!

column2: Huge and great beaches..to enjoy with amazing views.
column3: Extensive beaches with great views.of the mountins and sorroundings.Beaches are Clean with a lot of parking spaces and Clean bathrooms.Between the beaches and parking lots there is a long boardwalk where you can. Bike, walk,run,,etc You can see people locals or tourists from everywhere Sitting over there you can hear a lot of different languages talked.There is a nice Pier with restaurants and attractions and few coffes along the way..Come summer or winter and enjoy the beach and the views..and great people around

column2: Fun and Relaxing...all in one place
column3: Santa Monica Bay is a nice place to go. You can relax by the water and watch the surfers do their thing. Or head up to the pier to shop, eat, or play. Lots of good cafes nearby and much cleaner/safer than nearby Venice Beach.
With a baby blue Southern California sky, you can't beat a trip to the Santa Monica Bay (and the Pier). Definitely worth it just to say that you've been there.
It is def. the best/most beautiful beach in LA. Santa Monica pier is just awesome and its nearby beautiful streets and good restaurants/high fashion stores. I loved Santa Monica.
One of my fav. beaches in LA area.Nice atmosphere, very clean, lots of fun attractions on the pier.

column2: Fun in the sun and on the pier
column3: Santa Monica Beach and Pier, and Muscle Beach are great places to relax, enjoy the beach and the pier rides, or meet friends for a walk or a talk. We were there in the off season, so it wasn't too crowded or too warm. Lovely experience and inexpensive parking right on the pier.
we took a rive there, it was pretty windy' very beautiful at night time but cold' well November so there is some logic... take wind cout you will not regret it
A venue good for warmer weather, it brought back echos of The Beach Boys and Surfer Girls! The beach is bordered by Santa Monica Pier, Muscle Beach and the interesting characters of Venice Beach.
We walked along the board walk and looked at the scenery, the sunset was beautiful, people had there children with them :)

Enjoy the sunshine with sea breeze, have some fun in the games booth and rides. Surely this is a good place for teens, couples, family or even solo. We saw the sea lion swimming too, keep your eyes open and look for them! This is just so California.
A can't miss stop if you're visiting LA. Ranges from tacky boardwalk to wonderful and elegant hotels and dining spots.

column2: ***** Very nice place to be at when in LA *****
column3: Do not miss any chance to visit Santa Monica beach. Beautiful place and clean beach.Very Very happening and youthful place, with young and beautiful people. Also a good place to be with family.Beach sports are also available, though you would have to walk a bit long to actually reach the pier. But the view from the pier is definitely worth it.Just get in the beach wear, and hit this place... Totally Recommended.

We stayed on Ocean Avenue overlooking the bay. Absolutely wonderful. We spent many hours walking along the boardwalks and cliff top paths. Great views also.The walk from the Pier to Venice Beach is about 4 kms, an easy walk along the boardwalk.A trip out on the Pier is worthwhile. It is the end/ beginning of Route 66.There are plenty of eateries in the area from Cafes to fine dining.

I love Santa Monica Bay. I feel so relaxed coming here. I can enjoy walking along the pier and beach. It's a very nice scenery here to take pictures. You can buy some food or snacks in Santa Monica Pier too. I really enjoyed coming here. This is the place in LA that I will be visiting again next time.

column2: been coming since I was small
column3: This was pretty much the only beach I ever went to when I was small, I used to love it so much. Actually, I still do. We try to go a lot over the summer and visit Pacific Park, it's fun for the family!
Enjoyed the walk along the beach, great shopping just off the beach and great atmosphere and places to eat

We always take our out of town guests here especially if they have kids. It's great day or night. We don't usually eat at the restaurants, we don't find the food that good, but we ride the rides and play the games.

column2: What can I, it's a nice fun place to visit
column3: Go and visit, walk the boardwalk, go to the amusement park, take a dip, stop for a picture at Bubba Gump. Whatever you fancy, take the time and go. It's fun and the kids will definitely enjoy it.
I lived in Marina del Rey and always loved going to Santa Monica Bay. Find a good place to park and enjoy!

column2: Such a broad beach with lots of walking to do on a beautiful day
column3: While the breadth of this beach varies with the tides and with the global warming, it remains a wonderful feature on the west side of Santa Monica. The California Grade - the approach down from the north part of Santa Monica appears currently to be under construction.
this place is neat...the views are awesome. beaches are amazing and magazine like. makes you want to live there until you find out the cost.
This is where a lot of Baywatch was filmed, massive beaches with people just chilling out. The peir is cool and is the end of Route 66

column2: take the family to the beach
column3: The santa monica pier is always an enjoyable place to go. Even if it is a cloudy day, you can walk on the pier and sit and eat in one of the restaurants. Bring your cash because it can get pricey if you have the kids!
As I know, safety is not secured in LA. However, I could enjoy the street within this area without any risks.
It's just a 30 minute drive from LA and you can enjoy the lovely beach and an amazing amusement park!

column2: Loved the place, great eating places and lovely beaches, walks etc.
column3: Loved it here, it was busy as it was a bank holiday weekend, the pier is lovely, plenty of stalls things to do and eating places. We ate at Bubba Gumps the food was great. Would visit again if back in LA.

column2: An evening at The Santa Monica Bay is Memorable !
column3: An evening at the Santa Monica Bay makes for a lovely evening.Walk along the lovely beach and enjoy the activities at the Pier. Enjoy a ride on the Pacific Wheel,the solar powered Ferris wheel,that gives a breathtaking panoramic view of the Southern California coastline from 130 feet above.

One of the best and easily accessible beaches in LA. Lots of parking lots along the coast and tons of additional sites in the area. (walkable to 3rd street promenade, Santa Monica Place Mall and tons of great restaurants along Ocean Ave.
This beach is marvelous. It's huge, beautiful, the pier is legendary, and a ride on the big wheel is great experience. If in the area, go there! You can also swim and lay on the sand, it is perfect!
A laid back beach area that was family friendly. Santa Monica had a very relaxing vibe to it, lots of food options and shopping
The most breathtaking beach i have visited in a while The Pier was fun with rides and games and lovely views out to the ocean. We shopped on the promenade and had a dip in the sea to cool off.
It looks even more awesome than in the movies (of course)! Don't miss the chance to spend some time on the pier!

This is a very pretty area , Do not be shocked over the homeless people there are many in the area , ( we cant help them all :( The beaches do not have Shells so if you are looking for them you would have no luck on the beach . Lots of pretty sky lines to look at and lots of cluster apartments . Lots of people , traffic was not too bad getting in Parking is not cheap .
On a hot LA day Santa Monica is the place to be. The pier is great to stroll around and take in the view. Santa Monica is an interesting place to be. Great to people watch.

column2: Do it Do it..Just Do it!
column3: The land of Baywatch! The Pier (Beginning of Route 66)..The walk, the sunbathe, the splash in the ocean..You can't miss out this vital part of LA!
My wife and I and Teen kids enjoyed a morning in Santa Monica. Interesting shops, the pier is easily recognized from many movies we've seen. A bit tame on the rollercoaster, but enough for me!
Lovely clean beach. White sand. Lots to do and see at the pie. Plenty of touristy shops. Funfair for young and older. Big wheel at the top of which you can see for miles along the Pacific coastline.

Santa Monica beach and pier are classic LA destinations. It is crowded, parking can be difficult, but it is worth it. This is a well-kept family-friendly beach. You can spend hours walking south to more colorful Venice. Here, gawk at the body builders, the skate boarders and the medicinal marijuana doctors. Head away from the beach for a couple block and fantasize about living on the artificial canals, then hike back to Santa Monica. Takes hours to see it all, but a great LA experience.
the view is just worth the walk and also they have parking areas near the beach or you can use public parking near the beach
Just an excellent destination in LA to spend a day or so. Beach is nice, pier is iconic, many places to eat around

Santa Monica is a great escape from downtown LA. The beaches are spacious and the pier has some great restaurants and activities on it, including the Route 66 sign. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.
Nice enough, but crowded, tough to drive to and park, a bit cheesy especially the pier. Better off doing other things nearby and visiting the beach down sour.

I grew up here and am an expert on this area. The public transportation to get here is easy. The pier, S.M. Place and the 3rd St. Promenade all all happening places. Lots of restaurants, bars and shopping for any thing your heart desires. Also Bike rentals, skate rentals, boogie boards,SUP boards,surfboards etc to add to your enjoyment along the beach which is clean. Has a boardwalk and a bike path that runs from the area north to Pacific Palisades to The south to Redondo Beach.
We found this beach along with muscle beach it's beautiful and clean, we had a walk on the pier too was lovely

From Zoltar the fortune teller to pinball. the Santa Monica Pier has it all. It was like being at a mini carnival. The fair rides, the hot dogs, the vendors, everything. I loved it! bought a new floppy beach hat to protect my fair weather Michigan skin and stared out over the railing at the ocean. Gorgeous. Go out and enjoy it. One more off the bucket list. Oh and the actual parking lot on the boardwalk is a little freaky. It squeaks and sways as the cars drive on it.

My brother and I went down to Santa Monica on Thursday, October 29, and it was just wonderful! It was a perfectly sunny day. Blue skies. Sunshine. Not a cloud in the sky. On the way back, I stopped off at the Santa Monica Police Substation on the Pier because I needed assistance to get over the bridge to Ocean Avenue. The police officer there was very nice, professional, kind, and very sympathetic to my situation. Santa Monica is my favorite beach resort, and I would like to go there again someday.

column2: Nice beach and pier for an afternoon walk
column3: Lots of restaurant options all around and really great view of the mountains. The pier has rides which we didn't go on but it looks really nice. It's not an all day place to visit as u can see the whole thing pretty quick.
This place has so much to offer. I enjoyed learning about Popeye and how he came to be. There was a good variety of food to choose from and the Route 66 ends here.

We visited Santa Monica for the day and took a bike ride along the bike trail , it is a lovely day out but as a warning there are A LOT of homeless people so please don't not stay near the beach of a night time
Just did a quick stop at the pier to see what all the hype is about , and it was worth every minute. Live entertainment, loads for kids to do. Good restaurants and ice cream, a must see.

We visited the Santa Monica pier area recently. Because of the traffic and our inexperience at driving in it we wanted to drive early. We arrived, got parked, and walked to the beach for sun rise. It was beautiful. We walked on the pier area and spent time in the park adjacent to the beach. We really enjoyed the area. It was a beautiful beach.

column2: It is sort of a must visit isn't it?
column3: I visited here on a very windy day so maybe not the best time to go... but the area is beautiful. The park on the pier looks just like it does on TV. Good for the visit.
I drove from LA to santa monica and it was freshening and beautifulRelaxing and soothing breezeBeautiful weather and site

column2: Great Beach Location Close to Los Angeles
column3: Santa Monica is a great place to visit. Start your day by visiting Jinky's Restaurant for one of the best breakfast's in the Santa Monica area. Next enjoy shopping at the mall and all of the surrounding stores. (There is even a huge TJ Maxx in the area that has a huge selection). End your day by watching one of the most beautiful sunsets in the world out on the Pier or spoil yourself and enjoy a world-class dinner at Ivy on the Beach. Love this place!
The beach is huge and there are so many people just enjoying their day, jogging walking etc. Plenty of room and restaurants. Beautiful views and peace
Lovely place to visit, lovely beach. Lots to do and see on the Pier, lots of souvenirs to buy and good eating places. A must to do!

column2: Beach with lot of variety and entertainment
column3: This is one of the really beautiful beach with multiple themed beaches nearby. For entertainment and small shopping shops are there.
Fell in love with this place instantly - fans of the film Lost Boys may see some similarities but seriously it's a great beach, clean and absolutely beautiful.

column2: A little touristy but still nice
column3: I wanted my daughter to see the Pacific Ocean during our visit to LA, so Santa Monica was a logical choice. There is easy parking nearby, and lots of restaurants to choose from both on the pier and in town.

column2: Santa Monica Pier in Nov was buzzing!
column3: I was here with my daughter on Thanksgiving 2014 and considering we came from New York where it was snowing to Santa Monica and it was 28 degrees and people were swimming. The pier was packed and the weather was superb so there was a great atmosphere. We saw a frolicking seal near the pier and we had seafood before heading to the airport to fly home that evening. Definitely a place you can see in a couple of hours but there is plenty to do in such a small area. There are rides, stalls and restaurants and it is obviously very touristy but that's the whole point, right? I'm heading back in Dec so I'll be visiting the pier once again.
Santa Monica is a must see if you are nearby. The beach is lovely, the pier is god fun and there are plenty of shops/restaurants nearby.
Schedule a day to walk along the beach in Santa Monica. It is very beautiful and there is much to see and do.

After a very hot day in LA this was a great place to end up. There was a cool breeze on the pier and very relaxing to walk and people watch. During lunch we had a window view of the ocean and pier. Great adventure!
Santa Monica is a lovely place to visit. It has something for everyone, lots of shops, a beautiful beach and pier.Our time was limited in Santa Monica but I would definitely return in the future.

Had a great day at the Pier and beach before next day departure on a cruise. A true landmark, and captures a time period gone by. Very well maintained, but expect touristy shops and restaurants. Immaculate public bathrooms! A terrific mix of people enjoying the fun of the attractions.

column2: Day tour of LA Including the Santa Monica Pier
column3: It was awesome and our guide gave us lots of time to experience the culture. We enjoyed the total pier and ate some goodies.

I was particularly impressed with a boardwalk on the sand for disabled people. The pier was old world style entertainment with the ferris wheel and trapese artists. Interesting that it is the end of Route 66. Plenty of eating styles to choose from.
This beach is a nice place to go for a stroll along the beach.The beach is clean and we had a lovley walk along the sea to the peir.

column2: Enjoyed a day in the Sun at Santa Monica Bay Beach
column3: We traveled by public transportation to Santa Monica Bay Beach. I was a hot day but there was a breeze. We only put our feet in the water and it is cold. Note: you have to walk down a steep hill to get to the beach. Walking up would be a slight problem for those with walking issues.

column2: Beautiful sunset and you can tell exercising is a lifestyle there
column3: It was a cloudy and drizzling day when we visited the beach. It was quite windy there. People were doing different sports, such as yoga, etc. You could tell it's simply a lifestyle of L.A. We were wishing to watch the sunset, so we kept praying for the sky to get clearer. It didn't, but we still got to see an amazing sunset. Wonder what it would look like when it's all clear.
The Santa Monica Bay is family friendly, inexpensive place to visit. The pier has lots to do for bigger budgets.
