Really nice beach, no smoking or pets allowed. Load of parking nearby and you also have the Santa Monica pier nearby.

We drove to the end of Route 66 and enjoyed some time by the pier. You only need an hour or so unless you are going to the beach. The pier has some shops and a few places to eat but I thought the highlight was the Ferris Wheel. When you begin to go around on it you get an amazing view of the pier, the town and the beach and they let you go around quite a few times so you can get pics. The beach was nice. The sand was clean and the water clear. We had a great time. FYI: it is very touristy and crowded and most of he food is fast food.

I love visiting Los Angeles, and because I have a son living there, I go frequently. The Santa Monica Pier is amazing. The beach is huge (much larger than any on the East Coast that I have visited) and the walkways and paths are great. There is so much energy there. I could easily live in Santa Monica (if I could afford it):)
Great place to relax and people watch. You can spend the whole day enjoying the views and sounds. Just remember to bring a lot of sun block.

column2: Beautiful but crowded and driving is awful
column3: Take bus here is recommended since driving around here and parking is hard to find.Each time we drove pass Santa Monica towards Malibu was a nightmare. Personally I love to eat around here, but prefer to go to quieter and less crowded beaches away from the tourist area. There are so many beached along the coast that are so beautiful and fun to enjoy.

we spent a really nice day at Santa Monica Beach, the atmosphere was lovely and there was plenty going on along the pier and the promenade. The only thing that spoilt it was leaving a bag containing gifts that we had bought in the restaurant where we had lunch!!

This is as far as you can go on Route 66. As you look out you can see where Baywatch was filmed, there is a lot of touristy stuff to do and see or you can just stand and take in the view and people watch.

As part of our Los Angeles experience we could not miss Santa Monica with its pier, seafront, beaches, sunsets and roller bladers. Not to mention the open top cars. Stroll around and check out the many cocktail bars.
A must for all travellers to LA, fantastic views and entertainment everywhere, will definitely return on our next trip
Big beach, free showers.Plenty of restaurants and gift shops on the pier.It is one of the must see places when you go to LA.Get here taking the 733 bus, from Union Station.
Nice clean beach to relax or go for a walk. You can eat / drink on the pier or go into the amusement park. Easy to get to. Recommended
The beach looked clean and inviting but the pier was junky, noisy and so old. Not the tourist destination it is famous for,

column2: Best place for a walk or jog at sunrise
column3: I was walking along the beach north of the pier about 7am when I came across a sea lion so I took a few pics and enjoyed the wild life!

Glad we went here but it was surprisingly grotty with lots of homeless people lying around. We arrived quite early in the day (about 9:30) and have heard that the place only comes alive around midday. Maybe if we had gone later we would have enjoyed it more. Was good to see the iconic muscle beach, the skate bowl and the pier though.

column2: Keep your eyes open and you wits about you!
column3: The Bay is stunning and the walk from Venice to the Santa Monica Pier, really gives you an insight of what going on, but make sure that you keep your eyes open and your wits about you, as an American Smile may cost you more that you bargained for! As long as you are aware of your surroundings, you will have a ball, get your camera ready.
if i was staying in la again it would be here i would stay here along the bay area as it is a nice area.
Great beach, shops, restaurants. It was lovely to visit and a great way to spend a day, so allow plenty of time.
Nice atmosphere. Food, drinks and rides. Nice family or couples atmosphere. Nice to just sit and people watch or ride the rides and a nice walk on the beach.
This place was awesome, the beach, the pier, and everything around, it's awesome... Anyone who visits L.A. shouldn't miss this area...

column2: Beautiful place with a lot of attractions and good food
column3: A great destination when visiting southern California. Santa Monica pier sits on,this beach and offers live entertainment and good food. A great place to spend the day!

I come to Santa Monica several times a year. It is one of my favorite places on Earth believe it or not. Mainly because it is close to home but it has everything I love. The beach is phenomenal, the playgrounds are great, The Pier! With all the rides and food along with countless events throughout the year there is always something to do...and if you like to shop there is world class shopping and dining within walking. The views are amazing. The only thing that I would say is that sometimes the water is not safe to go in and they put signs up...With such a large amount of people close to the coast, it's no winder why....but I still give it five because the water is usually not where I hang out and when I do, I just go down towards Venice or up to Malibu where its secluded.

Busy beach and pier but worth the stop , 12 dollars to park , worth a walk about , bubba gump shrimp co for drinks, meal and souvenir , Forrest Gump memories, take a photo by the sign end of Route 66..

easy to park, don't forget change if you have your car, i like walking by the pier and take some pictures :), the beach is nice and clean i bring some food to do a picnic be careful with the pelicans they like to be sneaky and try to eat your ships :)

column2: Just like a good pier in England.
column3: The pier at Santa Monica is worthy of its iconic status. We especially liked the Route 66 sign at the beginning of the pier - just as a group of UK motorcyclists finished their journey.

My friends and I went on a Tuesday afternoon. I'm from Florida, and I've been to many beaches in my day. This one was lovely. Lots of room, decent amount of parking, and of course the pier with plenty to do.
A lovely town. We went in the evening and the atmosphere was brilliant, take a trip out onto the pier and see the sign!
Santa Monica Bay is another one of my Los Angeles favorite places to visit. What more can you ask for with having the bay, beach, great food and shopping all in one place.
Really great atmosphere walking along the pier, ice cream in hand and other hand in the hand if significant other. Ferris wheel ride, dogs, people and a happy atmosphere

column2: One of my favorite places in So Cal
column3: This place contains many tourists from all over the world. There is so much to do and see here. From the Santa Monica Place (Mall), downtown Santa Monica, Pacific Park, trail to Venice Beach, this place is one of my favorite places to visit. The food can be a little pricey but there is so much to choose from. The beaches are clean with many activities such as hiking, biking, and volleyball. It is a must go visit place.
We loved this area. Great to walk down the Santa Monica pier as seen in the countless films and see where Route 66 ends! The sea was very rough and beware of the currents.

What a great way to spend an afternoon! If you're staying in downtown LA take a taxi to the Santa Monica Promenade and walk to the Pier. Besides the shops and restaurants you'll see various performers and musicians. Catch a cool breeze on the pier, ride some carnival amusements or watch planes from LAX take off into the sunset. Great for families, friends or a romantic stroll.

lovely pier and day out beach is sandy and golden , my husband sat with hiss feet in Forest Gumps shoes outside of Bubby shrimp which was funny, had musical groups playing on the pier which was good and the music was very good saw a seal around where people were fishing off the pier and it was waiting for the fishermen to throw back the heads and tails to it once they had gutted the fish they add caught it was just nice sitting and people watching, the other thing we saw was a pig being walked in the sand
Walked all the way to the end of the pier, a very hot day but plenty to see and do, colourful and fun. Got a fab banana split too, a must see

Shopping is pretty decent, not too busy and pretty much all of the stores you would want. The bay is pretty, and the sunset was lovely. The pier by night makes for a great photo opportunity - it's instantly recognisable. Drive up the pacific coast highway to Malibu while you're around that area, worth a visit from pier to pier.
Great day walking both Santa Monica and Venus Beaches. Did 4.2 miles. Came back to the Pier in time to catch the sunset. There is a new garden park just near Main St and Colorado.

column2: Santa Monica Bay is a great walking/shopping area, but do not go in the water
column3: A beautiful stretch of beach, walking, biking areas, paired with shopping and sea food, but do not swim in the ocean because the bay has been contaminated with sewage too long. It is not helthy
Beautiful Beach. Has a lovely sandy beach lots of attractions to see and do also a safe walk way along the beach. has shops and restaurants close by if you want a snack.perfect for a day out

When we arrived on Santa Monica Pier there was a chap being arrested by police for driving his car on the pier in the middle of the day, that was interesting. Overall great place for kids, teens and adults, rides available, restaurants etc.

As an Angelino, I've been to Santa Monica countless times. But I am always amazed at how much my friends who visit from out of town love this place. The pier is obviously the best attraction, it has an amusement park, restaurants, gift shops, and there is a lot of people from all over the world. Since many tv, music videos and movies have been filmed here, my friends from out town enjoy it much more when I show them the spots where these were filmed and they take a picture there. To top the experience, have a few margaritas as you watch the sunset.

If you visit LA, this is definitely worth a visit. Like the bay view in Mumbai, this affords a "string of pearls" view at night and a beautiful view of the bay during the day. There are lovely homes, great restaurants of all kinds, many cultural venues and just about everything a city can offer plus beaches and beach weather all year round.

Every time I've visited Santa Monica, I've always found the beaches very clean and well respected. There's plenty to see, within walking distance of the beach. Plenty of places to have lunch and just a short way from Venice.Would recommend walking along the pier for the views and visiting the British pub not too far away called Ye Olde Kings Head!

Keep on driving North on the Pacific Coast Highway. You'll reach Malibu Beach in about 20 minutes which has a longer and much nicer beach. Continue another 10 minutes and you'll be in Zuma Beach. Next to Huntington, which is much further south, Zuma is one of the nicer beaches in Southern California. It's the middle of October here now and about 90 degrees in the sun.
Santa Monica Pier was very interesting. A typical amusement pier but a lot more nostalgic. It is the end of Route 66 and there is a little "museum" at the end. Lots of souvenier shops and junk food.

We arrived in Los Angeles from New York and immediately went to the Pier. We took all the iconic photos and parking was easy to find not that far away. There were tons of food vendors and we ate the fresh tamales we saw right on the pier. Clearly its also a place for children as there were swings and things for them to do on the beach. I didnt have my son in tow but its on his list of places to visit next year.

This area could be considered a tourist trap, or as a fun day to spend money doing the things you can`t or don`t do at home. Also the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier has decent food and great frozen margaritas

The beach here is very good. The Pier has a small amusement park and small restaurants. There are a lot of souvenirs stores. The mall at Santa M贸nica has a lot of store, most of them expensive brands, but it is a good place to walk around and grab something to eat.

We visited Santa Monica largely because of it's main attraction The Pier. The Pier is definitely the happening area with it's range of activities and restaurants. We enjoyed Happy Hour drinks whilst watching the sunset from the pier. The beach & bay are magnificent though....such a wide beach that I never expected. Beautiful.
it was pristine and very nice beach loved the ambience and surrounding on my day trip tot he monica baywould like to spend a night in my next trip
I have been wanting to go here for years and finally made it out. I thought there would be a lot more than what I saw, but then again maybe there was and I just didn't see it. Had fun on the pier.
Santa Monica is a great spot, of course its touristy. We went here on the hop on and hop off bus. Lots of people here with lots of shops and restaurants. Great place to spend a nice sunny day!

Really loved this place ,it has a fantastic beach and coastline ,had to have a paddle while I was there.Then went for a walk on the pier which was very enjoyable with lots of shops and restaurants. The highlight was standing next to the end of route 66 on the pier.
Love Santa Monica Bay & pier. Go there every time I visit LA. It is very touristy yet a wonderful exposure to the beauty of the water. Great people watching too!

Well this was far, far below what I expected. This pier is an amusement park....I guess I should have done more reading before I walked all the way there....ah well, lesson learned. However, walking along the boardwalk was an experience to behold. Tons of very strange folk to see.

column2: Wonderful C Shaped Bay for LA ....
column3: The Bay stretches for so long that it's claimed by each of the town / areas that it touches. Stretching all the way from Palos Verdes to Point Dume, with lots in between. Enjoy some of the best deep white sand beaches in the world ...

This is so worth a trip to Santa Monica beautiful place with a great vibe. We spent the day just wandering the shops and walking along the pier which is a real carnival atmosphere. the Ferris Wheel gives you a fantastic view of Santa Monica beach. The day we were there was extremely hot so we had to buy a hat like a lot of others, so the hat people were making a killing that day. We had lunch at Bubba Gumps and it was nice and they have a fantastic view over the beach. You won't be disappointed. We caught the local bus for $1 each way from Fox Studio's.

Its full of life and full of people! The pier is beautiful and takes you right up to the sea where you can watch people fishing or fish yourself The seagulls hover! There is good food around! Artists abound, all wanting to make a portrait or you, or better a caricature! You can join the trapeze artists and get trained! And you could just watch the waves roll by and the evening descend quietly! Beautiful!
The Pier is well worth the visit. Very touristy, lots of souvenier stalls on the Pier and accessible from the Hop On Hop Off Bus route.

Beautiful bay on LA's west side. The air is much less polluted here than the rest of LA because of the prevailing westerly sea breezes. Wonderful climate, if you don't mind morning and afternoon fog (hey, it's clear for two or three hours almost every day!). The bay water is cold most of the year (56-68 degrees), but there is a huge and wide sandy beach, which is perfect for posing. I especially like the long, wide bicycle/running/rollerblading trail along the edge of the sand and road.
a must see at least once, so many movies references, and the carousel a must see, bubba gump shrimp also good
Always try and get to this area when I visit LA as its in such contrast to the rest of the city and it provides a relaxing break from the traffic - if you can find a place to park !

A good experience filled with people, but if you're looking for a quiet time along the beach I wouldn't recommend coming here. It can be crowded with people and kids so that diminishes from the experience. You can rent bicycles and ride along the coastline to visit the other beaches; each beach has its unique flavor.
What a day on the beach! You can tan on the beach or take a bike ride along the boardwalk and see the sights like muscle beach and Venice beach. Or take a stroll on the Santa Monica pier.
Amazing beach, very clean, lots of places to eat. There are play and exercise areas all along the front and a great cycle path that keeps pedestrians safe.
Beautiful place but was very busy while we were there as it was a public holiday. Well worth a visit.

column2: Not quite Baywatch, but that's a good thing.
column3: Nice beach. Not quite what I expected having come from Australia. The water is calm and there are plenty of life guards about. There is a lot of beach so you will find a place to base yourself. The underside of the piers is worth seeing from a historical, cultural and design point of view.

column2: Santa Monica Bay/Pier - something for everyone
column3: Perfect place to stroll, dine, play, shop and just people watch. And of course view sunrise, sunset, surfers, boogie boarders, sun bathers, fishing, dolphins and sometimes whales.

column2: day for soaking up the sun
column3: You've just got to go there to say you've been, think Baywatch!. In a travel holiday it's probably the one best area to go and soak up the sun. Parking on the beach was only $12 for the day. Sea was a bit rough if you have young kids, surf was up!

column2: The Beach of my Child hood
column3: While this beach can be crowded and at times dirty there is a wonderful pier with many attractions and a historic Merry go round. The board walk to Venice is not long and is very nice
Clean, hot, all life can be seen here . Truly beautiful beach. The pier is fun, and wonderful shopping very close by. Very friendly place.
It is so nice there! It is crowded there, but that was not an issue. There are street artists, restaurants (famous and expensive ones) and a great view,
great place for adults and chidren.....lots to do on the pier...midway....booths restaurants....sand and water

Beautiful long and wide beach, and totally a tourist trap, though I think it's a must to go here! We went to the pier and it was so crowded but we found a lot of talanted people playing and singing along the pier. We also had lunch at the Bubba Gump Shrimps - you need to apply to their waiting list in advance to get a table - approximately 30-60 minutes later. I will definitely go to Santa Monica Bay again to have some more time to explore the surroundings.

Enjoyed our short stay at Santa Monica Pier as part of our LA Private tour, we enjoy fish and chips on the Pier and loved people watching, was our favourite part and the beach is amazing, a great time had by us all, hopefully we will be back...loved the Welcome to Famous Santa Monica Pier and the sign for the end of Route 66

gorgeous clean sandy beach - plenty to do - pier very busy but we did visit labour day weekend. fantastic views from the pier lovely old fashioned merry go round if i visited again would be during week hoping for it to be a bit quieter, plenty of street entertainers around also
A great expanse of sand - you can be near people or isolated from them - the choice is yours! Wherever you go, you arent far from a cafe as well
Very pleasant location; vibrant with an excellent fully functioning pier. There are lots of activities appropriate for a wide age range.

This is a popular beach that can get very busy, but is a must see. Great fun to walk over the pier and see the stall along the way. Don't forget to buy an icy lemonade before venturing up the hill back to the main road.
clean, warm water, a lot of surf boarders to watch out for. Parking $12.00 I feel was too expensive.

I would really love to see what type of beaches someone is used to who considers this ordinary. I live in Australia where we are blessed with some pretty amazing beaches but I have to say that I have never seen such an incredible expanse of sand on the beach than that at Santa Monica Bay. The sand is fine white sand and very clean. The beach had a large number of people on it but because the beach and bay covers such a large area, it didn't feel like they were all crammed together. You shouldn't come to Santa Monica without having a walk along Santa Monica Bay and walking down onto the beautiful clean beach.
Beautiful area. Would book hotel in this area and visit Hollywood from here. Much nicer area than Hollywood B.L.V.D.

is a regular beach nothing especial, just the diferencie is what is around , a lot rides , lights, people never sleep i guess , we went there by 3 am and still ppl walking and having fun, i wish come back in the day time, i didnt get chance to swin bc was chill,and water cold, but iis so nice have a walk around the beach.

you must go to santa monica, best place in LA , full of life, thursday and saturday night they have live concerts on the pier, amazing views when the sun goes down and the music is on. we loved venice beach too its like 20min walk on the beach from sm.
It is too busy and nothing special. Thousands people on the beach. Some with swimming suits but also many with cloths. Dirty and Chaotic.

column2: Sunshine, surf and the end of the mother road!
column3: Santa Monica has a great vibe, a beautiful beach and more than one famous landmark showing the end of historic Route 66.We spent a couple of days in LA and took the Big Blue Bus from our hotel to Santa Monica, for just one dollar. I wish we could have stayed for more than one day, and would love to go back sometime. You can easily spend a whole day relaxing on the beach, playing in the surf and choosing from the many places serving good food. We ate at Bubba Gump Shrimp Co and chose a table on the balcony so that we could watch the sunset, the perfect end to a fabulous day.
Amazing weather, tonnes of eateries and a romantic stroll! Parking near mcd if taking car,, also attended impromptu salsa night yipppee

We spent with my family and my 4 year old child the day here. Lots of things to do, we spent some time at the games and ferris wheel and got a beautiful view of the pier. Walked around the pier and the beach, had a blast. Good food around when youre hungry. Not to much trouble with the parking. Highly recommended.

column2: A sunny day in Santa Monica Pier
column3: We visited Santa Monica Bay on a sunny day in September 2015. Lots of historical sites (muscle's beach, end of 66) which are remembering us old times.
Excellent spot to take the whole family and make sure you stop at Japadog for the most amazing hot dog you will ever eat.
Beautiful place with lots to do. Also further along the beach about 3 miles you can also find Muscle Beach

column2: A great day out in the sun
column3: we spent the day here and venice beach and it was great just seeing the sights and enjoying the beach we loved it and were sad to leave
You can spend the whole day here just cruising along the boardwalk. Great views,heaps of eateries .good entertainment. We ate at one of the food trucks parked on the main road,cheap good food.

We had pretty just started our day visit to Sante Monica Pier but were evacuated due to a possibly lightning storm. Good on the authorities for being cautious. We were refunded a fair amount for the tickets we paid and had a great time on the pier otherwise. Had some fun with local bus trips and enjoyed our day in spite of the rain.
I spent the whole day at the beach here sunbathing and going on the rides at the pier. I would really recommend going here to get a great taste of LA

column2: Nice to walk along the beach
column3: We went on a Thursday so not very busy. $12 to park but I think you pay to park everywhere in LA. Beach was a little dirty with trash. May have not been busy also due to water was under a warning. The shops are pricey since most people there are tourist. Did not go on any of the rides located on the pier

column2: Cool place, a lot of homelessness but the place is sick
column3: Santa Monica is a a cool place with good surfing, body boarding, and a cool pier with bubba gump co. restaurant on it which i recommend. Muscle beach is also cool and the area is very iconic for any GTA player. A lot to do in LA but a full day allows you to see all of Santa Monica

column2: The pier is fun, beach great and it's a lovely walk to Venice too
column3: Santa Monica is worth a visit for anyone coming to LA. Yes allow 90 minutes to get here from downtown but once here stay for hours. Enjoy the town, the pier, the beach and views then promenade to Venice for the eccentricities. TIP. Take train to Santa Monica and Vermont then bus 704 takes about 80 minutes to the beach. Avoid peak hour though as it will take 2 hours instead.

After being in the hustle and bustle of Los Angeles it is well worth visiting this beautiful area with a stunning beach, dramatic coastline around the bay and the amusement park on the pier. You must try the ferris wheel for some amazing views of the coastline

You can enjoy the Santa Monica Pier with its rides, arcades and antique Mary-go-Round. There is also a small UCLA aquarium under the pier. Plenty of places to eat, and you get to enjoy street performances by locals. You can do some license-free fishing at the end of the pier. If you decide to use the beach itself, stay on the left side of the pier, closer to Venice beach. The water is way cleaner, and you'll enjoy your experience much more.

Great place with lots to see and do. Miles of sands but you will need puplic transport or a car to go the full length along the coast of Santa Monica. We were short of time so stayed on the S Monica pier but even that took a couple of hours. Well worth it though.

column2: A fun day at the beach!!
column3: A fun way to spend the day at the beach. Plenty of restaurants to choose from and shops to walk through.
This beach is too crowded and too overrated. The water was extremely cold as well despite the very hot weather. Don't waster your time and search for better beaches in LA

column2: don't drive a large vehicle on pier
column3: There aren't any signs for directions so our bus drove onto pier which was a no-no so we backed up to the main st and stopped there to let us off. Typical tourist area, rides, restaurants, shops.
Crowded, difficult to find parking but all in all a nice afternoon visit to check out the view from the pier will suffice.

column2: nice to walk along the beach and see the people and the shops ;)
column3: Nice ;-) i麓m used to the sun but please dont sit in the sun more then 30 min max besause it is so Hot you will burn
Nice place to go with family and friends. Loved the beach and Santa Monica Pier.I had a great time at the Pier.Restaurants were excellent food and service.
Lots of little shops, restaurants and street entrepreneurs - kids had a blast in the sea. We visited in April 2014

Great beach, great shopping mall in Third Street with Nordstroms and Bloomingdales at one end. There is a great vibe having a car free shopping zone. A short walk away is the pier and Bubba Gumps where we always go for a cocktail and shrimps after shopping. Santa Monica is our go to place whenever we stop over in L.A.

Went to Santa a Monica to see the pier. Some thing you just have to do in La. Very touristy. Sant Monica itself was very nice. This is where I'd stay if I went back. Very clean, compared to holly walk of fame.
Awesome place to go to chill out and take it the atmosphere. The place was buzzing with people and is a great place to sit and people watch.

column2: A place must visit again and again ......
column3: Stunning view ! The beach is a best place for relaxing & dont feel want to go home after spend few hours there. Fell in love with it.

column2: Not worth it, even though you still want to see it
column3: I really looked forward to it, walking on the Santa Monica Pier.However, when I was there it was loaded with people. Couldn't even normally stand or walk somewhere.Attractions were limited, not as much as I thought.A lot of (different) food-stands, together with some souvenir-shops (bubba gump shrimps!)

Parking is $12.00/day if you park in the lot under/near the pier. This is not too bad if you plan to spend the entire day. The beach is very wide making it a decent walk to get to the water. Sunsets from this beach are beautiful and the Pier Park makes it fun as well. Lots to do. You can also pick up the Starline hop on hop off bus at the Santa Monica Pier. You have to walk back up the hill to the street. Be careful, the girls in the Starline establishment will give you wrong information in a heartbeat just to move you on. It is a clean beach and plenty of places to put yourself up for the day.

When you visit Santa Monica take time to walk along the promenade that offers a great view of the beach and the pier. It is a lively place full of people enjoying the warmth of the summer sun and the street theatre and buskers. The pier is also a fun place to visit.

We had the opportunity to visit Santa Monica Pier during our stay in Los Angeles. I think this place is a must visit when you are in LA. The parking is very reasonable in the area. The beach is amazing. It is quite scenic when you go on the pier. Another land mark at this place is end of famous ROUTE 66. Highly recommended.
Santa Monica is beautiful! The beaches are so large and the water is so blue. We saw a seal swimming around the pier!! Great spot to visit.

Our kids wanted to go to a beach everyday while we were in California. We took them out to the Santa Monica Pier one day and they had a blast. It is great being on the beach and then going over to the amusement area! We wish we had arrived earlier in the day to spend more time but it was great watching the sun set and then seeing the ride light up the night sky.

Lots to do here. Many people are out on the beach, there is also an amusement park on the pier. There are lots of shops and restaurants. It was not a very warm day when I was there yet many people were on the beach and in the water. The temperature was about 67 degrees. I can just imagine what its like when its 80 degrees.
Big, wide stretched beach with stunning views. The Santa Monica Pier, the end of Route 66, is a must to visit.
So much fun! Rides, ocean, food, and the greatest view! A must when you visit LA. Good souvenir shops, interesting people, and typical California.

Ocean is always perfect, while Santa Monica Pier has a relaxing atmosphere where you feel like in at a friend party.Buts: no sun protection and you have to bring with you all the stuff; just one shower, which I managed to detect

column2: You Can't Beat Santa Monica Bay, Santa Monica, Ca. Los Angeles County & AFB (SMO)
column3: Well the weather is superb! And it is the most superb weather in all of the world! Although it seems more like one of the ghosttowns in California and other parts of the true west. There is more food and drink and space for one person as if it is a population 1 old historic preservation and conservation site. I especially like this Los Angeles AFB (SMO) location with it's free city wi-fi, street cams, and free computer use at the Santa Monica Main Public Library ($25 if non resident of Santa Monica). Third Street Promenade is the greatest place night or day. And Tongva Park is a sight to see. There are some soloists like GMBR 530 AM/GMBR-TV/GMBR-FM/GMBR Broadcasting Company and GMBR Bush Pilots that is available online in Santa Monica. Hotels and Motels and rentals and sales of homes can be very cheap still. Karen Hall Realty, NAR (Zillow) Santa Monica, Ca. is the best at Air Force Lodging in Santa Monica where the land is best for everything imaginable. http://mdak.on.com/md/558/qusbtlo6ccetc59bz5x4_M.jpg

column2: Amazing beach to spend half a day
column3: Beautiful beach with lot of restaurants, rides and a long shore. A must watch in LA during your visit. Awesome surroundings. If you are looking for spending a day on beach, it is the place to be with your family & friends.

column2: Amazing place, would love to go again!
column3: Amazing place, really cool atmosphere, great beach! There even places for free parking. Nice places to eat, wonderful walk around. The third street promenade is also great. Lots of music, dance, different artists.
Always fun on the pier. Supper at Bubba Gumps, a few rides on the midway and watch the sunset off the pier.... A great way to spend and evening

the best beach in the world ? maybe not, but certainly the best in California from my experience. stupidly clean beach, lifeguards a-plenty, and decent waves and a clean sea .... what else do you need ?
You can enjoy a beautiful sunset ..the views are beautiful, you can grab a bite at the Annenberg Beach Cafe and surely spot a few celebrities!
Nice place for a family visit. However not much different than Navy Pier in Chicago!! Great food and snacks!!!
Such a beautiful place to go and get away from it all. Santa Monica pier was wonderful to just walk along and take it all in. It was my wife's and I favourite part of L.A
The wide expanse of beach was nice, but the place offered less than I had expected with all the hype around it being one of the famous LA beaches.
Santa Monica is worth the drive! The beach is gorgeous. We stayed in Anaheim but made the drive since so many locals suggested going there! We were not disappointed!

column2: Clean Beach, Great Food, Magnificent Weather!
column3: This is a really nice beach to visit. We always eat at the Annenberg Beach Cafe. The food is excellent and the food servers really hustle but do not rush you. We have been their in January and in September. Anytime of year it is a great place to go.

I visited the St Monica Pier during my short visit to LA. I can say it was definitely one of my highlights, the views are beautiful with gorgeous blue sea! The pier is old and slightly run down but that is what makes its so beautiful and a place that you should definitely visit! The beach is also lovely and is ideal if you want a day to relax and soak up the sun! Definitely make this a must during your visit in LA!

We didn't really think much of LA until we went to the Santa Monica Pier - this area was really lovely and had a great vibe and feel to it. There were so many people just out for a stroll along the pier. There are show rides for kids, lots of shops and lots of food options. A great day - just make sure you have a hat if it is sunny as it gets very hot!

column2: Great place to spend half a day or more
column3: Went there with two kids - 6 and 11. Strolled along the beach, rented some bicycles and went on the ferris wheel. The atmosphere was very nice and calm and it was a very nice day all in all.

column2: Excellent beach to spend your evening (or morning)...
column3: Excellent beach to stroll. Not to swim though. Amazing Pier and ofcourse not miss the Promenade which is on 3rd street if I remember correctly.
Amazing day (a weekday) in sunny Santa Monica. Parked in the nearby Santa Monica place and walked to the pier. The music, the small shops and the amusement park on the pier defines the good vibe!

column2: Great day on the Pier!! Beautiful view!
column3: Loved Santa Monica Pier! All day experience with dining, walking, the rides, the shops , the" interesting" people walking around lol then hitting the beach! there was 13 of us and we enjoyed our bonding time together at the pier1 Bring your camera lots of photos to take! Bathing suit, towel! The view from the Ferris Wheel is amazing as well as the sunset!
I like the place. it is clean and relaxing, the kids can play and you can walk along the coast or watch the ships

column2: Spend some time in Santa Monica
column3: Not nearly enough time to spend in Santa Monica. The park along the beach is lovely and the 3rd Street pedestrian mall is very nice with lots of shopping and restaurants.
This is a great way to relax from the Normal stressors of life. The family can have a great day together!!!
Loved this place, plenty to do at the pier and the beaches are stunning, stayed to watch the sunset then went into the town for something to eat and really spoiled for choice.
The bay is beautiful. It makes a lovely walk through to the pier and then further on to Venice Beach. Great place to watch the sun slowly sink into the sea as it sets over the bay
Definitely a very nice place to spend time in LA. The various food alternatives, beach, view, pier are all very nice.
The perfect spot to relax. The view is magnificent no matter which beach you go to. Coffee shops are close . Just get your coffee and go for a walk with a group of friends .
Nothing much here, unless you go to the mall area.If you need to get out, call UBER cabs. They can take you to other places. Perfect for people who like to: swim, skate, bike, walk

Went to Santa Monica Pier at night to see all the lights of the attractions. Our boys bought the all ride pass for $28. Rides were okay, nothing special, but to ride them on a pier at night was special. Fun thing to do for an evening.

column2: lovely spot to see the ocean, walk the pier and buy an icecream
column3: It's a bit cheesy and old fashioned but despite that it has a real charm and is recognisable from many movies. We used the fortune teller from 'Big' with Tom Hanks and rode the Ferris wheel. The icecream said on the pier were huge!

This cute bay is my favourite spot in LA. It is not very big or full with shops or restaurants but it is peaceful. Especially when it's cloudy, you can see many different shades of blue. I recommend you to walk to the end and watch the ocean to feel the sweet summer breeze of LA.

column2: Worth a visit when in LA
column3: Stopped at the pier and beach on a Friday mid-day, as we were on our way up the coast. Although it was more crowded than I expected, it was a pleasant experience. The pier was clean and most people were friendly and just having a good time. The end of the pier provided a great view of the coastline!

Definitely worth the trip from where we were staying in West Hollywood. Stunning views and lots of things to do, especially for kids. The beach was incredibly crowded but lovely with lots of waves and handy to the third street promenade for shopping and food.
I had always heard of the famous Santa Monica Pier so couldn't pass up the chance to see it while visiting CA. Beautiful area and great view of the ocean.
Not a must see, but go if you have the time. An interesting side to LA that you don't often see - and a great place to find vegetarian restaurants or alternative healthy options to the rest of LA.
Was worth the trip, great beaches and the Pier has a lot to offer. Walking up to the Pier is a real sight. Places to eat and rides, just a fun place to check out
We spent the afternoon here following a lovely lunch at Lobster! It was a carnival atmosphere, lots of people, but a fun experience. Lovely view of teh ocean and beach!

the long shelf of the Santa Monica Bay makes for the largest wading, splash, and wave-action pool in So Cal. MDecent parking right on the beach is still cheap. Bring your cooler, umbrella, and the kids!

column2: Worth a day down at the bay
column3: Walking towards the pier from a long the beach was pretty surreal. We've seen the pier and fitness area on quite a few movies and tv shows and now we were there ourselves. We were lucky we visited on a lovely December day which added to the atmosphere. The beach was clean and lots of folk out skating, biking and just taking in the day. Definitely worth a day down by the bay!
Love the Pier, there is quite a lot to see and do- nice food places to eat at too and such a nice beach.
Santa Monica is a must when in LA. It's got the pier and the nice beaches, and has a safer vibe than Venice Beach.

This is an great place to see the Pacific Ocean and California beach-goers. The pier is long and wide with a good mix of things to do for families of all ages. There is an aquarium, an amusement center located on the Pier with 13 rides. There are a variety of restaurants and eateries for your dining pleasure and a host of musicians scattered up and down the pier to serenade you as you stroll around. There are wonderful views of the ocean, ships, vistas, surfers and swimmers along with a varied mixture of people from all cultures.Cons: Parking is awkward and convoluted. The Pier is separate from the city of Santa Monica so city sightseeing and buying can be a challenge.All in All, the Pros outweigh the Cons so if you get a chance to visit, by all means, do so!

We went to Santa Monica beach by own car. Parking cost is 9 USD.We rent bicycles for 25 USD for the whole day and also rented a surfboard for 30 USD. The kids eere trying to ride the waves 3 hours long, they enjoyed it.

column2: Be careful about venturing into the actual water this summer.
column3: I love the Ocean, but California has been a bit tortured lately. The pier was full of fishermen but I don't think many bothered to read the posted sign warning about high levels of toxicity in the various fish that was posted at the pier. There was black sludge collecting on the shoreline that was keeping back all but a brave few, who likely suffered some kind of consequence later, I'm sure, from going in the water.
A beautiful LONG walk along this area where mountains and ocean can be seen is very invigorating. People watching, Breathing in the fresh air does wonders for the spirit.

column2: Fell in love with Santa Monica
column3: Fell in love with Santa Monica. So much so, I wanted to sell up and move there! Loved the beach and the healthy lifestyle and the nightlife along 3rd Street Promenade in the evening. Santa Monica had everything to offer for a great start to our holiday - fantastic hotels, beautiful beaches, lots to see and do and great night life. I would definitely recommend for anyone to stay here rather than LA. It is only a short distance away by car and you will have a much more relaxed and enjoyable time staying by the Ocean rather than in the dirty, manic city.

column2: I live here and even I think it's over priced for Hotels
column3: I live very near here and I have a bias for the beach area in Santa Monica, Hermosa Beach and Manhattan Beach. My problem with Santa Monica hotels are the prices. I have put family up at Lowes and paid nearly $400 a night. I could put them up at the Portofino in Redondo for much less than half that price. Point is, Santa Monica beach hotels are overpriced for what they offer... If you want a water view. The area itself is a great place to spend a day. WIth the new Gold Line (Light Rail) opening up this year/2016, it will be much easier for people to travel here and see the sites without having to spend a small fortune on a hotel.

column2: Nice place to spend an evening
column3: Nice place to be at night . So many people doing sport activities . Nice bars and restaurants . Very live . Do not miss it . In summer it will be very humid and hot but if you there later at night you escape the heat . Might be a good option if you are with children to avoid dehydration

column2: Good for tourists but nothing special
column3: Good for a visit but lack of restaurants with good quality food. Too many tourists around the world, I expected something better. Visit the canals
I just love the beach and this is the epitomy of a beach... Probably 800-1000 wide sandy beaches with great atmosphere.
We had a lovely time at Santa Monica. I found it to be very clean and there was a lot going on to stop and see.
Great fun. Very crowded with tourists, locals and vendors. This is a colorful scene that is fun for everyone. Walk the pier, go on some rides, buy a cheesy souvenir or play games on the midway.

We drove there on the way to Venice. The parking lot was pretty crowded and the whole beach area was full of people enjoying the water view. A lot of people were cycling and roller blading. It was great for people watching!

Beautiful. Very popular, even on a Sunday morning. You will see all ages, many on wheels (bikes, skateboards, etc.), and various personalties. Visit the area between the pier and Venice Beach. Impressive usage of space.
Massive beach with lovely water , the pier is a nice walk , nothing too spectacular about it but it's good to know I've done it.

Park at the public parkings. On the 3rd street north of Broadway, for a 2 hours swim in the ocean it cost us $2.50.Walk down pico and visit the beach, then walk south close to the waves until you get to Venice Beach and see unique peoples!

my first dip in the pacific. The beach is massive so although lots of people also plenty of space. Huge parking lots as would be expected. The beach had showers but they were a long way back up the beach from the sea. Generally clean. Life guards stationed at regular intervals. We walked along the surf to Venice and back again
Santa Monica is beautiful. A must see visit with the famous pier. Heaps of shops and things to do and see.

This beach is an excellent place for relaxing. The beach area is quite big and hence able to absorb the crowd. To justify the name Pacific ocean was quite peaceful with friendly waves of reasonable height and less frightening.. A good place for children.
Unfortunately, we haven't found anything peculiar about this place. Overcrowded and the ocean is really dirty (I mean seaweed). I tmay be not a problem for someone but I think it unpleasant.

I wish there was something like this where I lived. My kids talk about this part of the trip the most. The amusement park on the pier is great with great family friendly rides. The staff are good and the rides are clean. They are not like those cheesy local church carnival rides that look like they're about to fall apart.Lots of food and souvenir choices. We ate at The Albright. Line goes fast and lots of places to sit. Food was good too.My only complaint was test the beach in the immediate area of the pier tends to get a little seedy with some homeless and true beach bums. But none the less, still felt totally safe.

column2: Lovely place for an evening walk
column3: Lovely place to visit, not that much here, small funfair and standard pier attractions and places to eat. At the end of the pier is a nice view of the coast. Would recommend an hour or so here for a nice walk not much longer. Last part of Route 66 so really busy, make sure you get a photo with the Route 66 sign.
It's absolutely more complete the taste of L.A with a day spending by the sea side of Santa Monica. It takes some 1,5 h by bus to go but it's worthy

column2: When in LA it is must see bay
column3: If you don't go do Santa Monica Bay when traveling around California and especially LA, you won't understand this state and city at all.

column2: Oh how I love this place!
column3: Great place to take the family! The prices are steep at the shops but a little splurging doesn't hurt. Went on a Sunday afternoon/evening and it was still very crowded but not too crowded that you can't enjoy it. The Live bands/acts were great also. The view is gorgeous. The water was nice, sand not so much. I will also note that unlike other beaches I have went to, the Life guards were very alert and attentive, at least the one near us. He didn't just sit in the chair, he walked the beach and kept his eyes on the waters.
I love the fact that you can ride your bicycle without people panhandling you the entire ride. You feel so relax by bay with the nice cool breeze. If you are in Los Angeles; go at least once .
We went there at the end of our trip and it's awesome! We loved it, if you're going to LA you def have to go there

column2: Bring boogie boards and an umbrella, or buy them there from the vendors walking the beach.
column3: The surf was really big when we were there. I recommend boogie boards. There is plenty of room on the beach. The parking lots are great. I wish there were showers or even hoses to wash off.

From Santa Monica to Venice Beach, the and is clean and even soft like flour in a few places. Waves break straight in for most of the beach, so not great for riding. Plenty of choices for food and bathrooms all the way.

column2: not cool for spring break with kids
column3: nice beach ..avoid the spring break crowd ..it gets packed and parking is a hassle ..but all rest of the year even summer is ok.

We visited Santa Monica on a previous visit to LAWe strolled the sidewalks, popped into little boutiques, had a delicious meal at the famous Ivy restaurant - a great place to stroll around and just enjoy the ambience

column2: One of the few beaches within the reach in LA
column3: We don't really have much options when it comes to beaches in LA. Santa Monica beach can get crowded. Not much to see. But that's all we have pretty much unfortunately. At least I am happy that the beach is still within the reach. You can do some bicycle riding. There is a bike path that goes down to Venice beach (I believe it goes all the way to Redondo Beach).

column2: A pleasant walk along the beach
column3: We visited the pier and enjoyed watching the people on the rides and the fishermen (fisherpeople?) trying their luck. Not sure that I would eat anything caught in this location.We strolled south along the beachwalk. There are separate areas for walkers and bikers, rollerbladers, skateboarders so it makes the walk pleasant and much safer. We ended up at the Venice Beach boardwalk which attracts vendors targetting the teen/twenty generation. Fun to watch all the activity.We returned to Santa Monica for dinner as the restaurants in Venice tend to be a bit too trendy for our tastes.
Beautiful beaches and lots to see walk along the prom and check out Venice beach visit del ray the fishing village and see all the boats oh and get a churrito very tasty treat on the beach

We had a great afternoon out in Santa Monica Beach and Pier. We rented a bike and went down to Venice beach in 20 minutes, it is fun to see all the people doing yoga and sports by the beach and also the beach bums and the lifeguards. very stereotypical California, if you have time, take an afternoon off by the beach and enjoy the fun park at night.

column2: Excellent and cool day at the beach
column3: Santa Monica is a great place to chill out at the beach for the day. There are plenty of amenities close by and you always have the pier if you're looking for a little excitement. The beach was clean and well patrolled by lifeguards.
Always beautiful. Fun pier and place to fish. Ferris wheel light can be seen for miles. Music on summer nights.
The pier is a must visit, Do not park on the pie, look for parking on side streets it is a lot cheaper and the walk to the pier is more fun.

column2: Lovely way to spend a summer afternoon
column3: The beach is long and wide with plenty of room for everyone on a hot summer day. The water, beach and pier were very clean. There are a lot of dining options with a pricing range for everyone. The biggest challenge was finding a parking spot.
The beach is wide and comparatively clear, but rather noisy and overcrowded for elderly people. Youngsters enjoy the various activities held.
what a great place to be.. I had a wonderful time there ... them birds stole my food hhhh but its all good

column2: Beautiful View from Malibu to Palos Verdes
column3: Santa Monica Bay is my favorite place to spend time in Los Angeles. Whether one is at Malibu, Santa Monica Beach, Venice Beach or the beaches to the south such as Manhattan or Hermosa, the scenery is beautiful. The beaches are clean white sand and there are views of Catalina Island and super tankers going in and out of the Port of Los Angeles. Lots of sailboats can be seen throughout the bay especially on weekends. Santa Monica Pier is a fun place to go along the beach. Great views of the entire bay from the end of the pier and from the top of the Ferris Wheel on the pier. Many times during the year I can see whales and dolphins off shore. Venice Beach is the perfect area for people watching. There are all types of interesting characters at Venice plus lots of entertainment, music, food and an old hippie environment. Malibu at the northern area of the bay is quiet compared to Venice or Santa Monica. Beautiful beaches along the Malibu coastline. Hermosa and Manhattan are more upscale beach areas and quite beautiful. Palos Verdes in the south part of the bay is gorgeous with fantastic views from the cliffs. Throughout the year, many pods of whales pass this location and are easy to see from the cliffside. If you are coming to Los Angeles, be sure to go to some of these beaches for the real California experience !

Another disappointment as it was so crowded and hard to get about. The beach likewise was crowded and absolutely filthy., including bottles on the beach. A disgrace to LA really. Would give this a miss altogether - no better than Blackpool promenade.
This was the first place we visited after arriving LA, and we had a nice, relaxing afternoon stroll. In January, the weather was really nice and enjoying the sunset there was really nice
Wicked beach so many people and of your in to sight seeing and people watching it's right here. A little fish and chips joint on the corner was fresh and fast.

column2: Wide Beach With Lots of Activities
column3: This beach is very wide and close to the amusements of the pier. You can also walk to some good restaurants and 3rd St Promenade. The water is not the cleanest but is acceptable. Avoid drainage pipes which discharge street and storm water. The ocean by these outlets is not healthy. You'll enjoy clean sand and beautiful views of the bay, Palos Verdes peninsula, the Malibu coastline and Catalina Island on a clear day. A fun day for the kids. If you want strictly ocean activities, I'd head up to Zuma where the water is better, the beach equally huge and lots of families.

We visited Santa Monica on an open top bus tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. There was plenty to do on the pier and we walked along the cost line to Venice Beach which was full of character. Glad we did it.
Very crowded but very pretty water looked clean. Santa Monica pier is a short walk. Beach was clean. Great place for families.
Fun place to hang out. The Santa Monica pier had its fair share of shops, restaurants, rides, and games. Enjoyed my time there. Lots to see and do. Family friendly too.
I wish I lived here! Wow! What a bounty to live close to the bay and be able to see the sunset and sunrise daily.

Santa Monica Pier is a fun place where you can ride the rollercoaster and Ferris wheel, which has great views. The beach is long, white and beautiful. There is also an aquarium where you can stop and visit.

column2: Come back time and time again...
column3: So we've just completed trip number 6 to Santa Monica, this time over July 4th weekend. It's so popular because the beaches, shopping, weather and general relaxed feel of the place is so inviting. It was much busier over Independence day so if you want it a little less busy, avoid that weekend. It never tires and when the sun shines (after that early morning marine layer) it's great for sitting on that beach and soaking up the Californian sunshine. It's safe both day and night..ok seagulls occasionally try to steal your snacks..but hey that's as bad as it gets...the bay is long and wide enough to have your own little area to call your own..we love it!

column2: A Day @ a Classic SoCa Beach!
column3: An awesome, southern California beach community w/ nostalgia! Muscle Beach, terminus for the historic Rt. 66, the pier, beach volleyball, ferris wheel, sun, sand, surf! Pack a picnic (or eat @ one of the many seaside options), bring beach gear, & enjoy for the day! Get there by 10:30-11:00 a.m. on Sat.'s & pay the $12.00 all-day parking fee - it's WELL worth it!
A fun place to visit. And you will not be alone! A beautiful beach with lots of activites if you want to. Or just an area to stroll around in.
We stayed in SM during our visit to LA, and it was a brilliant choice, in my opinion! Perfect base and to get to stroll along the Pier after a day out was great!
Fun walk out on the pier especially at night when the carnival is all lite up. Enjoyed seeing all the fisherpeople and the artists playing music.
Best part of the holiday.Could of stayed there lovely clean beach and pier.we sore the Dolphins swimming by the pier.

column2: Experience the beach and a carnival at the same stop!
column3: Great places to eat and have a beer. Parking is as expected on the coast over $10, but you can get within short walking distance of the pier easily. Plenty of room to put out an umbrella and stay for a while on the beach, swimming in the ocean is something everyone should try!
Don't miss the sun setting over the Pacific Ocean. The pier offers the best views and there are lots of options to do on it also, food and amusement rides.

column2: One of America's Most Beautiful large bays
column3: It winds along the coastline from Santa Monica to Pt. Dume in Malibu west of the Santa Monica coastal mountains. Along its shore line are some of the world's most beautiful and most affluent coastal neighborhoods, Santa Monica, Pacific Palisades and Malibu.
Very family friendly beach. Easy to get to via taxi or Uber. Lots of dining opportunities. Large beach which has lots of people all of the time but not too crowded. Friendly, cleanish and safe.
Santa Monica pier is much better than Venice Beach, but both are very seedy and really hyped up by the film industry. Not really worth visiting.
Santa Monica pier is amazing such a beautiful way to spend the day. Wonderful beaches and just a great atmosphere. You can walk to Venice beach from there although it is a long walk.
Lovely place to go swimming, wandering, get some food - whatever you want to do! Very safe during the day and ideal spot to watch the day go by!
Spent the afternoon at the pier & beach. We had a great time! Beach is long and wide and the sand becomes hot in the sun. Pier is touristy but fun with rides, buskers, souvenir shops and food.

Santa Monica was truly excellent. Myself and partner drove here from Hollywood and spent the day here and enjoyed it so much. We stayed mainly on the pier and surrounding beach area and the atmosphere is just fantastic. There is lots to do and have to say I enjoyed the Ferris wheel and roller coaster a lot more than I probably should have but when you have a view of a beach this pretty you can't help yourself. Also do yourself a favor and get an ice cream off the pier they are delicious! Brilliant place I have always wanted to go and cannot wait to hopefully return for longer in the future!
Honestly, I expected a bit more, but it was still good.I watch a lot of American movies, therefore it was good to see in the flesh.Visited in November 13
Classic tourist stuff, but when in LA do the tourist stuff. I like finishing up the day down here and then having some kind of meal on the pier.
been gone so long and who'd have thought I could be at the beach in January? Good view. Continue up the coast to see it all.

column2: Fun, famous place seen in many movies and shows.
column3: Fun area. Great shopping and restaurants. Pier is fun with amusement park, beautiful view of the pacific ocean. Lovely beach. It would be hard not to enjoy this lively place.

column2: Santa Claus at Christmas and Santa Monica in the Summer months.
column3: Santa Monica is a great place .The Bay and Town are full of entertainment for all ages . The hotel was excellent and gave fantastic service. I was based in Santa Monica and visited her sisters Anna and Barbara .Malibu was also on the list which is not far away.
Looks like there was a lot to do, however, parking was a challenge and somewhat intimidating for me. We passed on lots of things because parking was tight and/or far away.
Lots of beach to walk on, nice enough food establishments but something is missing here, perhaps too commercial for me, better off on Huntington Beach, much quieter.

We drove here and also to venice, venice was a complete let down but santa monica a lovely place, there is parking just head for the pier and it is sign posted, you may have to wait a bit. Plenty of places to eat, also it is the end of route 66 so worth it just to get a photo there.
Its a lovely place to hang around and have a good time. Make sure to visit this place. It will be a very good experience . Highly recommended.

I've lived in Los Angeles my entire life and I still get a thrill going to Santa Monica. You can walk on the pier and go on some rides. Go to the end of the pier to see far up and down the beautiful coastline. You can walk Palisades Park which is right near the entrance of the pier. Third Street Promenade with tons of shops and eating places is only a few blocks away. Be sure to watch the sunset as it is magnificent.

column2: View of the ocean, weirdos, and beggars
column3: We liked the ocean and the long pier.We didn't like beggars, and weirdos. It is the first time I've seen a "Hari Krishna" beggar in over 30 years. At least I know where they all went.

I absolutely crave my return to Santa Monica Beach and Pier. I really enjoyed the fun in the sun, ocean waves and the vibrant atmosphere. This has been one of my best decisions of my life...GO TO Santa Monica Beach Now...lol...The bike and roller blade rentals, the sand and surf, the restaurants and food vendors oh so awesome! If in the LA area for fun, definately put Santa Monica Beach on your list!

Nice beach but always over crowded. You're better off to go farther north or south to avoid such huge crowds. Watch out for the aggressive homeless people which is getting to be a bigger problem in many areas of LA.

If you are visiting with children, you will enjoy the visit and include the amusement park. Lot of parkings nearby, Close to the Wyndham there's a 3 hour free parking with a small fastfood. Close to the pier is about $12 parking fee which is expensive if you are staying for a couple of hours only.
Fun experience, don't forget to take something to sit on, definitely something to do with family, free live entertainment, and safe environment.
We thought the beach and pier were super. Lots going on, full of tourists and locals. Definitely worth a visit.
very busy bustling area. great shopping, great walking, activities for all ages and many places to stop revive and survive
walking out on the pier is so nice and watching the ocean at sunset is unbelievable. There are rides for the kids and shops to sell all sorts of things
I was expecting more, instead there's nothing much to see. When I was there, the beach and the pier were empty, and I really didn't see the appeal.It's true, everything looks different on TV.

column2: Nice to walk and see sunset !
column3: Nice place to see sunset, u can do many thing there !Shopping and walk and eat !There's a street just for walking and see talented shows.

column2: Beach with a view on the Best Coast
column3: One of my favorite beaches and piers in the United States. This is where the California dream is realized. Cute beach vendors, sun and fun, good tourist-watching. Look out for the guys fishing off of the pier, and be prepared to pay $15-$30 a day for parking.
Nice place ti visit, an Icon, you can go there and then pass to the Promanade another place you must visit.

Theres many songs about Santa Monica, artists like Sheryl Crow, Everclear and even Australias very own Savage Garden sing about this city. Its easy to see why, its a place full of juxtapositions, relaxation or excitement, chill out or dare to be different that all culminate in the one place. Theres a spark in the air, one that many cities try hard to get but dont achieve. Bottle up your time in Santa Monica and when leaving be sure to save some of the spark for when you get home.More info at this blog post:http://danyellekelly.com/2015/07/25/part-1-la-life/See Hear Speak No Evil

column2: My son's first time at the ocean
column3: Beautiful. Great first time experience in the water for my 13 year old son. Perfect temperature, even at dusk. We explored the pier and enjoyed some beautiful music being performed at the water's edge of the pier. Lots of unique vendors set up as well as the Famous Bubba Gump restaurant. We did witness a couple of homeless teenagers and were heartbroken to see them dig through the trash can to eat. We provided a meal and will be praying for them.
enjoyed strolling along the board walk looking at the waves the beach is a little packed but to be expected...enjoyed our day on route 66

Santa Monica was a refreshing experience for my wife. We were staying in Moreno Valley where the temps were hitting 105 and then we went down to Santa Monica and the weather was a very comfortable 77 degrees. She loved the pier but unfortunately the beach was a bit too crowded. We walked down a ways and had a horrible lunch but then there werent many people and then we began a quiet day of cool sun, relaxing waves and a pretty clean beach. It wasnt paradise but it was pretty close!
Beautiful! We got a bus to Santa Monica from metro. It's lovely. We hired bikes and cycled down the beach front, wow the views very fantastic!
if you travel to LA this is one of the places you have to stop by and see, the famous pier from Forest Gump and the official end of route 66, to the famous beach from Bay Watch series.
Really beautiful and spacious beach, kept clean, with toilets and showers and several parking possibilities in the surrounding. Beware of sea gulls! They steal food, even unopen packages ;)
Great for walking , easy stroll to Venice from Santa Minca.people watching to keep you entertained all day, sports, gorgeous beach, lively pier at Santa Monica, and LA style all round

column2: A taste of what I thought the West coast should be!
column3: Beautiful beach, amazing sunny day. A taste of a traditional pier too with some great keep-sakes. Really enjoyable walk down past muscle beach. Cycles available to cover more distance and enjoy the whole area.
The whole waterfront in the LA area is beautiful. My kids loved the water. We stayed on the beach and drove around and looked at things. It's a beautiful area.
Very wide bay, lots of activies to do, didn麓t feel the water but the day weather was lovely.The corridors for you to walk, ride a bike o skate were also vey likable, baby loved it.

column2: A bike ride along the Pacific coast
column3: We were there in May, on a not so hot day, so much, much quieter than it could have been, which was great for us. We hired a couple of bikes and rode along the bike route from Santa Monica Pier beyond Venice. It was OK, some interesting designed beach front house, both Venice Beach and Santa Monica Pier are very tourist driven, but a pleasant afternoon with a walk along to pier to finish.
It is lovely to walk along the sidewalk or even to bike ride. Many people enjoy walking at sun down or at night especially in the summer months when it isn't too foggy.

We caught the beach and pier on the day before the 4th. It was busy! But everybody was happy and getting along. This place is one of the iconic places you have to check out on your LA visit. The beach is huge, and CLEAN. The water is COLD! The pier was busy and we stopped for a beer at the very end. Lots of people fishing and wandering and enjoying life. Go for a few hrs and enjoy.
so cute. loved all of the options from the beach, to the rides, to the exercise equipment. our entire family had a great time.
Rented some bikes at the beach.Had a really nice bike ride along the beach.We also went to the pier to get a bite to eat and try to win som prizes at the stands.The beach is really beautifull.
What a lovely place to enjoy the ocean and sun! The pier has lots of fun things to do. It is a don't miss for Santa Monica!
Really enjoyed the walk on the beach. Nice and clean, a bit cold for this Texas gal but enjoyable to say the least
It's a must see and must experiens, but I like the promenade better. Think it's a tad bit overrated to be honest

Great iconic venue. Our short visit to LA include a stroll up the prom at the wonderfully eclectic Venice Beach ending at Santa Monica Pier. Great traditional features . lots to see and do .We had lunch at Bubba Gumps.
The beauty of this place has to be experienced. Looking out into the bay was a spiritual experience. Rest, Relax, Rejuvenate- this is what this place does.
Loved Santa Monica Bay, stopped for lunch at the pier. Was great to see it for myself after seeing in movies for so many years.
Awesome Beach, really had a very good time - Enjoyed bathing. Its one of place must visit in Los Angeles.
Just an overall beautiful area! So much to do in Santa Monica!! We always spend a whole day here whenever we visit LA. Walks in the morning on the beach are the best! A really nice, clean area!

The area of Santa Monica is one of the most famous in LA ... and it has every right !!! The beach is very large and space if it is what you want !!! Bathrooms and showers are quite clean and the possible activities that can be done are many. To finish with the Pier, the end of the legendary Route 66, essential step of a journey into the City of Angels !!!
Lovely Beach and could spend hours waiting for the lovely sunset then a walk back to the streets full of eateries and shops giving a wonderful experience.

column2: It was a short visit, but it was beautiful!
column3: This bay is beautiful. A nice place to enjoy the beach and catch some rays. We will spend more time on our next visit.

This is a long and beautiful beach full of activities for everyone. First of all, there is the ocean to play in, along with lifeguards; plus the usual beach activities (tanning, relaxing, reading, etc.). There is also the original ' Muscle Beach' with exercise equipment (ropes, hoops, etc.), for both kids and adults, and a fun amusement park on the Santa Monica Pier.
The beach was very clean and wide open. No boardwalk to speak of so bring your own food and don't expect more than a ferris wheel and a roller coaster.
Fun place to people watch and just hang out. Quintessential LA. Parking is a hassle on the beachfront, suggest parking a bit further away and walking.

column2: Go for the Sunset photo op
column3: Pretty Bay on the Pacific; great photos at sunset! The beaches are clean, the palm trees and landscaping very tropical & pretty.

Loved Santa Monica...we took a bike from Venice beach to the pier at Santa Monica, but easy to walk there. Lots of entertainment on the pier and great places to eat and drink. We had iced coffee and iced caramel latte at 'the coffee bean' on the pier. Not cheap, but fantastic to stroll along the pier 'people watching' before going into bubba's and then the bike ride back.A definite 'must' to visit when you're in LA

column2: the best live concert a sunday and saturday nights
column3: there are shopping malls and live concert at nights on sunday and saturday at third street until after midnights and very safe area
Loved the boardwalk but the rides are old school and don't live up to all the modern day theme parks if that is what your kids are into. Shopping on 3rd street plaza is fun too.
We visited there during the Spring so the place was not crowded as in summer. It has many entertainments.

column2: Great place for a walk and sit and relax and watch people
column3: Just sitting on the beach watching people go by was so much fun. Then going on the pier and looking back at land was absolutely beautiful. The wind was very welcoming it was hot. We sat and watched the people fish off the pier was fun.

We loved the beaches, the food and the whole feel of this community. I loved that we could walk back and forth from Venice Beach. Beautiful architecture all along the beach and the downtown streets are beautiful with several pedestrian pathways. The weather was perfect for my liking - warm in the day and cool at night.
Nothing special, a lot of boobytraps. The view is better on rout no.1The water are cold so you can't get into the ocean
Great restaurants. Perfect spot to people watch and walk on the long Boardwalk to see and smell the Pacific Ocean

Went on a tour to the beach and wish we didn't, they didn't spend enough time there to enjoy everything it has to offer. Take a car or public transport and spend a whole day enjoying the beach and attractions.

Clean and neat area . I think you can say that upscale people live in this vicinity. Food is expensive. Top class cars are everywhere. High end shopping . Do not come here if you have only 100 dollars in your pocket.

column2: Oh Santa Monica - I wanted more!
column3: A bit of a let down like so much of America! The pier was very ho-hum with all the cheap, nasty tourist junk and fast food. Shops & more shops which all gets a bit boring. I wanted to get out to the mountains and away from Hollywood and sub-standard beaches. I'm feeling hard to please right now!

Santa Monica Beach has some Amazing dolphins that come and perform very early in the morning on Mother's Day every year, but... You must be there very early or you'll miss it. 6am early, and it's pretty chilly, so... take a blanket. Great show though.
Great beach in a sunny place pretty much all year around! Put your skates on and run up and down the beach!
The weather was great and so it brought out folks in droves. We had a great time enjoying both. The traffic is terrible so leave your car at home.

this is a must see if you're in the l.a. area. the bay runs at least from malibu, all the way down to the south bay like palos verdes. i would explore the malibu-santa monica area; santa monica has great shopping and restaurants, very close to the beach, and you can walk down to the beach from ocean avenue, along the pier, to the sand.

My wife and I really enjoyed Santa Monica Pier and all of the attractions. This is where the mighty Route 66 starts (or ends). There was some live music (and very good at that), shops, Ferris wheel, merry-go-round and other sites. To walk around the pier and gaze at the shops and people was wonderful. The beach is wide, big and breath taking. The shopping mall is a short walk away, with numerous food and beverage outlets, made for an excellent day out. It can be hard to find a parking space but get there early and spend the day. A must see when in LA.
A wonderful great experience. This is a very clean beach and the cool weather was icing on the cake. Great place to just sit and chill out and relax
LOVED this area. Would love to come back to just get the vibe. Bubba Gump restaurant fantastic and the jetty area was a hit with all of us. How wide is the Beach?????

Sand between my toes, smell of funnel cakes, and sound of waves crashing on the beach... Priceless. We walked on the pier and played games, ate at Bubba Gumps, and rode the ferris wheel. Families or couples can find many things to do here. It was not expensive for LA and night time it all comes alive.
The pier is iconic and the beach is breath taking dine shop drink play and enjoy a day in Santa Monica
People who like beaches should go for sure. We enjoyed here as my daughter loves playing with water.
Just a lovely beach - busy and buzzing but not overcrowded. wWe just loved the vista and a lovely walk!
By far the most iconic Californian city. Santa Monica and it's bay with beaches, the pier and 3rd street promenade is the most busy of the beach cities. A must see when in LA.
Santa Monica is a cute beach neighborhood with great shops & restaurants. The pier is fun and lively and the beach is long and wide.

As a person, I'm no great beach fanatic, but Santa Monica bay and the beach need to be experienced. Totally different to Venice Beach, far more class, but to be fair, the sun, sea and sand are the same.
Great place to hang out for an afternoon. Parking/traffic were a bit of a challenge, but the beach and promenade are worth it.

Very long sand beach in Santa Monica. Easy to get here from Hollywood and this beach deserves that you spend the whole day here.The water is clean, unfortunately the water was very cold when I visited, even if the weather was great.Tons of people on the beach, but since it's huge, it's not really a problem to find a good location.There is also a big pier with a Ferris wheel.

First of all it's a beach and in the summer, a busy one at that! The Boardwalk is lovely for cycling but again, in the summer it's really busy not only with bikes but with loads of buggies, small children and dog walkers so please be careful. Parking is limited but if you park on a side or back street a few minutes away and walk you'll be just fine. There are lots of shops along the Boardwalk ranging fro touristy things selling sunglasses and vintage style scarves and beads etc. to cafes and boutique stalls. The Ferris wheel is lovely, cost $10 and overall this is a gorgeous beach area to visit. Maybe I'm being too critical but I am just saying as it is!
The first beach that I'd ever been when I first visited USA. We enjoyed watching people walking along the shore, but the most important thing that happened here was, the "proposal"!

Loved the Santa Monica Pier We walked from Venice Beach to Santa Monica Pier Beautiful view Enjoyed watching people riding Skate Boards Bikes and Roller Blading Plenty to see here There is also a Beautiful Merry Go Round that has been there for years

It is fun to go to the pier if you have never gone. Kids will especially enjoy the pier. I love strolling down 3rd Street Promenade and watching all of the entertainment. Lots of shopping and lots of places to eat.Bubba Gump's is a must if you have never gone there.
The beach was lovely and so big! A lots to do and see. Walked along the pier and found the Japadog from Vancouver - so delicious!

The visit to Santa Monica Pier was probably the highlight of our visit in LA. Watching the hundreds of Harley Davidson motorcycles ending their drive of Route 66 on the pier was amazing. Nice shops an tons of very good restaurants on the pier. People watching was also high on our list. I tried to see if Pamela Anderson wasn't saving somebody in the sea, but to no avail. This is really a place to go.
We walked to the end of Santa Monica Pier to see the bay. We saw a few surfers out in the water. The rickety old boards gave my wheelchair a nice bouncy ride. We wandered, looked, and enjoyed.
The beach was lovely and soo big! So many things going on and lots to do and see. Didn't get the chance to take a bike ride but if we ever go back we will!

column2: Santa Monica Bay - A Great Place to Spend a Day!
column3: We love Santa Monica Bay and always visit the pier when we are in Santa Monica. The last time we were there in September 2014 we spent a lot of time on the pier just looking out into the bay. It's a great place to spend a day!
Had a great time looking at the shops, experiencing some rides and having some food whilst at the pier.

We really enjoyed Santa Monica Pier and all of the attractions. We had an artist named Dennis doe character drawings of each of my adult grandchildren. It was very affordable and he was quite good and a nice guy. There was live music, lots of sites to see and of course the ferris wheel and a few other "all American" rides . We spent about 6 hours there and still didn't see everything. Another must if you are in the Los Angeles area.

column2: Plenty of Activities for the whole family to enjoy!
