column3: I just love the Santa Monica Bay. There are plenty of activities for the whole family to enjoy. The beach is nice and clean, the pier boasts rides, restaurants, fishing and more. Santa Monica offers a plethora of restaurants to explore. Probably my only complaint is that there are parking issues at times due to the popularity of the Santa Monica Bay. It is a beautiful and clean area. Enjoy!

Santa Monica Bay is one of the places you'll want to live after visiting. The moment you reach the beach front and see the surroundings it is incredible. There is a great atmosphere and tons of places to eat.

What a great way to spend the day with your family. My husband and I stopped here just for a quick look. So glad we did. The beach is beautiful, the weather felt much nicer than our florida heat and the attractions all looked like fun. Do recommend for a family day.

Take the time to walk the pier. Check out the restaurants and fun. A gorgeous view of the bay...all for free. A must see. A nice stroll down to the pier and back up! (If you have walking issues...you don't have to walk all the way down onto the pier...plenty of views from "above".)
Visited my daughter when she lived there. Clean white sand beaches and beautiful water with several restaurants overlooking the water to choose from to enjoy a meal while watching the waves.
Part of my sister and my trip to Ellen's 12 days of Giveaways was a stop at the Santa Monica Bay and Pier. Stunning, beautiful, and life changing.
Everyone should experience a Santa Monica Sunset!! Stroll to Venice Beach and ride the Merry-go-round at the Pier.

nice for a beach day specially if you want to see the baywatch in action. The Santa Monica Pier is also nice for a bit of shopping and eating. It is where route 66 starts (or ends). Basically it is everything you have always seen in movies and tv series.

It was an awesome experience to spend time in the Santa Monica Bay. The crowd and the place gave us a nice positive vibration. Its must visit for beach lovers. But highway traffic to the beach was heavily crowded and we had to miss other place to cover this.

Beautiful place! We especially enjoyed the rides on the pier and just walking along the beach. We were amazed to see the number of people playing in the water despite the cold. With the shopping malls a walking distance way and the numerous food and beverage outlets, we spent an entire day there.

column2: A nice walk along the beach
column3: Have you ever tried walking in a nice set up " Beach, Sun, Trees ........ " . It's one of the most beautiful place to walk & enjoy the weather , the sun & people all around... Santa Monica is the best to visit in LA.....

The beach is nice and clean , has a great vibe and there is lots to see and do on the Santa Monica pier. But having come from Australia, the beach area wasn't really a 'wow' moment for us, especially when we saw how a quarter of the beach was removed to make way for an ugly car park - bit weird really. I am glad I still went as now I can compare.FYI - the region is the beginning/end of Route 66

column2: Cold ocean but along shore pleasent
column3: with Water temp Hovering around 55-60 he water is COLD Thats why only Fools and Kids are in the H2o,,,but for people watching and walks Knock your self out................. its very nice good get a tan beach
Beautiful beach that we loved with an amusement park onit. Went for 13 days and saw many parts of California. Just gorgeous.

This is my must go place if i am in LA. Fabulous vibe, sunshine, blue ocean, miles of cycling, 100s of sights to take in, right from the freaky things at Venice to the muscle beach to skateboarding... i could spend the whole weekend just chilling here. Grt options for food & drinks as well. Children & per friendly

My husband and I were enjoying the pier when we decided to get our feet wet. The water felt great but too cold for me, my husband got in for a bit then came out. As we were putting our shoes back on we noticed a chunk of black puddy like substance on his foot. We didn't know what it was until we googled it and found out that tar balls occasionally wash up on shore, luckily he isn't allergic but it was disgusting and hard to get off since we didn't have soap with us. Other then the tar balls the beach and shops are great. You can also rent a bike and ride down blvd all day.

column2: Beautiful, lots to do and see,local arts and crafts etc.
column3: Lots of market stalls and souvenirs. Local people,arts,crafts,restaurants. We ate at" Bubba Gumps". We did Henna tattoos on our walk to Venice Beach. You can bike ride it or get a bike taxi. We got a bike taxi back. Don't recommend travelling in public transport or being here late at night. But too beautiful to miss, just do it in the day.

Santa Monica beach and Pier are a favorite of mine, we always walk to Venice Beach ad the houses are amazing. Being from the Midwest it is the quintessential LA experience and a great way to get some sun. I haven't been to LA without heading to Santa Monica and the beach:)

I'm not a huge fan of LA, and didn't spend much time at Santa Monica (I was in the process of waiting for a tour to leave). I would like to have returned if only to take some photos. I can see it would be a great place to take the family for the day.
Rode a few rides, enjoyed the view of the ocean and went on a movie star home tour. We also ate some good food and went in the aquarium.
My wife and I walked along the beach and the Pier, to enjoy the scenery. This place is much better than Venice Beach.

column2: Santa Monica Pier a must see
column3: Near the pier we enjoyed renting bicycles and riding to the boardwalk flea market at Venice Beach, then further north to watch the boats sail in to Marina Del Rey. The pier has something for everyone with an amusement park, fishing, great restaurants and souvenir shops.

Santa Monica is a nice place and worth visiting. Allow yourself some time and walk on the beach, enjoy so famous Santa Monica Pier and some sopping. There're many people around however it is not so big problem and I recommend this place to visit. Frankly speaking to visit LA area it is a must see place - enjoy.

column2: The Views - The Beaches - The Pier... whats not to love
column3: A vast expanse of the Pacific.. The Santa Monica Bay is home to some famous beaches including Malibu, Will Rogers State Beach, Surfrider, Santa Monica State Beach, and Dockweiler State Beach.The Pier is always there.. a Grand historic and cultural landmark offering family fun & education - The Santa Monica Pier Aquarium is Heal the Bays public marine-education center located beach-level, just below the Carousel at the Pier. A must visit for families with curious children.. Many enjoyable hours can easily be spent.

column2: It's part of the Pacific Ocean!
column3: It's part of the Pacific Ocean and has a bike path from Santa Monica to Redondo Beach. How can one improve on that.The Santa Monica pier remains fun and Venice Beach is a hoot.

My son and I visited Santa Monica over two days. We went down o the sandy beach after got car park right down front next to aquarium. Then went shopping in 3rd Promenade which was particularly good or my son as he likes Converse,Levi's, Apple & Nike stores.
There is something to be said about going to Santa Monica. The beach is like no other, the outdoor shopping is fantastic, it's magical.
Santa Monica is a beautiful city. The bay is walking distance from all the shops and restaurants. If you want to go there, make sure it is an all day trip!
Beautiful beach. Lovely little town of Santa Monica - compelling street art. Fun shopping on beach. Lots of movies filmed here.

This place is very nice to visit lots to see and do here. Under the Pier there is a aquarium that is rather small and intimate. The rides at the Pier are solar powered and fun. This place has a lot do and see. Walking the beach is always nice.

Beautiful view of Venice Beach and great walkways all around the bay. If you feel really energetic you can walk to the pier and back. Lots of eateries, interesting people as well as watching the hunks work-out at Muscle Beach! You might even see Hulk Hogan!

Whether you count on passing the day or spending the night there, Santa Monica is well worth your time.Great sandy beach, vibrant city centre with great shopping and dinning options. Accessible by bus and parking is abundant in the many public parking towers. Rates are also reasonable (first 90 min free, next hour $1, every other 30 min $1.50 up to $14 a day).Personally liked it better than Venice beach although not very far.Less knick knacks and tourist-oriented souvenir stores, more accessible, more things to do. Only downside, can be very busy and commercial.

column2: BEAUTIFUL PLACE A MUST GO AND VISIT!!!!
column3: Santa Monica.....this place is unbelievably clean a total "litter free" place.A pleasant walk around the shops, so peaceful no hustle and bustle, followed by a walk down santa monica promenade.I would recommend this is one place in LA not to be missed!!!
Beautiful views. Walked from Santa Monica Pier along the waterfront to Venice Beach which was an absolute fantastic walk! Lots of people, great atmosphere, enjoyable, must do!

it's such a peaceful place it's hard to explain the boardwalk and the palm trees and the hill that has views of the ocean don't know the exact names of the places there's also and outdoor mall so it's both shopping and beach.
We enjoyed ourselves here. There is a lot to see and what, including people watching. The beach is nice and clean. There are always a lot of people around but we didn't get pushed or shoved.
Pier was good for kids. Area was quaint and had a nice relaxed feel. Shopping area was clean and laid back

column2: Santa Monica pier is a must see place but needs to help its homeless..
column3: Seeing Santa Monica Pier was a must see on our holiday and it brought back memories of Big with Zolthar and lots of other tv shows. We sunbathed on the beach (a little dirty here and there) and paddled in the sea. Would have been a great visit but we had to walk by dozens of poor homeless folk sleeping rough on the park areas by the promenade, Santa Monica should get some help to these people some of whom were clearly suffering drug problems. We were saddened and scared at the same time.
Santa Monica Bay is a great place to spend the day. Plenty of open sand and cool water. Just make sure you bring sun protection. Plenty of places to find food to purchase or pack a picnic.
As part of our LA downtown tour we stopped here where we could view a part of the harbor and enjoy the amazing boats. Great spot.
Make this a priority, if you have limited time in LA. Stop by Shutters & have lunch on their ocean front deck.

Yes if you say in Indian slang it was a time pass beach and with nice cold winds blowing we were not able to get in the water at all. But it gives you an amazing view of the ocean and great place to buy souvenirs. We had our dinner at Bubba Gump but did not enjoy it so much.

One of the landmarks on any trip to Los Angeles and remember there is the pier which is fun for ALL ages and the nearby Thrid street shops and mall which provide any thing a shopper could want and many food options as well
We enjoy our visit this place the climate was also good with lot's of activities around so people can send their valuable time with love one.

As part of our city tout last week, we had the amazing chance to stop by and have a look at this beautiful area that is the Santa Monica Bay. The beaches there are very well manicured and the sand is so soft. The beaches are wide and the waves just big enough. This is definitely a must do while in LA.
a pretty touristy place. not as happening as the venice beach area. the santa monica pier still a landmark and worth the visit.
great place to go and just people watch, great for photos, fun entertaining atmosphere, a must see in LA

column2: Nice Bay but unbearable type of weather(
column3: Good things: You can enjoy the views of the ocean motion and sunbath on the beach. Bad things: Weather for me it's NOT cool, so freeking hot and humid at times. Sunburns are very comon...that's definitely NOT fun at all!
theres construction going on. Becoming ghetto now.Not much food places to choose from. It was our second trip there for the year. Although nice enough to bike around.Parking is not very good

We came on A Thursday and they had a free gig on the pier while the sun set, which was just wonderful. The only problem was you couldn't take alcohol in much to our disappointment but there were numerous bars we could pop into for a refreshing beer. The ferris wheel was great, lovely views and super fun.

Not one of my favorite beaches. I lived in Santa Monica in 60's . Water in the bay then was soso. I think now is just poor management of drainage from street and sewrs to Ocean. Most of the time Ocean is fair to terrible. There are plenty of better beaches. Zuma, Malibu, Hermosa are a few.
Great views of the ocean with plenty of places to eat alongside a wide range of activities for all age groups.
there are lots to do here, strolling , volleyball beach, sight seing skate board, swimming and if you feel hungry there are lots of restaurant to choose.

column2: Lunch on the Santa Monica pier
column3: The attractions on the Santa Monica pier are rather old and average, but it's got a million dollar view. I dined at the Mexican restaurant on the end of the pier and have a great meal. I parked in the large lot north of the pier...an all day lot at $12. After parking, I found that there is an hourly parking lot on the south side of the pier that would have cost me much less money for my short stay.

column2: A lot of creativity in Santa Monica Beach area!
column3: It was a little cool near the water on our visit, but there were still plenty of people on the beach! The amusement area was nice too. Lots of food trivks, people on bikes, walking dogs, a few homeless, but area was safe. It was a good, people watching place for someone just visiting the area.
This is a very happening place in CA, specially from evening onwards. You will love the food around and the park near the beach are. Fun place for families.

Used to be a nice beach/shopping experience. But since the City of Santa Monica decided to feed the homeless, the beach and the Promenade are a smelly dive. You feel like you need a tetanus shot after walking on the beach amongst all the medical waste littering the shore. And parking is a joke. Take a hint... drive north on the PCH until you can see cleaner sand and water.

column2: Always something to Do with the "In Crowd"
column3: Went to visit a long time old friend who lives here and it is still just as much fun and excitement as it was many, many, many years ago when I lived in Southern CA. The beach is fabulous and the girls are too beautiful to describe. Felt like I was in an episode of "The Rich and Famous"

Santa Monica Bay is a beautiful location with lots of beach front. Temperatures are cooler in the Bay due to the cooler ocean temperatures. The Santa Monica Pier is located here with roller coasters, ferris wheel, and an aquarium. There are a few nice restaurants on the Pier, and it is close by Ocean Avenue, Third Street Promenade, and Santa Monica Place. It is busier during the summer and tourist season. Traffic on the I-10 to get to Santa Monica can be congested so leave early or very late to avoid it on weekends. You may see dolphins, seals, and on rare occasions a whale sighting.

This place has a way better vibe and feel than venice beach, and has lots more to do to enjoy a day at the beach. At night the place is always alive and just as fun to visit. the shopping precinct is only two streets away and pretty awesome!
We travelled to Santa Monica for the day whilst staying in LA. It was well worth the drive. Gorgeous setting with plenty to see and do. Even just a walk along the Pier is stunning.

The beaches are white sand clean and uncrowned. Plenty of car parking space at reasonable rates. Life guard stations are spaced out along the beach and there are plenty of void outlets and cycle hire huts along the beach. It is a lovely walk up to the Santa Monica pier where there is a restaurant and fair ground with a big wheel, roller coaster and bumper cars to enjoy. We were impressed with the location compared to other areas around here.
It麓s a big beach with white sands very long where we can take a goos bath.However its natural beauty it's not very great, but it's very animated.

We are only in L.A for 3 days and ended up spending a whole day at the Santa Monica Beach. The weather was nice and the people are very friendly (compared to NYC!!) I loved it and would recommend it to my friends and family. Walk down the SM Pier and try some of the vendors food before jumping aboard the ferris wheel!

column2: I felt like I was in a movie!
column3: What a nice promenade! Shops and great shopping. Great eateries all over the place. We weren't there for long but still enjoyed walking around the place. The evening was a little cold, I wish we could have stayed longer.
Good eating, shopping and sight seeing. There are so many things to do here that you will need more than one day.

Beautiful sandy Beach with reasonable Parking fees, facilities for all very child friendly, lots of shops, restaurants and bars. Santa Monica Pier is lively with funfair, restaurants but all a little pricey.
I like going to Santa Monica at night when the pier in lights. A lot of the restaurants do close early.

Love that place. That was one of the most exciting places we have ever been. You literally have a whole lot of fun. My wife hasn't been to the beach in her whole life that was a good experience for her. She's planning to go back next week. 攫攫攫攫攫攫攫攫攫
You have seen it in the movies. It looks just the same!The beach is huge. Public access areas are available. The cleanliness is to be admired and there are lots of beach volley courts

Great beach and the pier was great.Had a Japadog, famous in Vancouver. If you like Japanese foods like okonomiyaki, takoyaki etc then you might like to try hotdog variations of these type of flavours.Would like to come here again and look at the shops. We walked to the pier and went straight to the beach and walked towards Venice Beach expecting loads of quirky performers etc but we went during the week so not much going on. The Venice Beach vibe seems to pick up on a weekend.

Santa Monica is one of the nicer beaches although it still has some interesting characters. I highly recommend going to the 3rd Street Promenade if you are visiting SM and or a scenic drive along PCH to Malibu and back!
The beach... The Pier... EspeciallY at sunset, it was all just WOW! <3 We also booked a Malibu Beach Homes Tour from the pier, it was also so worth it!

column2: Good place to visit in LA
column3: Nice place, a lot of games. Bikes available. Roller coaster is there.A nice view from the pier.The place is quite crowded.

We spent a couple hours here its s nice beach I imagine if the weather was good it would be even better. the peer is lovely with souvenirs stalls fair rides and a nice mexican restaurant that we had a nice meal in
We loved having lunch on the pier, walking on the sand and enjoying the crowds. Had a hire car and it was very hard to find a park as it was a Saturday.
It is really a nice place to go with my family even in winter day this place always looks warm and beautiful

I came here whist driving down the coast to get to San Diego. It was a stop off to all the beaches on the west coast. This is quite a relaxing beach with much to do and look at, with a variety of shops and very friendly people.
Nice place for a walk and close to great shopping. The ferris wheel look beautiful and the view across the wide sandy beach is impressive.
Santa Monica is a really lovely area with a great pier with some good relaxing restaurants and a fantastic view over the ocean and the beach.

We parked here pretty easily and hired bikes to ride along the pathway to Venice beach.It was a Sunday and it was pretty busy, but if you take your time and stick to the right side, it doesn't seem that busy.It takes about 25 minutes just cruising, but longer if you stop and people watch. A great day out!
A lovely bay with a super beach. Great sunsets and a bustling lively place to visit. There is plenty to see and do. Boat trips from the marina are popular but not cheap.
Walked along the beach, the pier was heaving. Main shopping area is quite upmarket and makes for an enjoyable stroll
Sanata monica is made out to be this glamourous beach area etc very exculsuive and expensive yet its a clean tidy beach full of beggars and homeless people and nothing special.
Did Route 66 trip from Chicago. Was disappointed there weren't more signs giving the location of the end of Route 66.

...were that I wished I knew someone with a big yacht that I could be best friends with for an afternoon. There is nothing like sailing around on a big expensive boat that someone else has paid a lot of money for. Can't beat it.Unfortunately, I just got to dream. Oh well...
Too bad I didn't have time for the beach on this trip. Maybe next time I will stay a little longer to fully enjoy myself. It was nice watching people enjoy themselves..

no matter how many times I go to the Santa Monica bay , the beach is so awesome! you can choose a very commercial part like venice, marina del rey and santa monica or a more nature oriented part like playa del Rey or the dockwailer beach. the results are the same. awesome!!

The beach along the Bay is lovely and wide. There are a number of people on surfboards trying to catch the waves. Parking, like most places, can be tough to find. There is valet parking for $7 further along the beach. We did see dolphin from shore.. We headed out of Santa Monica on the PCH, but much of the view of the ocean is blocked for miles by the beach homes. You get a better view driving up into the hills.
took amazing pictures there! very beautiful while the sun is setting and at night time. nice relaxing views. try to have dinner at bubba gump!
Nice to see but a bit Tacky with some of the attractions & shops. Expensive rides for what they are, more for children though. Nice beach though . Worth a few photo,s
It was a great place to go to. It was relaxing and fun. The weather was nice but the water was cold we couldnt swim.

If you like the water this is the place to go. This is a wonderful place to just sit and be one with nature or play volleyball. Lot's of sand and sun to be had. It is worth the time and energy to visit. You won't regret it.

column2: Lots Of Fun With A Funky Feel
column3: Santa Monica Bay is huge and has a n array of activities. If you go into the ocean even though its 100 degrees outside, know that water is going to be cold.

column2: Fresh air; clear skies or foggy: nice
column3: This area of the Los Angeles area coast gives one the feeling of a nice spread of Pacific Coast beach. The beach is quite wide and there are usually people there engaged in different activities: working out, jumping rope, roller blading, sun worshiping, Segway, dreaming, reading and/or overall relaxing.The sound of the ocean and the surrounding fresh air lift the spirits and there is eye candy and action for those who need that.I try to go here every LA visit I make. One year we stayed in a hotel overlooking the Park. It was heavenly.
A great place to wander around and take in the beautiful views and salt air. Very peaceful. Visit for 3 or 4 hours and you'll come home completely relaxed.

column2: Thanks for the tip Richard Henry Dana
column3: In Dana's "Two Years Before the Mast", from 1840, he carefully lays out so many truisms concerning Santa Monica Bay. One f the things he refers to are the sweet breezes that arise at night. If you are staying at the Casa Del Mar, or any of the nearby beach hotels, be sure to open that window at night and enjoy them for yourself. It is sweet ocean air on a gentle breeze. If you can make a pelagic trip, go for it, you can't go wrong. Depending on the time of your visit, we often of plentiful whale, dolphin and sea lion sightings. Go to the beach, go to the Pier. Breathe.
I love the bay, the pier, the promenade and everything about Santa Monica... I never get bored of walking by the ocean during summer time..

The Santa Monica beach, despite its crowded jetty, is a great place to commune with the Pacific, certainly more exciting than Venice beach. We walked miles on the sand and delved into street food. Good parking options available

column2: Great Place for a Long Stroll
column3: After a wonderful breakfast at the Veranda Restaurant (Georgian Hotel), we headed across the street and walked all the way to Venice Beach about 2 miles or so up the road. We took our time both on Ocean Street, which sits above the beach, and also walking the pathway along the beach. We walked into the lobby of the Loews hotel and out onto their balcony/pool area, which is gorgeous. The Venice Beach "boardwalk" (a strange name for a pathway that is actually pavement) was exactly what you would expect and for us, not worth the time.
Would have loved to spend more time here - the beach is clean and there are restaurants aplenty. Also, a small fun park for children. One of the longest beaches I have seen.
Rent a bike and ride from Santa Monica to Venice Beach. You won't regret it! Stop at one of the beach cafes to have french fries and lemonade. You won't want to leave!

column2: Santa Monica Pier and Wheel, Marisal Mexican Restaurant
column3: My daughter and I were exploring West LA and found the pier where we rode the Wheel and had a great view. We walked to the end of the pier and found a Mexican Restaurant. We both enjoy the cuisine and I had excellent fish tacos and a tasty refreshing rita on the rocks! My daughter enjoyed her meal too.

Myself, my guy, his Mother and 2 sisters went to the Santa Monica Bay/Pier and we went to the beach and put our feet into the freezing Pacific Ocean. We walked along the Santa Monica Pier and people watched. There was a music festival and the "Zombies" were performing and food trucks and vendor booths.
it was a lovely quiet area good for a day out with the family or quiet drinks near the water. Clean area with lots of tourists

column2: Pacific Ocean beach - Bustling with energy....
column3: I had never imagined that a beach in California could be so crowded.....Bubba Gump is the best restaurant on the beach...and lot of expensive souvenir shops...but overall a good one time visit....
i love amusement parks and i love beaches! And guess what, they're both found here in santa monica bay! definitely a winner!
Took the train. Here from hollywood. So glad we did. What a lovely beach. Spotless and such a lovely place with a great shopping centre

column2: Beautiful Beach - clean and well kept
column3: Only had a short time to visit the pier and do some shopping. Area is clean and well laid out. Tourist map not 100% accurate but is good as a guide. Gorgeous topiary animal sculptures - easy to move around
A really fun place to see and the views were really nice. I would suggest taking a coat because it was a bit chilly in the evening.

walked from Venice Beach to Santa Monica pier. It was a cool, overcast day so no-one on the beach apart from some brave souls near the pier. It was 'interesting' walking along the boardwalk with a mixture of beach ware shops, cafes,etc and some people selling arts and crafts. The pier is old, a couple of rides which would suit young kids, very small. Santa Monica CBD was nice.
the park is fun, buy the la pass which includes the park ticket, beach is amazing also. do watch the sunset over the ocean here, its beautifull
Beach has a lovely pier and was very clean. A bit windy on the day I went but worth it as the beach goes on for miles. Well worth a visit and whalers restaurant is really good for seafood linguini.

I enjoyed my trip to Santa Monica more than anything I did in LA for four days. The beach is like a postcard and very clean. The pier was fun and there was plenty to see and do. I could easily spend 4 days there and just drive into the city if needed.

Went here as part of our bus your as they said Venice beach is a bit run down these days. Lovely beach and we walked the pier where there was a fair ground. Prices were very high but we expected that. Lovely views and you can see across to Malibu where all the stars live. Windy day for our visit but so take an extra layer of clothing.
It just felt like an old school place. Brings a sense of warmth. Did not take any rides but just took a stroll

Great base to visit Los Angeles and other towns and cities nearby. On the edge of so many 'must see' in the area. Santa Monica itself is lovely with lots of shops and restaurants. 20mins from LAX it provides a much quieter alternative to staying in LA without compromising a great time. The hop on hop off stops in Santa Monica and we used it to get in and out of LA. On one side Venice beach on the other a short drive to Malibu. I would happily stay in Santa Monica.
This is a beautiful area. Great sunsets. The beach is very clean and great if you like to exercise. Get there early or take a cab there. Parking seems to be difficult to find.
My son is the gondolier in Marina Del Rey and we had a beautiful view of the bay. I stayed on his sailboat for 7 nights and went all around the area. By car and sailboat.

Huge clean beach. Keep your eyes peeled we saw a sea lion swimming closer to shore than some swimmers ! Plus dolphins within 100metres of the shoreline. Pier is typical but worth a visit for the end of Route 66 signs and funnel cake. Shopping on 3rd Street was good and lots of restaurants.Very large number of homeless people wandering streets, sleeping on beach and grass on cliff tops and scavenging through bins. None bothered us personally but quite shocking to see. Parking is free for first 90 mins in all the car parks we used near 3rd Street and only dollar for each hour after that. Great place to stay away from hustle of Los Angeles

We stopped by the pier on a Friday afternoon. There is so much to see and do. Carnival rides and games, a huge Merry-Go-Round. Just an FYI...each ride costs $8.00 per person, so you may want to purchase the all day ride option. Good selection of restaurants, and shops. There is a play area for the kiddos down by the merry go round area. A lot of parking available. Many beautiful photo opportunities!!
I enjoyed the beach area. There was lots to do and the atmosphere was very Cali. Parking was very inexpensive and I wish I would have had time to run along the beach.
Downtown and the coast are both a very pleasent place to wonder and watch the sunset in all its glory. Crowded but interesting.

It is a very active place to hangout with your friends and family. The whole area has lots of eating joints & shopping options along with the Santa Monica Pier where they also have some fun rides to enjoy. Must visit place to relax.
We visited here a couple of times and really liked it. The people are friendly, they have a shopping mall which has all you need, some buskers and it's right near the water

We spent a few hours in Santa Monica walking around before heading down to the beach area. We had bags so took of our shoes and went for a walk in the sand. It was nice to breathe some fresh ocean air before walking over to the pier. Our kids went on a few of the rides which they enjoyed. Lots of people on the walkway roaming around and lots of places to get food and snacks. It was a great way to waste a few hours.

column2: A wonderful place to be in
column3: Everything about the place was nice. Beautiful sea view. Nice breeze. A guy playing soothing songs on the keyboard. Had a great evening.

With it's long and wide beaches this place is another great spot among Los Angeles beaches where you can spend a whole day and decide to come back the other. Ones who do not like the quality of food and service are people who have spent too long time on the Mediterranean coasts and expecting the same here. The world is big and there are different spots and cultures all around bros.
Loved Santa Monica Bay. The beach was lovely and the shopping is brilliant. So much going on there and lots of big name brand shops.

Santa Monica bay is a execellent place for beach lovers with , a long bay area with plenty of restaurants , long sandy beach and a baywalk area . Avoid the place on national holidays or saturday , when it tends to be extremely crowded and you may tend to feel lost in all the crowd . Santa monica , is very near to the Venice beach area , which offers a truly beach experience for the family .

column2: Nice place to visit in limited time
column3: has some atmosphere I didn't expect to find, both day and night. A friend took me, else I'd have not known of it.
Santa Monica bay is a great place to relax and hang out with family, friends or even have some time for yourself. Great sightseeing. Awesome restaurants around.
Like going to a midway. Tourist trap. Really not much to see or do unless you like fast food and buying souvenirs. Parking was expensive also
This is a very rich neigborhood of Los Angeles. Beautiful houses and well dressed people. Certainly worth to spend a day or half.

This was the first visit to L.A. for myself and my wife and we stayed in the Beverley Garland Hotel, North Hollywood, which ive got to say is a wonderful hotel with great staff. We wanted to find a place to visit so went to Santa Monica and specifically the pier. To get there we took the hop on hop off bus which gives you commentary all the way there and back which is great if you no very little about L.A. On entering the pier you find yourself at the end of route 66 and a sign depicting this. The pier has many attractions and food outlets. My wife and i enjoy spicy food so we were overjoyed when we found a lovely Mexican restuarant at the end of the pier with great views out to sea. The staff were all dressed in authentic Mexican clothing which added to the experience. So to summarise, Santa Monica is a must for those visiting L.A and the Mexican restaurant served us lovely food with prices very affordable.....If your going to L.A don't miss out on Santa Monica :)

A little overcrowded and touristy but that is expected. Despite that I had a great time with my best friend unwinding on the beach and exploring the local amenities. Lots of restaurants and bars so spoilt for choice.

column2: Fantastic and Stunning but too windy today
column3: Pier was great but it was far to windy today and needed to be out of the wind to make it enjoyable. Coming from Australia find it hard to believe that they call it a beach. Wind got so bad found a great bar across the road from the entry to the Pier brilliant for watching the world go by. Del Friscos Grill

Having taken a holiday to Los Angeles I decided to visit Santa Monica, whilst visiting the town I made my way down to the beach and I was taken aback by the beach and its views. I would thoroughly recommend visiting the beach if you are on holiday in Los Angeles or the surrounding area. The view of the pacific is simply breathtaking and the beach itself is equally wonderful. In addition you have the pier which only adds to the splendour of the pacific.
Sunshine and the Pacific Ocean. The pier is a must see. Lots of souvenir shops and interesting people. Really enjoyed the experience.

column2: A day at beach with entertainment
column3: Pier was fun place to visit and a great way to break up the usual by putting your feet in the ocean. End of Route 66 and great way to start beach relaxation. Venice is a good end to beach visits a little South of San Monica.

column2: the best beach in los angeles
column3: I've absolutly loved this place, it's very relaxing, very beautifull and the beach are amazing and very well preserve.For me the best beach in L.A.Very safe place where you can relax and eat in one of the little restaurants near the sea or even have some fun on the theme park from the pear.Amazing place i just want to go back.
Santa Monica really is a great place to visit. Fantastic beech and pier, great restaurants and bars, very lively very friendly lots to do and see.

We went by bus to Santa Monica. A very lively shopping area with heaps of bars & restaurants. Walking over to Santa Monica pier you cross a busy freeway by bridge. The beach is huge & covered in deck chairs. The pier has a Ferris wheel & all the usual side show activities happening with people selling all sorts. Sign saying end of Route 66 seemed to be a popular photo spot.
I've visited SM with my wife and toddler in a unforgettable weekend of pure joy and fun. This is great either during the mornings or evenings.
The landscape of the beach within the hill range, the pier, everything is just incredible. A must do visit when in LA and for a visit to the bech!

column2: a large crowded and fun beach with a nice view at sundown
column3: It is a very long beach with a pier in the middle. It is often crowded and not pretty by itself. But the atmosphere is casual and it is easy to take it easy and walk on the board walk watching,g the crowd and enjoying the sun.It is very difficult to find a parking space outside the public parking.

column2: Nice fun easy bike ride at the beach.
column3: Great place to rent a bike for casual drift along a dedicated path and take in the varied sights. From crazy buffed and showy locals strutting their stuff, the odd swimmer or surfer, beach food, cute Venice canal area, truck-loads of souvenir ships, the huge marina del Rey, interesting design beach houses and wide beach heads all the way down to Redondo. All good fun. Bike rental easy but if you have a specific bike type beyond a well-used American cruiser style you had better book a day or two ahead. Take sun-screen, hat and water with you - you'll be out in it all day for Redondo and back.Don't forget REI for shopping back at Santa Monica after you drop your bike back. n.b. Rentals usually close around 6pm.Buses there and back from the city or Hollywood are about every 30mins and cheap. Allow about 40mins to Santa Monica from Hollywood so can make a full day off it all.

column2: fun place to hang out all day have lots fun
column3: fun place to hang out all day have lots fun rides the beach good food . great for walking do date frindly or to go with family too a lot eye candy too

We went on Easter Sunday so it was going to be busy and sure enough walking along the pier you were jostling for space, but there was a nice atmosphere with a live band playing at the end. Stalls along the way, mostly touristy stuff (portraits, gimmicks). The beach is large and clean, but it was busy. A great place for people watching as the Californians hang out and practice circus skills and acrobatics on bits of elastic! Also cycle trails along the front.

The beach at Santa Monica is massive. The sea id mostly calm. There is a fun fair for children on the pier which we walked the length of.There is a lovely restaurant at the end of the pier. We ate outside which was warm as they had heaters outside.The service and food was very good.

The beach of Santa Monica is one of the places in the US where you can breathe freedom in the air. I was there in the spring, the best moment to go there, according to my opinion. You can witness thousands of people involved in thousands of different activities. Everyone is free to be and do whatever he/she wants without any fear to be judjed or mocked. The beach has facielities for every taste. Whatever your mood is, being there makes you happy.

Travelled on hop on off bus to Santa monica, which was a great experience. Went down to the harbour and was surprised that, as a Revenge fan, they used buildings as Jacks bar...and saw seal ions for further added bonus. Busy as it was Sunday, but interesting people watching. Kid heaven on the pier.

We had just a couple of days in LA after finishing a cruise and before flying home. Santa Monica was a lovely place to stay with the iconic Pier, great beaches and huge choice of restaurants. There was a lovely feel to the place. It's a shame that the traffic is bad at times but pedestrians well catered for with crossing lights at every junction.

This was the phrase I heard from a member of staff in a coffee shop just after they ejected a vagrant. Everywhere you go in Venice Beach and Santa Monica there are homeless people camped out and it makes me very nervous when walking about. They approach people and come up to the glass when you are in restaurants. I like the whole LA vibe and the venues we visited were great but the vagrant problem spoils it.

12 yo had fun on the rides BUT!! The best is the "BUBBA Gump" restaurant (From the Forest Gump movie) Food was really great, Service fantastic, would really highly recommend it. Put it on your bucket list!

column2: Chill out by the beach before that dreaded long flight home.
column3: If you are filling in time between plane journeys then i would highly recommend this beach.It is not crowded and very very pleasant.LA airport offer a free shuttle bus to the Santa Monica Big Blue Bus No 3.There are printed instructions at the information centre at LAX where we were greeted by a delightful elderly volunteer man who told us "good choice ladies". Basically, wait outside under the Blue LAX Shuttle Sign and catch the free shuttle to LAX Parking Lot C shuttle.Exit the bus at the first shuttle stop and walk across the path to the LAX City Bus Transit Center to Bay 12.Take the Santa Monica Big Blue Bus #3.It costs US$1.00 one way(how cheap is that for a half hour ride.)Exit bus at 4th Street & Broadway Ave.Walk west on Broadway Ave for one block to the 3rd Street Promenade and the Santa Monica Place shopping mall.Warning allow 1 hr to return back to airport if it is after 4.00pm because of peak hour traffic.Plenty of cafes and restaurants for all taste buds.What i personally loved about this beach is that there are tourist security guards who give you a business card and you can text 310-499-2928 for parking assistance,events,directions and feedback.So as a tourist you are perfectly safe.We saw a seal close to shore and it was just nice to sit and take in the lovely seabreeze before our flight home.There were buskers and a lady with a parrot and a man with a snake if you want a photo with them(of course for a small fee).One guy was funny about 30 yrs old had a cardboard sign which read 'Small change please".Two blonde pretty German tourists were behind us and he turned his sign over and it read "Your hot! and he called out to the girls "I''ll take phone numbers".so i laughed and said " girls, you would of made his day if you gave him a phone number and they said," We should of given him a fake one".It is all good and a bit of fun when you are on holidays.It certainly makes the atmosphere of Santa Monica.
what's not to love.......sun,surf, people watching and good food. The scenery is just beautiful. A great place to spend the day.
There was a heatwave when we went so very busy. We are glad we went there as a really nice place to visit

What's not to love? Stretches of sandy white beaches and surf. This is California at its best. Take a walk from Santa Monica pier up to Venice beach or ride a bicycle or rollerblade/rollerskate (they are all on hire). My friend and I walked all the way up and then got tired and so hired segways. A segwa is that funny looking two-wheel device that you see in movies. I have always wanted to try one. As nerdy as one looks riding a segway with a helmet on, it was such great fun and it saved my feet. We got back in record time and the guy we hired them from was waiting to take them off our hands (that was great service). Loved this time!
Rented a bike and spent a day at the beach. Great! Beautiful scenery, excellent people watching, good restaurants.
live place full of attrations to relax and holiday . Good for family and summer more than winter. a lot of variation of restaurant on the breach . Avoid use star line

Now I like the beach. I like tourism too. But the pier was a little too manufactured and your food options are places like Bubba Gump Shrimp. If you are looking for less chain style places, this isn't where you want to go. There is a small amusement park area but we didn't go experience any of the rides. If you like Dave and Busters you will like this place. Don't plan your whole trip around it, but it also isn't the worst place ever. Maybe plan for one afternoon or evening of rides and silliness.There is pay parking that was about 2 bucks and hour i think.
Went here during the hop on hop off bus trip. Beautiful never ending beach and pier. Lots of places to eat and drink.
We visited the Santa Monica pier, played volleyball on the beach, shopped and ate on 3rd street (street shut down to shoppers and restaurant seekers.
If you can avoid the homeless and see Santa Monica for what it is that's great , you will enjoy your experience... There is so much to see

column2: Went for a run along the beach
column3: Nice path for running - lots of other runners around. Also the weather was beautiful and the the parking was close. Really liked visiting here.

When we lived in California, we never went to the pier, and so now, leaving the cold and snow of the east, we decided that this was a must see and do. Santa Monica is beautiful and the pier is a blast. The only thing was there was a cold fog the rolled in while we were on the ferris wheel which really made us cold. But we can imagine on a beautiful clear day that it would be heaven riding up there with the vista's all around. There was a great street magician there, an older guy who was the best we've every seen. And the things to see and buy and try were just fabulous. Don't miss out on a piece of California history.

I think this was okay....but I mostly likely would not go back. The Pier is crowded and junk. The place could be more attractive if the restaurants and tourist kiosk were designed to be better than average.
One of the best waterfronts i have ever been to... scenic as one would imagine... lively... amazing shopping and dining options in the vicinity... try and stay here for 1/3 of your LA trip...
OK....so its a beach , and a pier with tacky overpriced rides , and shops selling crappy goods at high prices. Next to it is a shopping areas and lots of mediocre restaurants.Big deal

We went to Santa Monica bay and pier today, it was extremely busy which we expected on Good Friday Easter. The beach is beautiful, the pier is heaps of fun with buskers, little shops etc. You can hire push bikes to ride on the safe bike track along the beach. We had mega fun. We were visiting from Australia.Definitely worth a visit. You can catch the Big Blue public bus there from the LAX airport area for $1 a trip. Bus is air conditioned and you do not need to stress over LA traffic.

column2: A must see when in Cali!!
column3: We went in the summer in the states and Santa Monica was amazing! A day of sun, surf, shopping and eating! The pier itself is a great attraction for families and friends! The nightlife was quite decent as well!

Really enjoyed my visit! It was a Sunday but not too busy. Lovely weather, great for walking, cycling or skating, as well as people watching and see any street performers. Don't miss the frozen yogurt. Lovely. Easily accessed by bus ($1.75) from town centre or Hollywood/ Sunset Boulevard!

column2: Enjoy the beach and the reastaurants
column3: A full day in the beach, there is plenty of haute cuisine restaurants and shopping. Visit the pier, get in to the Ferris wheel, go to the arcade or visit the aquarium.

I think I am more writing for the Pier... Its more of a touristic fun with some shops and limited eateries. The view from the pier although is great. More famous due to the Baywatch thing.... It was too cold to get a taste of the beach but the area around is beautiful and worthy of visiting once. Still would ask people to save time here and head for Venice beach.. its double the fun for sure.

My nineteen year old son and I recently took a spur-of-the-moment trip to Los Angeles, and decided to stay in Santa Monica for three of the nights we were there. What a good decision that was! The beach is lovely, and there are many shops and restaurants in which to spend your time. The area is equally fun to see at night as it is during the day. We are very happy that we decided to spend a few days in this area. It seemed to be a good location from which to venture into other areas of LA as well.
Stunning scenery , pleasant atmosphere , fun to walk around , there are many nice places to eat .Nice stroll in the evening at sunset even with my husband

A really great place to go. The beach is great apart from a certain amount of tar on the beach. The pier is a must with good rides, the end of Route 66 and even a Route 66 shop. The town is really good and even has a British goods shop selling Marmite
Famous in france (moovies) and pleasant stay for all the family beach. parking the car is easy. shopping, sports, restaurant easy. road 66 starts here.

First time visiting this beach and i'm in love! This beach has everything and more. The beach itself is very clean and beautiful. The pier is great, with little shops, great restaurants, and a little theme park. It was very busy but that didn't take away from all the things you can enjoy there. Parking can get a little hectic but they have plenty of "garage" parking for a low fee. Great neighborhood. We will be visiting soon!
Great to relax straight out of the city, little nicer than Venice beach especially at night. Do the pier, embrace the locals, and enjoy the clean beach. The bars set back a street are cool too :)

We visited Santa Monica Pier after touring LA all day. It was crowded and people watching was interesting. We enjoyed a stroll on the boardwalk and a nice meal. While dining we were treated to a beautiful sunset. This is a nice place to visit for the history and because you have probably heard of Santa Monica Pier.
Nice beach and bay. The view is quite nice with the pier and the cliffs in the background. It is quite wide and it gets very busy on the weekends.
We took the city bus to Santa Monica and went to the oceanfront. We had lunch at Bubba Guppa's, the food was great. And spent some time people watching.

Fantastic place to take a walk along the beach, relax and unwind. The Pier is of course the diamond in the crown for fun activities, great places to grab a bite to eat, the amusement park at the end and of course people watching. Try a funnel cake if you get time or have a meal at Bubba Gumps

column2: make sure you add this to your sightseeing tour
column3: Our disappointment was we ran our of time to see all we wanted to see ....... so give yourself plenty of time to do the pier and Venice Beach

column2: Oh how i miss Santa Monica
column3: We were holidaying from Australia and Santa Monica was our first "beach" stop on our day out in a hire car. Wow. What an impression this has made on us. The pier with the rides is dated, but we had so much fun. We sat and watched people riding and rollerblading and working out. It was so different!Definitely recommend visiting here!

Santa Monica is as you expect, glam and expensive for the most part, but with real people carved into the LA lifestyle. Casual eating houses, good shopping, bars and cafes and great night life. It was actually the best place of my LA trip.
Lovely pier great for strolling and enjoying the sea breeze and people watching. There is lots of entertainment for kids.

We went to the Bay for a quick visit and lunch. The views were great and the beach looked beautiful. We were there in March and the pier had plenty of people. Based on this, we might guess it is very crowded during the summer months. The shops on the pier sold mostly junky souvenirs, but the ice cream at the Soda Jerks shop by the carousel was great.Parking was only $1 per hour near the base of the pier.
Visited Santa Monica in February, weather was good and it was not very crowded. Really recommend the area. Great restaurants and shops, really nice atmosphere.

column2: Wonderful place, beautiful ocean and beach
column3: We loved our time in Santa Monica bay. We went to thf beach and walked along the pier. It's a pretty big placd so easy to get lost. We had a frappe each on the beach. The weather was fine and the locals very friendly.

column2: Visited twice within a 4 day stay
column3: We visited LA for 4 day and visited Santa Monica twice within this period as we enjoyed it so much. The shops are great and found the view amazing on the beach.Well worth a visit if your in that part of the world.
Visited so many places/beaches but few have such great cool looks and fresh air.Public washroom may have been cleaner.

We rented bikes in Santa Monica and rode along the bike path to Venice beach and back. It was great fun to people watch and also see all the vendors along the way. We then had lunch at the Mexican restaurant at the end of the pier. The food was delicious and the prices were very reasonable for such a beautiful spot.
Nice place to hang out, look at the people maybe grab something to eat, the weather was really warm for this time of the year.The views of the beach are amazing.
Muscle beach a must, been going to this area for 4years and have never had to make a complaintBe aware of people holding snakes for photographs
We went to this area to have dinner one night and it is so pretty. I would say if you have time to go for the day and have dinner. It is a very different feel then other parts of LA.

We ended our California vacation by spending the day on the pier, I will say I think it would be much prettier at night when it's all lit up. We had a lovely stroll along the pier and enjoyed looking out at the water and watching the men fish.We were lucky enough to be able to see some wildlife, we had a seal swim up looking for food and there was a boat full of seals sunbathing.I look forward to coming back in warmer weather maybe for a swim!

column2: Always a great place to visit and walk around.
column3: I still do not get why it is so popular, its smelly, the beach is dirty, the pier is packed, the beach is packed, the water is dirty, but yet, here we are, always a stop when we go down there. love the peopel watching, the tourists are fun to watch. The private reptile and bird zoo is crazy, i say it is animal abuse. I guess might as well make money of your pets. n8oD

They have the best pier in the state of California, food galore, amazing beaches, bike path for miles, and the best shopping that Los Angeles County has to offer. And the cherry on the top is the new subway station being built next to the pier and 3rd street promenade. 3rd street has the best people watching outside on San Fran. And it's very deverse with a little bit for everyone. Our favorite part are the street performers, that make the whole day worth while ;-)
lovely views, lovely photo opps. and there is this weirdness at the same time,so watch the kids, they do get a lot of beggers around there
Nice place with wide variety of restaurants and caf茅s, shops and pedestrian walk ways, muscle beach over rated but interesting walking there along the concrete "boardwalk"

This place is as pretty as the pictures. The weather ha a nice brezze! Very family friendly ! Free and pic attractions. There were some talented street preformers. Places to eat and rides. It was just great. We did the on the hop on hop off which is a great way to see a lot in one day...overall pier was great!! Will spend more time to next visit!!
Santa Monica is a great place where you can walk, do some sports, swimming, eat and drink.Also has a great sunset

Had tons of fun rides and games for kids. Bubba Gump is Right on the pier which was delicious!! Beaches where clean and the people where Friendly. Nice Place to get cheap adult beverages located on pier also.

We came in the winter time but still very much enjoyed this beach and bay. There were hardly any people and it was warm enough we could relax on the beach, it was like our own paradise. The water was cold but there were still some people swimming anyway and enjoying it. I would recommend this beach area to every one as it is nice and clean.
Very nice place with view of the bay and lots of shops nearby. So definitely a place to go whenever you're in the area for hangout.

If I had ten thousand words to describe my home beach I would fill volumes in the libraries of the world. The Santa Monica Pier is my favorite place, and as I look out over the ocean at sunset the whole of the ocean surface appears to be on fire. It is where I go for healing, peace, and serenity. As I walk down the steps next to Bubba Gumps and on to the North Sands of the beach all the toxins are flushed away. I had some swelling in my right foot and thirty minutes later it had vanished.What can I say but Santa Monica Pier and Beach is my true love. You can give me all the beautiful places in the world but as for me I would give it all up just to be on my home beach. Like southern California it is the same for the pier and beach, it is my most beautiful love, and my place to commune with my Hannah. I love her so, she is my passion, my heart, my spirit, and my soul. May it never leave this earth. Santa Monica Pier and Beach, I truly love and adore you. Kiss.You will pay a fee for parking, I think it is still $6.00.

column2: Escape and Enjoy Santa Monica Bay
column3: Santa Monica Bay is so much more than just a bay. Sunsets are beautiful with or without the Santa Monica Pier and Ferris wheel in your photos. Photo ops are so numerous, you have many options. Nearby Oceanfront Avenue parallels the beach, and you can walk from one restaurant to the next, read the menus posted outside and choose where you want to dine. In most restaurants, you can walk in and find a table just before or after peak times of the day. Definitely check TripAdvisor for restaurant reviews. We like to try different restaurants on Oceanfront before or after photos of the sunset. Definitely a destination to get away from the frenzy of in other LA areas.Santa Monica Bay is at the end of the now Historic Route 66, the famous historic highway from Chicago to Santa Monica. (Officially decommissioned as a U.S. Highway in 1985.) Will Rogers Park is located between Oceanfront Avenue and the bay. Also, Santa Monica Place and Third Street Promenade for shopping are located just two blocks from the bay. With history, shopping, restaurants, and fun, Santa Monica Bay is gorgeous and offers so much it's hard to know where to begin your visit. We start by parking at the at the parking garage on Third Street and plan our visit so we are at Santa Monica Bay at sunset! It's a beautiful getaway!

Nice area to go with kids as there is long promenade where to walk and hire bicycles. Nice beach.There is pier that can be visited and walk with the family.Outside of the promenades on the main Beach road there are nice and good quality restaurant with good value.
loved it, the entertainment for people is fantastic and its such a nice day out for a family , well worth it
A lovely beach and view. Walk along the wharf, have a swim or go to the very modern shopping centre. There isn't a train to get there so either drive or catch a bus from the city centre.

This is a great place to visit for just a short time or to spend all day. It's a little more classy than Venice Beach but not really better. Just different and more touristy. It has the pier that is loaded with games, shopping and is a good place for pictures and seeing sea lions.

Nice beach to visit. The boardwalk has reasonable parking price and some nice attractions. For a really nice walk, go to the top of the bluff. There is a nice walking path with lots of beautiful landscaping.
A great place to relax, enjoy the views and some sun. The pier was a great experience as well and we saw a seal and some dolphins from the end which made our day.
Good spot to visit "once", some decent places to grab a beer, nice view of the pacific coast and the Malibu hills.

Not so amazing as shown in films which dwells on the best parts. We spent three weeks here as participants in the Malibu International Film Festival (Special Jury Award) and as a consequence saw much of Santa Monica, and Los Angeles in general. This was the only place you could thankfully walk all the way to Venice Beach and beyond. The rest of LA was car infested all the way to Hollywood, which was a hateful place. Only the Hispanic workers travel by the meagre public transport available. Cinema dominates over all, even the waiters and waitresses in restaurants we went to were 'resting' actors and desperate for recognition. "Hey, can I give you my card? You don't know who you'll meet. You could help me!" Ugh! The 'desperation' in LA pervades everything, and it is refreshing to return back to the sanity of walk-free Santa Monica. But as already intimated, the beach which extends to Venice, is not special. And Venice until very recently was a place where the delinquents and homeless ended up. In all, a depressing location.

Having visited the Getty first, we needed some fresh ait and then the drive to Santa Monica isnot that far. You can park nearby, walk the pier and 3rd Street Promenade . Had to look hard to find cosey place for coffee and then went off to next target to visit.

Enjoy the sun dawn from a bench, see the end of highway 66, eat at Bubba Gump, Forest Gump legendary place, see the cannons which protected the coast, marvelous ocean, lovely pier, lots of restaurants, nice people and food. A paradise!
It's not very often to experience such a magnificient view over the sunset!Catch a sunny day, take a stroll up towards the north, then bathe in the orange-pink gorgeous scenery.

Fun beach with music on the peer. Clean sandy beach that was a fun walk. We parked down from the boardwalk and walked in. Parking meters stated our parking was valid till 5 and we could not get it to register a parking for later so we ended up watching the sunset from the beach nearby and sort of looked over our shoulder to make sure we were not being ticketed. Parking lto was open till sunset but for some reason the meters did not have time available till sunset which was about 7:00 that night.
Everyone visiting this region should spend a bit of time here - it's really beautiful especially at sunset. To avoid the crowds, come after dinner.

column2: Wear comfortable shoes and start here
column3: My daughter, who lives in LA, brought me by car to the Santa Monica Pier. Parking was reasonable, perhaps because it was evening, and it wasn't a bad walk from the lot to the pier. On the pier there are public restrooms, restaurants, shops, especially souvenir shops, some rides, most notably a Ferris wheel with a great light display, plenty of places to sit and look at the water, and some musicians and other entertainers trying to earn a living. If you are wise enough to wear comfortable shoes or sneakers, you can walk from the pier, on an overpass spanning the street, and find your way to the Third Street Promenade, and lots more restaurants.

column2: A must visit to see and smell the clean sea air!
column3: I caught a bus from downtown LA. Very easy to get here.The shopping mall and walk through the main trees was very pleasing to the eye-after downtown LA.The hedged dinosaurs in the main mall were very cool.The pier itself had a great combo of awesome souvenirs, buskers, plenty of places to relax and opportunity to have a coffee if you need a fix.It was nice to be able to sit here and take in the beach and relax!

Did you know ow that samo bay is the dirtiest water in all of the California coast? And the homelessness is outrageous and out of control. The water is brown, the beach is good. If you drive there, you spend a fortune on parking. So basically, there's nothing special about it.

Beautiful beaches. But as a whole Los Angeles was a let down:(Especially Hollywood lots of poor beggars and pretty dirty.Lots of hot fitness fanatics around the beach. I trained with a trainer around this area and did some fantastic photos around here. Nice parks too.I will do the complete Route 66 and return with my daughter one day :)

This is what you think of when you think of California! Palm trees, sun and sand. Lots of places to eat and have drinks. Or just hang out at the beach or the grass areas. Street muscians and artists and lots to see and buy. from cotton Candy to sweets, ice cream sodas and lots of people. Lots of store to shop in as well. Only set back if you travel in the summer it might be a little challenging to find parking. But other than that great fun place to visit.

column2: Favorite Beach Town in Los Angeles
column3: Santa Monica is a must see for any tourist visiting LA. In fact staying in Santa Monica is advisable (particularly in Summer), since you have the best of everything in close proximity and you're at the beach. 3rd Street Promenade, The Pier, Main Street and more, plus many great hotels, restaurants, bars and nightlife.

This is a very pretty beach for tourists and those who live close to it. The pier is touristy but a fun place to go if you are new to the area. The beach is ended in summer and parking can be a real problem.

column2: When in LA I will always stay in Santa Monica.
column3: What's not to love about Santa Monica? This area has everything a traveller could want, sites, shopping, restaurants, cafes, a great beach, quality hotels and within proximity of all LA's attractions. It's an easy drive from LAX and then everything local is within walking distance. When driving to LA's attractions all freeways are easy to access or just jump on to Santa Monica Blvd and head into town.

We enjoyed our visit to LA that included Santa Monica area. Our bus tour of LA started in Santa Monica beach area. Impossible to drive and park areas you are unfamiliar with so I recommend taking a tour.
What a beautiful area to spend a day relaxing and taking in the sights. The pier, surf and beach were all great as well as the town of Santa Monica. Walking the farmers market was lots of fun.

Fantastic beach. Use Santa Monica Blvd and avoid the freeways. Excellent restaurants and shopping. Use public parking ramp, it's free for first hour and a half, and then quite reasonable. Parked entire day for $11.

This place is beautiful and the people are so friendly and welcoming. We didn't get to go into the waters because it was such a short trip with so much to see and do already but we will be visiting again soon. There were lots of people on the beach so I'm sure others had a great time.

We headed to Santa Monica one afternoon and watched the sun go down. I honestly don't think you've ever really seen a sunset until you see a Pacific sunset. I almost turned into the double rainbow guy from YouTube!

We will definitely stay at Santa Monica longer on our next holiday. Loved the area and wondering around the beach area. Great beach - beautiful clear water be it a little cool. Make sure you spend some time walking on the pier.

column2: Welcome To City Of Los Angeles
column3: Youre waking up with somebody great, and youve got a plan.Get some sun. Bask in the view of the Hollywood Hills. Eat french toast.Then maybe get out of bed and go somewhere.Welcome to Santa Monica, a charming new cluster of suites torn straight from some lost Grease Lighting flick,Theyve got breakfast waffle service in the morning across the pier, at night andwell, here are the important stats.To read more visit : http://kandeegems.com/post/111313808805/mytravel
For me it was really fun to see Santa Monica because i only saw it in the movies. I did expect it to be bigger but it was nice to stroll around and look over at the sea.
A massive span of beach and rolling waves. From early morning always someone running,walking or playing with the dog.Pasific park opens around 11am.The beach is so clean and lovely soft sand.

column2: Great beach for viewing not swimming.
column3: As a local I can tell you that Santa Monica has pretty dirty waters. I would not recommend swimming in the waters ever.The pier is just great, they have a Ferris wheel and other rides.There is a great arcade with multiple types of games.Snacks, GREAT restaurants, and if you go on a weekend many side attractions as well.I would recommend to come here and tan on the sand, enjoy the views, shop, eat, and take lots of pictures.If you are looking for cleaner waters I would go further up north.A little bit further down is Malibu, which has better views and a much cleaner feel but does not have a pier and arcade.

Santa Monica was going to be the start of our road trip along the PCH to San Francisco. First we needed to find a parking spot se we can walk along the bay and then hit the pier.Santa Monica is funky and busy, the beach had kids running around, the pier was heaving and our kids wanted to go on the rides. We wanted to spend more time in Santa Monica but we needed to hit the road so we could not spend as much time as we liked.
The bay/pier has a whole day's worth of activities. Aside from walking along the pier, there is the arcade and restaurants to visit. Below the pier is a great playground with lots to see and do.

column2: Santa Monica Pier is a great way to spend an afternoon
column3: We had a wonderful time at the Santa Monica Pier. We sat at the Pier & people watched for a while. We ate lunch & enjoyed the amusement park. Rode the Ferris wheel. Beautiful area with fun things to do.

column2: everything you see in the movies
column3: It was an awesome stunning experience, there were a lot of beggars and they were not afraid to ask for even a penny. Clean area though. loved the walk.
Not much in the way of shopping, I don't swim at beaches, and there's only so much time you can spend contemplating the ocean as an alternate activity, so that made the trip somewhat of a bust.
lovely place, chilled and relaxed feel. Great ice creams somewhere everyone should visit. Easy to park, lots of things going on, we all loved it

Santa Monica is a must visit when in LA. whether in the morning or at night this place is just so amazing. Walk on the beach or just sit & admire the sea. The shops on the 3rd street Promenade offers a wide variety of range, excellent for shopaholics as well.
Great place to visit and experience some of LA' colourful personalities. Always something new to see.

I live close by so I frequent this place. The crowd can sometimes be overwhelming, especially during the summer. I bike nearby, hike and yes...swim too. Great selection of restaurants/bars and so great for people watching. Delightful!

Nice shops near the beach, the pier didn't have too much going on when we were there, but there was a muscle car show - saw a lot of cars.It was nice to sit on the beach and watch a surfer, who we were willing to do what he does well and he did.We took the bus from west Hollywood and it was around a 45min/1hr journey but with a little preaching on the bus - not from me, the journey was interesting and memorable. A great day out!

column2: Very trendy spot to spend some time.
column3: 3rd avenue promenade is nice, safe and clean. Bars and restaurants all very stylish. Walk into the shopping centre at the end of 3rd avenue and do a bit of shopping.Some quality bars and restaurants on top level.Walk to the pier for a bit of fun and nostalgia.Worth a day to visit and a lot better than many areas of LA.

column2: Santa Monica, the end or the beginning of Route 66.
column3: The pier is just something you need to experience if you visit LA, the trip down to the pier is well worth it. The entertainers are everywhere and there is a bunch of food choices. When you have finished visiting the pier take a stroll downtown and just soak up the atmosphere. This is where the rich and famous take their summer holidays!

Awesome beach...it was clean...we got ourselves wet here in water...then you have a place specially to watch the sunset...ample places for parking...lovely scenery...we spent the whole evening sitting and watching sun setting..it was beautiful ...good crowd on pier....place to take some real good pictures.

easy to get to from Hollywood, we took the hop on hop off bus tour. Really enjoyed the views and atmosphere, also the area was kept quite clean too. The only thing I didn't like was how crowded the pier was. We went around lunch time though so maybe if we went first thing in the morning it may be less crowded.definitely recommend trying the icecream at the little old school style carousel at the bottom of the pier.

Tried to visit the Observatory but couldn't park. It was our day of departure, weather had finally warmed up so we went to the beach. Wanted to go somewhere else as had been to Santa Monica Pier in 2003 but not too far from airport. Had lunch at Perrys which was OK but nothing special. Toilets on beach nowhere to wash hands & a load of tramps hanging about. Huge expanse of sandy beach but clearly very wealthy & very poor people in the vicinity.

A great beach where you can frequently see seals, pelicans and sometimes dolphins. Lots of activities including the Venice board walk, the Santa Monica Pier and the new Muscle Beach. Lots of great places to eat -- from casual to mighty fine. Mighty fine often requires a reservation. Also, there are some splendid hotels along the beach. You will pay for the splendor!

column2: Crowded & nothing much to write about
column3: The place is very crowded and can be found dirty at some places. There are lots of eateries to choose from but nothing special is on offer. It is a decent place to visit during the evening hours to soak in the bay experience but not high on recommendation.

It breaks my heart to see people rummaging through the bins searching for food. They don't even beg, because they care so assured of rejection. This was more so evident at Santa Monica Pier, and the poverty of the homeless is juxtaposed by the excesses of the tourist. The bag is pretty at night, the Pier lights up with neon lights. Not much to do though, although there are some excellent restaurants in the vicinity.Visited in August 2013

The view from the beach and pier is gorgeous. But it's crowded. Definitely not something I'd want to plan a day around, because I didn't find it fun to be around that many people. But still, watching the sunset was amazing.
Lots of rides and amusement place for the kids and not so young kids. Just like a mini carnival with games and such. Can watch the water nearby along the shore. Snacks and drinks for everyone.

the whole Santa Monica area is well worth the trip. We went there and had a look at the whole area down to Venice. It is a very pretty area and the people are pretty eye opening. The rides at the pier are good value and our kids really enjoyed them.
Loved the beach at Santa Monica but certainly didn't see it at its' best as it rained continuously. Went to Chez Jays bar which was atmospheric and friendly and welcome shelter!

Nice beach!! Coming from Australia I didn't expect a lot but I was pleasantly surprised. Unfortunately the day I was there is was one of those rare rainy days in LA so I didn't get to enjoy it in the sunshine, but it would have been a really nice to hire a bike and ride the track down to Venice beach. I think Californian coastline is spectacular. The hotels and eateries along the main drag have a really nice view Santa Monica Bay.

We took a whale viewing and sea mammal watching tour from the marina. It was approx. a 3 hr trip. We were taken to areas visited by seals and sea lions, we experienced the playful antics of dolphins first hand in nature where they belong as they swam alongside or led our boat disappearing in a moment when the motor was turned off. We had the opportunity to spot one grey whale migrating down to warmer Mexican waters to give birth to her baby. It was an experience of a lifetime, nature at her best. Pelicans and other sea birds also added to the whole experience. The boat crew was efficient and polite. Tickets should be bought on groupon with a generous discount. I highly recommend for nature and sea lovers.
to see sunset ,sunrise as well. try breathing in and out deeply with watching the sun.this is must-visit place in LA.

We visited Santa Monica as part of a day tour of LA.We were surprised to find out that the end of Route 66 is on the pier; albeit the unofficial one (in our opinion - the original plaque is a couple of blocks away on the main road).This added something a little special to our trip as we are both Route 66 fans and never expected to see this (or the original, which was worth the walk to find).The pier itself isn't huge, but has plenty to see. It wasn't too crowded when we visited which was nice.It was a nice place for a walk and well worth a visit.(If you're looking for a quieter pier/beach, try Manhattan Beach instead)

column2: One the best to enjoy the seaside, sunset, and people of all colors!
column3: It is a great place surrounded by many choices for your liking....from large crowds at he Pier with rides..many restaurants along Ocean Ave....3rd Street Promanade ....yes, people of all colors...and range, not only skin, clothing and faces... from "California girls" in bikinis to the homeless in blankets! Be prepared to take it in!

Worth visiting and it's nice for a walk. Lot's of people quite crowdy.Good for a walk, beautiful beach and nice pier.I didnt know that it's the place where the historic route 66 has one of its ends.What surprised me was the fact that there is a lot of homeless "looking" people it made me feel unsafe.

column2: Best place to surf and to have fun! :)
column3: Do you like to surf? Do you like rides? If you like does things this is the place for you. In the morning the Ferris wheel at the pier lights up and is beautiful. On Saturday and Sunday is crowded but it's worth it. I love to surf and it's usually a good place.
Try the rides! They are cheap and fun. No need to queue for a long time at all. Watch the sunset! Have some nice food! What a great evening.

I had a chance to visit the pier with family it was fun.. Lots to see beautiful at night the ferris wheel gives a great overview at night. I enjoyed the watch the family of seals at the end of the pier just so free and happy. A little nipping a sweater or jacket at night is great..

column2: I made it to the end of Route 66
column3: Visited last week in the afternoon, and I was surprised to see how crowded it was. Lots to see and do. People were surfing and swimming. First time dipping my toes in the Pacific ocean.

column2: Beautiful pier with lots to see
column3: The Santa Monica Pier is a very high energy place with lots of street performances. It overlooks the ocean and there are lots of treats and food to eat. It's very interesting and I could spend a whole day there. Would revisit if I had the chance.
Santa monica is so beautiful with a great view over the ocean. Check out "end of the trail" for route 66 on the pier. Can be a bit hard to find a parkingplace for the car on a busy day.
This is a great place to visit :) few rides, amusements and great beachs! Also, the mall is a good place to do some shopping!! :D Would recommend to all

Beautiful long beach and pier. Hire a bike from one of many places and cycle the bike path to Venice and beyond or towards Malibu. I found everyone here very friendly.
