Lots of interesting and quirky folk here. There are a lot of homeless people in the area but they were just going about their business. Plenty of shops and places to eat out too.

column2: A Nice Beach with Good Shopping Nearby
column3: The beach is nice and it's especially great if you ride your bike along the bike path. It'll take you all the way to Venice Beach. You can also make a quick stop on the Santa Monica Pier and either get on a ferris wheel, go to the end of the pier and see people fishing, or just enjoy the view of the ocean and coastline from both sides. Once you're done there, you can walk a few blocks and head to 3rd Street Promenade which has a variety of clothing stores, a movie theater, a book store, some restaurants, and a nice outdoor mall at the end of it. You can also drive north to Malibu and beyond on Pacific Coast Highway and enjoy the beautiful Southern California coastline.
Very nice place, the beach, the streets, the bar. Everything is good in this place.Certainly I could to live there.

It's a beach..If you're a tourist I suggest you to do a small stop simply to get the vibe of Santa Monica Pier and to walk on the beach. Although It is very nice, there's not much to see. I mean the views of the mountains and the ocean are beautiful but you can see that from any other place. So we decided to rent bikes to enjoy the view toward Venice Beach. (8$/hour but we had the GoCard --> check it out!)
Classic southern CA beach. Fun. Must see when visiting west Los Angeles. Drive north to Malibu and Oxnard for more rural beauty.
Pretty hard to go to LA and not end up here. I liked the acro yoga on the beach Sunday arvo. The pier is so touristy, wouldn't recommend, just walk/cycle around the beach.

column2: Santa Monica- lovely beach and pier
column3: Made my way to Santa Monica on the Starline hop on off bus. I always wanted to dip my toe in the Pacific Ocean and I achieved it on Santa Monica's large beach, Took a stroll along the pier and the view around the bay from the pier was wonderful. In all my visits around Santa Monica and other parts of Hollywood, Brentwood, Beverly Hills, Rodeo Drive, not a 'celebrity' to be seen. They must have known I was coming !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Technically speaking, the Santa Monica Bay is not in Los Angeles. It can also get very crowded on Summer weekends, so get there early.

column2: Just a Fun place to visit
column3: It's part of history and fun to be able to say you've been there. The bay and beaches either side are full of characters, signs and odd balls and is a must together with a visit down the road (actually a short bike ride along the promenade) to Venice beach

A very beautiful and peaceful beach located within 30mins from the LA international airport. Many people riding bicycle or jogging on the path along the beach. I spent 3 hours here before heading to the airport and felt relaxing. Will definitely come back if I am at LA again next time.

You're more likely to see a celebrity here than you are in Hollywood. This is a hotspot for the rich and famous. Make sure you walk down the pier and enjoy the surroundings. There is always something happening. It's a beautiful beach and you can spend a good couple of hours wandering around. If you're up for a walk you can walk down to Venice beach.

Walked to santa monica pier from venice beach,lovely 40 minute walk,you can feel the different vibe as you leave venice behind and approach the more upmarket santa monica,the homeless bodies seem to disappear as you walk.the pier was lovely with breath taking views,we ate at buba gumps on the pier and can highly recommend,lovely vibe,a must do,the little town itself was very nice although it was sunday and we only passed through,i did however get the opportunity to hols a snake for $5, good experience and not anything id usually do,mustve been the santa monica vibe.

We had an amazing day! Talk about beautiful! The view was breathtaking! There was music and carnival rides! We rode the ferris wheel and soaked in the amazing view! Then we walked along the beach! The water was ice cold but we just had to put our feet in! It was a very special day!

This place is great to unwind alone or with the rest of the family. You can either just seat and watch the little waves clash through the sands or jog around the path. Parking is difficult on busy weekends though but it's worth the wait.
Lovely beach, great pier and felt cleaner and safer than Venice Beach. Although the walk between them is worth doing. Definitely worth a wander round the shops too.

The pier is a fantastic little spot. There is a amazing atmosphere here, with plenty to do with something for everyone, volleyball, surfing, swimming, cycling, running and relaxing. There is no shortage of good restaurants either. You could happily spend the whole day here.
We always come here when we visit Los Angeles. It's never a disappointment. Always very clean, very peaceful, and always a good way to spend the afternoon.
Worth a stop and a walk out on the pier. Great views. Not far to experience Venice Beach or 3rd Street Promenade. Great restaurants and lodging close by as well.

Yeah worth seiing and enjoying the sun the mood the morning coffe in front of this vast ocean.Pass by and continue to venice beach or manhattan beach u can do both in one day if you dont have lots of time to spend in LA.
Great beach good swimming. Perfect for relaxing or being energetic, plenty of shops and restaurants. The pier is great with some very good buskers playing great music.
Just like a scene from Baywatch. Worth a visit just for the views. Beautiful place for the beautiful people!

Loved Santa Monica. Beautiful beach perfect for relaxing.Loved the idea of being able to do outdoors activities like cycling, running, volleyball, even saw people doing yoga on the beach at sunset.Didn't spend much time on the pier sadly and as we were driving out noticed lots of shops and restaurants so would like to go back to explore further.
We took a cab ride to Venice beach and took the walk to Santa Monica, A great tourist spot with plenty of food outlets and gift shops.Great day out.
So beautiful loved it very relaxing place to get away from all the stress of city life really recommend you go there!

Was not expecting this kind of beauty in LA just imagined a big city. Glad we made it down here its absolutely stunning views. The beach and walk are huge though so didnt make it the whole way to venice. Great to just chill with a drink or ice cream and people watch.

We must have been lucky when we chose to visit here as it was a beautiful day but hardly any people. It was lovely to walk along the beach and just enjoy the scenery and the views on such a clear and sunny day.Would highly recommend going on a weekday and earlier in the day to have a quieter and more enjoyableexperience.

Loved it. The views from this beach are incredible, I went a few times and we often saw dolphins jumping in and out of the sea earlier in the mornings. We were able to get free wifi whilst on the beach which really came in handy. Its very relaxing and theres lots to do including renting a bike, beach games, surfing and visiting the pier which is a must. Lovely restaurants and good fun.
Loved the views!!! its definitely a must see, make sure your ready to walk in sand to get to beach area though! !
You know that moment when it's right bright and sunny and you are wearing sunglasses then for some reason you have to take them off? Its cause the view is amazing! !!

Nice beach, decent calm environment. Rented a bike and rode along the track for most of the morning. Then checked out the little amusement park, and went for red lobster right next to it. The Pier is just a walk away from the promenade. You can spend an entire day just chilling in this area..

if you like traveling around the beach area, you must visit Santa Monica Pier and the beach it's completely like a different world all together the atmosphere, the krazy-looking carnival type rides, and extoic foods and drinks, if doing a night visit bring a sweater or a hoodie.Overall the site seeing is great to see!!!!!

We enjoyed a lovely day in Santa Monica walked out on to the Pier enjoyed the sun and sights then walked over to the promenade and had a few hours shopping and a great lunch on the roof top of the mall. We were staying by LAX and the return taxi was about $90
I enjoyed Santa Monica Pier and the beach. It was much better and cleaner than Venice. I recommend this beach and the shopping area.
Santa Monica Bay covers a huge area from the Palisades up to Point Dume. Worth taking a sea cruise to see the magnificence from the ocean perspective.

The beach was incredibly clean, organized and safe. The beach had life guards positioned across the beach. Awesome views over the coast. However unless you want to spend the day at the beach ($15 is pretty standard for LA) go further down and park on the street and pay at the metre for a far more reasonable rate.

We didn't go to Santa Monica for the beach - we took a walk down there and the beach is nice and wide - we didn't go in the water. The pier is a little tacky for our taste - the usual Bubba Shrimp and funnel cakes and rides that you can see anywhere at these types of locations.We really enjoyed the shops on 3rd street - the street is a pleasant area to spend a morning or afternoon with plenty of restaurants etc. Santa Monica is an upscale beach town and a welcome break from the traffic in LA
This is such a wonderful beach and it is enhanced by the strand which is a street wide sidewalk and all of the things going on along the beach.

My family visited the beach after walking along the Santa Monica Pier. This is a very clean, family oriented beach with lots of kids frolicking in the water with boogie boards. Lots of life guards around on duty too. They have an outdoor shower pole for rinsing off your legs and feet, and lots of public bathroom stalls for changing clothes.I'd say this is one of the nicest beaches in the LA area. There's parking right next to the beach for $15/day, and you can probably find cheaper parking a little inland from the beach.

It is very nice and long stretch of beautiful and relaxing coast with all the facilities in near reach. I has a nice pedestrian and cycle lanes which completes the fun: beach, walking, cycling, peer, and restaurants.

I'm not normally a "sit at the beach and relax all day" kind of person, so I never expected to fall so head over heels in love with Santa Monica. If I could have, I would have rescheduled my flight just to spend more time here. I haven't felt so relaxed in a long time. You could easily spend a few days here.

Coast of Santa Monica loved. Very broad coastline, pretty beach with special places for recreation and sports, spacious bike lanes through the entire length of the beach, entertainment center right on the dock of the bay, and much more that makes a stay at the beach in Santa Monica great =)The only thing that really surprised is the fact that we were in Santa Monica in March and on the street was 30 degree heat, and the water in the ocean at this point was just ice !!!It was nice to be on the coast of Santa Monica and live to experience the atmosphere, which is trying to convey to us in many Hollywood films and television series, especially cool to see live was the atmosphere in the square near the beach in Santa Monica, where people do all sorts of things, sell their painted paintings, glasses, clothes or make reading poems or performing his own music, and it was all as colorful as it was shown in my favorite TV series Californication;)))I advise you to be sure to wait for the sunset on the beach in Santa Monica and distancing from the amusement park, to be photographed against the backdrop of the ferris wheel and the beautiful California sunset))) Photos will be great;)
easy to get to. Catch a hop on hop off bus which run frequently. Also travel down to Venice beach and Marina Del Ray. Well worth the time

I couldn't get over how wide the beach was, from the sea to the sidewalk. The sand is sheer, fine and golden, like caster sugar. I was surprised how few people were there to sunbathe; instead they were cycyling past, rollerblading, segwaying, playing volleyball or jumping on the hoops. Plenty of restrooms dotted from one end of Santa Monica Bay to the other. A great place to people watch.

column2: a glipmse of forrest gump movie
column3: I liked all the decoration and how it takes you to the forrest gump movie, food was good, service was good, id give it a try again if i stop by again
If you want to swarm to a beach with 5 million other people this is the place for you. Beach was dirty and the water didn't look too good either. Won't be going back....

I had never visited Santa Monica Beach before. I've always been fascinated with the entertainment on Venice Beach. Santa Monica has so much more - pier, playground, quite beach, carnival rides and games, street entertainers, bike paths, restaurants, and shops. We loved the Farris Wheel, ate funnel cake, played in the ocean, and swung on the swings. Saturday was our last full day in LA and we enjoyed spending the day at the beach.Tip - we parked in the parking deck behind City Hall for $3.50 which cost less than parking at the meter. A little walk but economical.

Santa Monica, while offering great scenery and an awesome beach isn't really anything special. If you enjoy swimming and don't mind crowds, or enjoy touristy shops then this may be for you. However, don't base a trip on going to Santa Monica as there are plenty of other great places to visit in the area.
This beach is great for walking, biking or a little jogging. Good for photographers too. The place is clean too and the place in totality is good for people from all walks of life.
Being from Minnesota I was looking to checking out LA beach and I was very pleased. Beautiful beach, lifeguards all over the place. The sand is nothing you can find in Minnesota. Worth going too.

column2: So much to see and do
column3: Pier, Beach, shops, restaurant, tour, hotels, street performers...this place is fantastic and has such a friendly feel to it. Stayed for 3 days, could have happily spent much longer.
Santa Monica is a very nice place to spend your half day during your visit to LA. It has very quite beach, good shopping area and very good pub and bar.

Caught the bus to Santa Monica from downtownLA, it takes about 70 minutes but costs only $1.50. The beach is beautiful, a great pier with carnival rides and a lovely shopping strip just up the road. Gorgeous.

I drove down from Beverly Hills for the day - first going to Malibu Beach which was stunning and some beautiful houses right on the water! Santa Monica Beach was stunning. The weather was gorgeous, lots of people around and a great place to do a spot of people watching and enjoy the atmosphere. Definitely take a stroll along the Pier and if you have time to go on the Ferris Wheel its worth the view. A great day trip to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Do not miss out on visiting this beach.What a great place to see the real people of los angeles.It is great to come down and get some fresh air. I recommend going on the ferris wheel as it is iconic of the area and you get even better views.

Took a day trip down from hollywood. The minute we got off the bus we felt the energy and fun of the place. The weather was amazing, a great atmosphere, the water was refreshing, the views stunning. Enjoyed the boardwalk, had ice creams, shopped had a dip in the ocean... just a fun filled afternoon in a beautiful location. One of my favorite places in LA by far.

We took public transport from West Hollywood to get here - what a mission!A huge beach with lots to see, do and buy. We walked all the way to Venice beach; trying to hunt down Arnie but alas, didn't find him.Really nice area and was a nice change to the Hollywood area.Locals are lucky to be so close to such a fabulous beach!

column2: Good way to fill in a couple of hours
column3: Caught the '#3 Blue Bus" at $1 each way per person from LAX to Santa Monica and walked out to the pier. There has been a lot of construction down there since we were last there and it is well set out. Walked around and watched street performers, people and relaxed. Was very busy but well policed. Had a great afternoon.

column2: The Santa Monica Pier is so fun!
column3: You have to go to the pier if you pass through Santa Monica. Cool drinks, tasty eats and family fun!

I have to give it five stars because it's just a favorite experience of our visit to LA. I could give four stars because of minor complaints like it being crowded and such, but come on, that is part of the experience. Great beach, great hotels, dining and shopping close by, and an amusement park on the pier! What's not to love?

column2: Great place to stroll and relax
column3: If you're visiting LA and check out Santa Monica, kick back at the pier and beach if you have time. Although busy and often crowded during the summer, your trip to Santa Monica is not complete without some shots of yourself at the pier and beach. Palisades park on the bluffs above is also a nice place to stroll.

Was killing some time running around LA and it came to me that I never been to Santa Monica Beach. Shame on me right? So I took the 10-15min drive(30min with traffic) and I was not disappointed. Nice scenery, clean beach. Lifeguards mile apart from each other. And not to mention all the beautiful people your surrounded by. Great place for a jog. Places like this make you feel proud to be a Californian. So much to do in LA.
Great atmosphere...beach is big with plenty of room for everyone...pier is fun with stalls and entertainment
This beach is nice I like the pier there's a Ferris wheel and games for you to play with family fun ! Great walk and the Santa Monica promenade is near by to
We visited here our first day in LA and loved it. Beautiful beach and had great fun on the pier. Some great places to eat, and the Ferris wheel gives you a great view
On my visit to LA from CT this was on my top list. I was quiet disappointed as this place was smelly overcrowded and not so clean..

Nice for walking, jogging, biking, sunbathing, roller skating, people working outits expensiveparking, eating, the shop are little huts, not sure why all the fuss  the beach is average.restaurants not worth the prices they charge.But I guess it because its Santa Monica and people with money who will pay ridiculous price for homes there make it popular.There is nothing special about itHippy style beach...not that thats a bad thing looks run down, loads of homeless people, some characters, but they seem harmless. Not sure I would venture out at night thou.Arnold Schwarzenegger, was suppose to of been homeless so thats why these homeless pole do not get moved on as Anni has influence.Tip: Better off going down to Venice beach and staying around the pier, a bit cleaner.I think there is where most people who gave 4-5 stars where, do not forgot the beach is long an depending which end you are at will depend if you like it.Go see it, just to say you been there.Good to spend a day, chilling, grabbing some beach food.
Santa Monica has a lovely beach which has a theme park on the pier. I enjoyed walking in the area watching the people surfing.

column2: Love walking along the beach and pier
column3: One of my favorite places to come when visiting LA. Feels like a completely different world from Hollywood etc. it is always interesting to see what different performers are around and people watching as you walk along the beach.
Very nice beach and a small amusement park. Walking on the pier was very nice because I saw it in a lot of movies.

This beach is just gorgeous! Take a drive through Venice Beach and stop here. My family took surf lessons from Aqua Surf School and had so much fun. The waves and sandy bottom were perfect for learning. Just beautiful!

The Bay and the surrounded area was great - although the fact that it was a beautiful sunny day will have helped! We walked from the pier down to Venice Beach and enjoyed the people watching and walking on the clean and huge beach. Lots to see and do and plenty of great restaurants and caf茅s.

I think Santa Monica Bay is the best seaside visit in LA! The beach is perfect, a Santa Monica has a huge variety of caf茅s and restaurants, parking is reasonable, and the pier is great fun. If you have only time to visit one beach in LA make it this one. And pick up a Hot a Dog On A Stick at the stand near the entrance to the pier.
We are from the UK really enjoyed our time in los angeles and santa monica .end of route 66 got afew pics thanks santa monica

column2: Love It the End of Route 66
column3: Every time we visit Los Angles we always stop off at the Pier to enjoy the day at the beach. We always find something exciting to get into at the pier. It should be noted that we visited the pier on Christmas Eve... and while the rest of the country was under winter freeze and snow advisory, we as a family was relaxing on the beach..."What A Life". In short, if possible please try to catch the sunset at the pier, simply beautiful!!!

column2: Beautiful beach but so many people
column3: This beach is beautiful. The pier has great views. I loved riding the Ferris wheel on the pier. The traffic to get there was insane and the number of people made it a little unbearable. We went on a Saturday so I would recommend a weekday.

I love taking a walk there! The weather is just so nice and great!There are a lot of small shops nearby. Remember to stop by to get some postcards and cute things for your friends!Santa Monica is a must-see when you visit los angeles.

Our visit to Los Angeles would have been absolutely incomplete had we not visited Santa Monica Bay and PierIt was late afternoon when we reached and the sea breeze was strong enough to almost make us feel that it could blow us awayThe bay was great .. The Pacific was not too ruffled that day and the waves were gentle,the sand was soft and we enjoyed ourselvesThe wash facility at the corner of the stairs beside Bubba Shrimp was very convenientThe Pier was magnificent ... It was festive without needing to be overly so and it was an instant mood lifter just to be thereOne envied the people who were casting their fishing rods and spending a lazy afternoon thereOne word of caution though .. The boulevard fringe draws attention of the homeless as evening comes, and while they absolutely keep to themselves, it would be prudent to avoid interfering with them as they settle into their personal spaces
Spent a very pleasant afternoon and evening. Shopping, eating, sightseeing all good, although expensive

Unfortunately when I visited Santa Monica Bay is was extremely foggy, however, I still recommend visiting. It was still great to wander around and see the pier. I'm sure it would have been lovely on a nice sunny day.

Great experience! I had the opportunity of being there more than once. Totally worth! I found it better than visiting Beverly Hills and others overrated places in L.A area. The amusement park is fun and the beach really pretty. I went to a really good restaurant near by with yummy vegan options but I can't really remember the name right now. Just remember to bring a jacket even during the summer, it's a little chilly and actually really cold during the winter.

column2: somewhere you don't have to drive!
column3: a lovely walk/skate/run with beautiful views. The bay is a lovely and there is a vibrancy that you don't find on most sea fronts. The people are friendly and when the sun is shining its a lovely way to spend the day! It is a popular tourist destination but you don't feel surrounded by tourists, more like one of the locals!

Unlike much of the rest of LA, you can actually walk here! There's a beach prom, a higher cliff (bluff) prom through the Palisades, a pedestrianised retail street and plenty of sidewalks. Bliss! It's a beautiful location with wonderful beaches. The pier and fairground might not be to everyone's taste but it's entertaining at any time of the day. There are excellent sea front hotels and a good selection of restaurants - which you don't have to drive to! Definitely recommended.

I will never get bored of Santa Monica!A lovely beach and an iconic pier which you will find in many films throughout the years.It is a popular destination for tourists but there is a large sense of calm in the area that makes for a very chilled out visit.At night time the area follows that of the day with a chilled out vibe than you will find back in LA.

Nice drive through Santa Monica, Stopped at the pier , it was nice , lots to do. Definitely reccomend heading out here if you are near. Beautiful scenery, scenic. Gets a little dumpy as you head towards venice beach, but you can definitely spend a day here!

Very nice place for a walk - beautiful scenery, and the pier has many fun things to do. I agree that it is one of the best things to do in LA, especially if you just want to relax, rest and have a coffee or drink.

We finished our 5 week holiday in America in Santa Monica. With only a short walk from the Santa Monica Pier we visited it every day we were there playing in the arcade and doing rides for the kids.We watched beautiful sunsets as the day passed on and toured down town during the night shopping and stopping for cocktails then shopping some more.Definitely a place to visit if you don't stay there on you holiday.

I caught a couple of buses to Santa Monica Pier and I am so glad I did, this is by far the best thing in LA! The pier is fun and the walk to Venice Beach is just the best. I don't know what else to say, just bring your camera and sunscreen and you're all set :)
I had a lovely evening here. I went down onto the pier, got a funnel cake and jumped on the Ferris wheel. It was beautiful and an iconic thing to see. A must visit

Took a stroll and a look at the bay just after landing, stretch the legs and get some air sort of thing. Very interesting place to wander along the path that follows the coast, beware of bikes, rollerblades etc. Some of the shops are a little different and "out there". A very pleasant and leisurely introduction to L.A.

Visited Santa Monica Pier on an October vacation. The weather couldn't have been more perfect! Sunny and warm (around 75 degrees). My friend and I went out to LA to see some sights and while there we took a double deck bus tour and got off at the Pier. I have to say I was a little disappointed in the length of the pier expecting much more. I've always heard about Santa Monica Pier and expected many more shops and better places to eat. Most of it seemed like the small hamburger joints with just a couple of decent sit down restaurants which we did not dine in due to the number of people waiting for a table. I understand there are restaurants near the pier but we wanted to experience what was actually ON the pier. Even the souvenir shops were a bit of a disappointment for this shopper! But we managed to find a shop with loads of t-shirts right across the way from the pier at the beginning of it all that fulfilled my shopping experience.We also did not walk over to where the rides were because I'm no longer into the ride attractions anymore.All in all I'm glad we visited. We got to stick our toes in the cold Pacific Ocean and sit on the sands to catch some rays and people watch. Luckily in October it was not very crowded at all.I was also thrilled to see the sign that said it was the end of Route 66 because that's also a dream of mine to travel Rt 66 as far as it goes. At least I got to see where it all ends, lol ! I just wish my camera didn't need to be charged so I could have gotten a picture of the sign! Maybe when I travel it someday! Here's hoping...........

Visited Santa Monica bay and pier first in August 2013 and it was crowded, but beautiful and a great place to spend a few hours. Compared to other parts of LA (Hollywood/Downtown) Santa Monica is a beautiful area, great to have a meal or a drink and watch the view. Returned in mid-September, needed a jumper but the sun was still out and the crowds had gone. Still beautiful. Short ride from the LAX hotels too.

santa monica beach is a good place to chill or working out after a day plenty of work and stress.Not the best beach to have a total relax because of tourists using the Pier to hang out, however is closed to the 3rd promenade and to the centre of the neighborhood.Walking or cycling from this spot to Venice B, Marina and manhattan beach is totally a must.
Just a short trolley ride from LAX area. A place to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city for a sunset stroll or meal in one of many restaurants.
Serenity!! Beautiful place and great view. I could just lay on the beach everyday. Area is very clean. Family friends couples would all enjoy this place

We walked and cycled the stretch from Manhattan beach through to the end on Santa Monic. There are some great areas of architecture, and some really tacky parts along the beachfront.The marina at Marina del Playa is a good place to gawk at some magnificent boats, or hire a sailboat and kayak and paddle around this huge marina

column2: Nice place to rent bikes and enjoy the area
column3: The boardwalk goes for miles of easy riding. Santa Monica pier has overpriced rides and restaurants.

The coastline is fabulous, clean beach... We got there at about 5/6 pm when the sun was setting and it was just fab to see the sun set. The entertainment at different sections of the pier was cool. The rides for kids are overpriced and you have to pay for parking. It was reassuring to see Santa Monica police at different parts of the bay. At around 8pm, lots of people were arriving to watch a song festival going on. All in all we had a lovely evening there.
If you never seen the sea before, Santa Monica Bay might give you some surprises. But it's not so good in my mind. Nothing special there. It's windy in winter.
the bay is a nice and beautiful place where you can relax either sitting and sunbathing on the beach or shopping nearby. A very unique atmosphere!
Thought the rides etc were over priced.... The entertainment along pier was interesting. Needs work done to pier as run down.

We consider ourselves beach aficionados, and have visited almost every popular and/or celebrated beach resort along the east coast from Maine to the Floriday keys. We specifically went to California and traveled Rt 1 from Dana Point to Monterey CA in search of the perfect beach/coastal vista. While we definitely found what we were looking for, it wasn't in Santa Monica.While we much preferred Santa Monica to Downtown LA/Hollywood, the beach and the pier is just ok -- nothing special at all, and the local hotels and restaurants are certainly not worth the prices they charge. What's more, Santa Monica is still very far from LA/Hollywood, so if you're looking for a place to stay that is local to both beach and Hollywood, unfortunately Santa Monica isn't it. If you are looking for the comprehensive SoCal experience, my suggestion would be to spend one night at a Hollywood hotel and then transfer to a beach resort in Ocean County (such as Laguna or Doheny), which has more upscale lodging, magnificient vistas, and excellent dining.

It's not the best beach in the area but it's above average. Crowded in areas especially around Santa Monica and Venice Beach, but head towards Venice out of Santa Monica a bit and you'll find a better place to beach if you like it less crowded. There is a pier in Santa Monica but there's not much there except a handful of rides. The best bike rental place I've found in the area is located right at the base of the boardwalk - across from the snake statue kids like to play on - I believe the name is Sea Mist rentals. I suggest taking half a day or more, renting bikes and riding between Santa Monica and Venice Beach. (Note: A quick stroll through Venice is all you'll need. Do a little people watching but it's pretty gritty comparatively.)

We spent 2 days at Santa Monica .Our initial plan was to spend a single day but we so enjoyed the beach and the peir we scheduled a second day .We walked the walk way .Spent time at the 3rd Street Promenade and the mall .The pier was cool .We rode the ferris wheel .The view was great .Santa Monica was a joy to behold .Go .You will like it .

Beach and bike path great. I am sure the views are great if you can get a day that isn't cloudy/foggy - it can be bright blue sky and hot sun 1 mile inland but chilly and grey on the bay. The pier was disappointing/on the verge of tacky with fast food joints round every corner. The street entertainment and stalls were not as good as Venice boardwalk. Third Street shopping was nothing special. We thought the whole place would be a little more refined than it actually was.

column2: A fun way to spend an evening.
column3: We visited Santa Monica Pier one evening in late May when we were in LA for 2 days. After the glitzy glam of Hollywood Walk of Fame, Beverly hills, and Rodeo drive, this was a perfect serene place to spend the evening.Parking was convenient to find. We spent our time walking up and down the beach, then explored the pier which has a Ferris wheel and roller coaster right on the pier and is beautiful in the evening.Loved the place!! There were street performers, and singers who were actually quiet good. Caught a beautiful sunset and then headed to the 3rd street and had a very memorable Mexican meal at Mercado's. Will definitely be back and this time will surely get on the roller coaster. :)

column2: Enjoyable but I have been to better
column3: We enjoyed at day in Santa Monica and spend most of our time walking the beach, the pier was good but not great, we had a nice meal in a Mexican restaurant at the sea end. However I wished afterwards we had chosen to explore a different area with a bit more to do. The sea front shops were cool and the street performances made it interesting but all in all I have been to better.

We loved Santa Monica, we have never done the West coast, and it was our first time seeing the Pacific Ocean, and it was well worth the trip. Santa Monica was clean and the people seemed nice, we walked along the beach I had a paddle, it was 4.00pm and the sea was still warm, no litter and the sea was clear. we walked along the pier,had a coffee and watched the world go by this place did not disappoint. we parked the car on the beach front car park about 拢6.00 for the days parking great value.

We stopped by when taking a week long visit to the Malibu and LA area. The parking situation is good as there is a large lot right on the beach and there is copious room along the large beach expanse as well.With regard to the pier, our experience as out of towners was "ok". It was busy and there were some shops and places to eat, though nothing that really held our interest. We eventually walked to the Third Street Promenade, which is only a short distance away.Overall the combination of great parking, easy beach access, the pier and access to Santa Monica make this a nice attraction. That being said we enjoyed the pier, harbor and restaurant experience in Santa Barbara a great deal more than this one.

It was my first time seeing the Pacific Ocean and the Santa Monica Pier did not disappoint. It was too cool to get in the water, but my wife mingled with the locals and shared an ice cream cone on the pier. We will definitely make a return visit.

column2: The Place where you can close to Pacific Ocean
column3: Nice pier located next to Pacific Ocean. Boardwalk is good, you may see many street artists playing music there. Also you can get on some rides at the Pier, but have to buy tickets. Many people were chilling there not just tourists. Its nice place to spend with family and friends.
Unfortunately we had a VERY windy day so a little too cool & a lot of sand blowing around - otherwise a great place for tourists !

Yes, it is dirty, cold and often foggy. But the Bay is a great urban space at the nation's edge. You can ride your bike for miles along the beach front. In the afternoon, the light here is magnificent as it hits the water and the hills. That light is unique.

Santa Monica is a nice city located near LA and next to the Pacific Ocean, at night the city looks really interesting, take a walk thru the city and go to the beach and the Pier is real nice to have a walk on
I loved this place, beautiful beach and scene. Definitely worth it. Take as many pictures as you can. It was the first time I saw the pacific ocean.

It kind of looks like every beach in US that I ever visited - long and sandy :)But this one has some charm. It has couple of places to buy food or drinks and it's very lively so I would definitely recommend to visit :)

We drove from Malibu along the Pacific Coast Highway-beautiful. Parking was only 6 bucks at the pier and that was pretty cool, too. It was all better than I thought, after seeing the Hollywood Blvd area first. I'm from Chicago, so that's where Rt 66 starts and they have a sign on the pier marking the end. Street performers and artists selling their goods. It was awful windy. They views were amazing, watching the waves pound the shore. Clean beach and pier.

All the movies you saw that were ambiented in this wonderful place come to mind when you walk arround. The place is not really clean but hey there is so much people here that is a miracle that there isnt more trash

This is a great city on the coast the pier is one of the best west of jersy and the shopping on third street is second to none. the mall is high end and everything cost an arm and a leg. the food in the area is top of the line and it is crowded all the time. lot's of street crafts and entertainment.

Santa Monica is a lovely place. There are sooo many people visiting anymore that it's really too hard to park and the sales tax is impossibly high. The view though from Ocean Ave is lovley and the walk along the promenade is lovely.
Shutters on the Beach is just one of the places to enjoy the view. Drive to the Santa Monica Pier on PCH. You may even see a dolphin or two.

I wish i spent more time in Santa Monica Bay, nice places to see, good restaurants to eat and beatiful people to see. Different vibe from where i'm from (MIA), the sunset always gives it a more picturesque view than the Atlantic ocean. You can also see lots of artists around from caricaturists and sculptors. There was a chinese sculptor at the boardwalk that makes amazingly identical/looked alike head sculptors in 10-15 min. You can't help it but admire this guy and wonder why is he not working in big art boutiques or shops. We only stayed a half day, but planning to stay longer next time.

column2: Beautiful old style beach and pier
column3: I loved it here, view is beautiful, sand is lovely and the pier was charming with its big wheel and arcades good old fashioned beach and pier
Admittedly it was an overcast day, but still it was just a pier with lots of tacky fish restaurants and homeless. Hard to imagine Baywatch was filmed here.
i loved this place the food and the birds and the fog coming in i soent hrs and hrs there and the mexcian food is yum

column2: Great place to spend an afternoon
column3: Santa Monica is a great place to spend the afternoon with the kids in the games, great attractions and view, the parking lot charges $6 flat fee.

LA is all about the water, and the bay is everything. Beaches from Malibu past Palos Verdes into Orange County, the strand. Bike riding, running, walking, surfing, sand, it's all here. Not to mention Venice Beach and it's side show

Our trip consisted of 2 adults starting in New York and ending in San Francisco.During our 3 week trip Hurricane Sandy had just left to be followed by a severe NE snow storm. President Obama had been re-elected and I managed to change my status from single to married!We went toNew YorkLas VegasLos AngelesSanta MonicaCarmelSan Francisco.Santa Monica is one of the very few places on this earth that I have seen and thought, I could live here!A relaxing era about the place, don't know if it was we had come in from Vegas but the first walk out onto the beach was delightful. We went to Bubba Gumps, at the end of Route 66, yep a tourist haunt but that was what we were! Served by Rat who was brilliant! Then a walk along the wooden pier and back to the hotel. In the morning on a LAsightseeing tour which ticked all the boxes off the places we wanted to see without having the hassle of finding places to park all the time.Decided to stay an extra night in Days Inn Santa Monica which was again very nice.The people round here seem to be very friendly after the brashness of NYC and the falseness of Vegas.I will be back here, it was a lovely place

Between Point Dume, in Malibu, and the Palos Verdes Peninsula. Its eastern shore forms the western boundary of the Los Angeles Westside and South Bay. So many beautiful beaches and area's to visit along the Bay.

Love people watching at this type of place. Very clean beach and fun entertainment along the pier. Avoid the bumper cars-hardly working and disappointing to kids. Rides are expensive. Walked over to Third St. and interesting street entertainment and wide variety of shops and restaurants.

Gorgeous beach!!! There are apparently tons of prohibited activities (playing frisbee for one..) but who cares? There are plenty of other beaches if that's what you're after. Santa Monica beach is well kept & perfect for people watching. There's plenty of fun you can have here.
This area is lovely and there is a terrific bike-path on which you can occasionally get away with roller-blading.

We visited Santa Monica in the afternoon and went straight to the bike hire shop.We hired a tandem bike and rode all the way up past Venice beach and enjoyed all the funky people and shops along the way.Then watched the sunset off the pier and it was spectacular.This was my 2nd time here and will come back again if in LA.

avoid the crowded days such as weekends this is an amazing place to be with your children or partner I totally adore this placeit would be a lill harder to get thru with a heavy stroller like mine but there is an elevator in the restaurant they will be glad to help you

The best thing about Santa Monica Bay are the scenic views at sunset. Get a table at the Lobster (right at the first step of the SM Pier) and watch out the window as the sun dips below the water line. Breathtaking!
The pier and bay are a nice way to spend some time - try to arrive early (before 9) for better parking. Things pick up from about 10am.

.... compare and contrast.... history says the houses and beaches of Venice have benefitted from the ripple effect of Santa Monica's success. Santa Monica is a fantastic place, the bay is amazing, but in my view I prefer Venice. That said, this is still a stunning place. Larry Hagman lives here, so it's gotta be good.

column2: Love the beach, just check the sewage report before diving in
column3: It's so pretty here! The beach is fairly clean and when the water is clean, it's really refreshing. Nice bike path and good looking lifeguards!

column2: A lovely day by the beach
column3: Visited as a day trip while staying in downtown LA and had such a nice day. There's so much to do! Visited the amusement park, sat on the sand, rented a bike and spent a few hours bike riding, wandered around the shops and had dinner and a drink before heading back. The bike ride was my favorite part. Bike rentals were really inexpensive; I think it was $15 for the entire afternoon including a lock and a helmet. There is a long paved trail along the ocean which takes you by Venice Beach as well as much quieter, more peaceful sections. There's a lot to do even if it isn't a perfect 'beach day'.

Santa Monica beach is a definite must go to beach in the summertime, even in the winter time (December), it's a awesome beach. Heaps of space, lots of activities (Volleyball, cycling, surfing etc), There's always something happening. The day that we went there were at least four film sets there.Santa Monica itself is great! so clean and safe (of course there's the occasional homeless person, as with anywhere in the Los Angeles area). Great shopping and accommodation. Good for families.I'd definitely recommend spending a few nights in the Santa Monica if you're in the Los Angeles area. The closer to the beach, generally the better.

I grew up in SoCal so going to the beach was a normal way of life. I got to know every beach in three counties. This beach is ok. It doesn't stand out as something amazing compared to some of the other beaches because it's geared more towards the commercial side of things. There's stores, shops, and restaurants all over the place, but the beach itself is just a long slab of sand on the ocean, nothing private or cozy, and nothing you can't find just about everywhere else in SoCal.
this beach very popular for LA so dont missed... you can see why they very different with other beach

it was a cool day when we were able to go, but the beach was nice. in Santa Monica there are many shops, entertainment, restaurantslook for ratings from the health board in the windows of restaurants anywhere in calfornia an "A" is what you want to see, a "C" you get closed down.
Excellent to visit. We travel to Santa Monica, Malibu beach in our red camaro. Great experience.
We enjoyed hiring bikes and riding to Venice Beach and back - good shopping areas in Santa Monica also
Good place to tan, but if you are in Los Angeles, it takes skill and some patience to actually get there, pay high for parking and then soak up the sun.
Sun, sea and sand. Beaches were pretty clean, water is very chilly! Lots to see and do for all ages.

column2: Quiet beauty but check the water safety staus.
column3: Ceretain areas are good for swimmming so be careful if you select this opotion. Otherwise, the pier and the whole bay including northern Malibu or southern areas are so lovely. The newly renovated Promenade is fun too.
Great place to visit...the pier is getting beter as time goes by...lots of tourist from all over the world come here for the beach, pier and shopping in the Prominade...

column2: What's not to like about any nice, wide, sandy beach?
column3: It's nearby, close to shopping, restaraunts, offices, stores, etc. We have our own beaches in the South Bay, but if you have plans to spend some time in the Santa Monica area, you might as well try this beach if you like to be in and\or near the Pacific Ocean. I'll bet the water is (relatively) warm here in the summer!

column2: For all ages...singles, couples, and families!
column3: Fun, clean, and filled with activities that never stopped! Food was good at the mexican food restaurant located on the pier!
Nothing exciting, just the pier and a bunch of people walking around. Parking is terrible.
The activities on the pier are great, including the restaurant at the end. Do NOT eat any fish caught in this bay. It is sometimes polluted.

column2: Lovely Santa Monica Bay and Beach
column3: Beautiful, large, clean beach close to a lovely, lively cityand boardwalk with amusement park. Much to do and see

I used to come to this beach as a child and did a lot of swimming and fishing here. Back then, the water was clean for swimmng and there were plenty of fish to catch. Now, I'm afraid to swim the the bay for fear of catching something.
Nice surprise close to Los Angeles. The pier is nostalgic but don't recommend the Mexican Restaurant there it's over priced, didn't taste well and not friendly! Great people watching on the beach.
This bay is the background for so many movie scenes. The ferris wheel is iconic, and the old time boardwalk carnival is nostagic.
Love this place. It's so lively! Great for pictures taking
Great malls in walking distance also, nice beach, amusement park on the pier, good food, lovely sunset!

column2: We dive the Santa Monica Bay
column3: We use boats that leave from Marina Del Rey for these Santa Monica Bay diving trips. Usually we dive the star of Scotland wreck which has an interesting history as a covert ops war ship and later an offshore speakeasy. It lies in 70 feet of water about 2 miles from the Santa Monica Pier

column2: Enjoyed the Pier. Too short of a visit.
column3: After seeing many pictures of the Santa Monica Pier in travel magazines and photo contests, I wanted to visit Santa Monica. In doing research, it sounded like Santa Monica Pier and the beach were a fun spot to visit both day and night. Venice Beach, boardwalk, and canals are only a short distance away, and were also highly recommended by everything I read, and many people I met. Unfortunately, I was on a very short time schedule. I had spent the morning at the Getty Museum and then traveled down to Long Beach to see the Queen Mary. I had hoped to arrive in Santa Monica a bit earlier. However, by the time I arrived in Santa Monica, it was dark and the only thing I had the chance to do was visit the Pier. I loved watching and taking pictures of the kaleidoscope of changing colors of the ferris wheel. It was really beautiful. I imagine the view of the Pier at sunset is breathtaking. It was also fun being in the middle of all the activity of the amusements. The end of Route 66 is on the Pier, and its post became another photo opportunity. There were a few nice restaurants on the Pier (Bubba's Shrimp Co., was one) but when it started to drizzle, I decided to get on the road before it started to rain harder. I want to definitely go back to Santa Monica and also visit Venice Beach and its canals, and take a drive up to Malibu when I visit LA again.

column2: Santa Monica is great for all ages.
column3: We went there as a family of 5 kids aged 9-13, We hired bikes and rode from the Santa monica pier along the bike path to Venice beach pier.(pick a bike with a basket if your into shopping,) it may come in handy. We then stopped on way back parking up our bikes while shopping .had no problems it's all very casual and anything goes. Lots to see on the way like the muscle beach gym scatepark and an interesting park on the beach where you see enthusaStic gymnasts swing effortlessly and tipe rope being done near the pier at Santa Monica . Close by is good shopping just about a street away from mc donalds. Holiday inn is an awesome place to stay ,very close to everything and quiet and very safe.

I always park at the 3rd st promenade garage and get my tkt validated. Walk to the pier and choose a direction. Go right towards Malibu or left towards Venice. I personally like Venice direction best. You can walk, run, roller skate/blade, or rent a bike and cruise along. Make sure you stay for sunset! Thats the best part!

column2: Nice stroll down the Pier. Route 66 officially ends here!
column3: Santa Monica is a lovely, clean beach. We parked in the short stay car park before the pier, 2 hours was $2. We walked along the pier to the official end of Route 66. There are a few rides and places to eat along the pier.It was nice to grab something to eat and just sit on the pier, relaxing.There are not many shops, for shops go to Venice Beach.It's a lovely place to relax but not much else to do.
